sense.definition: Aleph, the first letter of the alphabet, interchanging with other gutturals, e.g. אבב, הבב, חבב, עבב; אליתא, עליתא &c.

sense.notes: often used to form second roots of verbs ע"ע, e.g. אטם, טמם.
frequ. prosthetic, e.g. אגודל, גודל, v. אִ־
sometimes inserted to replace a radical, as באגא = בגא, esp. in verbs ע"ו, as דָּאִיךְ fr. דּוּךְ, קָאִים fr. קוּם &c.
frequ. (in Talm. Y.) dropped in the beginning of words, e.g. בָּא = אַבָּא; מַר = אֲמַר.
affixed to the end of Chald. nouns, corresponding to prefixed ה in Hebrew (status emphaticus), e.g. אַבָּא = הָאָב.

sense.definition: as numeral letter, one, as אות א' = אות אחת one letter.
sense.notes: Sabb. 104 a; a. fr. [Editions and Mss. vary, according to space, between the full numeral and the numeral letter, א' for אחד, אחת; ב' for שנים, שתים, שתי &c.]
&c. a prefix,
for the formation of nouns in Kal, Peel, Afel (Hifil) &c., e.g. אִסְפְּקָא, אִיסְ', אַפְטָרָה, אַפְטַרְתָּא &c.;
demonstrative, e.g. אִיהוּ = h. הַהוּא; אִנָּא, אִינָא &c.
euphonic (prosthetic) אִדְמָא = דְּמָא; אִית = h. יֵשׁ &c., esp. before foreign words beginning with two consonants, e.g. אִסְטְרָטֵיגוֹס, אִיסְ' = סְטַרְטֵיגֹוס &c.

sense.definition: a prefix (followed by Dagesh Forte) = עַל upon, over, e.g. אַמָּרָא = עַל מָרָא; even before gutturals, e.g. אַאַבְנָא.

sense.notes: plur. of אל"ף q. v.

, a fictitious word made up of each third letter in מנא̇ מנא̇ תקל̇ ופר̇סין̇ (Dan. V, 25). Snh. 22 a; Cant. R. to III, 4 ממתו"ס וכ' the inscription on the wall was so arranged as to form words composed of its every first, every second and every third letter respectively.
, v. אַוָּארָא
a prefix of words of Greek origin answering to αὐ-, au-, e.g. אבטומטוס = αὐτόματος; or to εὐ, e.g. אבגינוס = εὐγενής.

sense.definition: (Assyr. A-bu, Schr. K. A. T., p. 247) Ab, the fifth month of the Jewish calendar (of thirty days) beginning between the eighth of July and the seventh of August, and ending between the sixth of August and the fifth of September.
sense.notes: R. Hash. I, 3, על אב וכ' for announcing the beginning of Ab messengers are sent out, for the sake of the fast. Ib. 18 b ט' באב the ninth of Ab, anniversary of Temple destruction. Taan. IV, 6 משנכנס אב with the beginning of Ab. Ib. 29 b לישתמיט מיניה באב let him try to be relieved of (the law-suit) in Ab. Meg. 5 b; a. e.

sense.definition: , const. אֲבִי, אַב [embracer], father, ancestor, progenitor; teacher; chief, leader; author, originator.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 46 end המגדל אב the educator is the real father. Lev. R. s. 1 אבי החכמה וכ', the father of all wisdom, … the father of prophets. Y. Ned. V, 39 b; a. fr.—אַב בית דין (abbr. אב"ד) president of the Court (Great Sanhedrin), next in dignity to the Nassi. Taan. II, 1; a. fr.—Metaph. origin, cause. Num. R. s. 10 (play on אֲבוֹי, Prov. XXIII, 29) א' אוי the cause of woe (sin).—אב מלאכה (for which also עיקר) one of the chief labors forbidden on the Sabbath, opp. תולדה a labor the prohibition of which is based on the ground of its being a species of the former, or derived from the former. Sabb. VII, 1 sq.; a. fr.—[Y. Sabb. II, 5 a, אב שלה, sub. מלאכה.]—אב הטומאה one of the original or direct causes of levitical uncleanness, opp. ולד (child) secondary cause. Toh. I, 5; a. fr.—א' הנזק v. Pl.—בנין א' creation of a class, i.e. a conclusion, by analogy, from a case explicitly stated in the bibl. law on all similar cases not specified in detail. Sifra introd.—Ib. K’doshim, end, ch. 11 (ref. to Lev. XX, 27) זה ב' א' לכל דמיהם בם this forms the rule for all cases in which the Bible uses the word d’mçhem bam (that the penalty is stoning to death); a. fr.; v. also בֵּית אב.— Pl. אָבוֹת־, const. אֲבוֹת,

sense.definition: fathers, ancestors, patriarchs &c. Ber. 26 b prayers א' תקנום have been instituted by the Patriarchs; a. fr.—אבות בתי דינין, v. supra. Ḥag. II, 2.
sense.notes: —בת א' a woman of noble descent. Num. R. s. 1; a. e.—Metaph. principal, chief א' מלאכות, v. supra. א' הטומא' Kel. I, 1; v. supra.—א' נזיקין (sing. אב הנזק) the chief actionable injuries or damages, from which the subordinate are deduced (תולדות). B. Kam. I, 1; a. e.

sense.definition: Aboth, the first section of the Prayer of Benedictions (v. תְּפִלָּה), so called because it alludes to the Patriarchs.
sense.notes: R. Hash. IV, 5; a. fr.

sense.definition: Aboth, name of a treatise of the Mishnah, containing sayings of Talmudic authorities and belonging to the fourth section, נזיקין, of the Mishnah collection (משניות); also styled פִּרְקֵי א' a. מְסֶכֶת א'.
sense.notes: A similar collection of a later date is contained in Talmud Babli editions, named א' דרבי נתן Aboth d’Rabbi Nathan. [Y. Yoma VIII, 44 d top אב בית נפש v. אֲבֵידָה.]
ch., v. אַבָּא

sense.definition: the young shoots of a tree, opp. to the branches growing directly from the trunk.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 81 a אִיבּוֹ של אילן ed. (Ar. a. Ms. חובו, v. חוֹב II, cmp. Rashi a. l.). [Y. Erub. III, 21 a top איבו; Y. Succ. II, 53 a צידו.]

sense.definition: pl. אִבִּין, אִיבִּין state of growth, development.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 58 a cascuta which became wormy באִבֶּיהָ during its growth. Ib. 127 b figs which shrunk באִבֵּיהֶן during development. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c bot. he who presses olives מאִבֵּיהֶן from where they grow (before they are ripe to be taken off). [Tosef. Maasr. I, 4 איבין אדומים, Var. אובין, read אוּגִין, v. אֹוג.] Ib. 5 they differ על האיבין concerning the plants in their growing state (between ripening [גמר] and blossoming [הנץ]; Var. אוֹנין incorr.); cmp. יָבַן. Ch. v. אִיבָּא I.

Targ. O. ib. XLI, 43; a. fr.—Freq. אַבָּא (also in Hebr. phraseol.) my father. Snh. III, 2. B. Bath IX, 3; a. fr. Meg. 12 b אהורייריה דא' my father’s steward. אבי א' my grandfather. Ber. 10 a bot.—Snh. 113 a bot. א' אליהו father Elijah (sarcastically).—אָבוֹהֵ ד־, אָבוֹי ד־ N.’s father. Ber. 18 b; Y. B. Mets. IV, 9 c top; a. fr.—א' סב, א' רבה grandfather. Targ. II, Esth. VII, 10. Yeb. 21 b.—Trnsf. origin, source. Sabb. 22 a אֲבוּהוֹן דכולהון דם the source of all analogous cases is the law about blood (that you must cover it from a sense of propriety).— Pl. אֲבָהָן, אֲבָהָתָא Targ. Y. Deut. XXIV, 16. Targ. I Chr. I, 2; a. fr. Men. 53 a בר א' of distinguished birth.—Kid. 83 a; a. fr.—[אֲבָהֵי Targ. Prov. XIX, 14 Ms.; read with ed. Wil. אבהן; oth. ed. אבהו corr. acc.]

sense.definition: (בָּא, וָוא, וָוה in Y.) pr. n. m. Abba, ( Ba, Va), a frequent name.
sense.notes: [Sometimes distinguished persons go by that name, being orig. a title (v. next w.) while their real names are dropped; v. esp. Ber. 18 b בעינא א' I want Abba &c.] The most distinguished are

sense.definition: (בר בא) א' בר אבהו Abba bar Abbahu (Ba), father of Samuel, an Amora.
sense.notes: Abba bar Abbahu (Ba), father of Samuel, an Amora.

sense.definition: א' בר רב הונא, in Bab. רַבָּה q. v.
א' מרי, contr. אבמרי Abba Mari, an Amora.
sense.notes: —אבין, אבינא, contr. with ר' into רַבִּין, רַבִּינָא Rabbin, Rabbina

sense.definition: Abba (father), a title of scholars (less than Rabbi), as Abba Saul, A. Yudan, etc.; cmp. foreg.

sense.notes: M. Kat. 12 b א' בשלניא a forest in Sh’lanya. Keth. 79 a, v. זַרְדְּתָא. Snh. 39 b (prov.) מיניה וביה א' ניזיל (ליזיל) ביה נרגא (Ag. Hatt. בנרגא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) from the very woods shall it go into the hatchet (as a handle to strike the woods).

sense.definition: (reduplic. of אב, עב, עו; v. עַוִּית) prop. swelling, heaviness (cmp. כאב), hence disorder of the stomach, vomiting (spasms); usu. in connection with חמה, fever with vomiting.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 19 did you ever hear, this ass here that is driven out חמה עליה אבבית עליה Ar. (ed. corrup. צינה עליו כמה חככים עליו) has fever, has vomiting (spasms)? Ib. s. 53 חמה ואכאבית. V. אַכְאָבִית.
, read אֲכָאטֵיס.
Targ. Koh. VII, 3.

entry.language-reference: √אב, cmp. עב, חב, גב, כב, קב &c., v. חָבַב I a. II; to be thick, to be heavy, to press; to surround; to twist; to be warm, glow etc. V. אבד, אבל, אבק, אבר, אבס, אבה &c.)

sense.definition: to be thick, to swell, break forth; v. חָבַב a. הָבַב.

sense.notes: Targ. Hos. IX, 10 מאבבא q. v.
, v. איב'

Koh. R. beg.; a. fr. (Midr. Till. to Ps. I אביינוס; Cant. R. beg. אווגיטוס, corr. acc.).— Pl. Yalk. Ps. 863 שהוא אֶוְגְּנֵסִין (read בן א') he is the son of nobles; Midr. Till. to Ps. CV בן גנסין (corr. acc.) cmp. גְּנִיס.

sense.definition: (read סְטָטֵי—), אֶוְוגִּינִיסְטָאטֵי m. pl. (εὐγενέστατοι) most noble.
sense.notes: Ruth R. to I, 2. Midr. Sam. ch. I.
, v. אנג'

sense.definition: , v. אבב) to be pressed, go around in despair (v. Prov. XXXI, 6; Deut. XXVI, 6) to be given up, whence
to be lost, perish; to be beyond recognition.
sense.notes: Sifré Deut. 301 (ref. to Deut. XXVI, 5) לא ירד … אלא לאובד (read לוֹבֵד or לֶאֱבוֹד; Yalk. Deut. a. l. לאבדם prob. לאַבְרָּן; Ms. Zer. Abr. 3 לֵיאָבֵר) Jacob went to Aram with no hope but to perish (be a slave &c.). Ohol. XVII, 3 a field שא' בו קבר in which there is a grave that cannot be located. Keth. XIII, 7 אָבְדָה דרך וכ' the path to his field cannot be traced. Gen. R. s. 91 אבידה א' לנו we have lost something; a. fr.

Ib. ואנו שאָבַדְנוּ ר' ס' and we who have lost (mourn for) R. S.; a. fr.—Part. pass. אָבוּד lost, irretrievable, perishing, decayed. Keth. 108 a על הא' on a contribution to the Temple which has been lost on the road. Y. Shebi. IX, 38 d top מאיליהן הן אֲבוּדִין they perish of themselves (they decay naturally); a. fr.
Keth. 104 a; a. fr. Sifré Deut. 301 לֵיאָבֵד, v. supra.

Ned. 33 b אי' את מעותיו he wasted his money, (cannot reclaim it). Keth. XIII, 6 אי' את זכותו he forfeited his claim. Ab. Zar. 55 a אנו נְאַבֵּד וכ' shall we give up our honest dealing? Ib. IV, 7 יְאַבֵּד עולמו shall He destroy His world? Ḥag. 3 a ובקשתם לאַבְּדָהּ ממני and you wanted to deprive me of it? Ib. 4 a זה המְאַבֵּד וכ' one who destroys what is given to him.—א' עצמו לדעת to commit suicide wilfully. Gen. R. s. 82; a. fr.

definition.italic: to drop from memory, to forget.

sense.notes: Aboth V, 12; a. e.
Targ. I Sam. IX, 3; a. fr.—Snh. 111 a; a. fr.—Y. Pes. IX, 37 a כאָבִיד הוא it is to be looked upon as lost.
Targ. II Kings, XIX, 18; a. fr.

sense.definition: = Pa. Targ. Deut. XXVI, 5; a. fr.—Y. Kid. III, 64 c bot. אובדתא חיין וכ' thou hast ruined this man’s (my) life.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 56 אובדת ליבך thou hast lost thy wits; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be lost, to go to ruin.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. XLI, 6; a. e.—Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b ווי דמובדין alas for the lost (deceased)! Y. M. Kat. I, beg. 80 a ויובדן and decay.
Lev. R. s. 34 מִתְאַבְּדִין if they should be lost.—מִתְּבִיד = מִתְאֲבִיד Pes. 5 b; a. e. [Lam. R., to IV, 21 לאיבדא, read לאיעבדא, v. עֲבַד.]
דבר הא' a business which cannot be postponed without irretrievable loss. M. Kat. 11 a; a. fr.
Targ. Prov. XXVIII, 28.
, v. אֲבֵי'
pr. n. m., v. אֶבְדִּימוֹס
, v. אברומא
, v. אֶבְדִּימוֹס
Koh. R. to V, 8.
Y. Meg. III, 74 a bot. rendered in a secret political letter טוב ילד Good-Child. (Ed. קום—, קין—corr. acc.)
, v. next w.

Y. Keth. XI, 34 b; mostly abbrev. אבדימא, אבדימי (corrupt. אבדומי, אבודמא, אבודמי), name of several Amoraim, the most prominent: Eb. of Zepphoris. Y. Ber. IV, 8 a; a. fr. [V. Frankel Mebo, s. v.] V. וַרְדִּימוֹס.
Y. Ber. VIII, 12 c top א' ודאי real separation.

sense.definition: Habdalah, a formula of prayer for the exit of the Sabbath or Holy Days.
sense.notes: Ibid. beg. 11 d. Pes. 113 a; a. fr.— Pl. אַבְדָּלוֹת. Y. Ber. V. 9 b bot. שבעה א' seven objects of distinction (mentioned in the Habdalah).

sense.definition: Abdan (contr. of אבא יודן), an Amora of the first gener.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IV, 7 c bot. (cmp. Gen. R. s. 10). Ber. 27 b Ms. M. (ed. אבידן); a. e.
Y. Dem. VII, 26 a bot. או' אוכלין waste of eatables; a. fr.
Targ. Prov. XXVII, 20; a. e.
, v. אֲבֵי'
, v. אֲבַרְתָּא

sense.definition: Abbah; father of Samuel; v. אַבָּא II.

sense.notes: , v. אבי

sense.definition: Abbahu, name of two Palestine Amoraim, one prob. of the first gener.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. V, 8 d bot; Y. Bicc. II, 64 d top; the second a celebrated disciple of R. Yoḥannan, residing in Cæsarea. Y. Ber. II, 4 b top. Succ. 48 b; a. fr.—Babylonian Amoraim by that name. Sabb. 119 b; Kid. 33 b, father of Rabbah, v. רַבָּה. B. Kam. 117 b, contemp. of R. Ashé, v. אַשֵׁי.

sense.definition: Y. Kil. III, 31 c Ar. (ed. אבחטס , read אַמְבָּטִיס q. v. or אִיפּוֹבַּטֵיס (ἱπποβάτης) stallion ass for mares.

sense.notes: pl. of אַבָּא.
, v. מַמְצִיא

sense.definition: Ibbu (Aïbu), all prob. forms of the same name, an Amora.
sense.notes: Snh. 5 a אבו Ar. ed. pr. (ed. אי', Ms. M. איי'). Succ. 44 b איי'. Ruth R., Par. 2, beg. רבי אי'. Num. R. s. 12. Y. Succ. II, 53 a bot.; Pes. 4 a, a. fr. איי'. [אִבּוּ name of a bird, v. אִיבּוּ].

sense.definition: (= אנב', נבב to be hollow; cmp. בִּיב I) reed, flute; pipe, tube.
sense.notes: Arakh. II, 3 א' של קנה a reed flute, א' של נחושת brass flute. Kel. II, 3; Men. X, 4 א' של קלאים Ar. (ed. קליות) an iron tube for roasting grain.—א' רוֹעֶה (Var. אבובראה, אבוברואה) shepherd’s flute, name of a plant (Eupatorium) used for medicinal purposes; v. חומטריא. Sabb. XIV, 3; ib. 109 b; Y. ib. XIV, 14 c

Yoma 20 b (prov.) א' לחרי וכ' a flute is musical to nobles—give it to weavers, they will not accept it (fools criticise where sages admire). Succ. 50 b.— Pl. אַבּוּבִין. Targ. Jerem. XLVIII, 36; a. fr.
, v. foreg. h.

sense.definition: (= אבו אברם), בר א' Bar Abbub’ram.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 38 a
, v. אִיבּוּד
, v. אָכוּז

sense.definition: Abbud’yana, a gentile name (referring to idolatry).
sense.notes: Git. 11 a
, v. אֶבְדִּימוֹס
, v. אַכְוַרְנְקָא

sense.definition: (cmp. אֵבוּס; אבז, √אב) Euphem. for buttocks, extremity.
sense.notes: Erub. 53 b; v. אָכוּז.

sense.definition: woe! ah! Num. R. s. 10 (ref. to Prov. XXIII, 29) האוי והא' the woe and the ah.
Abuyah, known as the father of Elisha, v. אלישע.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b; a. fr.
Y. Sabb. V, 8 b bot. Ar., read אִטִּין or אִטַּיָין.

sense.definition: (יבל, cmp. יְבוּל) the gate for carrying grain into the house, wagon-gate, gate-way.
sense.notes: Pl. אִבּוּלִים, אִיבּ'. Tosef. B. Mets. XI, 10 אין חולקין את אי' וכ' ed. Zuck. (ed. הָאִבּ') you dare not divide gate-ways between heirs unless there is the required space for each.

—M. Kat. 22 a begin to count the days of mourning מבבא דא' from the time ye turn your faces from the city gate-way (to go home while the corpse is carried to the grave-yard). Keth. 17 a; Meg. 29 a when people form a lane מא' ועד סיכרא from the city gate-way to the burial place. [Ar. house of mourning, v. אִבּוּל I.] B. Bath. 58 a bot. there was written אבבא דא' Ms. M. (ed. incorr. בא') over the gate of the town entrance (where court was held).— Pl. אִבּוּלֵי. Erub. 6 b. Yoma 11 a. Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 52 אבוליכון (ed. Vien. אכול'). Targ. Jer. L, 26 אִיבּוּלָהָא (h. text מאבסיה; v. Pesh. a. l.).
Nid. 67 b משום א' on account of the rude conduct of &c. [Rashi = אבולי dangerous, cavern-like entrances to the bath-house.]
, B. Bath 143 a, אאבולי read with Ms. M. אַבּוּלִי ואסטרטיגי, v. בּוּלִי II
, v. אַבִּילִין
Y. Pes. IV, beg. 30 cd (ר' אל' בשם ר' אבין; ר' א' בשם ר' אל'); Y. Taan. I, 64 c. Y. Shebu. VI, 37 a bot—V. בּוּן.

sense.definition: , pr. n. m. Abuna, an Amora.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. II, 33 d; a. fr.
, v. אַכְוַנְגַּר

sense.definition: feeding receptacle, bowl for working men; manger.
sense.notes: Ned. IV, 4.—Sabb. 140 b אי' של כלי (Rashi אב') a real manger, opp. אי' של קרקע a piece of ground fenced in and used as manger.
Y. Shebu. VII, 37 d top; VIII, beg. 38 b. [Y. Ter. I, 40 b אבוס read אִכּוּם or אָכִים.]— Pl. אֵבוּסִים. Y. Snh. 63 b אֵבוּסֵיהֶן their stables. V. אֵיפוּס.
Yalk. Lam. 1001, v. אֲבִיקָה.

sense.definition: (אבק, cmp. אבך, חבק; v. Sachs Beitr. I, p. 62; Naḥm. to Gen. XXXII, 25) [ bundle of twigs], torch (with, or without של אור).
sense.notes: Sot. 21 a נזדמנה לו א' של אור a burning torch happened to come in his possession. Ber. 43 b א' כשנים walking by torchlight is equal to two walking together (as regards protection from night-spirits).— Pl. אֲבוּקוֹת. Tosef. Succ. IV, 2 were dancing before them בא' with torches. Ib. 4 בשמונה א' של אור; Succ. 53 a ח' א' של אור; Y. ib. V, 55 c top א' של זהב (corr. acc. or read זֶפֶת?); Mish. ib. V, 4.

sense.definition: (Ar.) m. (= אִמְבּוּרְקְלוֹן q. v.; a Babyl.
sense.notes: corrupt. of an imported Palestinean phrase) bed-cover, ticking (involucrum). Pl. אַבּוּרְגְּנֵי, אַבְּרוּ'. Erub. 62 a בריאה במוהרקי וא' a lease of a court yard is called sound (legal and not merely a legal fiction), if connected with the privilege of placing in the yard chairs and seats, [Rashi, cmp. Mishnah;—מוהרקי, obviously a corruption for גוהרקי or גלופקרי, cmp. גמורקין.—Other explanations of our w., suggested by מוהרקי, v. s. v. מוה'.]
, v. אַכְוַר'
, v. אֲפוּזְיָינֵי

sense.definition: a foot-disease in animals believed to arise from vermin in consequence of a stroke of lightning;

sense.notes: B. Mets. 78 b (expl. הבריקה Mish.) אבזקת (Rashi אבזקא, Ms. M. אבוק, corr. ז for ו; cmp. Y. ib. VI, 11 a top. s. v. בָּזָק) atrophy or paralysis of the feet. Ib. א' במילת' וכ' the moths are in the royal wardrobe.

sense.definition: (Arab. bazr, abzâr, v. בזר, פזר) anything used for seasoning, spices &c.—Fig.
sense.notes: requisites, appurtenances. Snh. 74 b אינהו וכל אבזרייהו they (the commands) and all appertaining thereto. Men. 73 b עולה וכל אֲבִיזְרָהָא Ar. a. Rashi to Snh. l. c. (ed. חבירתא corr. acc.) the burnt-offering and &c.
, v. אַמְבָּטִיס a. אבהנוס.
, v. אַבְּטִי

sense.definition: (בט; cmp. בוט, בוץ, בטט a. deriv.) belly, whence leather wine-bag.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 34 b א' דטייעי (Ar. אכטא) the travellers’ wine-bag. [Y. Yeb. IV, 5 d, v. אֶפְטָא.] [אבטאות, v. אַבְּטִי.]
, v. אַבְּטַי
, v. next w.

Erub. III, 4 (35 a) ed. (Ms. M. אבטולס). Ib. 36 a; Y. ib. 21 a bot. אבטילס (v. Rabb. D. S. Erub. l. c., notes). Ex. R. s. 21 (אבטלוס) אבטוליס.—M. Kat. 18 a אֲבִיטוּל (prob. abbrev. of our w.), surnamed ספראה (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.), an Amora.
Midr. Till. to Ps. I, 5 האומרים א' הוא העולם Mus. (ed. טומטום, corr. acc.) who say the universe is a self-moving power (has no creator). [Better: אַבְטוֹמְטוֹן (αὐτόματον, S.) chance.]

sense.definition: (= אַבְטוֹנוֹמִיּוֹת; αὐτονομία; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Autonomi) cities enjoying their own laws, jurisdictions.
sense.notes: Y. Meg. I, 70 a bot. שני א' (read שתי). Y. B. Bath. III, 14 a top אבטנ'; Bekh. 55 a שני אבטילאות (corr. acc., Ar. אבטלאות, אבטליות). [Cmp. corruptions of אַגְרוֹנִימוֹס.]
, v. בְּטַח II
= הַבְטָחָה.
Tosef. Ohol. XIII, 3 (ed. Zuck. אבטו) v. בְּטַח II
, v. אַמְבְּטִי

sense.definition: , Var. חגה Sifré Deut. 80 (v. ed. Friedm. a. l. note 3), read טוֹגָא (toga) or טִיבִינָּא (τηβέννα) Roman toga.
(ὀπτίων, optio; Perl. Et. St. p. 103; D.
sense.notes: C. Lat. s. v.) commissary, quartermaster in the Roman army. Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c bot. אתא א' וכ' a Roman quarterm. came and made him stand behind him (in the public convenience).
Maasr. I, 5.— Pl. אֲבַטִּיחִים. Ib. 4; a. fr.
—Pl. אֲבַטִּיחַיָּא, אֲבַטִּיחִין. Targ. O. Num. XI, 5. Y. Snh. VII, end, 25 d
, v. אַבְטוֹנִיּוֹת
abbr. of אַבְטוֹלְמוֹס.
בית א' Beth. Abt., name of a priestly family who had the secret for preparing the frank-incense for the Temple. Yoma III, 11; I, 5; a. e.
Y. Bets. V, 63 b נר של א' a light burning to no purpose. Y. Shebi. VII, 37 c top על הא' for the loss of time.

sense.definition: Abtalion (Greco-Romanized by Josephus Πολλίων, Pollio), name of a Chief Justice of the Sanhedrial court in the days of Hyrcan II and of Herod.
sense.notes: Aboth I, 10; 11. Eduyoth I, 3. Yoma 71 b; a. e.
, v. אַבְטוֹנִיּוֹת

entry.language-reference: אָבָה, √אב to press, surround, embrace, v. אָבַב; cmp. אָוָה, חָפֵץ)

sense.notes: Targ. O. Deut. XXV, 7; a. fr.—[Targ. Prov. XXIX, 11, ed. Wil. מאבה, read מֵאֲכָהּ, v. מאך.]
, v. אביה
R. Hash. 21 a (ref. to Deut. XVI,
שמור א' וכ' observe the ripening of the equinoctial season that it be in the month of Nissan (rule for intercalation). Men. 84 a; a. fr.

Targ. O. Lev. II, 14; Ex. XIII, 4; a. e.—Snh. 11 b; Y. ib. I, 18 d top זימנא דא' וכ' the season of ripening has not yet come. [Y. Maasr. V, 52 a אביבא דפילא, read אַרְכּוּבָא.]— Pl. (adj.) אַבִּיבִין, אָבִי'. Targ. O. Ex. IX, 31 (ed. Berl. sing.).

שומר א' the keeper of a lost object waiting for its owner to claim it B. Mets. 29 a; a. fr.—בעל א' the owner of the lost thing. Kid. 2 b בעל א' מחזיר וכ' the owner hunts for what he has lost, i.e. man woos woman (allud. to Gen. II, 21); a. fr.—M. Kat. 25 b בכו לאובדים ולא לא' Ms. M. (ed. בכו לאבילים) weep for the losers, but not for the lost (deceased).
אֲבֵידַת נפש decrease of physical strength. Yoma 74 b.—(Y. ib. VIII, 44 d top אב בית read אבידת).

sense.definition: (אבד; cacophemism for וַועֲדָא q. v.), בֵּי א' = בֵּי וַועֲדָו) prop. their place of ruin, cacophemism for meeting-place, gathering for idolatrous purposes and performances connected with idolatrous feasts (games, &c.) which the Jews, under Hadrian, were forced to attend.
sense.notes: Sabb. 152 a. Ab. Zar. 17 b.—Transf. meeting place of early Christians where religious controversies used to be held. Sabb. 116 a ספרי דבי א' Christian writings. Ib. רב לא אזיל וכ' Rab would not attend a Be-Abedan, Samuel would.

sense.definition: Abidarna, gentile friend of R. Yuda.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 65 a top. [Ms. M. אבינדרא, Var. אבי דרבא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.]
f. ch. = h. אֲבֵידָה. Targ. Ex. XXII, 8; a. e. B. Mets. 23 a; 27 b; 28 b
, v. אכזווייא a. אַסְיָא.

sense.definition: , בַּר א' pr. n. m. ( Bar) Abyu, name of a renowned obituary poët.
sense.notes: Yeb. 103 a; M. Kat. 25 b בר אביו Ar. (ed. אובא, אבין, Ms. Var. אבו, איבו, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
Lev. R. s. 34 (etymol.) he is called ebyon, שהוא מתאב לכל (Yalk. a. l. מתאוה) because he longs for everything. Gen. R. s. 71. B. Mets. 111 b

sense.definition: caper-tree, or caper-berry, so called from the stimulating effects of its seed.
sense.notes: —Pl. אִבְיוֹנוֹת. Maasr. IV, 6; a. e.
f. pl. אֶבְיוֹנוֹת dial. for חֶבְיוֹנָה. Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. II, 2 (ed. Zuck. אובינות).
Midr. Till. to Ps. LXX, end.

sense.definition: , בֵּי א' pr. n. pl. Bé-Ebyoné (Poor-House); Rashi.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 117 a. [Ms. M. איביוני, Ms. F. אבוויני, Hal. G’dol. Ms. אכסני; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.—Prob. a corrupt. of בי זיונא, v. בִּזְיוּנָא.]
, v. אֲבִזְרָא
a renowned Babyl. Amora (original name נַחְמֵנִי). Keth. 65 a; a. fr.
Oth. Amoraim of that name. Ib. 94 a. Erub. 62 a
, v. אַבָּיָיה
Y. Succ. II, 53 a, רב א' read אַבִּינָא.
בר א' reader, precentor. Y. Pes. V, 32 c bot.—Y. Taan. III, end, 67 a; Y. Sheb. I, 33 b top אביי.
, v. אֶבְגִּינוֹס
Y. Yeb. VII, 8 a bot א' אשקלון, read אַוִּיר; comp. Y. Shebi. VI, 36 c
, v. אָבֵל, אֲבֵלָא a. אֶבְלָא.
Lam. R. introd., (R. Abbahu 4); v. אֲנִינָה.
fem. of אָבֵל II.
ch. = next w. Targ. Lam. II, 5; v. אֶבְלוּ.—M. Kat. 20 b באפה נהוג א' in her (thy wife’s) presence observe mourning (when she is in mourning).

M. Kat. 20 a sq. א' שבעה the mourning time is seven days. Ib. 24 a אין א' בשבת no mourning ceremonies are to be observed on &c. Yeb. 43 b א' חדשה recent (i.e. individual) mourning, in contrad. to א' ישנה mourning over Jerusalem. [Gen. R. s. 8 beg., some ed. אבילות—אוביל read אכילות—אוכיל].
, v. אֲבֵילוּ

sense.definition: Abelin, Abilena, a district of Peræa (v. Graetz, Gesch. d. Jud. II, 2, p. 457).
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 17; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 66 a האכלון (corr. acc.); Pesik. R. s. XVIII (p. 88 b ed. Friedm.) אובלים; Ruth R. to I, 5 אבולין. Tosef. Zeb. II, 3 ed. Zuck. אֵיבְלַיִים (Var. אובלים). Cmp. אִבּוּל a. אָבֵל pr. n. pl.
a disciple of Rabbah. Shebu. 28 b; Y. Ned. II, 37 b; Y. Shebu. III, 34 d top.
A. bar Tobi. Y. Naz. IX, beg., 57 c
Y. Bicc. II, beg., 64 c, Rabbi A. Cmp. אַבּוּן; v. אַבְיוּ.
Y. Pes. V, 32 c.—Y. Ned. IV, beg. 38 c (prob. Abbuna, as shortly before). [Y. Peah III, 17 d bot. בינא prob. the same.]—רב א' contr. רַבִּינָא q. v.
Sabb. 151 b, v. אַכְסָן

sense.definition: (בוק, v. בקע; comp. אָפִיק) outlet, esp. a pot in the bath-tub to which a waste-pipe is attached.
sense.notes: Mikv. VI, 10.
, v. אֲבַק

sense.definition: Abikah, a hero at the defence of Jerusalem.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 29—30, א' בן גבייתי (Yalk. Lam. 1001 אבוקא בן גבתרי).
, v. אֶבְקוֹלָס

sense.definition: strong, mighty, eminent (opp. קל light, of no influence); noble.
sense.notes: — Pl. אַבִּירִים. R. Hash. 25 b אביר שבא' the noblest of the nobility. Y. ib. II, 58 b bot. אַבִּירֵי עולם (Babli ib. l. c. חֲמוּרֵי; Koh. R. to I, 4 גדולי) the world’s noblest sons. [Esth. R. to II, 4, v. אַבִּירָם.]
, v. וַרְדִּימוֹס
Esth. E. to II, 4 ר' יהוש' בר א' (some ed. אבירים, Midr. Sam. ch. XIII בריה דר' בירי).
, v. אַבְשׁוּנָא

sense.definition: , א' ישימון pr. n. pl. Abyath Y’shimon, usu. בֵּית י'.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II, Num. XXI, 20.

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Ebyathar, an Amora.
sense.notes: Git. 6 b. Y. Ber. IX, 13 a
Hithp. הִתְאַבֵּךְ to blend (of whirling smoke columns). Pesik. R. s. 29—30.

sense.definition: (Syr., P. Sm. 15; v. foreg., cmp. b. h. אָבַק) the fighter, whence large cock.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXX, 31; cmp. זַרְזִיר (Var. אַכָּבָא, Ms. אַבְּרָא).
Tosef. Erub. V (IV), 1 אמרו לו א' said they to him, yes (we admit). Erub. 30 b top. Nid. 3 b; a. e.—Gen. R. s. 91 לשון דרומית וכ' it is a South Palestine expression where ãbal means bram, v. בְּרַם.
Ber. VII, 1; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. pl. Abel, name of several towns; cmp. אֲבֵילִין.
sense.notes: Erub. 87 a ed. (Ms. M. בבל, corr. acc., Var. lect. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

sense.definition: , v. אבב; cmp. אפל); [ dark, cmp. קֹדֵר], mourner, esp. during seven days after burial.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 14 b; a. v. fr.— Pl. אֲבֵלִים, (אֲבֵילִין) אֲבֵילִים. Keth. 8 b; v. בְּרָכָה. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c bot. אֲבֵילֵי גויים mourners among gentiles; a. fr.—Fem. אֲבֵילָה, אֲבֵלָה. Y. Ber. IV, 8 a; Y. Taan. II, 65 c bot.

Hithpa. הִתְאַבֵּל, Nithpa. נִתְאַבֵּל to observe mourning ceremonies, to be bound to mourn, be an אָבֵל. M. Kat. 20 b כל שמִתְאַבֵּל עליו מתא' עמו over whom one is bound to mourn, with him he must mourn, i.e. one must share in the mourning ceremonies of a relation at whose death he would have to observe mourning; a. fr.—Tanḥ. Sh’mini, 1 נתא'. Pesik. Sos p. 148 b; a. fr.
Targ. Lam. II, 8.

Targ. Gen. XXXVII, 34; a. fr.—Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c top. v. אִימִירָא. Esth. R. beg. כד ילידת הוו מִתְאַבְּלִין when the Empress gave birth, they (the Jews) mourned (it being the Ninth of Ab). B. Kam. 59 b את חשיבא לאִתְאַבּוּלֵי וכ' ed. (Ms. R. לאַבּוּלֵי, v. infra) art thou distinguished enough to wear mourning for Jerusalem?
. Ib. מְאַבֵּילְנָא ed. (Ms. F. מאבלנא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., note 6) I wear mourning.

Y. M. Kat. III, 82 b; a. fr.— Pl. אֲבֵילִים. M. Kat. 7 b מי שתכפוהו אֲבֵילָיו he whom his mourning days overtook, i.e. a second case occurring before the mourning days of the first expired.—אֵבֶל רַבָּתִי Ebel Rabbathi (Great Mourning), name of a Talmudic treatise, also named euphemistically שְׂמָחוֹת Rejoicings.—[Chald. Targ. Gen. L, 11; v. אֶבְלָא.]
, v. אוּבָל
ch. = h. אָבֵל. Targ. Koh. VII, 2; a. e.—Pl., אֲבֵילַיָּא, אֲבֵלֵי, אֲבֵילִין. Targ. Prov. XXXI, 6; a. e.—Y. M. Kat. III, 82 d bot.; a. e.
ch. = h. אֵבֶל. Targ. Gen. L, 11 (Var. אִיבְלָא אָבֵל). Ib. O. XXVII, 41; a. e. Targ. Y. II Lev. X, 19 אֲבֵילָא.—Gen. R. s. 27 (prov.) comes joy, rejoice; בשעת א' א' comes mourning, mourn.
f. = אֲבֵילוּתָא. Targ. Y. II Deut. XXVI, 14.
Ar. ed. Koh., v. אבלוסמוס
Gen. R. s. 33 (Snh. 108 a בלועה דגדר). Cmp. אבילין, אובלין.
כלי א' camping apparels (leather covers etc.). Zeb. 94 a Ar. (ed. אַכְסִלְגְיָא q. v.).

sense.definition: ; cmp. פלש, a. b. h. פלס) those who cut through (cmp. בקע a. deriv.), whence ground-diggers.
sense.notes: (Maim.). B. Mets. 77 a א' דמחוזא Ar. Var. (ed. a. Ar. אכ' q. v.; Ms. M. אוכלסי, Ms. R. אכלוזי) the ground-diggers (working men) of M.

sense.definition: Ablet, a gentile scholar, Ab. Zar. 30 a.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. III, 6 a bot., Y. Bets. II, 61 c
pr. n. m. Pesik. R. s. 33 [Y. Naz. VII, 56 a מגבילה; Y. Ber. III, 6 a bot. גבילה].
Y’lamd. B’haal. מטות של א' (quot. in Ar., Tanḥ. a. Num. R. s. 14 only … מנורות) couches of ebony wood. [Jellin. Beth Hammidr. VI, 88, Nr. 53 אבליגא.]

sense.definition: Avlas, in Cilicia, mentioned as one of the northern border places of the land of Israel.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. I Num. XXXIV, 8 אב' דקילקאי; Y. II ibid. תחומא דאַוְו' דקל' (the district of) A. of the Cilicians. Tosef. Shebi. IV, 11 עילי רבתא ed. Zuck. (Var. אולם); Sifré Deut. 51 לולא רבתא; Yalk. Deut. 624 לילא רבתא; Y. Shebi. VI, 36 c אולם רבתא. [Probably identical with Pylæ Ciliciæ, Πύλαι τῆς Κιλίκιας.] [Sifré Num. 131 סבטיא מאולם; Y. Snh. X, 28 d סובתה מאולם S. of Ulam; Bab. ib. 64 a סבטא בן אלס(?).]
Y. Meg. III, 74 a bot., rendered in a secret letter טוב למד well-learned; v. אֶבְדּוֹקוֹס.
Y. Snh. III, end, 21 d

sense.definition: , v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) stone.
sense.notes: Sabb. 10 a; Pes. 12 b כזורק א' וכ' like throwing a stone into a leather bottle (has no effect, or is indigestible). Num. R. s. 22 (prov.) into a well out of which you drank אל תזרוק בו א' cast no stone.—א' טובה jewel. B. Bath. 16 b; a. fr. Pl. אֲבָנִים, const. אַבְנֵי. Gen. R. s. 68 שנים עשרה א'. Ib. אם מתאחות הן שלשה א' (read שלש) if these three stones shall grow into one; a. fr.

sense.definition: Stone Chamber, name of a Temple compartment.
sense.notes: Parah III, 1.—א' גליון, v. אָוֶן.—א' הטועים (א' טועין, א' טוען, v. טָעָה) Stone of Losers (Claims), a place in Jerusalem where lost and found things were deposited and claimed. Taan. III, 8; Y. ib. 66 d bot.; B. Mets. 28 b—א' המבר or א' המקח auction place (for slaves). Sifré Deut. 26. Sifra B’har ch. VII, s. 6. Yalk. Lev. 667 א' הלקח.—א' מסמא a stone used for closing a pit etc. Nid. 69 b בא' מ' the corpse was put on a closing (immovable) stone; a. e.—קבועה א' a stone rooted in the ground, opp. תלושה. Y. Sotah IX, 23 c top.—אבני השדה v. אדני.—שׁוֹאֶבֶת א' magnetic stone, load-stone. Snh. 107 b; a. e.—א' הַשָּׁעוֹת stone-dial, Kel. XII, 4; a. e.—א' שְׁתִיָּה foundation stone, stone Sh’thiya which in the second Temple occupied the place of the Holy Arc. Yoma V, 2 (3); v. Gem. a. l.—אבנים תּוֹשָׁבוֹת immigrant stones, i.e. stones brought over from another ground. Tosef. Shebi. III, 4; cmp. Shebi. III, 7 a. Y. Gem. a. l.—א' תלושה v. sup. א' קבועה.—א' תקומה preserving stone, a stone believed to protect against abortion. Sabb. 66 a.—[For other combinations see respective determinants.]

Targ. Gen. XXVIII, 18; a. fr.—Pl. אַבְנַיָּא, אַבְנֵי, אַבְנִין. Targ. Ex. XXVIII, 11; a. fr. Lev. R. s. 16; a. e.—א' דאכפא weight-stones, to prevent the sheaves being blown away. B. Bath. 69 a.—א' דכוחלא black marble stone. Kid. 12 a. [Targ. Prov. XXIII, 28, read with Ms. Luzz. וצאדא בניא שברי and captures foolish sons.] [Y. B. Bath. II, 13 c … דיין אבן corrupt a. defective.]

sense.definition:
, only in Du. אָבְנַיִם (b. h.,
√בן, v. בֵּין, cmp. אֹפֶן)
the passage of the embryo, vagina.
sense.notes: Ex R. s. 1 (etym.) מקום שהולד נפנה בו (some ed. נקנה incorr.) where the child turns (to come to light). [Oth. etym. v. ibid. a. Sot. 11 b.]
, v. אֶבֶן ch.
Sabb. 109 b, v. כנגד
B. Kam. 94 b. Yoma 6 a; 12 a; a. fr.— Pl. אַבְנֵטִים. Zeb. 18 a

sense.definition: Abnimos, Nimos, a gentile philosopher, friend of R. Meïr [prob.
sense.notes: identical with the cynic philosopher Oenomaus of Gadara]. Gen. R. s. 65; a. e. א' הגרדי. Ḥag. 15 b נ' הגרדי.
Targ. Y. II Deut. XIV, 18, read with Y. I אֻכְמְתָא, v. אוּכְ'

Meg. 24 b בא' דל' תלי (Ms. M. באוב') it depends on the speculative faculty (not on the physical sight). Ab. Zar. 28 b באו' דל' תלי (Ms. M. בליבא תליא, cmp. Tosaf. a. l.) an affection of the eye-sight is connected with (has influence on) the mental faculties; (oth. opin., cmp. אֹבֶן, the fat surrounding the heart).

sense.definition: to stuff; to fatten, feed (act. a. neut.) B.
sense.notes: Mets 86 b (expl. ãbusim, I Kings V, 3) שאוֹבְסִין אותן בע"כ which people fatten with force. Ib. שא' ועומדין וכ' that stand feeding as they please. Sabb. XXIV, 3 (155 b) אין אובסין וכ' you must not (on the Sabbath) stuff the camel; expl. ib. you must not make אֵבוס בתוך וכ' a manger of her stomach (fill up to swelling); a. fr.—Part. pass. אָבוּס (= שׁוֹר). Meg. 9 a, a. e. (one of the changes said to have been made by the authors of the Septuag.).

sense.definition: (ἀβάσκαντα) unbewitched! may no harm befall you! Y. Ab. Zar. I, end, 40 b א' לא אמר he did not say abascanta, but etc. Y. Ber. IV, 13 c top (corr. acc.).

sense.notes: , v. נבע
Targ. O. Ex. IX, 9 (Var. אֲבַעְבּוֹעַיָן f. pl.).
, v. בְּעַד

sense.definition: (בָּעָה) search, begging, the appearance of the poor for their share in the crop.
sense.notes: Pl. אַבְעָיוֹת. Peah IV, 5 ג' אב' וכ' (Y. ed. IV, 3 אוּבְ') three times a day the poor would come (cmp. etym. Y. ib. 18 b top). [Oth. comment. ref. to etym. in Y. l. c. a. Targ. Obad. v. 6: “the owner appears” &c.]
Targ. O. Num. XXXI, 22.

sense.definition:
v. אֲבַק,
cmp. עשׁן), ( thick, whirling) dust, powder.
sense.notes: Sabb. III, 3 אֲבַק דרכים the (heated) sand on the roads. Ḥull. 91 a. Cant. R. to III, 6; a. fr.—הסופרים א' the refuse of writing material, or the colored sand strewn over the writing. Sabb. XII, 5 וכ' כתב במשקין if one writes (on the Sabb.) with a fluid or sap of fruits (instead of ink), or in the sand on roads or in the writer’s powder.—Trnsf. (cmp. אֲבַק) connection, something akin to, shade of, as א' לשון הרע a shade of slander; רבית א' a shade of usury; א' של שביעית an agricultural occupation indirectly related to those forbidden in the Sabbath year; v. infr.— Pl. אֲבָקוֹת. Tosef. Ab. Zar. I, 10 ארבע א' הן (ed. Zuck. אבקאות) the word abak in its figur. sense is applied to four things; cmp. B. Bath. 165 a; B. Mets. 61 b; 67 a; Succ. 40 b

אִבֵּק, אִיבֵּק (denom. of foreg.) to cover with powder, esp. plants, for fertilizing. Shebi. II, 2 מְאַבְּקִין (cmp. Y. Gem. a. l.). M. Kat. 3 a. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a top.—Part. pass. מְאוּבָּק powdered. Y. Bicc. I, 63 d bot. מאונקות (read מְאוּבָּ') grapes fertilized with powder. [Ar. “to remove the dust”(?)]

sense.definition: to be covered, or cover one’s self with dust.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 43.—Metaph. to sit at one’s feet as a disciple. Aboth. I, 4.
Men. 42 a אביק להו מיבק (perh. אַבֵּיק Pa.) he twined (the show-fringes) with loops.

sense.definition: (neut. v.) to be attached to, cling to (idolatry etc.).
sense.notes: Snh. 64 a; Ab. Zar. 14 b. Ib. 17 a א' בה טובא he was very deeply attached to sensuality.
ch. = h. אָבָק. Targ. Ex. IX, 9; a. e.
Tosef. Mikv. V, 7, read אָבִיק.
, v. אָבָק ch.
, v. אָבָק h.
Fig. רוֹכֵל אַבְקַת (peddlar’s spice-box) a great scholar. Cant. R. to III, 6 end.
Git. 56 a; Lam. R. to IV, 2. Tosef. Sabb. XVI (XVII), 6 (Var. אבטולס, אביקלוס). Cmp. אפיקולוס.
Men. 33 a, read אבקתא, v. next w.

sense.definition: (אֲבַק) loops, leather rings, on bedsteads for the reception of cords; in door cases, for hanging doors in.
sense.notes: Ned. 56 b; Snh. 20 b. דרגש בא' … a couch is called dargesh, when it is carried in and out (to be put up and taken apart) by means of loops (through which the cords are fastened); opp. mittah, v. בִּזְיוּנָא.—Men. 33 a, Erub. 11 b ed. (Ms. M. אנקתא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note), explain. היכר ציר ‘an indication of hinges’.—Macc. 23 a ( loops in the punishing scourge).
or יבר Hif. הוֹבִיר, v. בּוּר

sense.definition: (√אב, v. אבב; cmp. גבר, חבר) to be bent, pressed, thick.

sense.notes: Snh. 109 b (play on Abiram, Num. XVI, 1) שאִי' לבו מ' וכ' Ms. M. (Rashi לבבו, ed. עצמו) he hardened his heart against repentance.

sense.definition: (denom. of אֵבֶר) to measure wings, to define city limits, for Sabbath distances, in cases of wing-like projections beyond the line.
sense.notes: Erub. V, 1 כיצד מְאַבְּרִין (accord. to Rab’s spelling, while Sam. read מְעַבְּרִין, v. Y. ib. 22 b, Bab. ib. 53 a) how do we measure outskirts of a city in order to draw the Sabbath line?; v. etymol. definit. Y. a. Babl. ll. cc. a. Y. Ber. VII, 12 c top.

sense.definition: (b. h. Hif.) to soar, take wings.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 42 (play on Shemeber, Gen. XIV, 2) שמְאַבֵּר וכ' Ar. s. v. שמאבר (ed. שהיה פורח) he took wings to fly and obtain wealth.

sense.definition: Ithpe. אִתְאֲבַר (v. next w. a. foreg.) to be winged, to soar.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXXIX, 29.

sense.definition:
wing, v. אָבַר; cmp. כַּף,
כָּנָף)

sense.notes: —א' מן החי a part cut off from a living animal. Ḥull. 101 b; a. fr.
Snh. 107 a. Y. Keth. V, 30 b

sense.definition: town quarter, projecting outskirts (v. אָבַר Pi.
sense.notes: 2).—א' א' limb by limb; piecemeal. Sabb. 40 a. Y. Yoma VI, 43 d bot. Koh. R. to X, 15.— Pl. אֵבָרִים, אֵיבָרִים, אֵיבָרִין limbs, parts (of an animal). Shek. VII, 3 meat found אי' in entire limbs (opp. חתיכות cut slices). Sabb. 82 b אינה מטמאה לא' Ms. M. (ed. לא' אינה) does not make unclean when dismembered. Kel. XVIII, 9 (parts of a bedstead).—א' א' as sing. Ḥull. 11 b. Treat. S’maḥ. II, 12.—Ber. I, 1 the fat וא' and other pieces of the daily offerings. Ohol. I, 8 רמ"ח א' 248 limbs (joints).
Sabb. 154 b, v. חֶבֶר.—Ch. אֵיבְרָא.

Snh. 52 a פתילה של א' a string (bar) of lead. Ḥull. 8 a א' מעיקרו lead directly from the mine (hot). Y. Sabb. VII, 10 b bot. Kel. XIV, 5 הא' שבצד וכ' the lead hanging down from the neck of the animal (as ornament or mark). Git. 19 a; Sabb. 104 b כתבו בא' if he wrote the document with lead (solution); a. fr.

Targ. Ex. XV, 10. Targ. Y. Lev. XX, 14; a. e.—Snh. 64 a שדיוהו וכ' cast ye him into a kettle (of lead) וכסיוהו וכ' and cover him with lead (or heavy load; ed. שדיוה incorr.; Ms. M. omits דאברא; oth. var. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). Git. 19 a בא' (writing) with lead pencil, במיא דא' with a solution of lead.
, v. אִיבְרָא

sense.definition: , Targ. Prov. XXX, 31 Ms. the cock, cmp. אבר a. גבר; v. אַבָּכָא.
adv. (בר) outside, freq. with prefix מֵ־, opp. אגואי.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 130 ab Ab. Zar. 2 b למיתב מלכא מא' for the king to wait outside (of the court-room). R. Hash. 8 b למיקם … א'. Ber. 18 b יתיב א' sat outside (of the gathering of the righteous in heaven). Cmp. בְּרָאִי.
, Erub. 62 a, Var., v. אַבּוּרְגְּנָא
, v. ברי ch.

sense.definition: (cmp. אָבַר Pi.) wings or corners of city walls (h. פִּנָּה), pinnacles, mural turrets.
sense.notes: Sabb. 11 a ed. (Ar. אברוארי, read אבראורי; Ms. M. אַוְרַוְרֵי; Var. lect. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note)

sense.definition: (v. אֵבֶר a. חֶבֶר) balance, freight arranged for balancing, ballast.
sense.notes: B. Bath 24 b אימור באברוו' הוו מנחי Ms. M. (ed. באברו') I may say, the small kegs were placed among the large for balancing purposes.
, v. אִבְרוֹסִי
, v. בריכסון

sense.definition: hash or brine of a certain fish (Ἀβραμίς?).
sense.notes: Succ. 18 a (Ms. M. a. ed. אבד', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) [Rashi: ‘ a very small fish’.]

sense.definition: (prob. a. geogr. term) ibrosi, name of a species of olive of medium size, also called אֵגוֹרִי q. v. Ber. 39 a its name is not egori, אלא א' וכ' Ms. M. (ed. אברוטי, Ar. ed. Koh. אברוצי) but its original name is ibrosi or as some say סִבְרוֹסִי Ms. M. (ed. סמרוסי); Y. Bicc. I, 63 d bot. (אוורוס) אווריס.

sense.notes: , v. אַמְבּוּרְקְלוֹן
, v. אַבְרַוְורֵי

sense.definition: (Pers. âfrôsah) a dish of flour, honey, and oil; a word in a marginal note in Ms. M. to Ber. 37 a, quoted in Ar. and in Rashi to 36 b bot. (אברוש"די, corr. acc.), defining חביץ קדרה.
sense.notes: V. Rabb. D. S. a. l.
, Tosef. Neg. VIII, 2, v. בְּרוֹת

sense.definition: (בזא II, v. בִּרְזָא II; cmp. h. equiv.
sense.notes: עוּבְצָה, עוּבְצָא) prop. cutting, trimming, hence fur trimmed of its extremities ( and pinked), in gen. carriage-robe, cover [R. Hai Gaon declares our w. to be Persian, v. Ar. ed. Koh. s. v., a. Fl. to Levy Targ. Dict. II, 579 b.] B. Kam. 66 b מעיקרא קרו וכ' (Ms. M. אברזיד) before its use was determined upon it was called mishkha (skin), and now (even before the trimming is done), it is called ãbirzin (fur, robe). V. קִיצּוּעַ.

sense.definition: (v. בַּר II) lit. outside places, hence villages, cottages.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. VI, 10 a [Comment. ‘ to take refreshments’, v. אִיבְרָיָיא]. [אברייאה Cant. R. to II, 14, read אִיגָּרַיָיא, v. אִיגָּר.]
, Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 d, v. אַבְרְקִין
, v. אַבְרוֹת

sense.definition: (Gen. XLI, 43) Abhrekh, a title; homiletically defined א̇ב̇ בחכמה ורַ֗ךְ֗ בשנים father in wisdom, tender in years. Gen. R. s. 90.
(prob. fr. אֵבֶר; well-winged) name of a bird, prob. sea-mew.
sense.notes: Yalk. Esth. 1054; (Esth. R. to III, 6 עוף).

sense.definition: (Pers., v. Fl. to Levy Talm. Dict. s. v., a. Lagarde Ges. Abh. vol. 23) half-done meat.
sense.notes: Pes. 41 a (explain. נָא Ex. XII, 9) כדאמרי פרסאי א' (Yalk. Ex. 197 כד' אינשי) as the Persians say abarnim. [כדאמרי פרסאי does not necessarily refer to the Persian language, cmp. דְּבִיר. Perh. our w. is a Hebrew expression known among Persian Jews, and a compound of אֵבֶר נִים (= נעים, נאים) a tender piece. Cmp. בַּנָּאִים.]
, v. אַוְרַנּוֹס
, v. אוורקסין

sense.definition: (ברק = פרק; cmp. בקר = פקר, v. אפקרסין) underclothes, inexpressibles, breeches (cmp. Lat. bracæ, braccæ—of Oriental origin).
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 d שני א' Ar. (ed. Krot. אַבְרִיקִין; Bab. ib. 120 a וב' פרגד, Ms. M. פרגוד, Ar. פרגודין; Rashi genouilliers, a. German Kniehosen). Y’lamd. B’resh. quot. in Ar. (expl. פטישיהון Dan. III, 2
ב' הנתונות וכ' (fem.) the underclothes put around their loins.

sense.definition: (ברי, v. אִיבְרָיָיא, a. הַבְרָאָה) hyssop (used against indigestion &c.).
sense.notes: Sabb. 128 a (explaining אֵזוֹב). Ib. 109 b אברתה (mentioning two species, one named בר־הימג = אזוב, the other בר־הינג = אזוב יון). Ab. Zar. 29 a Ms. M. a. Ar. (ed. אבדתא).

sense.definition: (אבש = יבש) something dried; parched or dried ears of grain.
sense.notes: Meg. 7 b; Ps. 39 b קמחא דא' flour of roasted ears. Ib. 40 a חצבא דאבשו' Ar. (ed. אבי') a basin wherein ears are roasted.
, v. אוּבְשִׁין

sense.definition:
(Samar. אגה rendition of b. h.
נקב; cmp. הָגָה) to spell (letters), blaspheme, swear.
sense.notes: Snh. 101 b תנא (ו)בגבולין ובלשון אגא Ar. (ed. עגה), the Boraitha remarks (to ההוגה as in Mishn. a. l.) this (condemnation of one uttering the name of the Lord) refers to the country (not the Temple), and in the sense of Samaritan aga (swearing). Cmp. Y. Snh. X, 28 b top כגון אילין כותאי וכ' in a way as those Samaritans swear.
Gen. R. s. 28, beg., read אִילוֹגִין.

sense.definition: (contr. of אל גב = עַל, cmp. אַ־) prop. on the back, on top of, hence, upon, on the basis; (logic.) by dint of, on account of; by the way of.
sense.notes: Snh. 95 b א' אורחך while on thy road, i.e. incidentally, occasionally. Freq. אורחא א', v. אוֹרְחָא.—B. Mets. 21 b א' דיקירי because they are heavy.—Ib. 11 b, a. fr. מטלטלין א' מקרקעי the sale of movable chattel made binding by dint of immovable property jointly sold; cmp. קַרְקַע.—Kid. 26 b א' אחר by means of somebody else (taking possession in behalf of the absent person). Ib. 27 a מי בעינן א' is it necessary that he must say, ‘Acquire movable by dint of acquiring landed property’?—Pes. 113 a כל א' גביא בעיא every claim the legality of which rests on some additional circumstance (e.g. a loan collectible only on producing the note of indebtedness) requires collection (cannot be considered actual property until collected).—Sabb. 116 a א' כתב הוא דקדוש the parchment is sacred only on account of the sacred character of what is written on it.—Shebu. 40 b, v. גְּרָרָא; a. fr.
, v. גַּבָּא
, v. אָגוּסְטוֹס, end.

sense.definition: (= אוֹגְבִין, h. גְּבִיעַ, גִּבְעוֹל) calix or corolla of flowers.
sense.notes: Y. Kil. IX, 32 a top א' קסריי the cissaros blossom (v. Lat. Dict. s. v. cissaros, Gr. Dict. s. v. χρυσάνθεμον) “a woolly substance growing on stones at the Dead Sea, looking like gold, and being very soft; its name is כלך (χάλκη, κάλχη) and it resembles sheep-wool”.—(R. Ash. a. l. in Mishn.). Y. Sabb. II, 4 c top אנב' ק', corr. acc. [Var. lect. אצבין = אַצְוָוא?, אגטין.—Sabb. 20 b, our w. appears as גושקרא, גשקרא, obviously a corruption of cissaros ; Rashi ib. expl. ‘the shell of the cocoon’, prob. confounding with chrysallis which is likewise named from its gold color.]

sense.definition: (√אג, sec. r. of אוג, v. אוּגְיָא, cmp. אגר, חגר, עקד)
to twine around, tie up; to close, forbid.
sense.notes: Succ. III, 1; a. fr.—Sabb. 60 a אוֹגֶדֶת בו וכ' Ar. (ed. אוגרת, Ms. M. חוגרת) she fastens her hair with it.—Pes. 87 a בנות ישראל שאוֹגְדוֹת וכ' ed. (Ms. M. בחורות … שמגידות, v. Hif.) the maidens in Israel who forbid intimacy to their betrothed. Erub. 21 b ל"א אוגדות ed. (missing in Ms. M.).

sense.definition: (denom. of אֲגוּדָּה) to form a union or faction.
sense.notes: Sifré Deut. 294, v. Nif. [B. Bath. 14 a לוחות אוגדות, v. אָגַר a. אָכַל.]

sense.definition: to be tied up, united &c. Maasr. I, 5 ירק הנֶ' משיֵאָגֵד vegetables ordinarily put up in bunches, are subject to tithes from the time they are tied.
sense.notes: Y. Erub. III, 20 d top.—Sifré Deut. 296 שלא תאגוד עליך אגודה (read תֵּאָגֵד) no alliance (of the surrounding nations) shall be formed against thee.

sense.definition: , contr. הֵיגִיד, part. מֵיגִיד, מֵגִיד, to tie up, fence in, forbid.
sense.notes: Erub. 21 b; Pes. 87 a Ms. M. (play on מגדים Cant. VII, 14) שמֵגִידוֹת וכ' who forbid &c., v. supra (Rashi: שמַגִּידוֹת, v. נגד, who announce their menstruation); v. אָגַד II.
Part. pass. אָגִיד. Yeb. 39 b הא אֲגִידָא ביה is she not tied to him?, hence he must marry her.

sense.definition: (√גד, v. נגד a. גדל), Hif. הֵגִיד to stretch, prolong, postpone.
sense.notes: Erub. 21 b; Pes. 87 a (Ar. s. v. גד, v. however אָגַד I) שמֵגִידוֹת וכ' who postpone (reserve) sexual intimacy for their husbands. Y. Keth. V, 29 d bot. אני מֵיגֶדֶת וכ' I will extend (spend all the time of) my widowhood in my husband’s house.
Targ. Y. Ex. XIX, 13; Deut. XXX, 6. Denom. אוֹגְדוּתָא.
Targ. II Sam. III, 29 (some ed. אגר).

sense.definition: pole used as a yoke to carry burdens on the shoulder.
sense.notes: B. Mets 83 a דדרו בא' Ar., Ms. H., Oxf. &c. (Ms. M. איגרא, ed. אגרא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) who carry a burden on a yoke. Bets. 30 a(v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note
; Sabb. 148 a Ms. M. marg. אגרתא! (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 6). V. תִּגְדָּא.

Succ. 10 b, a. fr. צריך א' must be tied together. Ib. הותר אִגְדּוֹ if the tie of the Lulab became loosened. Erub. 101 b sq. בניטל באִגְדּוֹ (a. twice אִיגְ', Rabb. in D. S. a. l. באוּגְדּוֹ) when the door pin is handled by pulling the cord knotted to it.
Y. Ter. II, 41 b א' שנטמא a bunch of herbs that became unclean.
Sabb. 53 a
Succ. 33 b אי' מעלייתא וכ' (fem.!) it requires a substantial binding.
, v. אֲגַד III

sense.definition: (נגד, נ absorbed or dropped = הַגָּדָה) tale, story, lesson, esp. Agadah, that class of Rabb. literature which explains the Bible homiletically, opp. to Halakhah or legal interpretation (הֲלָכָה, שְׁמוּעָה).
sense.notes: M. Kat. 23 a שמ' וא' a legal tradition and an Agadah (homily). Y. Yeb. XII, 13 a. Y. B. Bath. VI, 15 c מסורת א' היא it is a traditional Agadah.—Y. Git. IV, 45 c בא' … מאן דייק לן who among us can enter into what thy grandfather said?—בעל א' a lecturer on Agadah. Gen. R. s. 94; a. fr.—אֲגָּדַת תלים the Agadah on Psalms. Ib. s. 33.— Pl. אֲגָדוֹת, אַגָּ'. Lev. R. s. 22, beg.; a. fr.—Cmp. אֲגַדְתָּא.

sense.definition: , pl.אֲגֻדּוֹת Tosef. Makhsh. III, 8 ed. Zuck., v. אֲגוּדָּה.

sense.notes: , v. אִגְּרוּ
, v. הָגְדָּס

sense.definition: (אֶגְדִּיקָס, popular corrupt. אנד', cmp. אַנְדִּיסְקֵי) m. (ecdicus = cognitor sive defensor civitatis, esp. in Asia Minor) state’s agent, syndic.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 12 א' ממונה על ביא שלה (ed. אנד'; בית שלו, corr. acc.) when an ecdicus is in the country, he holds the authority over the public road (curator viæ, v. בִּיָּא). Yalk. Ps. 794 (a. Ar.) אגר', corr. acc.— Pl. אֶגְדִּיקִין, אנ'. Cant. R. to VII, 9 (ed. אנ').

sense.definition: (v. גַּד I a. גִּירָּא, P. Sm. 23) worm-wood (Rashi: horehound).
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 29 a Ar. a. ed. (Ms. M. אוגרנא, with ר), in a prescription against asthma. Targ. Y. I Deut. XXIX, 17 אגד' (Var. אגר'); ed. Vienna pl. אַגְדָּנַיָּא (אגר').
B. Kam. 60 b opp. שמעתתא. Sotah 49 a יהא שמיה רבא דא' (abbr. יה"ש"ר) the kaddish (prayer) after lectures. Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 c

sense.definition: the Haggadah, i.e. the recitations for the Passover night.
sense.notes: Ps. 115 b א' והלילא Haggadah and Hallel. Ib. 116 b מאן דאמר א' וכ' who recited the Hag. in the house of R. Joseph (who was blind)?

sense.definition: (אָגָה to sting, v. אָגָא, √אג = חג, v. חגג) thorn, thorn-bush.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. VII, 37 b top.— Pl. אֵגִין. Y. Kil. V, 30 a bot.; v. הֵיגֶה.
Ḥull. 130 ab. Cmp. גַּו.

sense.definition: (אגג, v. אֵגֶה = h. חוֹגֵג q. v.) cleft, fissure.
sense.notes: א' דמיא cataract, water-falls (issuing from a fissure). Lam. R. to I, 17 (play on ḥ ogeg ibid. Ps. XLII, 5) כהדין א' וכ' Ar. like the cataract that rests neither &c. [Ed. געגעא].

Y. Sabb. VI, 8 a bot.; Y. Yeb. XII, 12 d top א' מלבינקי a band (of bast) with which mala punica (pomegranates) are tied together.— Pl. אֱגוֹדִים, const. אֱגוֹדֵי. Peah VI, 10 א' השום stalks of garlic plant used for tying bunches; [oth. opin. bunches of garlic on one stalk], opp. to אגודות tied bunches. [Tosef. ib. III, 8 אוגוּרֵי ed. Zuck., piles of garlic, v. אֵגוֹר.] [Num. R. s. 4 beg. חטים אגודיהם, v. אֵגוֹרִי.]
B. Mets. I, 8. Succ. 33 b כא' של וכ' as a bunch of herbs is tied; a. fr.

Lev. R. s. 30; Gen. R. s. 88 א' אחת one brotherhood.— Pl. אֲגוּדּוֹת. Peah VI, 10; v. foreg. Makhsh. VI, 2 א' של בית וכ' (herb) bunches which have been lying in the market houses; v. Tosef. ib. III, 8.—Yeb. 13 b (ref. to תתגדדו Deut. XIV, 1) לא תעשו א' א' do not form yourselves into religious factions. Ber. 4 a א' א' in companies (amusing themselves).

sense.definition: בֵּית א' pr. n. of a family, Beth-Aguddah.
sense.notes: Mass. Sof’rim IV, 1 של ב' א' … the scribes of the family Beth-Ag.
Yoma II, 1. Cant. R. to III, 6.

Git. 64 b (as signs of mental responsibility) א' ונוטלו if you throw a nut to it, and the child picks it up (at the same time throwing a pebble away); a. e.— Pl. אֱגוֹזִים, const. אֱגוֹזֵי. Orl. III, 8 נתפצעו הא' when the nuts are burst open. Ib. 7 אגוזי פרך crack-nuts (eatable); a. fr. [Tosef. Sabb. XIV (XV), 1 אגוז שבספינה ed. Zuck., read אוֹגִין, v. הוֹגִין.] [For etymol. cmp. אַגָּס.]
Keth. 77 b גירדא דא' scrapings of the bark of a nut-tree; v. אזגא.—Cmp. גּוּזָא, אַמְגּוּזָא.
Cant. R. to VI, 11.
, v. אָכְסִיגָרוֹן
Gen. R. s. 12, v. אנגיטוס a. אָגוּסְטוֹס, end.

sense.definition: (ἄγωμεν, fr. ἄγω) up! come on! Gen. R. s. 78.

sense.notes: Y’lamd. Emor (quot. in Ar, missing in Tanh.) א' נעשה במדינה.
Tanḥ. Mishp. 1, read אֲנוֹנָה.

sense.definition: Augusta, title of a female member of the imperial family (of Rome), in gen. princess &c. Esth. R. to I, 9.
sense.notes: [Tanʿh. Vaëra 8, א', read טוס …]

sense.definition: (Augustanus, Augustianus) a servant in a colonia Augustana, (perhaps identical with Curialis or Decurio; cmp. Gibbon, ed. Milm. II, 142 sq., Amer. ed.).
sense.notes: Snh. 26 a יכול לומר … טאן וכ' Ms. M. (Ms. C. a. F. יסטוון … ed. אגיסטון, אגיסטין, corr. אגוסטיין) he may say (as an excuse for tilling in the Sabbath year), I am merely an imperial servant in the estate.
, Gen. R. s. 1, v. אגוסטלי

sense.definition: Augustus, title of the Roman emperor, in gen. ruler, sovereign.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IX, 12 d bot. as one uses indiscriminately בסיליוס קיסר א' (βασιλεύς) Basileus, Cæsar, Augustus; Gen. R. s. 8 (corr. acc.). Ex. R. s. 23, beg.; a. fr.—[Gen. R. s. 12 א' במדינה ed. (Ar. אגבאסטס) read אַגְוִיסְטוֹר or אַגְבָאִיסְטוֹר v. אנגיטוס.]

sense.definition: Augustiani, a Prætorian legion entitled to proclaim the emperor.
sense.notes: Esth. R. to I, 3, end דקומייני א' the Decumani (or Decimani) and the Aug.—Gen. R. s. 94 גאו' (corr. acc.); v. Sachs. Beitr. I, 113 sq.
, v. next w.
Præfectus Augustalis, title of the prefect of Egypt. Gen. R. s. 1. ed. (Var. אגוסטולי, Ar. אגוסטלא).
Ex. R. s. 8 some ed., read אגוסטוס.
Y. Git. VII, 48 d לשייר לו אֲגוּפָהּ to reserve to himself the right of embracing her; Y. B. Bath. VIII, 16 c top גופה.
—[אִגּוּף v. אַגָּף.]

Tosef. Shebi. III, 3 ואי' יוצא וכ' ed. Zuck. (Var. ואיגד) and a mound (of arable ground) rises out of it (the rock).— Pl. אֵגֹורִים, אֵיג'; const. אֵיגֹורֵי. Tosef. Peah III, 8 אוגורי השום ed. Zuck. (Var. אגידי, אגודות, ed. אגודי, v. אֱגוֹד) heaps of garlic on the field, not yet bunched.

sense.definition: ; esp. heathen altar (cmp. b. h. גַּל).
sense.notes: Targ. Jud. VI, 25; a. fr.— Pl. אֱגֹורִין, אֵיג', אֲגֹורַיָּא, אֵי'. Targ. II Kings XXI, 3; a. fr.
Pl. אֲגֹורָאֹות Git. 88 b א' של נכרים (ed. אגוריאות corr. acc.) gentile courts.

sense.definition: (אגר) prop. store-room, hence the compartments of the nut-shell.
sense.notes: Pl. אֲגֹורֹות. Pesik. R. s. 11 as the nut has ארבע א' four compartments (Yalk. Cant. 992 מגורות).
inf. of אֲגַר.—אגורי for אֲגִירֵי, v. אָגִירָא

sense.definition: (v. אֵגֹור, אֲגֹורָה) fit for storage, of good quality.
sense.notes: Kel. XVII, 8 the olive (as a size standard) … neither large nor small, but of medium size, זה א' which is the kind called egori. Ber. 39 a; Y. Bicc. I, 63 d (etymol. explan.); v. אִבְרֹוסִי. Yalk. Deut. 851 זית א'. Gen. R. s. 91, end מור אי' myrrh fit for storage.— Pl. אֵגֹורִין Num. R. s. 4 beg. חטים אגודיהן, read אֵגֹורִין הם are all storage wheat (opp. טינופת). Cmp. אגרו.
, v. אֲגֹורָא II
v. אָגוּסְטֹוס
, v. גּוּחַ
Targ. Ps. CX, 3; a. e.
, Snh. 91 a, v. לֶגְטֹון;—Y. Kil. IX, 32 a v. אַגְבִּין.
— Pl. אַגְטְרַגְטַיָּיא Y. M. Kat. I, beg. 80 b אילין א' מה וכ' what is your opinion about those cascades?
, v. אוּגְיָא
, v. גּוּחַ
, v. אַגָּחוּתָא
Tanḥ. Emor. 18, v. בַּאיִין.—Y. Sabb. II, 5 b כפר א', read אָנוּן = חָנוּן Gen. R. s. 6.

sense.definition: (denom. of אגן, אוגנא, Pa.) to form disks or cakes (of wax).
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VII, 10 b bot. ההן דא' גיר קררין he who forms cakes of wax dust (on a Sabbath).
Gen. R. s. 56, some ed. אנונו—a corrupt passage, prob. to be read: ששמר את גנו משבולת הנהר והקיף את גן בנו עמו.

sense.definition: wife’s brother or kindred, brother-in-law, v. גִּיס.
sense.notes: Snh. III, 7 ed. Y.; a. fr.
v. אגוס'
, v. אֶגְסִיטֵרִין
Targ. Job VII, 1; 2; a. fr.— Pl. אֲגִירֵי. B. Mets. 76 b sq. (interch. in ed. with. אגירי, corr. acc.).

sense.definition: , m. pl., a corruption of a geographical term, perh.
sense.notes: אפירוטין (Ἠπειρῶται) (steeds) of Epyrus. Targ. Jer. V, 8 (h. text מַשְׁכִּים).
Lam. R. to I, 21; Pesik. Anokhi p. 138 b, v. גּוּשׁ I
— Pl. אִגְלֵי, אִיגְלֵי. B. Bath 8 a הכל לאי' גפא Ar. (ed. לאג'. all must contribute towards keeping the city gates in repair.; B. Mets. 108 a (Ms. M. גַלֵּי).
, v. גּוּאַלְקָא a. חֶבֶר.

entry.language-reference: אגל, sec. r. of אוג, cmp. חוג, עוג)

sense.notes: Ḥag. 12 b עליית א' (allus. to Job XXXVIII, 28) the upper store in heavens containing the rains. [V. Var. lect. in Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 200.]
read אֵילֹוגִין.
Targ. Y. Ex. XXXI, 5.
, v. גּוּאַלְקָא

sense.definition: to be bent, whence to be in grief.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CXIX, 28.

sense.definition:
v. foreg. a.
אַגְמֹון) anything bending and peeling, whence
leek, or leek-like plants, opp. to שחת young grain &c. Kid. 62 b this refers only to sha ḥ ath אבל בא' לא but not to ãgam.
sense.notes: Ib. מאי משמע דהאי א' לישנא דבוצלנא הוא (Ar. דבוצלא) what proof have you that ãgam in this case has the meaning of onion-plants? (Answ. ref. to אגמון Is. LVIII, 5).

sense.definition: (b. h.) reed, reed-land (juncetum), dwelling places of wild beasts, opp. שָׂדֶה cultivated land.
sense.notes: Taan. 22 a

sense.definition: (גמם) a field which requires clearing in order to be made arable, uncleared ground containing roots of trees &c. Ab. Zar. 38 a הצית את האור בא' set fire to an uncleared field.
sense.notes: Y. ib. II, 44 d bot. א' תמרים a field on which palms stood, the roots of which must be grubbed up.
Ab. Zar. 38 a לגלוי א' וכ' his intention was merely to clear the ground.

sense.definition: (גום, v. אֲגַם) a depression, stagnant water, lake; also marshland, meadow.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 36 b הבלא דא' the vapors of the meadow; a. fr. קטל קני בא' to cut reeds in the meadow = to be illiterate. Sabb. 95 a; Snh. 33 a.— Pl. אֲגָמִין, אַגְמַיָּא. Targ. Is. XXXV, 7; a. e.—אַגְמֵי. Sabb. 77 b דייר בא' grazes in meadows.
B. Mets 86 a.—B. Bath. 127 a; Kid. 72 a אקרא דא' Akra d’Agma, v. אַקְרָא Snh. 38 b אקרא דא' (Ar. אגמא דוקירי; oth. var. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

sense.definition: (v. אֲגַם I,) esp. אַגְמַת נפש (עַגְ') grief of the soul.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 14 b; a. fr. Ms. M., s. Ar. א' (ed. ע).
—בעל הא' cane-bearer, a subordinate executive officer. Y. Sot. IX, 24 b top; a. e., v. זְמֹורָה.
Targ. Is. LVIII, 5.—Targ. Job. XL, 26 Ms. (ed. אוּנְקְלָא).
m. = הֶגְמֹון. Sabb. 145 b ed.
, v. אַגְמֹון ch.

Sabb. 110 a א' דתיחלא a basin filled with cress. Ab. Zar. 31 a א' אפומא וכ' Ms. M. (ed. דפ') a basin-like vessel placed over the opening of the cask. Pes. 45 b.—Ber. 22 a בא' דמיא in a bath tub.— Pl. אַגָּנִין, אַגָּנֵי, אֲנָ'. Targ. Is. LXV, 11.—Pes. 30 b א' דמחוזא the kneading basins of Mâḥuza.—מֵישַׁר אֲגָנַיָיא pr. n. pl. Targ. Jud. IV, 11; Y. Meg. I, 70 a bot. אגנייא דקדש, later name of בצענים pools of Kadesh. [B. Kam. 61 b אגני דארעא Ms. R., ponds of the field, v. בָּאגָנָא a. נָאגָנָא.]

sense.definition: (Var. v. infra) name of a Roman general in the days of R. Yoḥ.
sense.notes: b. Zakkai, or of R. Gamliël, prob. a corrupt. of אגוינטוס Quintus, or אגויטוס Quietus; [Graetz: Atticus, v. Monatsschr. 1885 p. 17 sq.]. Sifré Deut. 351 אגניטוס. Y. Snh. I, 19 b top אנגטוס; ib. c bot. אנטונונוס; ib. d top אנטיגנס. Num. R. s. 4 (קונגטיס) הונגטוס; Bekh. 5 a קונטרוקוס. [אגוינטוס, קוינטוס, קוינגטוס seem most probable.]
Y. Ter. VII, 21 b, v. ארגנטריא
, v. next. w.
Gen. R. s. 20 Mus. (ed. אגנייה).
, v. אנגיסטור
Targ. II Esth. I, 2.
Num. R. s. 12; Midr. Till. to Ps. XCI, 2 ma ḥ ãsi (Ps. l. c.) means אֲגַנְתִּי my guard

sense.definition: (Tosef. עוּגָּס) m. (גוס, גסס to swell, v. גַּס III, cmp. תַּפּוּחַ) pear, pear-tree.
sense.notes: [In oth. Semit. dial. except Syr., plum, Fl. to Levi Talm. Dict. s. v.] Y. Kil. I, 27 a bot.; Tosef. ib. 4. Ib. II, 15 (Var. עובש).— Pl. אַגָּסִים, עוּגָּסִים) אַגָּסִין). Y. Ter. XI, 47 d bot. Kil. I, 4. Tosef. Shebi. VII, 16; a. fr. [Cmp. אֱגוֹז, esp. Cant. VI, 11, where the context points to fruits in gen. Cmp. חָבוּשׁ.]
, v. אָגוּסְטָאן
Ar. s. v. קלסקה, read אִסְטַגְיֹות.
[Mostly corrupt.] Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXXIV. Ib. to Ps. LXXXVI, 1. Ib. to Ps. XXVII. Pesik. Aḥaré p. 175 ab סקווטריס; Lev. R. s. 21 סקויטרים, read אקסיטרין (v. Buber to Pesik. l. c.).
Koh. R. to III, 14, read פָּגַע (Mat. K.).

sense.definition: (sec. r. of גְּפַף, v. גּוּף) to fill up a hole with pitch &c. B. Kam. 105 a.
(גּוּף I) the moulding or eminence of the door frame against which the door shuts, door-stop (esp. of door-ways in thick city walls &c. with reference to sacred limits in sacrificial law).
sense.notes: Pes. VII, 12 מן הא' ולפנים וכ' the space of the wall inside the door-stop is subject to the laws which apply to the space enclosed by the wall. Ib. 85 b א' עצמו the stop itself and the corresponding space. Y. ib. VII, 35 b אגוף.
(v. foreg. = גַּף; cmp. b. h. אֲגַפִּים)
Pl. אֲגַפִּים; Du. אֲגַפַּיִים. Neg. XIV, 1. Gen. R. s. 39; a. e.
Succ. 42 a

sense.definition: arms, shoulders of a human being.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. VII, 24 b bot. יכול יטלינו מבין הא' you might think the convict must be cut through at the arm-pits. Sabb. 129 a חבירותיה נושאות וכ' her mates lift her by her arms.

sense.definition: banks of river &c. B. Kam. 61 a a rivulet which imparts שלל לאֲגַפֶּיהָ booty (alluvium) to its banks.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 99 b שכלו א' whose embankments have disappeared (washed away).

Gen. R. s. 75, beg. מנערא אֲגַפָּהּ וכ' shakes her wings to shake the ashes off. [Targ. Ezek. I, 14, prob. אַנְפָּא.]. [B. Bath. 8 a, v. גַּפָּא.]— Pl. אֲגַפַּיָּא, const. אֲגַפֵּי. Targ. Cant. V, 11. Cmp. גַּדְפָא, גַּפָּא.
, v. הֲגָפָה

Y. Yoma III, 41 a top (expl. ãgartlé, Ezr. I, 9). Y. Bicc. I, 63 d bot. שהוא אֹוגֵר וכ' it stores up its oil, (does not-let it trickle out), v. אֵגֹורִי; Ber. 39 a שמנו אָגוּר וכ' its oil remains stored up.—Y. Nid. III, beg. 50 c top דם אָגוּר blood collected in one place.—Trnsf. to store up thoughts, arguments. Sifré Deut. 16 (play on géro Deut. I, 16) זה שאֹוגֵר עליו דברים that means him who heaps arguments up against him (his opponent in litigation). Ex. R. s. 6 אגור שא' דברי תורה (Var. שאִיגֵּר Pi.) he is called Agur (Prov. XXX,

sense.definition: because he collected words of the Law (stored up knowledge); Koh. R. beg. שאָגוּר בד"ת because he was stored (or girded, v. אָגַר II) with knowledge.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to I, 1 end. [Sabb. 60 a אוגרת ed., v. אָגַד.]
Num. R. s. 20 beg. (play on ויגר Num. XXII, 3) וחן נֶאֱגָרִין לעריהם and they were gathered to their towns (for defence).
Tosef. Dem. I, 10 המוֹגִירוֹת the store-keepers’ places; v. מוֹגָרָה, מוֹגֶרֶת.
אַגַּר to heap up. Targ. Y. Deut. I, 16 דמְאַגַּר וכ' (ed. Vien. מֶאֱגַר—) who heaps up litigations, v. foreg. [Targ. Ps. CIV, 7 למיגר Ms., v. נְגַד.]
Midr. Prov. to XXX, 1 שא' חלציו who girded his loins for wisdom; Yalk. Prov. a. l. Part. pass. אָגוּר, v. אָגַר I.

sense.definition: to halt, whence part. f. אוֹגֶרֶת (sub. סַכִּין) a knife having indentations which catch the passing nail of the examiner.
sense.notes: Hull. 17 b.—
B. Bath 14 a (intercharging with אָכַל q. v.).

sense.definition: (אָגַר) (√אג, akin to חכר; v. foreg.) prop. to tie, whence to hire, employ, rent.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXX, 16; a. fr.—Koh. R. to IV, 6; Lev. R. s. 3 beg. (prov.) גינא וכ' דא' he who rents one garden will eat birds; him who rents gardens, the birds will eat. Git. 73 a אגור מלחי they hired boatsmen. Snh. 73 a מֵיגַר אֲגִירֵי to hire help. Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. מיגר זנייתא hiring prostitutes. B. Mets. 79 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: same. Targ. Y. Deut. XXIII, 5 (4).—B. Mets. 77 same.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. XXIII, 5 (4).—B. Mets. 77 a (interch. with Pe.) (אגירי) אוגיר אגורי engages laborers.
Erub. 63 b אוֹגַר לן רשותך lease to us thy property. Y. Dem. VI, 25 b top. Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. אוגרית חמרי I hired my ass out.

sense.definition: (contr. of איתאגר) to be hired, to work as a laborer.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Deut. XXIII, 25; a. e.—Yoma 20 b (prov.) אי תגרת וכ' (combine into one w.) when thou hast hired thyself out to one, comb his wool (shrink from no labor).

Targ. Gen. XV, 1; a. fr.—B. Mets. 63 b א' נטר ליה compensation for waiting (giving time for delivery), i.e. advancing the money to the seller. Ib. 68 b פלגא בא' כ' half profit or loss. Ib. 69 b א' ופגרא payment for carrying freight, and indemnity to the boatsmen in case of wreck. Y. M. Kat. II, 81 b top א' וקרנא profit and principal (cost-price).—Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c top מא' כל הדין עלמא than all profit this world can offer.—2) that which deserves reward, meritorious deed. Ber. 6 b א' דפירקא ריהטא the merit in attending a lecture lies in running [to it] (anxiety to hear it). [אֲגַר, אַגְרָא staff, pole, v. אגד.]

sense.definition: Agra, father-in-law of R. Abba; father of R. Y’hudah.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 104 b; 134 a. Nid. 53 a
v. next. w.

sense.definition: (freq. אגרדמים) m. (a corrupt. of ἀγοράνομος, v. אַגְרוֹנִימוֹס) agoranomos, corresponding to the Roman ædilis, market commissioner, gauger, &c. Ab. Zar. 58 a א' נכרי (כותי, Ms. V. גוי א') a gentile agoran.
sense.notes: —B. Kam. 98 a א' טייעא an Arabian agoran.—B. Bath. 89 a מעמידין א' וכ' Ar. (ed. מִין—plur.) an agoran. may be appointed for superintending measures, but not for fixing the prices.— Pl. אֲגַרְדְּמִין B. Bath. l. c. (v. supra). [Pesik. Asser p. 96 a לא' שיצא (sing.) Ar. (ed. להגרונימוס read לא', cmp. Yalk. Ps. 729).]—אֲגַרְדִּימִים Sifra K’doshim ch. VIII; cmp. Y. B. Bath. V, 15 a bot. [Oth. corrupt. v. Pesik. l. c. note.]

sense.definition: (אגר I, Pi; cmp. אֵגוֹרִי) ( grain) fit for storage, of superior quality.
sense.notes: Y. Maas. Sh. IV, beg. 54 d מן הא' על השמתית וכ' T’rumah may be taken from the stored-up wheat for the wheat which has to be quickly disposed of, or vice versa. Y. Peah. II, 17 a חצי איגדו וכ' (read איגרו). Y. Naz. V, 54 a שחתית ונמצאת אגרון (corr. acc.) from dark colored wheat (inferior), and found it was igg’ru (superior). [R. Simson to Peah II, 5 quotes אֵגוֹרִי; El. W. in Sh’noth El. ibid. אֲגוֹרָה.] [B. Bath. V, 6 has לבנה white, pure for our w.]
, v. אוֹגְדוֹיֵיקָנְטֵי

sense.definition: (a corrupt. of אגרונומי, cmp. אגרדמיס a. next.
sense.notes: art.) costum-collectors, (cmp. Sm. Ant. s. v. Agoranomos). Gen. R. s. 75 ed. (Ar. איגרמי).
, v. אִגְּרוּ
, v. next. w.

sense.definition: (corr. אַגְרוֹנוֹ'), contr. אַנְגַּרְמוֹס m. (ἀγοράνομος) agoranomos, market-commissioner; v. אֲגַרְדְּמִיס a. אַגְרוֹמֵי.
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, 22 c top שהיה א' גדול the agor. was an influential man. Y. Ab. Zar. IV, 44 b top. Lev. R. s. 1 אגרונימון (corr. acc.). Y. B. Bath. V, 15 a bot. אנג' (twice); a. fr.

Kel. XVII, 12. Ex. R. s. 1.—בעל א' mighty, violent. Y. Peah. VII, 20 c top; v. infra.—Sot. 41 b אגרופָהּ של חנופה the power of sycophancy.— Pl.אֶגְרוֹפִים, אֶגְרוֹפִין. Kid. 76 b בעלי א' וכ' the men of power of the house of David; Snh. 49 a. Pes. 53 b בעל א' a strong, violent man (opp. גברא רבה a great man).

sense.definition: Agrippina, one of the signal stations for announcing the New-Moon, prob. a tower or height near Cæsarea Philippi, enlarged by Agrippa II. R. Hash. II, 4 (22 b) לא' … מא' Ms. M. 2, Mish. Nap.
sense.notes: (ed. מג' … לג'; Y. ed. מגְּרִיפּ' …; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 4).
Koh. R. to I, 18 read אֶנִּיגָרוֹן or pl. אֶנִּיגָרוֹנִין. Cmp. ארגסטירין.

or. acc.) wild (opp. אִימִירוֹן q. v.); rough. Gen. R. s. 77; Cant. R. to III, 6 כלב א'. Num. R. s. 11 (refer. to Gen. III, 8) שומע הקול א' after sinning, Adam heard the divine voice as a harsh one. Cant. R. to III, 7 (corr. acc.). Pesik. R. s. 15 בזעף א' וכ' … (leave out hebr. words as glosses to explain the Greek).
, v. אַרְגֶּסְטֵיס
= next. w.

sense.definition: (Ἀγρίππας) Agrippa, 1) the last but one Herodian king of Judæa. Sot. VII, 8.

sense.notes: the last but one Herodian king of Judæa. Sot. VII, 8. Lev. R. s. 3; a. fr.—2) a captain of the former.—Ab. Zar. 55 a אגריפא שר צבא של א' Ms. M. (v. Rashi a. l. a. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
, v. אֶגְדִּיקוֹס
, Y. Git. V, 47 b דינר א', read דינרא גרדיינא, v. גּוֹרְדְּיָינִי
, v. אַגְדָּנָא
, v. הָגְדָּס
, v. אַרְגֶּסְטֵיס

Y. R. Hash. I, 57 a bot. פרא בסיליאוס נומס א', cmp. Ar. h. v., a. s. v. בסיליאוס (ed. או נומוס או גריפיס) παρὰ βασιλέως ὁ νόμος ἄγραφος, for the king the law is unwritten (i.e. the king may disregard his own law). Lev. R. s. 35, beg. quot. in Ar. (missing in ed.).

sense.definition: Igrath, name of the queen of demons Pes. 111 a א' אזלת (an incantation).
sense.notes: Ib. 112 a. Num. R. s. 12. Cmp. נְגִירָא.

sense.definition: , to join, v. esp. Snh. 11 b; ושלש איגרות וכ') tablet, letter, brief, document.
sense.notes: Git. IX, 3 (formula of a letter of divorce) ספר … וא' … וגט וכ'. Ib. 85 b ולא … איגרת … אלא אגרת one must not write (in the letter of divorce) egereth with אי' which might mean roof (v. אִיגָר), but &c. Keth. 64 a; Y. Kid. I, 59 a bot. א' מרד a document stating a wife’s disobedience. Y. Meg. IV, 75 b top; Y. Snh. I, 19 b top א' ביקורת a document fixing the value of a property, v. אַכְרָזָה.— Pl. אִגָּרוֹת, אִיגָּרוֹת. M. Kat. III, 3 א' שׁל רשות secular, social correspondence, opp. religious correspondence; cmp. Y. ib. 82 a bot.; [commentaries: documents of secular government, v. רָשׁוּת]. Ib.; B. Mets. I, 8 א' שׁום א' מזון documents relating to legal assessment and to alimony.
v. אִיגַּרְתָּא
Lam. R. to I, 21; Pesik. Anokhi p. 138 b, v. גּוּשׁ
insep. conjunct.

sense.definition: (= עַד דְּ־; cmp. אַ־) prop. until that; by the time that; hence, while, when, in the place of.
sense.notes: Ḥag. 5 a אדזוטר when he was young.—Ḥull. 105 b, a. fr. אדהכי or אדהכי והכי in the meanwhile. Pes. 113 a אדחלא אכרעיך וכ' while the travelling dust is yet on thy knees, sell thy goods. Snh. 33 b אדמוקדך יקיד while thy fire-place is lit. B. Mets. 81 a, a. fr. ליתני וכ'—אדתני in place of stating A let him state B, and A would be implied.

sense.definition: (= עַל דְּ־) as regards—, in relation to the statement &c. of—.
sense.notes: Keth. 21 a אדחד דעמיה on (the testimony) of one who was with him. B. Bath. 159 b, a. fr. קשיא דרבא אַדְּרָבָא there is a contradiction between (one opinion) of Raba and another opinion of Raba; B. Mets. 18 a אַדְּרַבָּה … of Rabbah (not to be confounded with אַדְרַבָּא q. v.). Meg. 20 a אַדְּיוֹם in relation to (the reading of the Book of Esther) in day-time.

entry.language-reference: an apocopated form of אדע, cmp. זוע, אדיותא, נֹאד)

sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 13 (homil. etym.). אד שהוא שובר אידן וכ' cloud is called çd (destroyer) because it breaks the çd (distress of scarcity) looked forward to by the speculators in the market. V. אֵיד.
Y. Ber. III. end, 7 a, a. fr. הדא אמרת היא הדא היא א' this shows that this is like that, i.e. all the same. Y. Erub. IV, end, 22 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: name of several Amoraim; (v. Frankel Meb. Y. p. 61 b).
sense.notes: Y. Ter. X, 47 b bot. Pes. 80 a; a. fr.—Most prominent among them R. Ada bar Ahãba or Aḥãva. Y. Taan. III, end, 67 a; Bab. ibid. 20 b; a. fr.
A. דיילא, דיאלא (attendant of scholars). B. Kam. 119 a. Num. R. s. 9.
a slave. Kid. 70 b
בר א', v. בַּרְדָּא II, 2.

sense.definition: צֹדֶה; cmp. b. h. עַד prey, a. אֵיד destruction) fowler, one who puts up baits, snares &c. for other people’s doves.
sense.notes: Snh. 25 a (explain. mafri ḥ e yonim, Mishn.) אמר א'—ר' Ms. M. a. Oxf., a. Ar. (ed. ארא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., a. Ar.) R—says, the Mishnah means a fowler (to be disqualified as witness &c.).
Sabb. 35 b, v. אֲרוֹנֵי
Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 54 d top, v. אַרְבֵּל I
Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 4; a. e.

sense.definition: (אַדְרָא ed.) m. (√אד, v. אָדַר, cmp. חד, חדר, חדק &c.) fish-bone sticking in the throat.
sense.notes: Sabb. 67 a לא' וכ' against a fish-bone in the throat, say this spell. [For דד a. דר cmp. אודדא.]
Cant. R. to IV, 8, v. דדי ch.
, Y. Kil. IV, 29 b, bot., read אָדָא I (cmp. Y. Erub I 19 c bot. הדה וכ' a. corr. acc.)

S. 933, דוע to sweat, drip; cmp. אֵד) prop. sweat, א' דימא foam of the Sea. B. Bath. 4 a; Succ. 51 b (Ms. M. אידותא) the Temple building of marble looks like a surging Sea (from a distance). Cmp. אוּדְיָיתָא a. אֲזִי.
, v. דּוּךְ

sense.definition:
, אֲדוּמָּה f. (b. h.
אָדֹם, אֲדֻמָּה; דמם) red.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to VII, 3, שושנה א' red rose (euphem. for menstruation).—פרה א' red cow, used for purification ceremonies (Num. XIX). Ab. Zar. 24 a; a. fr.—Lam. R. to IV, 5, v. קְלוּרִית.— Pl. אֲדוּמִּים, אֲדוּמּוֹת; Y. Succ. II, 53 d, v. אֲדַמְדָּם.—Gen. R. s. 89; a. fr.

sense.definition: pr. n. m. Edom, surname of Esau, son of Isaac; mostly used as a nom.
sense.notes: gentil. Edomite, Edomite nation

sense.definition: fem. (sub. מלכות) Rome, Roman government (owing to the dependence of Herod on Rome).
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 35; a. fr. Ibid. מלכות א'; a. fr. [In subsequent ages: Christianity.]

Keth. 30 a חייבי עשה מצרי וא' the laws of intermarriage with Egyptians and Edomites as implied in Deut. XXIII, 8.—Pes. III, 1 חומץ הא' Idumean vinegar; a. e.—Snh. 12 a ולא הניחן א' הלז Ar. a. Ms. M. (later ed. under censorial influences ארמי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) and that Edomite (disguise for Roman government, v. foreg.) would not permit them.—Fem. אֲדוֹמִית.— Pl. אֲדוֹמִיּוֹת. Keth. 64 b שעורין א' Idumean barley.

sense.definition:
, const. אֲדֹון (b. h.;
דון) lord, judge.
sense.notes: Ḥag. 3 b אֲ' כל המעשים Lord of all creatures. Y. Kid. IV, beg. 65 b (allud. to Adon, pr. n., Neh. VII, 6

sense.definition: אין דין אין א' there is no justice and not judge.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 89 (play on Kar, Is. XXX, 23) קירי א' Kyri (κύριος) means Lord.

Gen. R. s. 89 נצטער יוסף עם אֲדֹונָתוֹ Joseph suffered while being with his mistress. Ib. s. 98 (play on ben porath Gen. XLIX, 22) בן שהפר לא' וכ' the youth that broke (defeated the plans of) his mistress; the youth whom his mistress broke (having him put in prison). Ib. (play on vay-mar’ruhu Gen. ib. 23) וכ' בן שהמר the youth who made life bitter to his mistress (v. vers. Mat. K. a. l.).
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VIII, 6, ed., v. אוּדְנָא III
, v. אדנדקי
, v. אִדְרוּתָא
, v. אָדַר
א' צלמא a procession in which an idol is carried. Y. Ab. Zar. III, 43 b bot.; Y. Ber. II, 4 b אה' צילמי'; Y. Shek. II, end, 47 a דארורא צילמא (read אדורי דצ'); Midr. Sam. ch. XIX צלמא הורדוסיס(?).
, v. אַדְווּתָא

sense.definition: (= ידי, b. h. הדה) to swing, throw, pitch.
sense.notes: Snh. 7 a, v. גְּזִיזָא. B. Kam. 22 a; Bets. 39 a אַדְיֵיה אדויי he threw it off. B. Kam. 98 a אדייה א' he pitched it out of his neighbor’s hands.
Y. Maasr. I, 49 b, prob. אֻרְזָא or אוּרְזָא; v. Y. Sabb. III, 6 b top.
read אִימִירֹון.
Targ. Num. XIX, 13 (Var. אַדְיוּתָא; h. text נִדָּה!). Targ. Ezek. XXXVI, 25 אַדְיוּתָא.

sense.definition: (= עֲדַיִין; אַד = עַד a. יין = הֵין; h. עַד הֵנָּה) until now; whence, still, yet; as yet.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IV, 8 a bot. אין את לזו וא' art thou not yet up to this, i.e. dost thou not yet understand it? Y. Taan. II, 65 c bot. א' את לזו. Y. Git. IX, end, 50 d וא' את ליי art thou still at that point, i.e. dost thou still ask? Y. Peah I, 15 c; Y. Kid. I, 61 b top וא' לחצי וכ' and yet he has hardly come up to half the honor due to parents.
, v. אֲדַל
m. pl., dialect. for אַרְזִילֵי. B. Bath. 74 b, v. אוּרְזִילָא

sense.definition: (= h. אָדֹום) red, full of sap, fresh.
sense.notes: Bets. 24 b, Rashi; v. however, הֲדַם.

sense.definition: (= h. אֲזַי, אָז; √ד־ = h. ז־) at that time, thereupon.
sense.notes: Dan. II, 15; 17; 19.—בֵּאדַ' at the same time, forthwith. Ibid. 14; 35.—מן א' from that time. Ezra V, 16.
, v. אוּדְנָא III
, v. אֹודִיצוּתָא
, v. דִּיק
— Pl. אַדִּירִים. Men. 53 a
Targ. O. Ex. XV, 6; a. fr.
Y. Sabb. III, 5 d bot. leaned a vessel לא' דתנורא (Var. לאוירא) against the rim of a heated store.
, v. דּוּשׁ ch.

sense.definition: Adakh, substitute of תקל (Dan. V, 25) by permutation of letters called א"תב"ש q. v. Snh. 22 a.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to III, 4 אנם (corr. acc.).
, v. אוּרְבָּא

sense.definition: mention, esp. invocation of the Lord, Divine Name.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IV, 8 a top לכל חדא וחדא מנהון אדכרה for each benediction an invocation. R. Hash. 18 b בטילת אדכרתא the use of the Divine Name in legal documents was abolished.
Targ. O. Lev. II, 2; a. e.
Targ. Ps. XXX, 5 Ms. … רוּ; ed. רוּת …
, v. אַדְכָּרָה

sense.definition: (√אד, עד dial. = חד, גד; cmp. גַּד I, גִּידָּא II, חַרְדָּל) garden-cress, summer-savory.
sense.notes: Tosef. Shebi. V, 11 (ed. Zuck. אדיל). Ukts. III, 4 ע'. Y. Shebi. VII, 37 c bot. ערל; ib. 37 b bot. ערלה (corr. acc.)
Pl. אַדְלָקֹות. Y. Shebi. VII, beg. 37 b מיני א' sorts of plants used for lighting purposes.
, v. הֲדַם. [v. Rabb. D. S. to Ab. Zar. 38 b, Bets. 24 b, note.]

sense.definition: , v. דמם) [ to be viscous, thick, dark] to be red, grow red.

sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c top המְאַדֵּם אודם he who produces a red spot (congestion of blood, on a Sabbath).

sense.definition: (b. h.) (b. h.) to be, grow red.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 9 (p. 231 b ed. Amst.) מַאֲדֶמֶת (היתה) if she was red-faced. Ḥull. 53 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: to cause to blush, put to shame (usu. הלבין).
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 4 (p. 218 d ed. Amst.) (play on עובד אדום).— Part. מַאֲדִים the planet Mars. Sabb. 156 a.— Part. Hof. מְאָדָּם, מְאוּדָּם. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c top מְאָדָּמִים dyed red.

sense.definition: m. (b. h.) man, pr. n. m. Adam, frequ.
sense.notes: א' הראשון (abbr. אה"ר). Gen. R. s. 17; a. fr.—ספרו של, ספרא דאה"ר אה"ר the (allegorical) book of Adam containing all generations and their leaders from beginning to resurrection, i.e. destinies of humanity. Ex. R. s. 40 beg. B. Mets. 85 b bot.
Targ. I Chron. XXII, 7; a. e.—Y. Maas. Sh. V, 56 d top מגבלא אַדְמֵיה to mix its (the bird’s) blood. Git. 47 a; v. חוּל II. Pl. אַדְמִין. Targ. I Chr. l. c.; a. e.
Y. Succ. III, 53 d איזהו א' שׁבאדומים which of the red colors is called adamdam?—Shebu. 6 a reddish leprosy (Lev. XIII, 42); a. e.
Gen. R. s. 34, end אנא גבלין ליה א' we make for it a dough of &c., v. דַבְדְּבָנִיֹּות, דַּמְדְּמָנִיֹּות.

Gen. R. s. 14 the potter takes sand (עפר) which is male (masc. gender) and clay (אדמה) which is female (fem. gender).—Sabb. VIII, 5 א' כחותם וכ' as much clay as is required for a seal on bag-knots. [For the meaning of the phonetic equivalents of our w. in other Semit. tongues, v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.]
Ḥull. 87 b, a. e. מראה א' reddish color.

sense.definition: Admon, one of the justices of the peace in Jerusalem.
sense.notes: Keth. XIII, 1.—Ib. 105 a א' בן גדאי.
to hair. Y. Ned. I, 36 d bot.
Y. Meg. I, 70 a bot. וא' דמין Adami changes into Damin
Targ. O. Gen. II, 5; a. fr.

ד־) base, pedestal.

, v. אִי'

Gen. R. s. 93; a. e.
Gen. R. s. 17; Koh. R. to VII, 23.

sense.definition: , א' הַשָּׂדֶה m. pl. name of a mythical animal, orangoutang(?).
sense.notes: Kil. VII, 5, defined Y. ibid. 31 c bot. בר נש דטור mountain-man, brought forth by the mountain and drawing nourishment from the ground (cmp. Job V, 23). Koh. R. to VI, 11.
Sabb. 35 b, v. אֲרֹונֵי
, read אַרְכִי בִרְיֹונִים, v. בִּרְיֹון a. אַרְכִי.

sense.notes: B. Mets. 7 a b sq.

sense.definition: , (neut. v.) to be fastened, stick to.
