sense.definition: to fasten to, to cause to take hold.
sense.notes: . Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 21.
Ibid. v. 45 ויאדקונכון (ed. Vien. a. oth. ויערק' corr. ד for ר).
Targ. Job. XLI, 9; 15 (Ms. מידבק).

Cant. R. to I, 11 לא' בן הדימה (Var. לאר' כן) a gloss inserted in the text, and which read לאו דוקא אלא כן הדימם ‘not to be taken literally’ (that the Divine Word kissed every Israelite &c.), ‘but he made them so imagine’.

entry.language-reference: √אד; cmp. הד, חד, גד in הדר, חדר, גדר)

sense.definition: to cut off, surround, isolate; whence

sense.notes: —Den. אַדִּיר.

cmp. עדר.—B. Kam. 11 a (ref. to עד Ex. XXII, 12, v. עַד in H. Dict.) יביא אֲדוּרָה לב"ד Ar. (ed. עֲדוּדָה, v. עדד; Ms. ארורה, corr. acc.) let him bring the stripped (the remnants of the torn animal, skin &c.) before court for assessment of damages.
v. אִדְּרָא, אִדְרָא, אִדְּרֹונָא.
Snh. 63 b (play on Adrammelekh II Kings XVI, 3
דא' ליה וכ' (the mule) that gives distinction to its owner when travelling.

Delitzsch, The Hebr. Lang. p. 15) Adar, the twelfth month of the Jewish calendar, containing twenty nine days, and varying between the eleventh of February and the twenty eighth of March. In leap years: א' רִאשֹׁון First Adar, of thirty days duration between the thirty first of January and the tenth of March; א' שֵׁנִי Second Adar, of twenty nine days, between the second of March and the eighth of April. Targ. II Esth. IX, 29; a. fr.—Meg. I, 4; a. fr.— Pl. אֲדָרִים, אֲדָרִין. R. Hash. 19 b

sense.definition: (אדר, נדר v. אָדַר) a place cut off, circle (cmp. זִירָה), whence threshing place, barn; also the grain piled up in the barn for threshing; cmp. גּוֹרֶן.
sense.notes: Targ. Hos. II, 11 בעידן א' at the season of its being piled up; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 63 the shovel דאפיך אי' which upturns the grain in the barn (= prayer averting evil decrees). Ib. (play on אדרת Gen. XXV, 25) כקש מא' like chaff from the barn. Ruth R. to III, 3 להיכן אקימתא א' where didst thou put up the barn?— Pl. אִידְּרַיָּא, אִדְּרֵי &c. Dan. II, 35. Targ. I Sam. XXIII, 1; a. e. Cant. R. to VII, 3 (homilet. rendition of הסהר אגן Cant. l. c.) א' דאזהרה a rounded place (cmp. גורן, זירה) of enlightenment, i.e. hall of the Sanhedrin. [With א or נ rejected: בי דרי. Taan. 3 b. B. Mets. 73 a.]

Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 c אדר תורתא hide of a cow. Ib. אדרא (ברא) דתבנא; Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד כותאי 2) אדר דתבן Ar. (ed. דור) a hide stuffed with straw. Y. Shebi. V, 36 a top א' דאילין חכימא וכ' the leather of these bottles is distinguishable from the leather of those.— Pl. אוּדְרְיָיתָא. Shebu. 29 b תליסר א' דתבנא Ar. (ed. אורוותא; Ms. F. אדידתא, v. Rashi a. l.) thirteen bagfuls of straw; Ned. 25 a

sense.definition: a cedar species, prob. Spanish Juniper.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 23 a מאי קדרוס (ם) אדרא Ms. M. (ed. קתרוס) what is kedros (κέδρος)? Adara. Snh. 108 b what is gofer? רב אמר אדרא דבי ר' שילא אמר וכ' Ar. a Ms. Fl. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.); cmp. Gen. R. s. 31; Yalk. Gen. 51.—Bets. 15 b יטע אדר וכ' let him plant an edar (allud. to addir &c., Ps. XCIII, 4); א"נ אדרא וכ' or adara as its (popular or Chald.) name is; as people say, it is called adara because it lasts for generations (א־דרא). Git. 69 b אטרף א' leaves of ad. Ib. מיא דא' decoct thereof.
Targ. II, Esth. VII, 9 (to which perhaps belongs. Git. l. c.).

sense.definition: (v. אָדַר, cmp. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) flag of a ship.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 73 a (for b. h. נֵס); Ms. M. אֲדָארָא (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).
Sabb. 67 a, v. אַדְדָא.—אדרא B. Mets. 26 a, read with Rashi אוּדְרָא v. אוּדְרָא.

sense.definition: (contr. of על דרבה, v. אַדְּ־) turn to the stronger side, whence as a dialectic term, on the contrary.
sense.notes: Pes. 28 a, a. fr. א' איפכא מסתברא on the contrary, the reverse stands to reason. Ib. 77 a הוה אמינא א' I might have said, ‘On the contrary’ &c.; a. fr. [Not to be confounded with אַדְּרָבָא, אַדְּרַבָּה, v. אַדְּ־.]

sense.definition: (ὑδραύλης, hydraula) player on the hydraulis, organist.
sense.notes: — Pl. אִדְרַבְלִין. Gen. R. s. 50 א' וכרבלין וכ' there are organists and flute players in the land (or organs and cymbals, v. next w.), and such a land should be destroyed? [Comment.—Perh. to be read אַרְדִּיכְלִין.] Ib. s. 23 ארדיכולין וכ' (ארדיב', corr. acc.).

Y. Succ. V, 55 c bot. עוגב זה ארד'. Ib. לא היה א' וכ' there was no organ used in (the) Jerusalem (Temple) because it interferes with the sweetness (melody of the song).— Pl. אִדְרַבְלִין; v. foreg. Cmp. הרדוליס.

sense.definition: (v. Schr. K. A. T. p. 617 sq.; cmp. אדר a. גזר) title of high officers.
sense.notes: Dan. III, 3. Cant. R. to VII, 9 א' איפרכיא adarg. means governors
Adroma (Southern) for b. h. תֵּימָא. Targ. I Chr. I, 30.
= דְּרָעָא. Targ. Y. Num. VI, 19.
Lev. R. s. 15 (var. corrup.); Yalk. Lev. 554. Ib. Job. 916 אִנְדְּר' (cmp. אדריינוס a. אנד').
Ber. 56 b top (oneirocritical play on Adar) בא' מיתת thou shalt die in glory. [Cmp. Y. Maas Sh. IV, end, 55 c; Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד מתלמ').]
Ezra VII, 23.
= אַדְרְיָינֹוס. Tanḥ. B’resh. 7; a. fr.
Deut. R. s. 1, interpret. נציבים (II Sam. VIII, 14) read אִסְטַרְטִיגִין, as Targ. a. l.
Tanḥ. B’resh. 7 בין א' לאוקיינוס between the Adriatic Sea and the Mediterranean.
, v. אַרְדַּב
, v. אִדְרַבְלָא
, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס a. אַדְרִיאַנְטֹוס.

sense.definition: Hadrian, the Roman emperor (117 to 138) under whom the insurrection of Bar Kokhba occurred; freq. mentioned with the imprecation שחיק עצמות.
sense.notes: Deut. R. s. 3; a. fr. V. אַדְרִיאָנוֹס.
, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס a. אַנְדְרִיאַנְטֹוס.

sense.definition: of the town Adria or Hadria in Venetia.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. II, 3 חרס ה' (Y. Mish. a. Gem. א') earthen ware of Adria (forbidden for use on account of some unknown connection with idolatry, perh. suspected to have been used as wine vessels before they were offered for sale; v. infra).
Ib. 32 a explain. חרס הד' ‘earthen vessels soaked with wine, and distributed in pieces, by order of Hadrian, among the soldiers to be diluted with water for drinking’.
Lam. R. to I, 17, v. אספסיינוס.
Gen. R. s. 23, v. אִדְרַבְלָא
Targ. Jer. LI, 33.
, v. אַרְדִיכָל
Gen. R. s. 8 Ar, ed. אינדרטין, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס
, v. דַּרְכֹּון
, v. אֲדַרְכָּן
, v. אַרְדִּיכָל

sense.definition: (prob. corrupt. of אַרְטְבַן q. v.) Adarkhan, a Parthian ruler.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 10 b (Ms. כין; oth. vers. אדרבך, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).—Esth. R. to I, 3 אדרכיאן.

sense.definition: legal permission to a creditor to trace the debtor’s property for the purpose of having it seized, assessed, offered for public sale, and eventually delivered to him.
sense.notes: [Order of documents, acc. to B. Bath. 169 a, vers. of Maim. a. others: 1) אדרכתא;

sense.definition: טירפא the right of seizure of the debtor’s property sold after the date of the loan (mortgage);
שומא record of the assessed value for which the creditor took possession;—acc.
sense.notes: to vers. in ed. a. Mss. 1) טירפא right of seizure &c.; 2) א' authorization to seize the traced property, defining position &c.; 3) שומא.] B. Bath. 169 a. B. Kam. 112 b. B. Mets 16 b. Ib. 35 b. Keth. 104 b. 2) private authorization to collect or take possession of one’s debt or deposit; assignment, transfer. B. Kam. 70 a Ms. M., At. (ed. אור'); Shebu. 33 b (ed. אור', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.); Bekh. 49 a
Snh. 63 b א' וכ' Adr. a. Anammelekh signify mule and horse; v. אֲדַר.
Targ. Jer. XXXII, 21; a. fr.—Y. Ber. I, 4 c top דאֶדְרְעֵיה the Tefillin of his arm. Koh. R. to XI, 2.— Pl. אֶדְרָעָתָא. Targ. Job XXII, 9.—אֶדְרָעִין. Gen. R. s. 65.—V. דְּרַע III.

sense.definition: of Edreï, a town in Naftali (Josh. XIX, 37), another in Menasseh (Bashan, Num. XXI, 33; a. e.).
sense.notes: —Y. Ber. V, 9 b top; a. e.
Gen. R. s. 63 (ref. to Gen. XXV, 25) כולו ראוי לא' every one (of the Roman people) fit for the purple cloak (may become an emperor).

sense.definition: (homiletically, as if אִדֶּרֶת = ch. אִדְּרָא, אִדַּר) the threshing floor, the store of grains.
sense.notes: Ib. כולו מפוזר ומפורד כא' entirely destined to be scattered (winnowed) like the grains, לזרותו וכ' [שעתיד] for the Lord will scatter him (Edom-Rome) like chaff &c. (ref. to Dan. II, 35).
, v. דּוּשׁ ch.

Y. Ab. Zar. II beg. 40 c אֹוהֲבָהּ her lover; a. fr. אוהב את הבריות philanthropist. Aboth I, 12; a. fr.—Part. pass. אָהוּב, f. אֲהוּבָה. Yeb. 23 a א' בנשואיה beloved (worth loving) for her well chosen marriage. [Y. Ab. Zar. l. c. איהבתו read אֹוהַבְתֹּו.]

הִתְאָהֵב to be beloved, popular. Lev. R. s. 32, beg., these blows (of persecution) had the effect להֵאָהֵב וכ' to make me beloved of my Father in heaven. Yoma 86 a שיהא ש"ש מִתְאָהֵב וכ' that the Divine Name may be beloved through thee (that thy doings may favorably reflect on thy religion).—

Tan. d’be El. I, 28 תהא מְאָהֵב ש"ש וכ' make the Divine Name &c. (v. supra).— Part. Pu. מְאוּהָב popular. Yalk. Deut. 837.—Cant. R. to I, 1 להַאֲהִיבָן (לאָהֲבָן) לקרבן וכ' to make them beloved (of God), draw them nigh (to God) &c. Ib. to V, 1.—Yalk. Cant. 981 הֶאֱהַבְנוּ לך עלמות הרבה we have made many maiden beloved of thee (converted them).
, const. אַהֲבַת ch. = next. w. Targ. Cant. VIII, 6.

א' שהיא תלויה בדבר love dependent on something extraneous, i.e. sensual, selfish love. Aboth V, 16.—עשה מא' (or עבד) to do good (serve the Lord) from pure motives of love. Sot. 31 a; Snh. 61 b; a. fr.—

sense.definition: (אַחֲוָוא in Y.) pr. n. m. Ahãbah, A ḥ ava, son of Zera, and father of R. Adda.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 29 a. Ab. Zar. 30 a; a. fr. Y. Yeb. VIII, 9 bc
Y. Ber. II, 4 b, v. אֲדוּרֵי
Y. Ab. Zar. V, 45 a, read אֲהָן.
, v. אָהֳלִית
, v. אֹהֶל
, v. אֲהָן

sense.definition: (horrearius, ὁρριάριος; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Horreum) store-keeper, steward.
sense.notes: [Comment.: fr. אֻרְוָוה, v. אוּרְיָא, equerry.] Meg. 12 b בר אהוריירֵיה דאבא thou, son of my father’s steward. B. Mets. 85 a (Ms. M. אהוריריה); Sabb. 113 b אהוריריה (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 4) א' דרבי Rabbi’s house steward (manager).

sense.definition: (Pers. Angra-Mainyus) Ahriman, the evil principle in the Zendavesta (Parsism); opp. הורמיז Ormuzd.
sense.notes: Snh. 39 a מפלגך לעילאי דהורמיז מפלגך לתתאי דאה' Ar. (ed. a. Mss. incorr., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; Tosef. a. l. Better vers. Ms. F. מפלגן our half) thy upper half belongs to Ormuzd, thy lower half to Ahriman. Ib. א"כ היכי שביק אהורמין להורמיז למעבר מיא בארעא (ed. corr. acc.) if this be so, why does Ahriman allow Ormuzd to let the water pass (through the former’s dominion) to the ground?
Y. Shek. V, 48 d, read הַיי.

sense.definition: m (אָהַל) staying under the same roof with an unclean object.
sense.notes: Naz. VII, 2 (49 b) על אֲהִילָן Talm. ed. (Mish. אָהֳלָן, v. אֹהֶל) upon staying with them under &c. Ib. 53 a אֲהִילֹו. [Sabb. 90 a Ms. M., v. אֲהָל.].— Pl. f. אֲהִילֹות the laws concerning ahil, whence Ahiloth (also אָהֳלֹות), name of a treatise of the Mishnah (of Seder Tahãroth). Y. M. Kat. II, end, 81 b there are things in the Order of Moëd קשיין מן א' וכ' more difficult than Ahiloth &c.—Ḥag. 14 a, a. fr. אהל'. B. Mets. 86 a אהי'.
, v. אֳהָל
Pes. 30 a
f., pl. אֲהִילֹות, v. אָהִיל

sense.definition: Ahina, a species of late and inferior dates (cmp. אַחְיָנַיָּא).
sense.notes: Ḥull. 46 b lungs apparently so peeled as to resemble א' סומקא a red Ah. B. Mets. 113 b א' מרירא a bitter Ah.— Pl. אֲהִינֵי. Tosef. Shebi. VII, 14; Pes. 53 a (m.!). Y. B. Kam. VI, 5 b bot. כבשא דא' a preserve of A. Y. B. Bath. V, end, 15 b כבשה דאהינו (corr. acc.), v. Ab. Zar. 38 b א' שליקי.
, v. foreg.

אִיהֵל (deriv. of אֹהֶל) to spread tent-like, to cover, shade, bend over &c., usu. with refer. to levitical uncleanness arising from being under the same shelter with, or forming a shelter over, a corpse &c. Meïlah 17 a אי' על מקצתו if he bent over a portion (of the blood). Sabb. 17 a אי' צדו אחת וכ' he caused one side of his body to overshadow the grave.—[More freq.]
same. Ohol. III, 1; 3 sq. הא' על המת he formed a tent, i.e. spread himself, or bent, over a corpse. Ib. הבית מַאֲחִיל עליו the house forms a cover over part of it. Y. Sot. IX, 23 c top; a. fr.

Succ. 21 b א' עראי a temporary dwelling. א' קבע a permanent dwelling.—Naz. 55 a א' זרוק a movable cover, e.g. a person carried in a vehicle over a grave, v. foreg.—B. Bath. 27 b, a. fr. א' הטומאה something spread over an unclean object, e.g. a tree shading a corpse; v. foreg. Naz. VII, 2, v. אָהִיל.— Pl. אֹוהֳלִים, (אָהֳולִין) אֹוהֳלִין. Y. Sabb. XX, beg. 17 c נטע א' to spread sheets over poles &c. (Tosef. ib. XII (XIII), 14, a. e. עשה א'). Y. Erub. I, 19 d א' בשיירה tents in a caravan, א' שבמחנה in a camp. Tosef. Kil. V, 25 אהולין ed. Zuck.

sense.definition: (Syr. אחלא P. Sm. 125; הל, חל, v. הלל, חלל, cmp. מוהל, מוחל)
an alcalic plant, used as soap.
sense.notes: Sabb. 90 a; Nid. 62 a (counted among plants subject to the laws of the Sabbath year).

sense.definition: a mineral substance of the same use (in connection with נתר; v. however Maim. to Nid.
sense.notes: IX, 6). Nid. l. c. והתניא הבורית והאהל; (Sabb. l. c. first time חול ed., Ms. M. אָהֵיל; sec. time אהלא ed., Ms. M. אהיל). M. Kat. 17 b; a, e. [The biblical אהלים a. אהלות have no connection of meaning with our w.]

Targ. Y. Num. XII, 12 (Var. אֲהִילָא, אָהֵילָא). Bets. 30 b קא סתר א' he breaks the tent up (by removing portions of the cover). Ib. 32 b; a. fr.— Pl. אָהֳלֵי. Sabb. 137 b אוסופי א' extending the spread sheets (by opening a door or window over which they were spread).
Targ. Job. IX, 30 (h. text בור). Sabb. 90 a, v. אֳהָל.

sense.definition: (= b. h. אהלים, אהלות?) aloë (used for medicinal purposes, v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Aloë).
sense.notes: Ib. 110 b א' תולענא; Git. 69 b א' תולאנא purple-colored aloë.

sense.definition:
(foreg.) dealer in aloë (prob. in b. h.
אהלות, perfumes).
sense.notes: . Ned. 91 b. B. Mets. 81 a
, v. אָהִיל
VII, 4 אה'. Zeb. 25 b אוה'.

sense.definition: (אהל) a group of tents, encampment; only in Pl. אָהֳלִיֹּות (= castra) camps.
sense.notes: (Always in connection with בצוצריות or קסטרא fortifications). Cant. R. to II, 13. Yalk. Ps. 624 אהו'. Lev. R. s. 1; a. e. [Cmp. בְּצֹוצְרִיֹּות a. גַּסְטְרָא as to versions.]
, v. אַחְמְרָא

sense.definition: or אֲהֵן, אֲהֹון m. (= הָן, הֲהָן, √ה־)

sense.notes: Y. Ber. II, 4 c bot. א' חזירא that swine. Ib. VI, 10 a bot. א' דמר he who says. Y. Yoma VI, 43 d bot. כא' דתנינן as that (Mishnah) which we have been taught. Y. Shek. II, 47 a top א' דהכא the subject just quoted. Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c (אהון) אהין להן לי אהן מהו חשוב of what use is this to me? of what value is it to me?—Y. Shebu. III, 34 d bot. וא' אפילו and this ‘even’—i.e. why do you use the word ‘even’?—a. fr.
Y. Ber. IX, 13 b top כל א' דאת אזיל wherever thou goest.

sense.definition: (adv. of time = על־הן, v. אַ־) thereupon, then.
sense.notes: Y. Taan. IV, 69 b top אכלון ואהון וכ' eat ye and then drink.
Keth. 67 b מקרבן אהנייתי, v. הֲנָיָיה ch.

sense.definition: (b. h.) Aaron, the brother of Moses.
sense.notes: Meg. 25 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (deriv. of foreg.) of priestly parentage, Aaronide.
sense.notes: Erub. 53 b נערה א' אחרונית (play on words) an Aaronide maiden, a second wife (in Ms. M. our w. is missing).
, v. אַהֲרֹון
prefix, esp. for verbal nouns, e.g. 1) prefix, esp. for verbal nouns, e.g. אודיצותא fr. דיץ.
או, אוו = εὐ-αὐ, v. אב

sense.definition: , v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) or; או … או either … or.
sense.notes: Shebu. 27 a או … לחלק the word אֹו in the Bible text is necessary as a disjunctif, (one or the other), contrad. from ו־ which is conjunctive (one and the other). Men. 91 a; או לדרשא the word אֹו intimates something not explicitly stated in the text; a. fr.— Pl. אֹואִין Shebu. 33 b.—אוֹיִין, אֹויִים, const. אֹויֵי the word אֹו in the biblical passages. Y. ibid. IV, 35 cd
Targ. Ex. XXI, 20; a. e. Targ. Prov. VI, 28 Ms. (ed. אי).—Ber. 2 b, v. דילמא; a. v. fr.
Y. R. Hash. I, 57 a bot. (in a Greek sentence), v. אגרפוס.

sense.definition: (contr. of אֲהוּ, אֲהִי v. הוּ, הִי) he, that, this (only in Y. Dial).
sense.notes: [Y. Ber. II, 5 b top או מקשי, read הוה מ'; ed. Amst. בעי.] Y. B. Bath. III, 14 b I was jesting באו גברא with that man. Y. Snh. XI, beg. 30 a באו ד(א)מר with him who says— Fem. אִי.—Y. Erub. III, 21 b bot. אי אידא אי אידא it is all the same; v. אִידָא II.

sense.definition: (אור; cmp. h. form צַוָּאר), only in א' דליבני a pile of loose bricks with openings between, opp. to solid wall.
sense.notes: Bets. 31 b; 36 a; Erub. 34 b Ms. Rashi (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; ed. אַוִּירָא, cmp. אָוֵירָא; Ar. אארא, derives fr. Pers.).
—בעל א' necromancer. Snh. 65 a; a. fr.

Targ. Is. XXIX, 4; a. e.—א' טמיא necromancy over bones, sculls, also for necromancer. Targ. Y. I Deut. XVIII, 11. Ber. 59 a א' טמיא כדיב וכ' the necromancer is a liar (necromancy is false), and his (its) words are lies. Sabb. 152 b bot. (of the woman of En-Dor, I Sam. XXVIII, 7). [Yeb. 103 a בר א', v. אַבְיוּ.]
, v. אָבְדָּן, אַבְדָּנָא.
, v. חֶבְיֹונָה

sense.definition: Ephesus, city of Ionia in Asia Minor.
sense.notes: Targ. I Chr. I, 5 אֹוב' (var. lect.); Y. Meg. I, 71 b אוו' bot. (rendit. of יון); v. מַקְדֹּונְיָא.
Dan. VIII, 2; 3; 6.

sense.definition: as a pr. n. Ubal (The River).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 16 (referring to Dan. l. c.) א' אוותנטין וכ' Ubal is the source of all the other rivers.
= אֶבְלָא. Targ. Y. Gen. VII, 10; a. e.

sense.definition: (אוּכְלָא, אָכְלָא) m. (יבל) vessel made of willow twigs; basket, or perforated trough; (as to shape v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Cãlathus).
sense.notes: Bekh. 43 b, v. בִּילֹון a. כִּילֹון. Sab. 123 b; Snh. 92 a, a. e. א' דקצרי Ar. (ed. אוכ') the fuller’s trough. Ib. 28 b the father of the husband and the father of the wife are no more kinsmen אלא כי א' לדנא (ed. אכלא) than is a basket related to a barrel. [For אכלא, אוכלא cmp. כְּלִיל, כַּלְכָּלָה.]
Erub. 12 a top (var. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 1). Ḥull. 55 b אובלים (ed. אי').
, v. אֲבַנְתָּא

cmp. חָבַץ II, a. חבץ P. Sm. 1181 sq.) heavy pressure, overload, prostration from heavy load. Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 2.—B. Mets. 36 b א' דהר the prostration from carriyng a load up hill. Ib. 78 a מתה מחמת א' died from fatigue. Sabb. 106 b. [Ar. reads אוכצנא, cmp. Syr. אכץ P. Sm. 190—corr. acc.]

sense.definition: f., אֹובְרִיזֹון, אֹובְרִיזִין m. (ὄβρυζον) pure gold, unalloyed.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. CXIX, 127; Targ. Prov. VIII, 19; a. e.

Maasr. I, 2 הענבים והאו' משיבאישו Ar. (ed. Talm. B. והאב' משה'; Talm. Y. הבאושין) grapes and ubshin are subject to tithes from the time they are called בְּאוּשָׁה q. v.—Y. Ter. VIII, 45 d top ענבים ואו' וכ' grapes or ubshin for a sick person.

אוגא P. Sm. 53) (rhus coriaria), red berry of the Venus’ summachtree. Peah I, 5. Dem. I, 1. Maasr. I, 2. Kel. XXVI, 3.— Pl. אוֹגִין. Tosef. Maas. I, 4 אובין אדומים (איבין, corr. acc.; cmp. Maasr. l. c. V. Löw Aram. Pfl. p. 44).
, v. אֵגֶד
, v. next w.

Y. B. Bath. X, 17 c (corrected text) שטר נפיק מר' חונה לר' שמיי אוגדויי מחיק קונטא לא מחיק. א"ר שמיי לר' חונה פוק חזי עם ההן אהן קונטא משמש. ומר עם טרייאקונטא. כי נפק אמר הדא בעי מתגרא תלתין אפסד עשרין. A bill of indebtedness passed from R. Ḥuna (who could not decide or on whose decision the party would not rely) to R. Sh.—on which bill ogdoë was blurred (showing an erasure), and conta was clear. Said R. Sh. to R. Ḥ., Go and see what is the lowest numeral in Greek that conta is combined with. Said he, It is triaconta (thirty).—When the party had left, he said, That man intended to make thirty (by the erasure) and lost twenty (the original having been fifty, penteconta).
Y. Ab. Zar. V, 44 d. Bab. ib. 31 a זג' (Ms. M. זגרור).
Targ. Y. Deut. XXX, 20, const. אוֹגְדוּת (Var. אוֹגְרוּת).
, v. אֵגוֹר end.

sense.definition: (אגי, sec. r. of אוג, v. אָוֶן; cmp. עוּגָה) rounded off, whence a field or fields surrounded with a ridge or ditch.
sense.notes: Ned. 6 b. Ber. 6 a כי כסלא לא' like the ridge surrounding the field.

sense.definition: (foreg.) rounded ditch, hole dug around the grape-vine.
sense.notes: M. Kat. I, 1 (Rashi to Ber. 6 a, Asheri to Ned. 6 b expl. foreg. w.; ed. עוּגְיוֹת).

sense.definition: (אוג; v. foreg.) border of a vessel, rim.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 25 ab; Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 17 ה'. Ḥ ag. 22 b אוֹגנוֹ its border. Pl. אוֹגְנִים, אוֹגְנִין, הוֹ'. Nid. 3 b. Erub. 87 b (banks). Kel. XXV, 6; a. e. [Ḥull. II, 9 (41 a) אוּגָן של מים Ar., a little pool, ed. עוּגָה q. v.]
Targ. Cant. VII, 3 א' דסיהרא the disk of the moon.—B. Mets. 69 b א' דקירא (some ed. אוֹגְנֵי pl., v. Rashi a. l., Ms. M. אַגָּנֵי, v. אַגָּנָא) cake of wax. Cmp. אַגֵּין.
, v. אֶבְגִּינוֹס
Af. of אֲגַר.

sense.definition: (אָגַר, גְּרַר) heap of stones, stone-hill (h. גַּל).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XXXI, 46 (Bab. דְּגוֹרָא); a. fr. V. אֱגוֹרָא I.
, read אוגדויי.
, v. גְּרַם Af.
, v. אַגְדָּנָא

sense.definition: a knife having notches, v. אָגַר II.
v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.; cmp. אֵיד) wooden poker.
sense.notes: Bets. 33 a; Sabb. 143 a
Targ. Am. IV, 11; a. e.— Pl. אוּדֵי, אוּדַיָּא. Targ. Is. VII, 4.—Snh. 93 a (prov. concerning bad company) תרי א' וכ' two dry pieces of wood and a green one between &c.
Targ. Ps. XLV, 1 (var. אוֹדֵאָתָא); a. e.

sense.definition: ed. m. (אדד, אדר, v. אָדַר: Syr.
sense.notes: אודדא; cmp. אַדְדָא, אַדְרָא as to dial. var.) upholsterer’s stuffing material, tow-cotton, wool. Sabb. 48 a לאהדורי א' (Ms. M. אוּדְדֵי Pl.) to put the stuffing back into the mattress. Ib. 141 a (Ms. M. אודדא); v. אֲשִׁישָׁא.—B. Bath. 58 a חביתא דא' (Mss. דאודד') a vessel full of stuffings (enigmatical for bolsters). Ab. Zar. 28 b א' דנדא וכ' (Ms. M. ארדא דנורא) tow cotton which has been dyed but not combed. B. Mets. 26 a; a. fr.— Pl. אוּדְדֵי. Kid. 12 a זוודא דאורדי (corr. acc.) a bundle of tow-cotton. [Cmp. עוּדְדָא, עוּדְרָא; also אִירָּא a. אִידָּן; v. Fuerst, H. Dict. lit. ר.]

sense.definition: (ידי, אדי; cmp. funda = sling and purse) purse.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 28 b א' דדינרי (ed. אוּדְיָיא) a purse of denars.
, Toh. VII, 7, v. אוֹרְיָיר
, v. אוּדְיָא
, read אוֹרְיָין.

sense.definition: (ידי, נדי) whatever appertains to irrigation, sprinkling arrangements; hence the field cistern with its purtenances.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 144 a (Ms. אִידְיָנִי, אִידְיָי'; v. Rashi a. l.) if a father left nothing אלא א' וכ' but a sprinkling business, what is earned with it belongs to all heirs alike. Ib. שאני א' דלנטירותא וכ' it is different with a sprinkling business, since all the attendance it requires, is watching (which minors can do just as well as adults). [Tossaf. ib Var. אידווני, watching pedestal, fr. דוי q. v. Cmp. however אוּדְנָא III.—M. Kat. 21 a, read אוּרְיָינִי.]
Targ. Jer. XXXI, 40 Ar. ed. pr. (ed. אֲרִיתָא q. v. ed. Ven. אֵדִיתָא).

sense.definition: (דוע, v. אַדְווּתָא) attendant, or superintendent of the vapor bath; cmp. אֲזִי—Y.
sense.notes: Shebi. VIII, 38 a זוסימי א' Zosime, the superintendent &c.
Targ. Ps. LI, 10 (ed. Vien. אֲדִי').

sense.definition:
prop. outlook (v. דִּיק) hence pr. n. pl. Odikutha (h.
ציץ).
sense.notes: Targ. II Chron. XX, 16.

sense.definition: (ודי) confession, esp. document stating a debtor’s admission of his indebtedness in presence of witnesses.
sense.notes: Snh. 29 b

אֲדָמָה, אָדָם; b. h. אֹדֶם rubin]. Y. Kil. VIII, 31 c bot. הא' מן האשה from the mother the embryo receives the substance for forming skin, flesh, and blood; opp. לֹובֶן white, sticky substance. Nid. 32 b למעוטי איש מא' to exempt man from being unclean from a red (blood) discharge, opp. to לובן white gonorrhoeic discharge.

sense.definition: (= h. אֹזֶן, v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.; √אד, v. אָדַר) ear.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. LXIV, 3. Targ. Ps. XVIII, 45 אוּדַן (ed. Vien. אוּדִין?, Ms. אוזן). Targ. Ex. XXIX, 20; a. fr.—Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c bot. טב לא' good for ear-ache; v. Bab. ib. 67 a; a. fr.— Pl. אוּדְנִין, אוֹדְנִין, אוּדְנַיָּא, אוּדְנֵי. Targ. Deut. XXIX, 3; a. fr. (also אֻדְנִין).—Snh. 106 a. Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 b bot.; Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד כותאי

sense.definition: (from its shape, v. foreg. a. P. Sm. 40)

sense.notes: Pl. אוּדְנִין. Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 b bot. (to one who had dreamt he had four udnin = ears, v. foreg.) מלוי את תרתי אֻדְנָיךְ ותרתי אוּדְנוֹי דגרבא thou shalt have wine enough to fill thy own two udnin (wine jars), and two udnin (measures) of a garba (v. גַּרְבָּא I) besides.
Ber. 22 a was sitting בא' דמיא Ar. (ed. באגנא, Ms. Beth. Nath. באוזנא) in a tub filled with an udna of water. Sabb. 157 b א' דמיא … Ar. (ed. באוונא, Ms. M. אַדָּנָא) by a bath-tub.

sense.definition: אֲדִינָא ( f.?) (= h. אֶדֶן; cmp. b. h. הֲדֹם; √דא, דנא; cmp. דּוּךְ) foot-stool, camp-chair, folding stool.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. XLIII, 10 אוּדְנֵיה Ar. (ed. אפדניה).— Pl. אוּדְנַיָּא, אֲדִינַיָּא. Targ. II Est. I, 2 תרתין אוּדְנֹוי (תרין?) the double footstool of king Solomon. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VIII, 6 מָטָה וישן וכ' (not מיטה) when it bends in (under the weight) but one can sleep on it; if it was originally so made, טמאה (not טהורה) it is unclean מפני שהיא כאו' ed. Zuck. (Var. אדיניא, ed. אדוניא) because it is made like a double footstool.
, v. אוּדְרָא, a. אֵדֶר I.

sense.definition: (דרך) a crushing tool, pestle, pounding club.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXVII, 22 ed. Buxt. (better, like oth. ed. אוּרְדָּךְ).
, v. אוי
, v. אהל'
of חרי Ar.) net-work, esp. loose fisher’s net, contrad. to אִיזְלָא. Y. M. Kat. III, 81 b top הו'.— Pl. אֹוהֲרֵי. M. Kat. 11 a למיגדל א' (Alf. אוחרי) to plait nets. Git. 60 b bot.
, v. אבגניסטי

וזא, a. וזוז bombum edit, P. Sm. 1060) [the noisy], goose. Ber. 57 a הרואה א' וכ' he who sees a goose in his dream, may hope for wisdom (with ref. to Prov. I, 20, ‘wisdom cries’ &c.). Y. B. Kam. V, end 5 a אֲוַוז ים וא' יישוב וכ' the water goose (bernicle) and the domestic goose are two diff. species (כלאים); Y. Kil. VIII, 31 c bot. א' עם א' מדבר וכ' the (domestic) goose and the goose of the steppes (wild g.); א' עם א' הים the domestic and the water goose; B. Kam. 55 a א' וא' הבר (Ms. M. marg. אֲוַוז בית וא' בר) the domestic and the wild g.; Bekh. 8 a
Git. 86 a.—בר א' duck. Bets. 33 a. Pl. אֲוָוזִין, אַוְוזֵי. Targ. II Esth. III, 8. Pes. 114 a. B. Bath. 73 b. Ḥull. 56 b הנהו א' דידן וכ' our (Babylonian) geese are considered as water fowls.
, v. אֲוַל
, v. אַבְלַס
, v. אָוֶן
, v. אַוְנָא a. אוּדְנָא II

sense.definition: ; pl. אַוְורֵי (אֲוַר dial. for עבר, v. Nœld.
sense.notes: Mand. Gr. p. 48 sq.; v. Ar. s. v. where אוברים = עוברים [not אובדים as in ed. Koh.] is twice used to account for the etymol. of our w.) crossers of rivers, travelers. בֵּי א'

B. Mets. 103 b אריסא עביד בי א' Ar. (ed. בי יאורי; Ms. H. בי אוריא, marg. יאורי) the tenant must entertain the crossings (of the dykes, ed. the channels) in the farm. M. Kat. 28 b רהיט ונפיל בי א' ואמברי יזיפתא יזיף Ar. (ed. ונפיל אמעברא ויזיפתא וכ' …, Ms. M. ונפיל בר זיירא אמברא …, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) one runs and rushes to the ford, and on the ferry he makes a loan (to pay the ferry-man; allegory of man’s carelessness in providing for the life to come).
Ib. (according to a second interpretation, v. Ar. s. v.) one runs and rushes among those ready to cross (mortals) &c. Cmp. עִיבְּרָא B. Bath. 91 a bot.
, v. וַרְדִּימֹוס
, v. אִבְרֹוסִי
Targ. Y. I, a. II Ex. XXVIII. 42; ib. I, Ex. XXXIX, 28 אוורקסי. Ib. Lev. VI, 3 (ed. Vien. אורקטין, II אברסקין). Ib. XVI, 4. [For וו = פ v. אֶוְושַׁר.]

sense.definition: (ed. אוּרְשִׁינָה) m. name of a mythical bird, Phœnix.
sense.notes: Snh. 108 b
, v. אֲוַשׁ
Targ. Y. I, Gen. XVIII, 2; 17; a. e.

Nid. II, 2 (14 a) נמצא על שלה א' Ar. (ed. אותיום, corr. acc.) if a stain is found on her bedclothes immediately after (the coïtion). Ib. 12 b; 14 b איזהו שיעור אוו' Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. ותס, וסת, corr. acc.) what is the interval designated by evthios? Y. Nid. II, 49 d bot. repeatedly הֶיוְתִּיאֹוס or הֶוְו'.
, v. אוותנטיא

sense.definition: (= h. אֵיתָן, r. אית) full, proud, bright.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXXI, 26 Ms. (ed. זִיוְתָן).— Pl. אִיוְתָּנַיָּא Ib. IX, 13 (ed. Buxt. a. oth. גֵּיוְתָנַיָּא)
, v. אַוְותֶּנְטִין

sense.definition: (αὐθεντία) origin, reality; v. next w.—עיקר א' the very reality, virtuality.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 25 עיקר א' וכ' the real famine was destined to be in the days of Saul. Cant. R. to I, 1 עיקר א' וכ' the real, authentic, among the several names of Solomon &c. Koh. R. to I, 1 אית' (corr. acc.). Num. R. s. 10 אוותיננייה (corr. acc.).

Gen. R. s. 16 פרת א' של וכ' the Euphrates is the originator (ultimate source) of the rivers (mentioned Gen. II, 10 sq.).— Pl. m. אַוְותֶּנְטִין. Y’lamd. to Num. XI, 16 (quot. in Ar. s. v. אמתנטין) כנגד אפת' של ישראל וכ' (corr. אוו') corresponding to the number of the originators of Israel, for with seventy souls &c.—Fem. אַוְותֶּנְטִיֹּות, אַוְותֶּנְטִיאֹות. Pesik. Sh’kal. p. 16 b אומות א' (seventy) original nations.

sense.definition: (√אז, v. אֲזַד; cmp. קָצֶה) a piece, part, uzya, a market term for a certain portion (quarter &c.) of meat.
sense.notes: Bets. 29 a in Pumb. they call it א' ופלגא א' Ms. M. (ed. ופלגו א' corr. acc.; Var. אוסיא) an uzya and half an uzya.
, v. אוּרְזִילָא
, v. אִיזְלָא

sense.definition: (= אונז'; נזק, v. אַנְזִיקָא) ( compensation for) loss, expense of money and time.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 6 b שקול א' וכ' (Ms. R. עבדיה כוליה ויהיבנא לך א') take compensation and do thou the work (do thou it all, and I shall pay &c.).
, v. אִיזְלָא

sense.definition: (זמי, יזם; comp. זְמָם, צמם) knots, fringes (in the weaver’s work).
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. ch. V, end שְׁיָרֵי … והא' the remnants &c. and the fringes (cut off for finishing).
, v. אִיזְמֵל
, v. אֹזֶן
, v. אוּדְנָא

sense.definition: (?) pl. (= חזניות, v. חִזָּיוֹן 2, a. חָזִיז; cmp. אֶבְיֹונֹות = חֶבְיֹונֹות) lichen-dishes.
sense.notes: Tosef. Shebi. VII, 13. [El. Wil. emends אהיניות = אהיני whereas the context intimates a vegetable.]
Targ. Y. Deut. XV, 2.

sense.definition: (= זיפין, v. זִיף) a species of bees, wasps.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 20.
, v. עוּזְרָר a. חִיזְרָר.
Targ. Prov. XXVII, 24 (ed. corrupt אחרנא; ed. Walt. אַחֲסָנָא).

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) prop. locking up, hence, trap, snare.
sense.notes: Targ. Job. XVIII, 10.
Targ. Ps. XLIX, 5 (Ms. אחדותא).

sense.definition: howling animals, owls &c. Targ. Is. XIII, 21.

sense.notes: , v. אֲחֹורִי
Targ. Y. II. Lev. XIX, 9; v. אֹומַן.

Targ. Koh. IV, 4.
, v. אֱטִימוֹס
, v. אַנְטִיפִּיטָא

Ḥull. 47 b א' בריאה Ar. (ed. אָטוּם) an obstruction in the lungs, a spot imperviable to air when blown up. Ohol. VI, 5 we regard the levitical uncleanness between the rafters כאילו הוא א' as if it was locked up (and could not affect what is in the house).
Mid. IV, 6. Par. III, 6.
Tosef. Kil. III, 14 ed. Zuck., v. אִיטָּן
Ab. Zar. 39 a, v. אֲטוּנָס
Koh. R. to XI, 1, read אנטיפיטא.
Snh. 63 a אִיוּוּ אלוהות וכ' (Ab. Zar. 53 b לאלוהות, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 8) they had a desire for many deities. Denom. תַּאֲוָה. Cmp. אוּת.
נִתְאַוֶּה (denom. of תַּאֲוָה) to desire, to be seized with a desire. Num. R. s. 10 (play on י̇ת̇א̇ד̇ם̇ Prov. XXIII, 3

the drunken man וכ' לד̇ם̇ יִ֗תְ֗אַ֗וֶּה will covet blood (forbidden intercourse). Gen. R. s. 51. Ex. R. s. 24, end.—Num. R. s. 2 התחילו מִתְאַוִּים וכ' they began to express a desire for standards (in imitation of the angelic hosts). Ib. divide them into standards כמו שנִתְאַוּוּ as they desired.

sense.definition: , a. Ges. H. Dict. s. v. אָוָה III) to point, mark.
sense.notes: Denom. אֹות II, תְּאָו, תַּאֲוָה.

sense.definition: (denom. of תַּאֲוָה, תְּאָו) to mark, to mark out.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to XII, 7 התחיל מִתְאַוֶּה תאוים he began to put up marks.
Gen. R. s. 46 בי לא אוי there is no (cause for) woe with me. Num. R. s. 10 (play on ãboy, Prov. XXIII, 29) אַב אוי father of woe.—2) interj. woe! alas! Kel. XVII, 16; a. v. fr.
Gen. R. s. 26 בגלילא וכ' in Galilee they call ḥ ivya, ivya
Amora. B. Bath. 19 a R. Ḥiya son of R. Iv.—Men. 78 a; a. e.
pl. of אֹו I.

sense.definition: (?) an interjection (cmp. εὔαν, εὖα) ho! hallo! Y. Ḥag. II, 78 a top; Snh. VI, 23 c bot. א' א' פתחון לי וכ' ho, ho! Open, for I am one of yours.
(אור; cmp. רוּחַ a. רֶוַח); space corresp. to חָלָל, esp.

sense.notes: Ohol. IV, 1 a tower שעומד בא' standing isolated. Ib. XVIII, 10 אוירָהּ של חצר the open space in the court-yard.—B. Bath. 163 a

sense.definition: (cmp. b. h. מְאוּרָה) hollow, cavity of a vessel.
sense.notes: Kel. II, 1 מיתטמאין ומטמאין בא' become unclean and make unclean by contact with the hollow (of the vessel).—Yeb. 67 b נפק לא' העולם came forth into the lighted space of the world, i.e. was born; a. fr.

sense.definition: (cmp. ἀήρ, aër) air, atmosphere, climate, weather.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 14 הא' שממנו וכ' (as one of the elements of nature) out of which the wind was made.—Gen. R. s. 34 א' יפה fine weather; a. fr.— Pl. אֲוִירִין blank spaces in writings. B. Bath. 163 a.—אֲוִירוֹת climates. Gen. R. s. 34 ברית נחלקה לא' a covenant has been made in favor of climates, i.e. God has implanted in man a love of his native soil even in bad climates.
Targ. Y. Ex. XIX, 17; a. fr.—Git. 20 b א' דמגילתא the blank in a scroll (margin &c.). Men. 35 a חזי א' to face the inside of the T’fillin.
Pes. 30 b שליט בהו א' the air strikes them. Y. R. Hash. II, 58 a bot. א' מעונן cloudy weather; a. fr.

sense.definition: pile of bricks with openings between, v. אַוָּארָא.

sense.notes: Y. M. Kat. I, 80 b bot., v. אַיְירָא
— Pl. אֲוִירְטִין. Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. IV, 10.
Shebu. 24 b (v. Rab. D. S. a.).
Targ. Y. I, Deut. I, 1; a. e.

Esth. R. to I, 1 b (ref. to Lam. III, 13 בני אשפתו, the quotation being omitted by clerical error), [read] ר' ברכי' ורבנן ר' בני. ברכי' אמר בני אוּכַּיְיפֵיה ורבנן אמרי בני אמורייה אוכייפיה שהיו מרוצין וכ' B’ne Ashpatho means ‘the children of his pressure’ &c., v. אֲמוּרְיָא.
Pes. 53 a של א', read אָבֵל; v. Tosef. Shebi. VII, 15.

Bets. I, 8 בורר א' ואֹוכֵל (Y. ed. בורר אוכל אוכל) he selects singly what is edible and eats immediately; a. fr.—א' נפש the necessary food for the day. Meg. I, 5 אלא א' נ' בלבד except the preparation of food (cooking &c., permitted on Holy Days, Ex. XII, 16).— Pl. אֹוכְלִים, אֹוכְלִין food, eatables. Ber. 50 b; a. fr. Ab. Zar. 52 b תקרובת ע"ז של א' an idolatrous offering consisting of edibles; Y. ib. IV, 43 d אֹכְ'.
ch.
—Yoma 80 b כל אכשורי א' א' הוא whatever is used for seasoning food, is considered as food.

sense.definition: the digested food found in the entrails, excrements, cmp. רעי.
sense.notes: .—Targ. Lev. I, 16; a. e.
Ab. Zar. 28 b תחלת א' the incipiency of &c., סוף א' last stage (near recovery).

sense.definition: a certain measure, Ukhla, (basket); cmp. כְּלָה.
sense.notes: —Y. Sot. I, 17 a תומן וחצי ת' וא' one Tuman (one eighth of a kab), and half a T. and one Ukhla; cmp. עוּכְלָא.
, v. אָכְלָה

ḳalaza, collegit, a. כרז, קלס; v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v. כרשׂ; var. forms: אָכְלֹוזָא, אוֹכְלֹוסָא, אֹוכְלָסָא, כְּלֹוזָא; h. form only in pl. אֹוכְלֹוסִין, const. אֹוכְלֹוסֵי, אֹוכְלָסִין) levy of troops or forced laborers (corresp. to h. צָבָא). Targ. I Chr. XI, 6; XX, 1.—B. Bath. 8 a; B. Mets. 108 a נפקי בא' (Ms. M. כלוזא) they have to go out themselves to do public labors (not permitted to hire substitutes). Ib. לאו בני א' וכ' are exempt from the levy. Ber. 58 a; Yeb. 76 b יצא בא' went out with the army; [strike out ודרש בא' Ber. l. c., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40]; a. fr.— Pl. אֹוכְלֹוזִין, אֹוכְלֹוסִין, אֹוכְלָסִין (v. supra). Targ. I Chr. XII, 22; a. fr.—Tosef. Ber. VII (VI), 2 אוכלסין. Ber. 58 a; אֹוכְלֹוסֵי ישראל a Jewish army. Y. Ber. IX, 13 c top.; Y. Snh. X, 29 b top. … אֹוכלֹוסַיָּיא ד the armies of students; a. fr.—Cmp. אָכְלֹושֵׁי. [Y. Ber. IX, 13 a; Midr. Till. to Ps. IV, v. אִסְכֹּולִי].

Targ. Lev. XIII, 31; a. fr.—Pes. 88 a.—M. Kat. 9 b הוה ליה ברתא א' Ms. M. (ed. our w. omitted) had an ungainly (freckled) daughter; Sabb. 80 b. Git. 67 b תרנגולתא אוּכַּמְתִּי a black (checkered?) hen. Ib. 68 a אוכמא בחיורא a black spot on a white skin. Pl. masc. אוּכָּמִין, אוּכָּמֵי, אוּכָּמַיָּא, אוּכְמַיָּא. Targ. Jer. VIII, 21; a. e.—Ḥull. 46 b א' א' covered with black spots.—Fem. אֻכָּמָתָא Sabb. 129 a. Ib. 20 b אוכמוותא Ar. (ed. אוכמתא) the black (greenish) moss on ships or puddles.
Targ. Y. Lev. XXII, 22. Targ. Lam. IV, 8.
f. same. Targ. Koh. XI, 10 dark hair, youth.
, v. אוּסְמָנָא
, v. אוּכָּמָא, אוּכְמָא.
, v. אוּכָּמָא

Kel. XXIII, 1; 2; a. e.—Y. Sabb. V, 7 b bot. או' a. אי'.—Y. Erub. I, 19 b bot. בין אי' לאי'; Bab. ib. 16 a בין או' לאו'. Sabb. 53 a.— Pl. אוּכָּפוֹת. Erub. 15 b ed. (Ar. אִכּוּפִין). Y. Erub. l. c. אִיכּוּפִין.

B. Mets. 27 b. B. Kam. 92 b (prov.) חברא קרייך חמרא א' וכ' if thy neighbor calls thee an ass, put a saddle on. Erub. 27 a גבא דא' the upper part of the saddle (Ar., besides other var., גברא דא' man’s figure on the upper part of the saddle) used as a handle by the rider.
Esth. R. to I, 1 b (איכ') בני או', v. אוּכַּיְיפָא
, v. אוּבְצָנָא

sense.definition: (אול to circle, v. חוּל, עול, cmp. עֹולָם, תְּחִלָּה) beginning, early season.
sense.notes: Targ. Hos. IX, 10; a. e.—מן א' from the beginning (of the world). Targ. Job. XX, 4; a. fr.—לאויל to ( its) previous condition. Targ. Ez. XVI, 55 (some ed. לְאַוְלְהַן). Cmp. אלל.

sense.definition: , pl. אוּלְבָּנִין (denom. of לְבוּנְתָּא) unguent made of incense.
sense.notes: Targ. Cant. IV, 11; (h. text לבנון, LXX ἀρώματα, as if לְבֹנִין).

sense.definition: (ולד, ילד) a tool for hollowing out and cutting the writing reed (scalprum), a sort of pen-knife.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. end. Kel. XII, 8 אולר (corr. acc.; v. Ar. ed. Koh. s. v.).

sense.definition: (ὅλο-) a prefix, sometimes separately printed, whole, entirely of.
sense.notes: Pesik. Vay. B’yom p. 4 b א' מרגליטין trimmed all over with pearls. Lev. R. s. 32, end אילו כורסין (corr. acc.) all gold, v. אֹולֹוכְרוּסֹון.
, v. אִילֹוגִין

sense.definition: Y. Taan. III, 66 c top, read מוּלְוָותָא, v. מוּלָא mule.

sense.notes: , v. next w.
Lev. R. s. 32 (variously corrupted, v. אֹולֹו־.—Ar. אולון כרוסא); Cant. R. to IV, 7 (corr. acc.).
, v. foreg.
— Pl. אֹולֹוסֵירִיקִין, mostly אֹולֹוסְרִיקִין pure-silken garments. Koh. R. to I, 7. Y. Sabb. VI, 8 b bot., Yalk. Prov. 935.—[Koh. R. l. c. second time some ed. אולוסתיקין, corr. acc.]
, v. foreg.
, v. אוֹלְיָיר
, v. אִילִיאֹוס

sense.definition: (olearius, ὀλεάριος S.) keeper of clothes at the baths.
sense.notes: Y. Maas. Sh. I, 52 d top מעות הנתונות לא' tokens (in place of small change) given to the olearius; cmp. Tosef. Maas. Sh. I, 4.—Pesik. R. s. 22; a. e.— Pl. אוֹלְיָארִין, אוֹלְיָירִין. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 12 מגררות של אוּלְיָרִין ed. Zuck. (oth. ed. אולו' corr. acc.) the brushes (strigils) of the bathing attendants. Sabb. 147 b. Y. Ber. II, 4 c top; cmp. Pesik. R. l. c.; a. e. V. אוֹרְיָיר. [Sabb. 144 a כלים הא', Nid. 20 a האולירין …, v. אוֹלָרִין.]
, v. foreg. a. אוֹלָרִין.
, v. אַלְלָא
אלם in front of, opposite, Schr. K. A. T. glossary, a. b. h. conj. אוּלָם) entrance, hall, esp . Ulam, the hall leading to the interior of the Temple. Mid. IV, 7; a. e.
Euseb. Onom.; Neub. Géogr. p. 18; 26

sense.definition: Ulam (Porta) a place in Gilead, and one in Galilee.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. X, 28 d
in Cilicia; v. אַבְלַס
Targ. I Kings VII, 6; a. fr.—Targ. II Chr. III, 4 אילם, Var. אוּלְמָנָא.— Pl. אוּלַמַּיָּא. Targ. Ez. XL, 22; a. e.
Sabb. 134 a מא' לקוטנא from the thick to the thinner side.—Nid. 8 a, a. fr. מאי אוּלְמֵיה wherein does his (its) strength consist, i.e. why is this opinion preferable to &c.?
, v. אוּלָמָא
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (ילף, אלף) custom, training, instruction; the Law.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIII, 14. Targ. Is. XXXII, 6; a. fr.—Y. R. Hash. IV, beg. 59 b for it is impossible for one to go through his Bible lesson דלא א' (read בלא; cmp. Ḥag. 3 a בלא חדוש) without some instructive observation. Y. Meg. I, 71 d top דלא מן א' not according to the Law. Gen. R. s. 80 וא' קבל Mat. Keh. (ed. ואולפין קביל) and has he received traditions from teachers? Lev. R. s. 19 אולפני מה נהיר באפי how my learning shines in my face! Y. Ber. VI, 10 c bot. נישבוק אולפנה וכ' let us drop discussion and return to the Mishnah. [Erub. 67 a bot. משמיה דא', read with Ms. M. דאִילְפָא.]—בר א' a scholar of traditional law. Lev. R. s. 3, beg.— Pl. אוּלְפָנַיָּיא instructive narratives, stories. Y. Kid. 61 b; Y. Peah I, 15 c bot.
Targ. Job V, 11; a. e.
, v. אוֹלָד

sense.definition: Y. Sabb. VI, 8 b bot., read קוֹרוֹלַרְיָיא m. pl. (pl. of corollarium) gilt, or silvered wreaths, a rendition of צניפות (Is. III, 23); v. bibl.
sense.notes: quot. ibid., a. Targ. Is. l. c.

sense.definition: or אוֹלָרְיִין m. pl. (pl. of aularis or aularius = aulicus, D. C. Lat.) belonging to the royal court, court-, only in connect.
sense.notes: with כלים or בגדים. Sabb. 114 a בגדי הא' Ms. M. (ed. כלים האוליירין); Nid. 20 a כלים האולרין court clothes, including white cloaks (גלימי), and red home or table dresses (לבושי, פתורי); v. Luebk. Alterth. s. v. Kleidung; Becker Gallus, ed. Gœll I, 16. Cmp. חִימּוּצָתָא a. בּוּרְדִּיקָא.
Y. Yeb. XI, 11 d top. א' זכר the mother of the male side, father-in-law’s mother; א' נקבה mother-in-law’s mother.
Toh. IX, 8 אם היה נוגע בא' if the reptile touched the cluster. Neg. I, 5 הלכה לה הא' the original leprosy has disappeared.
Lev. R. s. 14 end, Ar. (ed. אֵם).

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) the leaven, flour used for leaven.
sense.notes: Pes. 42 a קומניתא דא' (Ms. O. דנהמא) the decay of the flour-substance; v. כּוּתָּח. [V. also אוּנָא end.]

sense.definition: (ימי, Af. אוֹמִי) the act of administering an oath, swearing, imprecation.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. V, 1; 4.—*Targ. Y. II, Deut. XXVII, 15 פתחו הוּמְהוֹם וכ' (Var. פומהום, ed. Vien. קתחו corr. acc.) they opened their imprecation with a blessing.

sense.definition: (אָמַד) estimate, guess, measuring by mere sight, approximate assessment; medical opinion as to the nature of injuries.
sense.notes: Men. 54 b ניטלת בא' may be set apart (for the priest) by estimating (without measuring) the quantity. Snh. IV, 5 מא' ומשמועה from mere supposition or hear-say. Ib. 78 b אין א' אחר א' the first estimate (medical opinion declaring an inflicted injury fatal) cannot be upset by a second more favorable opinion (if erroneously formed under the resemblance of recovery); v. אָמַד.—Ib. א' האמצעי the (second) opinion intermediate between the first opinion and the actual fatal result.
Y. Taan. IV, 68 c top שלא … דן א' that one must not judge from mere guess (appearance). Aboth I, 16 אל תרבה לעשר א' in giving tithes do not give (even) too much by guessing (but measure accurately).
B. Kam. 41 a; a. fr.— Pl. אוּמְדָּנֵי Snh. 78 b

Ab. Zar. 18 a א' זו this (Roman) government; a. fr.— Pl. אוּמּוֹת nations; gentiles (contrad. to Israel); freq. א' העולם (abbr. או"הע, א"ה). Gen. R. s. 39 שבעים א' the seventy nations (in the Noachidic genealogy), v. אֶוְותַּנְטִין. Ab. Zar. 3 b באין אוה"ע וכ' the gentiles shall come and be converted; a. fr.—דיני א' (freq. עכ"ום, גוי) gentile (not Israelitish) law. Y. Kid. I, 58 b bot.; a. fr.—

[This meaning of ὁμολογία as receipt cannot be proven from Greek literature; cmp. however, Sm. Dict. Ant. s. v. Acceptilatio.] Y. M. Kat. III, 82 a bot., explaining שוברים (v. שׁוֹבֵר, receipt) אימולוגים (corr. acc., De Lara אוֹמוֹלוֹגִין pl. m. fr. ὁμόλογον). Y. Keth. IX, end, 33 c ולית רב או' (= ולית ליה לרב is it Rab’s opinion that the divorced woman is not bound to write a receipt (for her dowry)?
Pesik. R. s. 44, read אִילוֹגִין, v. ed. Friedm. p. 183 a
, read אֶגְמוֹנִיאָה, v. הֶגְמוֹנְיָא
Af. of יְמִי.
, v. אימ'
— Pl. אוּמְלָלִים. Snh. 66 a (ref. to Lev. XIX, 14) בא' שבעמך וכ' here the Bible speaks of the lowest among thy people (not נשיא בעמך as Ex. XXII, 27). [Ms. M. a. Ar. במֵילָלִין.]

sense.definition: (אמן, ימן) prop. straight line, leader, hence (agric.) the border-bed, outmost furrow.
sense.notes: Peah IV, 5. B. Mets. VII, 4. Ned. IV, 4 (41 b) לא יעשה עמו בא' he must not work with him together in the border bed.— Pl. אוֹמָנִיּוֹת, [fr. אוֹמָנִית, sub. ערוגה, f.]. B. Mets. 89 b
Targ. Y. I Lev. XIX, 9 (h. text פאה); Targ. Y. II ib. אוֹ מִן (read אוֹמַן). Ib. v. 27 Ar. (ed. צדדי), XXI, 5 (of the beard, h. text פאת זקנך).

sense.definition: skilled, artist, artisan, professional cook, architect &c. Ab. Zar. 34 b מורייס א' brine prepared by a professional manufacturer and dealer.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 1 מדעת א' after the plan of an architect. Pesik. R. s. 11 שאינו א' וכ' who is not skilled in climbing up.; a. fr.— Pl. אוּמָנִין Ber. 16 a; a. fr.

Targ. Is. XXI, 10 (adj.). Targ. Ex. XXVI, 1; a. e.—Snh. 29 a (prov.) שב שני וכ' seven years a famine may last, but the artisan’s gate it will not cross. Sabb. 133 b האי א' the surgeon (who circumcises). B. Mets. 97 a טבחא וא' the butcher and the surgeon (of the community).— Pl. אוּמָנִין, אוּמָנַיָּא. Targ. I Chr. IX, 30. Targ. II Kings XXIV, 14; a. e. Y. Ber. IV, 13 a top, as one uses promiscuously the words אומנון בניין וכ' (read אומנין) artisans, builders, architects.
, v. אוּמָן ch.
, v. אוֹמָנוּתָא
, v. אוּמַן
, read אֲמָנוֹס, v. אֲמָנָה II

Kid. IV, 14.—בעל א' mechanic. Ḥull. 54 b.—בן אומנותוֹ one’s fellow-tradesman, competitor. Gen. R. s. 32, beg.—Ber. 43 b כל אחד ואחד יִפָּה לו וכ' to each man the Lord made his trade appear nice. Y. Succ. V, end, 55 d (play on be- ĕ munatham I Chron. IX, 2

sense.definition: באומנותם through their skill; a. fr.— the workmanship (or its equivalent) to be furnished the (Roman) government.
sense.notes: B. Bath. IX, 4. Y. Dem. VI, end, 26 a; Tosef. Dem. VI, 4; cmp. אוֹצָר.— Pl. אוּמָנִיּוֹת. Gen. R. s. 24. Num. R. s. 15 קורא א' invited people by trades (each day another trade); Tanḥ. B’haãl., 3 קורא בכל יום א'.—Trnsf. arts, devices. Ex. R. s. 47, end כל הצדיקים באו בא' all the righteous (in their pleas and prayers) came with devices before the Lord (as Abraham prayed in behalf of fifty, forty &c.).

Targ. O. Ex. XXXV, 33; a. e.—Macc. 8 b; a. e.—Koh. R. to III, 9 מאי מהני אומנה באוּמָנוּתֵיה what does the artist profit by his skill? Y. Git. V, 47 b bot. יהבין בניהון לא' indenture their children as apprentices; Y. B. Bath. X, 17 c bot. לאומנתה (corr. acc.). Sabb. 103 a חזי א' וכ' sees a mechanical contrivance on a Sabbath and learns it. Y. Keth. IV, 28 d אמנותא (corr acc.), v. טְרִיקְלֵין.— Pl. אוּמַנְוָותָא, אוּמַנְוָן; אוּמַנְוָון. Targ. Ex. l. c. Targ. II Esth VI, 12; a. fr. [Y. Ber. IV, 13 a top, v. אוּמַן.]
, v. אִמְפְּרָטוֹר

(אמץ) a thick piece of meat, a piece which can be eaten raw after pressing &c. Sabb. 128 a חזי לא' fit to be eaten raw. Ḥull. 44 b א' מעלייתא a fine piece &c.; a. fr.— Pl. אוּמְצֵי. Git. 69 a שב א' seven pieces.

Targ. Y. Deut. XXIX, 12; a. e. Midr. Prov. to XXX, 28; a. e.— Pl. אוּמִּין. Targ. Y. Gen. XXV, 3. Gen. R. s. 61. אוּמַּיָּא־, אוּמַּיָּיא; אוּמֵּי. Targ. Ps. CXVIII, 1.—Midr. Till. to Ps. IX, 6 שנאיהון דא' those hated by the nations.—Sabb. 32 a.—אוּמָּאתָא, אוּמָּתָא. Targ. Prov. XXIV, 24.

sense.definition:
√או = עו to curve, be curved, hollow; to press, be pressed; v. אוי,
אוגיא &c.; comp. חו, חב, גו, גב, עב)

sense.notes: א' גִּלְיוֹן a cacophemistic adaptation of εὐαγγέλιον (v. גליון). Sabb. 116 a bot. (after לסכוניה, omitted in ed.) דר' מאיר א' ג' ר' יוחנן קרי ליה עון גליון (Rashi Ms. ר' מאיר, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) R. Meïr called the gospel falsehood of blank paper (or of revelation), R. Yoḥ. called it sin of &c. [Ib. several times עון גליון or און ג' in Ms. a. older editions, for אירייתא אחריתי &c. in recent ed., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.]

entry.language-reference: √או, v. foreg.; cmp. חבל, חַיִל, חזקה a. next w.)

sense.notes: Tosef. Ab. Zar. III, 16 (IV, beg.) כתב לו או̇נו̇ if he (the seller of the slave) wrote to him (gave him in writing) the liberty of his disposal of himself, i.e. that the slave, if he should run away from the buyer, would not be claimed by him who sold him; Git. 43 b כתב עליו אונו (read אליו or לו). Ib. מאי אונו what means ‘his own possession’? Ans. He wrote to him this, ‘If thou run away from him (the purchaser), I have nothing to do with thee. Ib. 85 b.—[Y. B. Mets. I, end, 8 a; Y. Kid. I, 60 c אונו, v. אוֹנִי.] V. אוֹנָה.

sense.definition: (v. foreg. ws.; cmp. גנן, חָנָה, חוּן, a. עוֹנָה, מָעוֹן) [circle], night-lodging, station for travellers (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Mansio).
sense.notes: Naz. 7 a כל אוו' וא' every station. B. Mets. 79 b; Ab. Zar. 65 a מא' לא' from station to station.—Deut. R. s. 6 she dared to bring disorder into אוננא של מלך (read אוונא or אַוְונָה, v. infra) the royal head quarters. Pl. אַוְונִין, אֲוָונִין. Targ. Is. X, 32 (ed. Vien. אַוְנִין). [Sabb. 157 b אוונא, v. אוּדְנָא II.] [Comment. use h. forms אַוְונָה, pl. אַוְונוֹת.]

sense.definition: , אֲוָונָא pr. n. pl. (v. foreg.) Avana, on the Tigris.
sense.notes: Kid. 71 b אכברא וא' Ar. ed. Koh (oth. ed. Ar. אכבדא); Talm. ed. בגדא ואוונא [Var. בגדת] Okhbara and Avana as bordertowns of Babylonia (v. De Sacy Chrest. Ar. I, p. 358 sq.; Koh. in Ar. s. v.).

sense.definition: , נקיס א' pr. n. m. Nakis Una(?), a gentile name.
sense.notes: Git. 11 a
Git. 69 b. Sabb. 108 a top.

Ḥull. 59 b; a. fr.— Pl. אוּנֵי. Ib. 38 a אזוזי א' moving the ears (as a sign of life in the last stages). Yeb. 60 b מפיקנא … מאוניך we shall get R. … out of thy ears, i.e. we shall make thee give up thy authority (a threat of excommunication). Gen. R. s. 45 אוניך דחמר thy ears are those of an ass.—Ḥull. 47 a ה' אוני וכ' the lungs have five lobes; a. fr. [Later Rabb. literature uses אוּמָא, v. אוּם, for the large lump from which the lobes branch off.] V. אוּנִין.

B. Mets. 58 b גדולה אוֹנָאַת דברים מא' ממון the wrong you do by means of words (wounding one’s feelings) is worse than that by pecuniary imposition. Ib. 59 a לעולם יהא … באוֹנָאַת אשתו וכ' one should always be on his guard not to wound his wife’s feeling, for as her tears are frequent אוֹנָאָתָהּ מרובה so is her sense of wrong (sensibility) deep.

sense.definition: (law) imposition, overreaching, fraudulent representation (which invalidates the transaction or requires redress); hence, redress in case of overreaching.
sense.notes: Y. B. Mets. IV, 9 d top, a. fr. whoever concludes a bargain במנת שאין לו א' וכ' with the provision that no legal redress shall be resorted to, is notwithstanding entitled to redress.— Denomin. Verb (אוֹנָה), Hithpa. הִתְאוֹנֶה to be imposed upon, to feel one’s self overreached. Y. B. Mets. IV, 9 d top. בשעה שהמוכר מִתְאוֹנֶה וכ' if the seller sues for undue advantage taken of him, he has the privilege of redress, provided the advantage amounts to one fifth or more of the price charged; if the buyer sues &c. [In Babli the denomin. verb is אִינָּה, v. אני.]
, v. אוֹנָאִיתָא
, v. אוֹסָאֵי
Targ. Ps. LXXIV, 20 (ed. Ven. אוֹנִאוּתָא; h. text נְאוֹת!). V. אוֹנָיָתָא.
, v. אַנְדִּיפֵי

sense.definition: to oppress, v. אני, and אוֹנָאָה.
(v. אוֹן) possession, title of possession, deed.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 79 (ref. to the letters יה in קשיֹטהֹ Gen. XXXIII, 19) יו"ד ה"א כותב הא' וכ' Yod He (i.e. the Lord) writes the deed; the Lord bears witness to the deed.— Pl. אוֹנוֹת. B. Bath. 52 a א' ושטרות וכ' deeds of purchase and other documents were issued in his name.
, v. אוֹנִי I

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. pl. Ono, W.
sense.notes: N. W. of Jerusalem. Cant. R. to II, 2; Lam. R. to I, 17. Snh. 11 b איש א' Ms. M. (ed. אוני); a. fr. V. אוֹנִי II.
, v. אוֹנֵיס

sense.definition: , א' קִטְמִין (v. אָנְקִטְמִין; ὄνος) the pulley of the crippled.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c. (Var. הוניס.).

sense.definition: (ὄντως) really! verily! Lev. R. s. 33, explain.
sense.notes: הצדא (Dan. III, 14); (Ar. אנטוס, some ed. אונטיס, corr. acc.); Num. R. s. 15 אנטוס (Tanḥ. Noah 11 האמת).
Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. IV, 6 ed. Zuck., ed. אצטלוס, Var. אצטלו' prob. אִצְטַלּוּת q. v.
, v. אוֹנָאָה

[The phonetic coïncidence with ὠνή produced the peculiar use of our w. in connection with Greek terms, in the Palest. literature.] Gen. R. s. 2 beg. בא' אחת ובטימי וכ' in one bill of sale and for the same price. Y. Pes. IV, 31 b bot. מיסתיוסיס בא' היא וכ' (read מיסתוס') it is a lease with a title of possession (for the term), and is (for the time being) an acquisition like a purchase. Y. Kid. I, 60 c (אוני a. אונו); a. e.— Pl. אוֹנִיוֹת. Gen. R. s. 84, end כמה א' וכ' how many deeds were written for him (how many times was he sold)?, cmp. אוֹן. [Midr. Till. to Ps. CIV, 24; Pesik. Rosh. Hash. p. 151 a, v. אוֹנָיָה.]

sense.definition: בית א' pr. n. pl. ( Beth) Oni in Palestine, prob. identic with אוֹנוֹ.
sense.notes: Tosef. Shebi. VII, 14 פגי בית א' (ed. Zuckerm. בֵיתְיַאנֵי, בֵיתְיַינֵי, Var. ביתיני) the unripe grapes of B. O. (Beth Yanai).—Y. Git. IV, 46 a א' אסור וכ' if a slave fled to Oni, he must not be extradited (because O. is a Palestinean place). V. הִינִי 3.

sense.definition: m. (prob.) of Oni, v. foreg., or pr. n. m. Onya (= Onias?).
sense.notes: Y. Orl. I, 61 a top; Y. Sabb. I, 3 c; ib. d אנייא R. Joshua Onia, an Amora.
, v. אוֹנָאִיתָא

XLVI, 18) prop. oppression, wrong, hence confiscation, dispossession. Pl. אוֹנָיוֹת . Midr. Till. to Ps. CIV, 24 (play on oniyoth ibid.) אלו הא' וכ' those are the oppressive measures which they inflict upon Israel, which they order to be written out eveny day. *Pesik. R. Hash. p. 151 a; Yalk. Jer. 312 הוֹנָיוֹת וזמיות confiscations and fines (Yalk. Gen. 121; Lev. R. s. 29, a. e. ארנוניות, v. Buber Pesik. l. c. note).
, v. אוֹנְיָא

sense.definition: , בית א' pr. n. pl. Beth-Unyaki, Bithynia, in Asia Minor (cmp. Neub. Géogr. pp. 262; 422).
sense.notes: Yoma 10 a תובל זה בית א' (Ms. M. אונקי indistinct; oth. Var., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) Tubal means B. Ab. Zar. II, 4 (29 b) cheese of בית א' (Ms. M. אונקי, איניקי, Mish. Nap. ותינייקי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). Tosef. Shebi. V, 9 הונייקי (ed. Zuck. גבינה ובית היניקי read גבינת ב' ה'); Tosef. Ab. Zar. IV, 13 בית הינייקי (Var. היניקאי). Cmp. וְתַנְיָה a. אַנְיָאקָא.

sense.definition: (prob. pl. of אוּנָא ear) bundles of wet flax.
sense.notes: Sabb. I, 6. Y. Shebi. V, 36 a bot.; a. e. [Rashi a. Tosaf. to Succ. 12 b אונץ as a plur., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; cmp. אָנִיץ.]
Targ. Y. Ex. II, 16; XVIII, 1.
Y. Taan. IV, 69 a והוו משלחין א' וכ' they would send the (forged) deed of sale to the steward; Lam. R. to II, 2 (corr. acc.).

B. Bath. 22 a א' דמלכא וכ' the wrong inflicted on the king of Edom. Lev. R. s. 33, beg. (ref. to Amos VII, 7, v. אֲנָךְ I) על שורא דא' upon the wall of (i.e. watching over) the wrongs (in sale and purchase); cmp. B. Mets. 59 a

sense.definition: read קוּנְכִין m. pl. (κόγχη, concha) purple shells.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XXXIII, 8; cmp. קוּנְכִי.
Tosef. Shebu. VI, 4 ed. Zuck., v. אֲמַפְּלַי

sense.definition: (prob. a nom. gentil., from a trading station named אוונכר, a compound of אוונא [a.
sense.notes: אִכָּר?]; cmp. אֲוָנָא) Avankreans(?), traders. Succ. 30 ab. [Ar. identifies our w. with אַכְוַנְגַּר which is not in agreement with the context.]
, v. אָנַן
Deut. R. s. 6, read אַוְונָא.
Lev. R. s. 23, v. אַנּוֹנָא.

Git. 30 a, a. e. אין א' בגיטין the plea of unavoidable interference cannot be raised in letters of divorce (to which a condition is attached). Y. M. Kat. III, 81 d bot., a. e. מחמת אוֹנְסוֹ through no fault of his.— Pl. אוֹנְסִים, אוֹנְסִין. Ned. III, 1, a. e. נדרי א' vows on conditions unavoidably unfulfilled.
Targ. Is. LVIII, 9; 13 מלין דא' offensive (violent) words (h. text אָוֶן, cmp. אוֹנָאָה).

sense.definition: (= h. אוֹנֶס, v. foreg.) force, wrong, robbery; accident.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XXXI, 12; a. fr.—Git. 34 a. אי משום א' shall we take into consideration the possibility of an unavoidable accident?— Pl. אוֹנְסַיָּא. Ned. 27 b א' דמיגליא (read דמיגליי, Rashi אונסא) accidents which may be foreseen.
m., pl. אוֹנָסִין = אָנוֹסָא.

sense.definition: , פרק א' a corrupt. of פְּרוֹקוֹנִיסוֹס pr. n. pl. Proconnesus, in Mysia, renowned for its marble.
sense.notes: Esth. R. to I, 6.

sense.definition: (נפל) a wooden vessel for the reception of refuse, remnants of victuals &c. Tosef. Kel. B.
sense.notes: Mets. V, 10. Cmp. next w.
, v. אֲמַפְּלַי

sense.definition: עוּנְקָא m. (ענק) neck, meat from the neck.
sense.notes: Sabb. 140 b א' ed. (Ar. ע'; Ms. M. עוזקא). Ber. 44 b ע' ed. (Ms. M. א').
, v. אוּנְקְלַי

sense.definition: bulk, pile ; (in philosophy) a primitive body.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. T’rum. 11 א' של מים the body of water; א' של אש (some ed. אונקנוס).

Gen. R. s. 12 (ref. to Neh. IX, 6 sq.) כל הא' הזה וכ' (ed. אונקים, corr. acc.) what is all this painstaking (creating the universe &c.) for? Ans. Because ‘thou art the Lord who hast chosen Abraham’ i.e. for the sake of establishing religion on earth; cmp. Midr. Till. to Ps. CIV, 18.
— Pl. (אוּנְקָאוֹת) אוּנְקִיּוֹת. Kel. XII, 2 (Var. in Mish. ed. אוּנְקְלִיּוֹת). Tosef. ib. B. Mets. II, 4 (disting. from אוּנְקְלָאוֹת).—[
for אונקיא, v. next w.]

sense.definition: ounce, one twelfth of a litra.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 17 א' של כסף an ounce of silver. Lam. R. to I, 1 נסבון מן אונקא (העיר) (corr. acc.) they bought ounce-wise (pepper).

Y. Taan. IV, 68 c top there is not a generation in which there is not (to be atoned for through suffering) אונקי אחת וכ' (read אונקיא אחת) a particle of the sin of the calf-worship. Ex. R. s. 43, beg. אוקיא (corr. acc.). Gen. R. s. 29; Yalk. Gen. 47; Job. 908 (play on אי נקי Job. XXII, 30) א' אחת היתה וכ' only an ounce (of merit) did Noah possess; v. אינוניתא.— Pl. אוּנְקִיּוֹת. Gen. R. s. 79, end (play on the letters of ק̇ש̇י̇ט̇ה̇ Gen. XXXIII, 19) במאה אונקֹיות … ס̇לעים … ט̇לאים for one hundred (ק̇) ounces (of gold) &c. V. אוּקְיָא.
, v. אוֹקְיָינוֹס
, v. אֶנְקְלַסְיָא
, v. אוֹנְקוֹס
, v. אוּנְקְלַי II

XL, 26.— Pl. אוּנְקְלִין. Targ. Y. Ex. XXVII, 10. Lev. (ed. ווי). Targ. Ez. XL, 43 (עֲנִקְלִין) עוּנְקְלִין.—Fem. pl. אוֹנְקַלְוָון. Targ. Y. Lev. X, 5. Targ. Esth. I, 6.—Targ. Y. II Ex. XXVI, 37 אַנְקְלַוָותְהוֹן their hooks.
plur. of אוּנְקְלַי I.
, v. אוּנְקְלַי II

sense.definition: (Ocellus?) Onk’los, the alleged translator of the Pentateuch into Chaldaic, freq. surnamed הַגֵּר the proselyte; often identified with Aquila, the alleged author of a Greek translation of the Bible; v. עְקִילָס.
sense.notes: Cmp. Meg. 3 a; Ab. Zar. 11 a, with Tanḥ. Mishp. 5. Cant. R. to I, 11 אלקולאון q. v.
, v. אֶנְקְלַסְיָא
; = אוּנְקַי; corresp. to b. h. לוּלַי; Greek adapt. ἀγκολη, LXX Ex. XXVI, 10; cmp. אוֹנִי as to contact of the two languages) prop. little ( camel’s) neck, hence

Kel. XII, 2 א' של כתפין Ar. (ed. אונקליות, אונקלין with adject. in the sing., corr. acc.) the carriers’ hook attached to their yoke, pole &c. Ib. א' של דרגש the hook of the bedstead (used for fastening the girths to the posts); של נקליטין the rack of the bed-curtain, v. נַקְלִיטִין. Ib. 3 א' שבכותלים hook attached to walls.—T’bul Yom IV, 6 ואנ' שלהם קיימת and the hook (attached to the now broken yoke) remained unimpaired; a. fr.— Pl. אוּנְקְלָאוֹת, אָנְקְ', (אונקלין) אוּנְקְלִיּוֹת. Tam. III, 5; Mid. III, 5; a. fr.—Kel. l. c.; Tosef. ib. B. Mets. II, 4; v. אוּנְקַי.

sense.definition: [cmp. ἀγκαλίς in S.] the load carried on the hook, the farmer’s load of sheaves or bunches; cmp. בלונקי.
sense.notes: Tosef. Maas. Sh. IV, 10. כל הא' the whole load. [Ib. 11 אונקולין, אונקלי, read with ed. Zuck. אינפולי].

sense.definition: Trnsf. (medic.) bent cartilage, esp. the cartilage (cart. ensiformis) at the end of the sternum which, being bent inside, presses on the stomach and creates nausea &c. Ab. Zar. 29 a מעלין א' וכ' you are permitted to lift the cartilage on the Sabbath (by means of a bandage &c.).
sense.notes: Ib. מאי א' וכ' what unklay is meant? Ans. the cartilage in front of the heart; v. אִיסְתּוֹמְכָא.

sense.definition: אוּנְקַל, נִקְלָה, נִיקְלַי f. (נקל, קל, cmp. esp. II Sam. VI, 20 to 2
the light garment, whence, a name for the easy dress worn in the house and, under the cloak, in the street, but in which it was unbecoming to appear in public. [Cmp.
sense.notes: II Sam. l. c. a. Num. R. s. 4; a. e.] Y. Yoma VI, 43 d top אוּנְקְלָה, נקלה, for which Men. 109 b אונקלי. Snh. 82 a he took off the point of his spear והניחה באונקלוֹ (some ed. לי—) and put it (hiding it) in his undergarment. M. Kat. 24 a אָבֵל מטייל בא' וכ' (Ms. M. מטייל אָבֵל) a mourner may walk on the Sabbath within the limits of his house (garden &c.) in the easy dress (showing the rent on account of a death in the family; Rashi). Sabb. 120 a (garments to be saved from fire on a Sabbath) אונקלי; Y. ib. XVI, 15 d top ניקלי.—Meg. IV, 8 (24 b) בית א'; (read as) Y. ib. a. Mss. בית יד א' the sleeve of his under-dress. [Tosef. Maas. Sh. IV, 11, v. foreg. 2.]
, v. אִיקוֹנוֹמוֹס
, v. אֶנְקְלַסְיָא
Ar. ed. pr., Ms. אוּם q. v.
m. pl., prob. מוֹסָאֵי, name of a tribe. Targ. Ps. CXX, 5, v. אוֹסיא (some ed. אונאי).
Midr. Sam. ch. XI, v. אִסְטְלִי

into או; cmp. אַף, אָנַף; also אֶפֶס) nose, nostrils. Sabb. 67 a ואאוסי דגוריתא and on the nostrils of the young lioness. B. Bath. 73 b דסליק עליה באוסיה אכלה טינא ומית Ms. R. (ed. דיתבא ליה אכלה טינא באוסי', Ms. M. אבלה, Ar. ed. Koh. incorr., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) into whose nostrils a ‘mud-eater’ (worm) entered, and the fish died. Pes. 112 a ידא אאוסיא וכ' (Ms. M. a. Ar. א־פגא) putting the hand to the nose is a step to fear (indicating anxiety). Ḥull. 67 b ועיילי באוסַיֵּיה and they (the worms) creep into its nostrils.
, v. אוּסִיָּא
Pes. 111 a, v. אסיא
Targ. I Chr. Chr. I, 5; a. e. read with ed. Rahmer מוּסְיָא; cmp. Yoma 10 a; Y. Meg. I, 71 b bot. (h. text מֶשֶׁךְ). [Targ. Y. II Gen. X, 2 אנסייא; Gen. R. s. 37 איסניא (misplaced); corr. acc.]

sense.definition: a. certain portion of meat, v. אוּזְיָא.

sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 49 אוסי (corr. acc.).—Num. R. s. 23 שפחות מן א' וכ' maid-servants from another estate. Y. Taan. IV, 69 a; Lam. R. to II, 2 אי' (corr. acc.). Lev. R. s. 34.— Pl. אוּסִיּוֹת. Ex. R. s. 20. Ch. pl. אוּסְיָאן, אוּסְיָיאן. Lev. R. s. 3, beg. he likes to be called מרי אס' (corr. acc.) lord of many estates; Koh. R. to IV, 6 אוסייאס (corr. acc.).
Y. Ab. Zar. V, end, 45 b דא', read דאניסטיסי, v. דָּנִיסְטֵיס
Gen. R. s. 14, end, Ar. ed. pr., read אופיתא.
, v. אִיסְכּ'

] surname of an Egyptian tribe. Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 32 (Var. חוּסְמָנַיָּא, a. אוּכְמָנָא the dark.). Cmp. LXX χασμωνίειμ, for כסלחים; Gen. X, 14; v. Fürst. H. Dict. s. v. כסלח; Ges. H. Dict. s. v. חשם.
, v. אָסְנָא
Snh. 94 b, v. חָסִיל.
, v. אִסְפְּלִידָא

גמלא דא' landing board. Snh. 67 b וקם אג' דא' Ar. (ed. וקם ג' דוסקנ' read with Rashi דסקונ', Ms. M. איסקניתא, oth. var. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) and he found himself standing on a landing board (ed. and there stood before him &c.).
(Yer. Dial.). Targ. Y. Num. XVI, 13; a. fr.—Y. Dem. I, beg. 21 c א' הכא here too.

sense.definition: (= עֳפִי Dan. IV, 9; cmp. b. h. עָנָף, a. אִיבָּא, אִנְבָּא) branches, esp. dry twigs, spray-wood.
sense.notes: Ber. 44 b א' פרסייתא twigs of Persian trees. Ḥull. 105 a פתכא דא' Ar. (ed. אופיי) a bundle of twigs. B. Mets. 30 b. Git. 61 a שדי אופיי (Ar. אופי) threw twigs down (which he cut off), and dates fell off (v. Tossaf. a. l.).

sense.definition:
f. (אֹוף m.) (b. h.
אַפַּיִם; v. אַפָּא; cmp. אֹוף I) face, looks, whence, nature, disposition, ways &c. Y. Shek. I, 45 d אין אתה יכול לעמוד על א' של וכ' You cannot understand the nature of that people.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 30 אופוֹ של דוד Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. pr. אופי, ed. אפו) David’s ways. Y’lamd. Vaëthḥ. (quot. in Ar.) ‘who is that nation’ שהיא יודעת אופו של אלוהיה Ar. ed. Koh. (oth. ed. אופי) that knows the ways of her God (what he desires &c.); v. Yalk. Deut. 825.—Gen. R. s. 14 end נשמה זו הא' n’shamah (breath, soul) means the disposition, character, as people say האוֹפִיתָא טבא the good nature!

sense.definition:
(אוף; v. אנף; b. h.
אָפַע) what is blown off, foam, froth.
sense.notes: Ab. Zara 26 a כי א' דימא Ms. M. (ed. דנהרא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., a. Ar. ed. Koh. s. v. אפי) as the foam of the Sea [river]; (Ar. as logs on the river, v. אוּפְתָּא, אוּפֵי). Ib. 70 b הוות נקיטא א' (Var. חופיא, ה', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 20) she took the froth off. Ḥull. 105 b א' (Ar. ה').
Y. Ab. Zar. II, 40 d top אהן א' סכנה an opium drink (prepared by a gentile) is dangerous.
, v. אַנְטִיפִּיטָא

sense.definition: (אֹופְכָיָיא f.) (אפך) destruction, ruin Lam. R. to III, 13 (expl. בני אשפתו ibid.
sense.notes: , v. אַשְׁפָּה) בני אֹופִיכֵיה (Var. אֹופְכָיֵיה) the children of those he laid in ruins; v. אִימְרָיָיא. [Differ. in Esth. R. to I, 1 b, v. אוּכַּיְיפָא a. אֲמוּרְיָא.]
Tosef. Ter. II, 4, v. אֲפֹולִים

sense.definition: , read אוּפֹּומְנֵימָאטָא m. pl. (ὑπομνήματα) public records, acts.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 28 a king wanted לעשות א' חוץ וכ' to pass acts without consulting the lieutenant-governor (hyparch).
Y’lamd. Balak (quot. in Ar. s. v. בלש) או' ed. Koh. Ib. שלח אפיקלין (corr. acc.) he sent constables (for her son).
Gen. R. s. 14, end, v. אֹופִי.
, v. אַפּוּכִי
Gen. R. s. 89, beg. v. אֲפֵילָה.

sense.definition: (with ref. to Ezek. I, 15) pr. n. Ofan, name of an angel.
sense.notes: Ḥag. 13 b.— Pl. אֹופַנִּים. Ib. 12 b. R. Hash. 24 b.—[In liturgic literature אופנים and אופן are used as the names of a section of the morning prayers; v. אֹופַנָּא.]

[In later Hebr.: method of interpretation = פָּנִים.]— Pl. אֹופָנִים; Du. אֹופְנַיִים. Ruth. R. s. 2, beg. You will soon find out איפניים שלהם וכ' (Yalk. Josh. 7 אופנים) their plans (strategic movements). Ab. d’R. Nath. (ed. Taussig, N’veh Shal. p. 12) על אופניו in its proper way.
— Pl. אֹופַנַּיָּא. Targ. Ezek. X, 13.—אֹופַנַּיָּיה that section of the morning prayers beginning with v’haofannim and describing the angelic praises. Y. Ber. V, 9 c bot.

turn, interpretation, qualification. Y. Dem. VI, 25 b bot. א' לית לון א' לית לסתמא we do not recognize an interpretation (of an agreement, so as to say, נעשה כאומר וכ' ‘it means as though they had said—’); no qualification is admissible for an unqualified agreement.

(cmp. אֶפֶס—, a. פֵּס, פִּסָּה) palms of the hand. Mekh. B’shall. Vayissa, s. 3, to Ex. XVI, 12 the Mannah came down על האו' וכ' on the hands of the Lord, as if it were to say, the Lord held forth &c. [In some ed. אוּפְסִין.]
m. pl., v. foreg.
, v. אָפְסֹונִין

sense.definition: (v. אוּפֵי) prop. the large central branch, hence trunk, stalk.
sense.notes: Succ. 32 a ואימא א' may I not say (as you insist on the palm-branch being kafuth, tied, joined) that I must use the stalk?—Ḥull. 47 b lungs resembling לא' a trunk (in color, touch &c.). Ib. 16 a וי"ו דכתיב אא' a Vav. written on a trunk (being broken on account of the rough surface = idle-talk).
= הֶפְתֵּק.

sense.definition: , v. אוי I; cmp. אָפַץ; v. חוּץ a. חָצָה) to be pressed ( to press, hurry).
sense.notes: —Part. אוֹצֶה, pl. אוֹצִין (as from אצה, v. חוּץ, חוּל) squeezed in. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. IX, 5 א' חבור (Var. הוצין) when they are squeezed in (tight), they are considered as connected for levitical purposes.
, v. אֶצְבְּעָא a. אֶצְבָּעִי.
, v. אָצְיָא
read אִיצְטֹולִין, v. אִסְטְלָא
, v. הֹוצֶן

sense.definition: store-house, magazine; provision; hoarded up treasure.
sense.notes: B. Bath 58 a; Git. 67 a, v. בָּלַם a. בָּלַס. Ab. Zar. 40 b; v. הֶפְתֵּק; a. fr.—Esp. treasury, the ( Roman) government’s treasury department where taxes in kind and money had to be paid. Y. Dem. VI, end, 26 a ושקול על ידי לא' and pay for me in the treasury-department. Tosef. Dem. VI, 4 ושקול תחתיי מן הא' (read אל הא'). Ib. 3 ושוקל לא' ed. Zuck. (ed. incorr. ואוצר). Ib. 4 פוטריני מן הא' get me a release from the treasury-dep.—Y. Dem. l. c. פרשיני מן הא' (read פוטריני). Ab. Zar. 71 a לא', מן הא', Ms. M. (ed. עוצר); cmp. אָצַר.— Pl. אֹוצָרוֹת. B. Bath. 11 a גנזו א' Ms. (ed. א' omitted); v. גָּנַז.—Ḥag. 12 b אֹוצְרֹות שלג וכ' the stores of snow &c. (in the heavens); a. fr. V. אֹצְרֹות, א' רוח.
Targ. Jerem. XXXVIII, 11; a. fr.— Pl. אֹוצְרִין, אֹוצְרַיָּא. Targ. Gen. XLI, 56; a. e.
, v. אִיקוּמֵינֵי
, read אִיקֹונִין, v. אִיקֹון
, v. אקט'
= אֹוקִים, v. קוּם
, v. אוקיי

sense.definition: = אוּנְקְיָא [?] Ex. R. s. 43, beg.—[ Pl. אוּקְיֵי.
sense.notes: Ber. 44 b משיתא א' סולתא, Ar. s. v. גלגל I, ‘than six ouncess of fine flour’.—Ed. קייסי; Ms. M. omits the entire sentence.]
, v. אֹוקְיָינוֹס
(Muss. אווקי) Cant. R. to VII, 8, read אֹוקְיָינֹוס. כמין א' inundating like an Ocean tide; v. טלנס
Targ. Y. Gen. I, 7; a. e.—Y. Ḥall. IV, 60 a bot.; a. fr.—Tanḥ. Ḥaye 3, and so is א' ים המת the Okeanos called the Sea of (covering) the dead. [Var. אונק', אנק'.]
Af. of קוּם ch.
Targ. Ps. CXXXIX, 2 [prob. אֹוקָמוּתָא].
, read אִיקֹונִין.
, v. עוּקְצָא

entry.language-reference: √או, v. אוי II; cmp. חָוַר, חָבַר, a. sec. r. אָרַר)

sense.notes: —Denom. אַוִּיר, מְאוּרָה &c.

sense.definition: to be broken through, grow light.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 2 c משיֵאֹור המזרח from the time the Eastern horizon is broken through, grows light.

sense.definition: (neut. v.) (neut. v.) to break through, shine.
sense.notes: Y. ib. III, 6 c bot. open thy lips ויָאִירוּ דבריך and let thy words come forth, speak out boldly. Yoma III, 1 ה' פני כל וכ' it has grown light all over the Eastern horizon.—פנים מֵאִירֹות bright countenance. Num. R. s. 11; a. e.

sense.definition: (act. v.) to enlighten, brighten, make shine.
sense.notes: Y. M. Kat. III, 83 b ה' עיניו וכ' (the teacher had opened his (Samuel’s) eyes &c. B. Mets. 33 a. Num. R. l. c. Ib. המזבח מֵאִירִים את (fr. Mal. I, 10) making the altar bright (with fire), feeding the fire on the altar. Yoma 73 b, v. אוּר.
Part. pass. נָאֹור clear. Targ. Prov. IV, 25 נְאֹורָן, נְאֹרָן, v. חֲוַר.

sense.definition: foreg.) breaking forth (cmp. Is. LVIII, 8) whence
break of day, light, day; fire; trnsf. rise, glory, power, happiness.
sense.notes: Ber. 2 b ביאת אֹורֹו the entrance of his day-break (dawn of his eighth day; Tosaf. a. l. the sunset of his seventh day). Y. Pes. I, beg. 27 a א' החמה sun-light. Ib. א' הנר candle light. Keth. 111 b א' תורה light of the Law. B. Bath. 4 a אֹורֹו של עולם intellectual light of the wold (a great man; the Law). Num. R. s. 15 אור של מעלן the celestial fire (believed to be the source of all light and fire); a. v. fr.

Pes. I, 1 לארבעה וכ' א' on the evening (eve) of the fourteenth day of Nissan; v. discussion ibid. 2 a sq., about the meaning of our w. R. Hash. 22 b; Snh. 70 b לא' עיבורו the evening following the eventual intercalation, i.e. the evening from the thirtieth of the past to the first of the beginning month.
Gen. R. s. 20 in the Pentat. of R. M. it read כתנות אור וכ' (in place of עור Gen. III, 21) this alludes to the garments of Adam resembling the rue, wide below and narrow above; Ar. (Rashi diff.).

sense.definition: foreg.) prop. light, flame; esp. Pl. אוּרִים ותומים the Urim and Tummim in the High-priest’s breast-plate.
sense.notes: Yoma 73 b א' שמאירים את דבריהם they are called Urim because they give their decisions in a clear way (not ambiguous as the oracles); cmp. Y. ib. VII, end, 44 c. Sot. IX, 12. Y. Kid. IV, beg. 65 b
Y. Ab. Zar. II. 40 d א' דשערין chaff of barley; (Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 d עור דסערין).
Targ. Num. XXVII, 21; a. e.
Y. Ned. III beg. 37 d אוּרֵיה (read אוּדְרֵיה?, v. אֵדֶר I); v. however Y. Shebu. III, 34 d
Targ. Ez. VII, 26; a. e.

sense.definition: (ארב, ערב to braid, interlace &c.); pl. אוּרְבֵּי, אָרְבֵּי meshes, void spaces, intervals.
sense.notes: Sabb. 50 b ביני או' ed. (Ar. ארבי, Var. אַרְכֵי, v. אַרְכָא I; אדכי, v. Ar. ed. Koh. s. v. ארכי, note) between the meshes or void spaces between the bricks. Git. 69 b. B. Bath. 3 a (Ms. ירכי, oth. Var. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

sense.definition: (ארב, v. foreg., cmp. סבך, סכך) brier, nettle or a similar plant (corresp. to h. סרפד).
sense.notes: Targ. II, Esth. II, 7 (Ar. ארבניא).

sense.definition: , pl.אוּרְבָּנֵי m. (v. foreg.; cmp. עֲרָבָה) bulrushes.
sense.notes: Sabb. 101 a קני ואו' (some ed. ואר') reeds and bulrushes. Snh. 82 b בין קני לא' וכ' what has Sh’vilnai (a woman) to do between the reeds and the bulrushes? (prov. for suspicious movements of women). B. Bath. 6 a, v. צְרִיפָא.

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) name of a seasoning reed.
sense.notes: Erub. 34 b
Kid. 12 a, זוודא דא', read דאוּדְרֵי or דאוּדְדֵי, v. אוּדְדָא

sense.definition: , Keth. 67 a שקי דא' (Ms. אדוריא, ed. רֹודַיָּא) prob. pr. n. pl. Urdaya, Rodaya, [or identical with foreg. w.?].

sense.notes: , v. אַרְדִּילַיָּא
Targ. Prov. XXVII, 22 some ed. (oth. אוּדְרָךְ q. v.). [The entire verse is corrupted, combining the traditional vers. with one from which LXX is translated.]
phonet. equival. צְפַרְרֵּעַ) frog. Koh. R. to V, 8. Lev. R. s. 22 (אוּרְדְּעָן fem.).
, v. foreg.

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) a disease of the tongue, rana ( frog).
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 d top.

Y. Pes. II, 29 a מאיר כא' clear as the sun. Zeb. 19 b, a. e. לא' at daybreak. Gen. R. s. 3 beg.; a. fr.—Chald. Adv. לִכְאֹורָה at first sight, apparently. Keth. 54 a לכא' כשמואל רהיטא apparently it would run (agree) with Samuel, כי מעיינת וכ' but when you consider &c.

sense.definition:
; pl. אֹורֹות (b. h.
אֹרֹת, II Kings IV, 39; prob. fr. אָרָה) herbs, esp. rocket.
sense.notes: Yoma 18 b, expl. גַּרְגִּיר (etymol. שמאירות וכ'; cmp. Plin. XX, 13 quot. in Löw Aram. Pfl. p. 93). [Gen. R. s. 20 אֹור rue; v. אֹור II, 3.]
part. of אָרָה, v. ארי
, v. אֹורְיָיר
, v. אוּרְיָא II a. אֻרְוָה.
, v. אוּרְיָא II ch., a. אֵדֶר I.
, v. אֹורְלֹוגִין

sense.definition: , a corrupt., prob. רֹוסָאטוֹן, m. (ῥοσᾶτον, rosatum) vin-aux-roses, rose-wine.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. VII, beg. 37 b א' שרי (Mas. איריוסטו) rose-wine is permitted in the Sabbath year.
, v. אֹורְיָיר

sense.definition: (cmp. ὄρυζα, b. h. r. ארז to be hard) rice.
sense.notes: Ber. 37 a; a. fr.—Pes. 35 a (opinions as to its classification with ref. to Passover laws). Cmp. אֶרֶז.
Targ. Y. Num. XV, 19 אורי'.—Y. Sabb. III, 6 b top אורז'. Pes. 50 b ארו' (Ms. M. אורז; ib. 51 a top ארזא, corr. acc.). Ib. 114 b ארוזא.
ר; Syr. עוזילא)

sense.definition: a slender young animal, esp. the young of the gazelle or any similar animal (Reëm).
sense.notes: Targ. Cant. II, 9 א' דאיילא (h. text עֹפֶר). Zeb. 113 b א' דרימא בת יומא (read בר); B. Bath. 73 b (corr. as Zeb. l. c.; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) a young antilope one day old. Num. R. s. 11; Cant. R. to II, 9; Pesik. R. s. 15 א' דאיילתא (עוּרְזִילֵיהוֹן וכ' pl.) young deer.— Pl. אוּרְזִילִין, אֹורְ'; אַרְזִילֵי. Targ. Cant. IV, 5; VII, 4. B. Bath. 74 b ארזילי דימא (Ms. M. אוזילי) sea-gazelles.—[
[Oth. opin. cedar-fruits; millet.] Y. Maas. Sh. II, beg. 53 b. Y. Yoma VIII, 45 a top; Y. Shebu. III, 34 b bot. אורזרייה (corr. acc.).
Ber. 58 a; a. fr.—Euphem. menstruation. Nid. 16 a (cmp. Gen. XVIII, 11 ora ḥ). Lev. R. s. 4.— Pl. אֹורְחִים, אֹורְחִין.—הכנסת א' the invitation of guests, hospitality. Sabb. 127 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: c. = h. אֹרַח, road, path, way.
sense.notes: Targ. Jud. V, 6; a. fr.—א' ארעא (h. דרך ארץ) custom. Ab. Zar. 2 b; a. fr.—א' דמילתא a usual incident. Git. 29 a; a. fr.—אגב אורחך, אגב אורחיה &c. on thy road (his road &c.), i.e. by the way, occasionally, incidentally. Ber. 2 a. Snh. 95 b; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 100 על א' for the journey (death). Targ. Y. II, Gen. XXXV, 9 ארחא דעלמא the way of the world (death).— P l . אֹורְחָן, אָרְחָן; אָרְחָתָא. Targ. Jud. l. c. Targ. Y. II Gen. XLIX, 17; a. e.—Snh. 109 a יהבית אֹורְחַיָּה לגנבַיָּה (missing in Ms. M., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) thou hast shown the thieves the ways (of stealing).—[אֹורְחָא guest, v. אָרְחָא.]
Y. Ber. II, beg. 4 a ר' חונה ר' א' R. Ḥuna in the name of R. U.
Af. of ירי.

sense.definition: (v. אֹור a. אוּרְתָּא) evening horizon, Sun-set, West, v. מערבא.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 25 a אוריה מאי ed. (Ar. אוריא) why is it called Urya? אויר יה (Var. אור) divine air (divine light = Palestine). Kid. 12 b איכא סהדי באוריא הא Ar. (ed. אידית, emend. in Tossaf. אורית), [read with ב"ח: הא אמרי איכא וכ'] but people say, there are witnesses in the West &c. Cmp. אֶסְתָּן.

sense.definition: pile of plucked plants, stalk, shed containing feed (dist. fr. אֹוצָר granary).
sense.notes: — Pl. אוּרְיָאֹות, אוּרְיָי' (אוּרְיֹות). Tosef. Maasr. II, 20 ed. Zuck. (Var. אוריות); ib. Erub. VI (V), 4; Erub. 55 b Ar. (ed. אוריות, אורוות, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). [In bibl. h. אֻרְוָה crib, stable q. v.]

Targ. Is. I, 3 (h. text אֵבוּס q. v.).—Snh. 98 b סוסיא באוּרְיֵיה … a horse is placed at his (the ox’s) crib., i.e. Israel is displaced and other nations feed on his soil.—M. Kat. 10 b למבני א' to build a stable (during the festive week). [Targ. II Esth. VI, 10; 11 אוּרַיָּא, read אוּרְיָא stable.]— Pl. אוּרְיָין, אוּרְוָותָא, (אוּרְיָיתָא) אֻרְוָותָא. Targ. II Chr. IX, 25; I Kings V, 6. Targ. II Esth. l. c. (אוּרְיָיתָא prob. sing.); a. e.

sense.definition: (horreum, pl. horrea, ὡρεῖον, ὥριον; v. Sm. Ant. s. v.) store-house, store (of all kinds).
sense.notes: Tanḥ. B’resh. 7 וכל א' שלי בתוכה all my stores are in that ship.— Pl. אוּרְיָאַיָּא (ch. form). Targ. I Chr. XXI, 13.—אוּרְיָיאֹות (h. form). Targ. II Chr. XXXII, 28 (h. text מסכנות). V. אֹורְיָיר, אֲהֹורְיָיר.
Targ. Y. Deut. XXXIV, 6.—Num. R. s. 2.
, v. אֹורְיָין I
, v. אוּרְיָא
, v. אֹורָיָיא
, v. אֹורְיָין II
, v. אוּרְזָא
, v. אוּרְיָא II h. a. ch.

Targ. Lev. VI, 7; a. fr.—מילה דא' (= דברי תורה) religious discourse, lesson, remarks &c. Y. B. Bath. VIII, 16 a אורייא; Y. Taan. III, 66 c bot. ייתא …—Y. Snh. I, 18 c אפלגינון במילי דא' he entertained them with religious discussions. Y. Hor. III, beg. 47 a עתיד לך מילה דא' be prepared for a religious discourse. Y. Shek. III, 47 c top מאי א' חדתא שמעת what novel interpretation hast thou heard? Y. Yeb. II, 4 a top מן הדא אורייה from what verse?—Taan. 4 a ליה א' … מרתח' it is the zeal of study that makes him warm (excited). Kid. 71 b אורייתין כשר' my instruction is acceptable, but my daughters are not desired. Sabb. 116 b א' דמשה the Mosaic dispensation (opp. א' אחריתי the new dispensation, v. אָוֶון).—דְּאֹורַיְיתָא (sub. הלכה = h. התורה מן) an enactment founded on the Bible text, opp. דרבנן. Succ. 44 a לולב דא' Lulab, the law concerning which is Biblical &c.; a. fr.—מִדְּאֹורַיְיתָא, adv. biblically, according to the Biblical law, opp. מדרבנן. Pes. 10 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: the Torah, the scroll containing the Pentateuch, used at divine service.
sense.notes: Y. Yoma VII, 44 b top כד היא חדא אוריא when you have no more than one scroll. Y. Meg. IV, 75 b bot.; Y. Sot. VII, end, 22 a כד חזרא אורייה (corr. as Y. Yoma l. c.). Ib. תא וכ'—תמן מייבלין א there (in Babylon) the Torah is carried to the Resh Galutha.—בר אוריא a scholar, man of learning. Yoma 78 a. Ḥag. 14 a אריא (corr. acc.); v. next w.
m. same;
Ib. 88 a א' תליתאי the threefold law (Pentat., Proph., Hagiogr.).

sense.definition: scholarship, authority to teach and judge.
sense.notes: Ber. 12 a בר אוריאן ed. (Ms. M. אוריא); v. foreg. w.—[
Gen. R. s. 50 בית אוריין ed. (Ar. מיתורין, Lev. R. s. 26 מתורין) place of office. V. מִיתֹורְיִין.]

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) pr. n. m. Oryan, Oryon.
sense.notes: Esth. R. beg. אבא א', Abba O. (cmp. אַבָּא). Y. Sabb. X, 12 d top יצחק בר אוריון.

sense.definition: (v. foreg. ws.) officer’s or teacher’s chair.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 21 b; 27 a א' גדולה Ms. M. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; ed. אוד') a high (teacher’s) chair. V. אוּדְיָינִי.

sense.definition: (horrearius, ὡρειάριος, v. אֹורְיָא, אֲהֹורְיָיר) store-keeper, used in the sense of אֹולְיָיר.
sense.notes: Y. B. Bath. IV, beg. 14 c מקום הא' (Tosef. ibid. III, 3 בית האוליירין) the clothes-keeper’s room.— Pl. אֹורְיָירִין. Y. l. c. אורורין, אורוו' (corr. acc.) Toh. VIII, 7 אודיארין (corr. acc.; Tosef. ib. VII, 8 אוליארין).
— Pl. אוּרְיָירַיָּא. Targ. I Chr. XXVII, 25; XXVI, 22 (ed. Rahm. אורייד', corr. acc.; Var. אוּרְיָרַיָּא, h. text על אוצרות).
, v. אֹורָיָיא
, v. אוּרְיָא I
, v. אֹורָיָיא
, v. אַרְכַּת
, v. אֹורָכוּתָא
Midr. Sam. ch. XIII, וכל הא' הזה למה and why all this lengthiness (of speech).

Targ. O. Gen. VI, 15 [Constr. אֹורֶךְ Targ. Y. Ex. XXVI, 13; Targ. O. ib., corr. acc.]—Sabb. 140 b טונא כי טונא וא' וכ' a load (of twigs) is a load, and the length goes in the bargain (the price is the same).
(of life). Targ. Ps. XCI, 16; a. e.
Ibid. XXXIX, 8; a. e.
Targ. Y. Deut. II, 31.
Y. Yeb. VIII, 8 d bot. (allusion to a case concerning the child of a certain U., otherwise unknown).
B. Kam. 70 a; Shebu. 33 b, v. אַדְרַכְתָּא 2).
Y. R. Hash. I, 57 b top. Pesik. R. s. 15; a. e.
, v. אֹרֶן
ch. = h. אֹרֶן. Targ. Is. XL, 20; XLIV, 14.

sense.definition: אַוְרַנְסֵי, אַבְרַ' (ῥάμνος, rhamnus) a kind of prickly shrubs, used for medical purposes and carried in lengthy bundles (v. D. C. Gr. s. v., a. Sm. Ant. s. v.).
