sense.notes: Sabb. 91 b או' ed. (Ms. M. אב'; Ar. ארנסי). [As to ור, בר for aspirate r, v. Lidd. a. Scott, Gr. Lex, 7 th ed. s. lit. P.]
, v. אוורקסין
לא' with suff. of pers. pron., to meet—, against—. Targ. Prov. VII, 10 (ed. Vien. לְעוּרְ'); 15. Targ. Ps. XXXV, 3 לְאֹורְעוּת.
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (ארע; corresp. to h. צִרְעָה) wasp, hornet (collect.).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Ex. XXIII, 28; a. e.— Pl. אוּרְעַיָּיתָא. Targ. Y. Deut. I, 44; a. e.—אוּרְעֵי, אוּרְעַיָּה. Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 20 ed. pr. (corr. vowel signs; later ed. אוזפיה). Y. Sabb. I, 3 b bot. תולעתא דסוסיא וכ' the mite in the horse’s carcass turns into hornets. [Cmp. same ideas among the Greek, Sachs Beitr. II, 92; Nican Ther. 741.]
, v. אַוְורַשְׁנָא
Pes. 2 ab אור א' the or of the Mishn. means evening. Ber. 3 b; a. fr.—Y. Sot. I, 17 b top, v. בְּרַת.
אַוֵּושׁ, (√אוו, v. אָוָוז; cmp. אוף, אנף, אפף, אופי, אוסי, אבב)

sense.definition: to blow vehemently, make noise, shout.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 86 a נשב זיקא וא' וכ' the wind blew and howled between the branches. Ber. 50 a וכ' איידי דאוושו because all shouted, the prayer was not heard. Ib. אוושו כ"ע ברכו they all shouted ‘bar’khu’.—Erub. 97 b אוושא מילתא the thing grows loud, becomes known. Ḥull. 46 b ריאה דא' lungs which give out a sound when blown up (indicating perforation). Ber. 58 a כי קא אוושא (Ms. M. שמעו קל א') when shouting was heard.

sense.definition: to swell, to be large, fulsome, lengthy (in wording).
sense.notes: R. Hash. 35 a משום דאוושי ברכות (Ms. M. קראי …) because the benedictions are numerous and lengthy. Ned. 2 b הלין דא' וכ' משום because the last named propositions are lengthy, he explained first what he had commenced with.

sense.definition: (v. foreg; cmp. יֵשׁ, אִישׁ) to be strong, exist.
sense.notes: Nithpol. נִתְאֹושֵׁשׁ to be confirmed. Gen. R. s. 67; s. 78 והיכן נ' בידן when were the blessings made sure &c. Cmp. אָשַׁשׁ.
B. Kam. 50 a חופר לא' digs excavations for supporting walls.

Targ. Cant. VIII, 9.— Pl. אוּשַּׁיָּא. [Ezra IV, 12; a. e.]. Targ. I Kings VII, 7; VI, 16; a. e. [Targ. Mic. I, 6 ed. Ven. אַוְשָׁהָא her foundations. Targ. Y. Ex. IX, 18 אנשהא (corr. אַוְ')]. [Not to be conf. with אשיתא].

sense.definition: Uhsa, in Galilee; freq. the scene of rabbin.
sense.notes: synods and enactments during and after the Hadrianic persecutions. Keth. 50 a מרה דשמעתא דא' master of the traditions of U. (in whose name they are quoted). [Ib. קאי באוכלוסא דא', read בהילכתא engaged in teaching the laws passed at U.] R. Hash. 31 b; a. fr.
, v. אֲשִׁיתָא
—אֹושָׁטוּת ידא acquisition, business. Targ. Deut. XII, 7; a. e.
, v. אֲשִׁיתָא

sense.definition: a word in a charm formula, supposed to mean day.
sense.notes: Sabb. 67 b או' Ar. (ed. אש', Ms. M. אושקי). Cmp. Tosef. Sabb. VII (VIII), 1.
, v. אַשְׁכָּף

sense.definition: (= h. שַׁכָּף; שכף, √כף, cmp. אוּכָּף) worker in leather, saddler, shoemaker.
sense.notes: Git. 68 b.— Pl. אוּשְׁכָּפֵי. Sabb. 112 a the travellers’ sandals דקטרי א' which the shoemakers knot (tightly). Ib. 104 b חרתא דא' the blacking used by shoemakers. Ib. 123 b חרבא דא' the leather dressers’ knife. Pes. 42 b פרורא דא' the shoemakers’ paste. Ib. 113 b
= חוּשְׁלָא.
Targ. I Chr. I, 20, v. אַשְׁלָא

sense.definition: (in Y. הֹושַׁעְיָא q. v.) pr. n. m. Oshâya,

sense.notes: freq. surnamed רַבָּא (the elder), an Amora of the first generation, redactor of Tosefta. Yeb. 18 b; a. fr.
, v. אוּשְׁפִּיזָא
, v. אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנָא
, v. אושפרתי

sense.definition: (נשף, with ז format; cmp. אטליז) night’s lodging, inn.
sense.notes: — Pl. אוּשְׁפִּיזִין. בעלי א' innkeepers. Tosef. Maas. Sh. I, 13; Meg. 26 a. [Mand. שפינזא, v. Nœld. Mand. Gr. p. 51.]

Git. 44 b אית ליה א' וכ' he has a lodging place in Palestine, (is an occasional resident), opp. ביתא permanent home. Meg. 26 a; Yoma 12 a it is customary to leave empty jars and hides of slaughtered animals (ל) באושפיזֵיה in one’s inn. Zeb. 61 b א' הוה נקט וכ' (Ms. M. אוּשְׁפְּזִיכָא … נקיטא, v. אושפיזכן; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) the Divine fire took up its abode now here and now there. Erub. 53 b שאיל בא' (Rashi משייל בעניין אושפזיכני, read ניה …, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 80) inquired after the character of an inn (of his landlord). Ib. (enigmatic inquiry that the landlord might not overhear it) גבר פום דין חי מה טיבו Ar. (v. Rabb. l. c. note 90) = איש־פי־ז־נא our inn—what is its character?
, v. אושפיזכ'

ך, cmp. דָּא, דֵּךְ) innkeeper, landlord, host. Meg. 26 a; Yoma 12 a; Sot. 37 a; Zeb. 54 a נעשה א' וכ' Benjamin became the host of the Divine Presence (the Temple being partly situated in his territory).

Zeb. 18 b בר אושפיזכניה (Ms. M. only אוּשְׁפְּזִיכְנֵיה) (the son of) his host. Snh. 7 b bot. Yoma 78 a פיזכנה … Ms. M. (ed. נין …). Bets. 4 a; a. fr.—Erub. 53 b, v. אוּשְׁפִּיזָא.—Fem. אוּשְׁפִּיזַכְתָּא hostess. Ber. 18 b ed. Ms. M. (בת אושפיזכניה).
Taan. 24 b Ms. (ed. אושפז', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, a. Var. lect. ibid.).
, v. אִשְׁקָקָא
, v. אֶוְושַׁר

entry.language-reference: √אה, v. אוי I; cmp. אתא, אֶת, אתר, a. אָתָה; v. also Ges. H. Dict. s. v.)

sense.definition: (b. h.) to be suited, pleased, whence to be gratified, to enjoy.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. III, 6 c top ראה את עצמו נ' וכ' he dreamt he felt sexual gratification; Y. Yoma VII, 44 d bot.; Y. Taan. I, 64 c bot.—Y. Bets. I, 61 a כל שנֵאותין בו בי"ט whatever you are permitted to make use of on Holy Days.— Fut. יֵאוֹת. Ber. VIII, 6 עד שיֵאוֹתוּ לאורו until being near enough to enjoy its light. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c top, a. e., differences as to spelling יֵאוֹתוּ or יֵעוּתוּ.—Denom. הֲנָאָה, נָאֶה, נָאוֶה, נוֹי.

sense.definition:
c. (b. h.; v. אוי,
אָוָה II; תְּאָו)
mark, sign, emblem; test, signal, military ensign.
sense.notes: Hòag. 16 a (play on ואתה Deut. XXXIII, 2; cmp. foreg.) אות הוא וכ' He is the ensign among his myriad; v. דּוּגְמָא. M. Kat. 25 b אל תזניחנו בא' וכ' forsake us not in the symbolic trial of bitter waters (in our trials). Pl. אוֹתוֹת. Kil. IX, 10 א' הגרדין וכ' the marks which the weavers &c. put on goods in their charge. B. Kam. 119 b you must not buy from the dyer לא א' ולא דוגמות either tests (pieces cut off to test the color) or samples (as specimens of color).

B. Bath. 15 a אות אחת one letter. Sabb. 103 a; a. fr.— Pl. אוֹתִיּוֹת (fr. אוֹתוּת or אוֹתִית). Kid. 30 a סופרים כל הא' recorded (or counted) all the letters of the Torah. Snh. X, 1 השם באוֹתִיוֹתָיו the Divine Name with the letters in which it is written (Jehovah). Kid. 71 a שם בן ארבע א' the quadriliteral Name; cmp. שֵׁם.—Lev. R. s. 26, beg. ח' א' eight letters. Sabb. XII. 3; a. fr.—Trnsf. notes, documents. Tosef. Kid. I, 7; B. Bath. 75 b; a. e.

sense.definition: v. אֵת) only with pronominal suffix
indicating the objective case, אוֹתִי me, אוֹתְךָ thee, &c.—2) with pronom.
with pronom. suffix of third person, for emphasizing the subject, אוֹתוֹ he himself, this one, the same, he who &c. Gen. R. s. 2, beg. ישב לו א' וכ' the latter now sat there confounded &c. Y. Git.
sense.notes: VI, 47 d באותו ענין on this very subject (divorce). Sabb. 13 b זכור אותו האיש וכ' may that man be remembered for good. Ber. V, 3 באוֹתָהּ שעה in that hour; a. fr.—אותו מקום euphem. for pudenda. Nid. 47 b. Git. 69 b; a. e.—אותו ואת בנו the law concerning the killing of the young with its mother on the same day (Lev. XXII, 28). Ḥull. V, 1; a. fr.— Pl. אוֹתָן. Y. Meg. IV, 74 d top א' שבפה those laws delivered orally. Keth. 4 a כל א' הימים all those days; a. fr. [In later writings אותו האיש is freq. used for Jesus of Nazareth.
Targ. Ps. CXXXIX, 2.
, Cant. R. to III, 11, read אִיקוֹנִין as Ex. R. s. 35, end.
Targ. Y. Lev. XI, 18 (Targ. O. ib. בותא q. v.; Targ. Y. Deut. XIV, 16 צַדְיָא). [Perh. corrupt. of בָּאוְתָא v. בָּאוָת.]
, v. אֶוְותִּיאֹוס
, v. אַוְותֶּנְטְיָא
Y. Snh. II, 20 c bot. read כִּיתְנִיתֵיה, v. כִּיתְנִיתָא
Targ. Y. Deut. XIV, 12 Ar. (ed. בר גזא, בר גיזא; h. text עזניה).
, v. אַזוֹב
Keth. 77 b גירדא דא' Ar. parings of glass (ed. אגוזא).
, v. אִיזְ'
, v. אִיזְגְּדַר
Ithpe. prefix of verbs with prim. lit. ז as אזדווג fr. זווג &c.

sense.definition: (= אזז √אז; cmp. אזל I; גז, חז, עז, חצד &c.) to be cut off; to go apart, be gone.
sense.notes: Sabb. 34 b; a. fr. ואזדו לטעמייהו they differ (cmp. פלג), each following his own principle (or consistent with opinions elsewhere expressed). Ned. 41 a שיתא אזדו (Rashi אזלו ליה) six of them are gone (escaped his memory). Bets. 10 b אזדו לעלמא disappeared (Ms. M. אזלו; 11 a אזלו). Meïl. 17 b נפק אזדא Ar. (read אזד, ed. אזל) he went out and away. V. אֲזַל.

Dan. II, 5.—B. Mets. 116 b if the landlord said, I let you this loft (as it is) א' it is a (divine) decree, i.e. it is the tenant’s misfortune that the loft fell in, and he has no claims. V. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.
, v. next w.
Targ. Job. XII, 5 Ms. (ed. אזדעזעא, const. … עַת).

sense.definition: ( Ithpe. or Ithpa. of זְקַף) rising.
sense.notes: Targ. Job. XIII, 11. Ib. XLI, 17 Ms. Var., v. מספיא.
, v. אֵיזֶה
, v. אַזְהַרְתָּא

sense.definition: forewarning, prohibition, esp. the explicit prohibition (‘ thou shalt not’) in the Bible, required for punishing trespassers.
sense.notes: Y. Peah I, 16 a top א' ללה"ר a biblical admonition against calumny. Num. R. s. 7 (play on zara Num. XI, 20) והי' לכם לא' it shall be a warning to you. Yeb. 3 b א' שמענו וכ' we learn here the legal prohibition, whence do we derive the penalty? a. tr.— Pl. אַזְהָרֹות. Kerith. III, 10; a. fr.
Cant. R. to VII, 3, v. אִדַּר.
Shebu. 20 b ואַזְהַרְתֵּיה מה' and the legal prohibition concerning it, is to be derived from this verse.— Pl. אַזְהָרָן. Y. Yoma VIII, 45 a תלת א' three prohibitory verses.

Neg. XIV, 6 א' יון (Ar. אזביון) Greek hyssop. Sabb. XIV, 3 (109 b) איזוביון, איזביון (read two words, Ms. O., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 4); a. fr.— Pl. אֵיזֹובִים M. Kat. 25 b אֵיזֹובֵי קִיר the hyssop (moss) on the wall (common humanity); v. אֶרֶז.
Targ. Ex. XII, 22; a. e.

M. Kat. 14 a אֵיזֹורֹו וכ' his girdle (around his house-gown) testifies for him (that he has no more than the shirt he is washing). Tosef. Shebu. V, 12 sq.; a. e.— Pl. אֵזֹורִים, אֵיז'. Gen. R. s. 100 אֵזוֹרֵי מתניהם וכ' they loosened the girdles of their loins (in mourning sympathy). [Ch. זריז.]
Sot. I, 17 b top איזורִי ואיזורֵיה דברי וכ' my belt, and my son’s belt and that of his father in law; Num. R. s. 9 (p. 232 b ed. Amst.); Y. Peah VII, 20 a bot. (corr. acc.); cmp. Midr. Sam. ch. XIII.

sense.definition: (= אַזְעִי, v. אוּדְיָיתָא a. זִיעַ) to heat ( make steam).
sense.notes: Dan. III, 19; 22.—Targ. Is. XXXIII, 4 וַאֲזַן (Regia אֵיזִין) and they shall heat (baths, ovens) therewith (h. text מַשַּׂק = מַשַּׁק), v. זִירְקְתָא; (cmp. Ezek. XXXIX, 9). Ib. XLIV, 15 (for baking); a. e.—Y. Ter. VIII, end, 46 c a bath house דאזייה וכ' which he had heated for seven days. Koh. R. to II, 8; a. e. דהוון אָזְיִין בהון that entertained the fires in them.—Lev. R. s. 28, end ועל מזגיה וקנחיה (read ואַזְּיֵיה Pa.) and he (Haman) went and made him sweat and cleansed him (with the scraper).
Gen. R. s. 63 קלוון אנא דיִתְּזוּן וכ' I command that the bath-houses be heated. Ib. אזלון ואִתְּזוּן they went off, and the bath-houses were heated (some ed. דְּיִחֲמוּן a. אַחְמוּן).
, v. אֲזַל

sense.definition: , pl. (זין) אֲזֵינִין weapons, בית א' receptacle of weapons, quiver.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. V, 16. Targ. Is. XLIX, 2 (ed. Ven. אַזְנִין). V. Targ. to Deut. XXIII, 14 אֲזֵנֶךָ.

sense.definition: (Af. of אזק, v. חזק, עזק) to tie up.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to VIII, 1 א' לרישי I have to tie up my head. (Yalk. Koh. 977 דחיק, Vers. אדיק; Y. Pes. X, 37 c חזיק רישיה his head was tied; cmp. Ned. 49 b.)

Y. Ber. V, 9 b א' שהיא מריוח the reference to rain (in the second section of the eighteen benedictions) which is an expression of satisfaction (plenty), opp. שאלה, the prayer for rain (in the ninth benediction) which is an expression of anxiety.—Y. Meg. III, 74 b top שתהא אַזְכָּרָתָן קודם וכ' that the recitation (of the events commemorated on Purim) precede the celebration thereof.

Num. R. s. 2, beg. the students מראים את הא' וכ' point out the Div. Name with their fingers; Cant. R. to II, 4 מדלג על הא' skips the Div. Name in recitation of lessons.— Pl. אַזְכָּרֹות. Yoma 8 a שיש בהן א' הרבה in which the Div. N. frequently occurs. Y. Ber. III, 6 c.—Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 c bot.; Bab. ibid. 116 a קודר אזכרותֵיהֶן you must cut out the Div. N. occurring in them (the heretic writings). Y. Taan. II, 65 c top י"ח א' וכ' eighteen times that the Tetragrammaton appears in the Psalm Habu (XXIX). Num. R. s. 2, beg.; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be gone, to leave; to go.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXXII, 1. Imper. אִיזֵּיל, אִזֵּיל. Targ. O. Num. XXII, 20; a. fr.—Y. Snh. X, 28 b איזיל חמי וכ' go, show thy face &c. Ib. לינה מֵיזַל … דנא מיזל וכ' I will not go … for if I did go &c. Sabb. 116 a א' כתב א' וכ' after the writing is gone, the sacredness of the scroll is gone (after the scroll has become unfit for sacred use, the material has lost its sacred character). Y. Dem. III, 23 b bot. הא אזילא מיבלא וכ' that man’s load would soon be gone (if each were permitted to take a chip). Y. Ber. VIII, 12 a הא אזילא ההיא דרב וכ' is the decision of Rab and Samuel gone (to be disregarded)? Y. Snh. X, 28 a bot. הא א' הדא וכ' (ed. Krot. חדא) is that which was received from (is the tradition of) … to be disregarded? Y. Yeb. VIII, 9 c bot. הא אזילא היא וכ' (ed. Krot. איזלא, corr. acc.; for היא read הדא or ההיא).—Trnsf. to depart life, die. Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d bot. this one committed a sin וא' בה and died in it, and the other &c. M. Kat. 28 b ווי לאזלא woe, for the departed one! Y. Keth. XII, 35 a top אזיל to die, contrad. to אתי to resurrect.—Imperat. usu. זִיל = אזיל.—Ḥull. 11 b ז' בתר רובא follow the majority of cases; a. fr.
XXVII, 19; √זל) to spin, weave. B. Mets. 24 b קיבורא דאזלי ביה אזלויי a skein which the net-weavers had used; v. זוּל II. Denom. אִיזְלָא a. next w.
Pl. אַזְלֹויֵי. B. Mets. 24 b (some ed. אזלוי corr. acc.), v. foreg.
Targ. O. Ex. XV, 8 (Var. אָזְלַיָּא; Y. נָזְלַיָּא).
, v. אִיזְמָא
, v. אִזְמַרְגַּד
, v. אִיזְמֵל

sense.definition: (σμάραγδος, σμαράγδιον) emerald, a jewel (also colored crystal; v. זמרגד a. זמרגדין).
sense.notes: Targ. Job. XLII, 13. Targ. O. Ex. XXVIII, 18 (Targ. Y. ib. אִזְמֹורַד); a. e. Ex. R. s. 38, end אִסְמַרַגְדִּין.
Targ. Is. XXXIII, 4, third pers. pl. of אֲזָא, v. אֲזִי

sense.definition: to be pointed, cut, cmp. חז, גז.
sense.notes: v. אוּדְנָא)
B. Kam. 79 b א' של מַטָּה human ear, opp. Divine perception. Y. Sabb. I, 3 b top; a. fr.

Cant. R. beg. ולא הי' לה א' וכ' but had no handle and could not be carried; a. fr.— Du. אָזְנַיִם 1) ears. Lev. R. s. 32, beg. א' לדרך the road has ears (be on your guard in speaking); a. fr.—2) handles. Kel. IV, 3, v. גיסטרא; a. fr.

sense.definition: אָזְנַיִם or בנות א' swollen glands of the throat (Rashi).
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 28 b א'; Y. ib. II, 40 d top; Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 d top בנות א'.
, v. אוּזְנִיּוֹת

sense.definition: to put around, girdle; to strengthen.

sense.notes: Ber. 16 b ותִתְאַזָּר וכ' and gird thyself with thy mercy.
Succ. 28 a א' זה א' if it read ezra ḥ (Lev. XXIII, 42), it would mean every native (man or woman); a. fr.— Pl. אֶזְרָחִים. Sifra Emor, end.—Fem. אֶזְרָחִית, pl. אֶזְרָחִיּות. Succ. l. c.
Targ. Y. II. Num. XXXI, 50; v. זְרֹועַ.
Pl. אִזְתַּוְודֵּי. Targ. Y. Ex. XXV, 12 ed. Vien. (oth. ed. אזתוור'; ib. XXXVII, 3 אסתוור', v. Ibn Ezra comment. a. l.).

sense.definition: brother, kinsman; fellow, equal, fellow-believer &c. Meg. 11 a (play on ãhashverosh, Ahasverus) אָׄחִׄיו ש̇ל ר̇אש̇ וכ' a brother (in cruelty) to the chief tyrant (Nebucadn.); a. fr.— Pl. אַחִים, אַחִין.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 89, beg. (play on â ḥ u, Gen. XLI, 2) in years of plenty הבריות נעשו א' וכ' people are brotherly to each other. Ib. s. 99 אחים דפחתא וכ' brothers to the degraded woman (Dinah), … but not to Joseph; a. fr.—Cant. R. to VIII, 1 שני אחים brother and sister
Targ. fr.— Pl. אָחִין. Targ. Gen. XIII, 8; a. e.—אַחֵי Yeb. 65 b.—Y. Yoma VI, 43 d אֲחֵינָן our brothers
interj.

sense.definition: (b. h.) exclamation of sorrow, Oh! Meg. 11 a (play on ãhashverosh; v. אָח I) א' לראשו woe upon his head.
sense.notes: Snh. 102 b (play on Ahab אח־אב) א' לשמי' a subject of grief to the Lord, and father (friend) of idolatry.—2 (= Syr.) exclamation of joy, Ah! Targ. Is. XLIV, 16 (h. הֶאָח).

sense.definition: pr. n. m. A ḥ a.
sense.notes: Arakh. 22 b; Keth. 88 a, surnamed שר הבירה superintendent of the palace. Y. Ber. II, 5 a R. A. surnamed Roba; a. many others. Y. Taan. II, 65 a bot.; a. v. fr.
Ḥull. 59 b

sense.definition: (contr. of אחי אבא) father’s brother, uncle.
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. XXXII, 7 אַחֲבוּךְ thy uncle. Targ. O. Lev. X, 4 (Ms. I a. III אח אבוהי; Targ. Y. חביבא q. v.); a. e. Yeb. 21 b Ar. s. v. בי אחבא (ed. בי דודי).

sense.definition:
, אַחַת f. (b. h.; v. next w.,
a. חַד) one.
sense.notes: [Freq. represented by א'.] Kid. 50 b, a. fr. בבת אחת simultaneously, v. בַּת III. Peah III, 3 המחליק מאחת יד וכ' (Ms. M. בא') he who takes out onions with a unity of hand, i.e. all of them for one purpose. Ber. 61 b, a. fr. על אחת כמה וכמה (abbr. עאכ"ו) how much against one, i.e. how much the more.—אחד … אחד both … as well as. Tem. I, 1 א' האנשים וכ' both, men as well as women. Y. Keth. V, 29 d top אחת זו ואחתֹ זו the one as well as the other; a. fr.—כְּאֶחָד, כְּאַחַת at the same time. Tosef. Neg. I, 11; sq. Sot. 8 a; a. fr.—Yoma I, 7 והפג אחת and cool thyself for once, for a change, v. חֲדַת.— Pl. אֲחָדִים
Yalk. Gen. 62 (ref. to דברים אחדים Gen. XI, 1) they spoke words על שני א' against two only ones (ref. to אחד Ezek. XXXIII, 24 a. Deut. VI, 4) [corr. acc. Gen. R. s. 38].
Gen. R. l. c. (Yalk. l. c. אֲחוּדִים v. next w.).

sense.definition: (sec. r. of חוּד, v. חוּד I) to join, close.
sense.notes: Part. pass. אָחוּד, pl. אֲחוּדִים
. Yalk. Gen. 62, v. foreg.
Gen. R. s. 38 (ref. to Gen. XI, 1, v. foreg.) דברים א' common goods, communism.
אָחֵיד, אַחֵד ch. (v. foreg.)

sense.definition: (corresp. to h. סגר a. תפש; cmp. h. אחז) to close (the door), to lock up; to seize, capture.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. XXII, 22 אָחֵיד. Ib. יֵיחֹוד, יִיחֹוד (fut.).—Targ. Deut. XXI, 19 יְאַ' = יַחֲדוּן (Pa.; Var. יֶחֱדוּן = יֶאֶח' Pe.). Targ. Am. III, 5; a. fr.—Snh. 26 a bot., a. e. אחדיה לדשא locked the door. Pes. 111 b ליה רוחא אחדא a spirit (demon, disease) seizes him.— Part. pass. אֲחִיד a) locked up. Targ. Josh. VI, 1; a. e.—b) (v. אָחוּז, s. v. אָחַז) holding. Targ. Am. II, 15; a. fr.— Part. pass. Pa. מְאַחַד locked up, hidden. Targ. Job. XXVI, 9.
Targ. Ps. LXXIII, 23.
. Targ. Ez. XIX, 4; a. fr.
Targ. Is. XXIV, 10 את אחידו … (read אתאחידו). Ib. LIX, 10 Rashi (ed. אתא חד corr. acc.). Targ. Job XLI, 9 (8); a. e.—אִתְּחִיד. Ḥull. 52 b א' דשא the door was locked.
Targ. Prov. XVIII, 19 (read … היך א' ד).
אֵחֲדַת רחמי shutting up of the womb, barrenness. Ibid. XXX, 16.

sense.definition: (contr. of אח־דאבא; v. אחבא) pr. n. m. A ḥ adboy, an Amora.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 113 b; a. e.
, v. אחי

sense.definition: (= b. h. אָחוּ, v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) [green], meadow-grass, reed.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Gen. XLI, 2.
Targ. O. Num. XXVII, 7; a. e.
Snh. 58 b בא' among brothers and sisters. Gen. R. s. 89 (play on a ḥ u, Gen. XLI,

sense.definition: in days of plenty there is אהבה וא' love and friendship.
sense.notes: —Lev. R. s. 2; a. fr.—Trnsf. בא' jointly. Sabb. 20 a (explain. אָח Jer. XXXVI, 2

sense.definition: עצים שנדלקין בא' Ar., Ms. Oxf. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, ed. באחוונא cler.
sense.notes: error) wood kindled all together [perh. with reeds? v. next w.].—2) (law) status of consanguinity. B. Kam. 88 a a slave שאין לו א' who has no legal status of consanguinity.
ch., v. אַחְוָא
pr. n. m., v. אַהֲבָה II
, v. אַחְוָונָא
, v. אַחְוֵיתָא
Y. Ber. VI, 10 a, bot.

sense.definition: willow-twigs used for kindling, kindling wood.
sense.notes: Sabb. 20 a (explain. אָח Jer. XXXVI, 23; v. אַחֲוָה 1, end) אַחְוָונָא (Var. אַחְוָנָא) willow-fire. Ib. one cried מאן בעי א' וכ' who wants A ḥ vana?, and it was found he had willow twigs for sale.
Ib. 20 b explaining אִידָּן; Ms. M. (ed. אחוינא, אחווינא).
Y. Kid. I 60 c top; a. e. Y. Ḥall. IV, 60 b. [Ib. אחיזה עצמה וכ' strike out the entire sentence.]. Ḥull. 75 a אחוזת עינים, v. אֲחִיזָה.
Targ. Ps. II, 8 Ms. (ed. אחודתא).
Dan. V, 12.
Targ. Ps. XLIX, 5; a. fr.
inf. of אֲחוּךְ, v. חוּךְ a. אֲחִיךְ.
, v. (כפר) אַחִים.
, v. אַחְוָונָא

sense.definition: (Syr. חחוניתא, v. חֹוחָא, a. Löw Aram.
sense.notes: Pfl. p. 149) plums. Y. Ber. VI, 10 b bot. (Bab. ib. 39 a דורמסקין).
Y. Ber. VI, 10 c top.

Bekh. 8 a; Gen. R. s. 20, beg.—Du. אֲחֹורַיִים (Ar. אחורים). Pes. 17 b, a. fr. א' ותוך the back (outside) and the inside of a vessel.—Y. Yoma V, 42 c top אֲחֹורָיו לקדש his back turned to the sanctuary.—Y. Pes. VI, 33 a bot., a. fr. מֵאֲחֹורֵי (prepos.) behind.—אֲחֹורֵי, לַאֲחֹורֵי same. Ber. 61 a; a. fr.
Ib. (ref. to Ps. CXXXIX, 5) א' למעשה וכ' the last of all things created; Lev. R. s. 14 א' לכל המעשים.
Ib. א' זה יום ראשון a ḥ or (Ps. l. c.) means the first day.

לאחורא backward. Targ. Gen. XLIX, 17; a. fr.— Pl. אֲחֹורִין, const. אֲחֹורֵי. Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 66 (buttocks).—אֲחֹורֵי behind, after. Y. R. Hash. II, 58 b top מן אחֹורֹויי behind him; a. fr. V. חֹורֵי. [Targ. Y. Lev. XIX, 26, v. חָרֹורָא.]

Y. Shebu. IV, 35 d top איתא או' another woman (wife). Y. Ber. IX, 13 a bot. שיטה או' another method, Lev. R. s. 14, beg. אמר או' said differently. Y. Meg. II, 74 a top אחו' another (scroll). Gen. R. s. 76 אחו' another (word, in reply). [Targ. אֹוחֲרִי. Targ. Gen. XXVI, 21; a. fr.]—[Dan. II, 39; VII, 5; 6; אָחֳרִי.] V. חֹורִי.
Yeb. I, 1; a. fr.—Ḥull. 114 a (of animals).— Pl. אַחֲיֹות. Yeb. III. 1; a. e.

entry.language-reference: sec. r. of חזז, cmp. אחד)

sense.definition: to press, seize, hold, keep; to befall.
sense.notes: Snh. 27 b אֹוחֲזִין מעשה וכ' holding in their hands the doing of their fathers, i.e. following their father’s example. Bekh. 33 b אֲחָזֹו דם he had an attack of congestion. Y. Pes. I, 28 b אֲחוּזַת הדם the animal attacked with congestion. Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 c bot. אֲחָזַתֹּו עין a pain in the eye seized him. Ib. XIX, end, 17 b אחזתו חמה fever overtook him; a. fr.—אָחַז בְּ־ to have a hold of.—B. Mets. I, 1. Y. Yoma II, 39 c top; a. fr.—Part. pass. אָחוּז holding fast, having a firm hold. Ex. R. s. 46 (v. אֲחַד).

sense.definition: א' את העינים to capture the eyesight, to delude by optical deception.
sense.notes: Snh. 65 b; a. e.
Y. Taan. II, 65 d top; a. e.

sense.definition: to distribute split wood ( kindling chips) in the gaps of a large pile, to ignite with kindling wood.
sense.notes: Sabb. I, 11 (19 b sq.) ומַאֲחִיזִין ed. (Mss., Ar. a. Y. ib. beg. 4 c ומחזין, ed. Ven. ומחיזין); v. חָזָה.
, v. חִזָּיֹון 2).
Part. pass. אָחוּי united. Num. R. s. 13, beg. שיהיו אֲחוּיִים אצלו they shall be united with him (around his table).

sense.definition: to join; to sew together (with fine stitches); cmp. חוּט; חוּד I.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 39 beg. אברהם שאֹ' את וכ' Abraham who united all mankind into a brotherhood (by the belief in one God), כזה שהוא מְאָחֶה וכ' like one who sews &c., v. infra. Ex. R. s. 40, end.—Esp. to mend, by stitching, the rent of the garment torn in mourning. M. Kat. 22 b; a. fr. Ib. 26 a לאַחֹותָן to stitch them together.

sense.definition: to be joined; to be stitched together.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 13, beg. (play on אחותי Cant. V, 1) נִתְאָחוּ לי וכ' they were joined to me (I joined them) in the captivity. Gen. R. s. 68 מִתְאָחֹות, v. אֶבֶן. M. Kat. 26 a אין מתאחין must not be stitched together.

sense.definition: to be joined by grafting, to grow together.
sense.notes: Y. Kil. I, 27 a top הן נתא' וכ' they (the two seeds) combine. Y. Shebi. II, end, 34 a bot. Y. Orl. I, 61 a bot.
אַחֵי as foreg. Pi. Targ. Koh. III, 7 לאחאה to sew together.
of אֲחַד q. v.

sense.definition: (= h. מְיוּחָד, v. יחד) singled out, devoted, betrothed.
sense.notes: Targ. O. Lev. XIX, 20. Targ. Ps. CXIV, 2. Targ. Cant. VI, 9.
Meg. 6 a היו קורין אותו אֲחִידַת מגדל צור Ms. (ed. שיר, Ar. שד) they recorded the act (of taking the place afterwards called Cæsarea) as the capture of Migdal Tsor.
— Pl. אֲחִידָן Dan. V, 12.

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. A ḥ iyah, several men of various periods.
sense.notes: , several men of various periods.
Shek. V, 1 א' על הנסכים A. superintendent of the Temple libations (wines, oils).
Ber. 63 b A., a Babylonian scholar opposing Palestine authorities.
רבי אחייה R. A., a Tannai. M. Kat. 20 a; a. e. Ibid. b ר' חייא לחוד וכ' R. Ḥiya (although a Chald. abbreviation of Aḥiyah) and R. A. are two different persons.
pl. of אָחֹות.
Targ. Hos. VI, 2 … אַחֲיוּת resurrection of &c.; a. e.
Kid. 22 b
, v. אֲחִיָּה
Git. 70 a (explained, as ‘fire of the bones’). Ber. 32 a (play on ויחל Ex. XXXII, 11). [Ib. 12 b אחילו Af. of חוּל II.]

sense.definition: , כְּפַר א' pr. n. pl. K’far A ḥ im.
sense.notes: Men. 85 a. Tosef. ib. IX, 2 אחום.

sense.definition: , pl. אֲחִינִיֹּות (prob. to be read אַחְוָנִיֹּות, v. אַחְוָנַיָּיא) plums.
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, 22 d top.

sense.definition: (חלל) defilement of a priest’s daughter, v. חֲלָלָה.
sense.notes: Snh. 66 b אם תחלת אֲחִלָּתָהּ וכ' if her first defilement occurred in whoredom (not in wedlock with one degraded).
Pl. אַחְמִיתִין. Targ. Esth. I, 4.

sense.definition: (חמר) ruby, name of a jewel in the High-priest’s breast-plate.
sense.notes: Targ. Cant. V, 14; v. סַמְקָן.
m., Ar., v. חוּמְרָא III

sense.definition: A ḥ m’tha, Ecbatana, capital of Media.
sense.notes: Ezra VI, 2, v. הַמְדָּן; v. Schr. K. A. T. p. 378.

, אח"ס בט"ע, a formula representing a permutation of letters wherein the first (א) interchanges with the eighth (ח) and with the fifteenth (ס); the second (ב) with the ninth (ט) and with the sixteenth (ע), &c. Sabb. 104 a אח"ס בט"ע גי"ף = א̇ני ח̇ס̇ עליהם מפני שב̇ע̇ט̇ו בג̇י̇ף̇ I shall spare them because they resisted sensual temptations; v. גִּיף
Targ. Lev. XIV, 34; a. e.—B. Bath. 133 b עבורי א' who unlawfully pass an inheritance from one hand to another.
B. Bath. 93 a; Shebu. 34 a; Snh. 37 b (Ms. M. B. Bath. l. c. יהיר). Tosef. B. Kam. III, 6 אֹוחֵיר.

sense.definition: to tarry, hesitate; to set behind.
sense.notes: Pes. IX, 9 אם אֵחַרְתִּי if I should be late. Y. Yoma III, 40 c top א' בו מעשה the text orders a later action after it. Y. Ned. X, 42 ab א' בעמידה he tarried in standing, i.e. was the last to sit down. Gen. R. s. 81, beg. א' אדם את נדרו if one procrastinates the fulfillment of his vow; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be postponed, be done late, be placed later.
sense.notes: Y. Yoma III, 40 c top בכלל מְאוּחָר היה would belong to things to be done later. Ib. יוּאֲחַר וכ' let it be done later than &c.—אין מוקדם ומאוחר בתורה there is no ‘earlier’ or ‘later’ (no chronological order) in the events or laws of the Scripture. Pes. 6 b; a. e.; Y. Sot. VIII, 22 d מוּאֲחַר.—Shebi. X, 5, a. fr. מאוחר (a document) postdated, opp. מוקדם antedated. B. Mets. V, 10 רבית מְאוּחֶרֶת postpaid interests.
Targ. Jer. V, 8 (of steeds, h. text מוזנים; some ed. ד for. ר).
take ye a later meal (on Sabbaths).
same. Targ. II Sam. XX, 5; a. fr.—[Targ. Prov. XXIII, 30 מַוְחֲרִין, מְוַוחֲרִין Part. Af. or Pa. of יחר = מֹוחר', מאחר'.]
Targ. Y. I Deut. I, 2; cmp. however ib. v. 6, v. אֲרַח.

אַחֲרֵי after, behind. Gen. R. s. 44 wherever the Bible uses the preposition a ḥ aré סמוך, it means in connection with, אחר מופלג while a ḥ ar means without connection ( later on). Yoma 6 a אחר א' after ‘after’, i.e. some time after the act, opp. חד אחר one ‘after’, immediately, v. אֶוְתִּיוֹס.—לְאַחֲרָיו, לְאַחֲרֶיהָ, מֵאַחֲרָיו, מֵאַחֲרֶיהָ after it, as concluding, opp. לפניה, לפניו introductory (prayer).—Ber. I, 4 אחת לא' one benediction after the Sh’ma. Ib. III, 4 לאחריו (prayer) after meal; a. fr.—כִּלְאַחַר יד as if doing a thing with the back of the hand, i.e. in a manner different from the usual way of doing it. Sabb. 153 b; a. fr.—מֵאַחַר

sense.definition: (conj. followed by ש־ or ד־) after, since, whereas, because.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 29 a מא' ששנינו after it has once been stated in the Mishnah … why was it necessary (?) &c. Ib. b ומאחר דאפי' וכ' and since it is not even rabbinically unfit, why &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: a legal term, mea ḥ ar, the presumption of the truth of one’s statement, because he might have pleaded more profitably, if he had been inclined to lie.
sense.notes: Y. Shebu. VI, 36 d bot. אין אומרים בממון מא' מאחר וכ' in money matters we do not apply the principle of mea ḥ er, so as to say that because he might have said ‘thou hast not lent me anything’, he may say, ‘thou didst lend me, but I paid half of it’ (and his plea must be accepted without an oath); v. מִיגּוֹ s. v. גּוֹ.—אַחֲרֶיךָ thy successor. Y. Kil. IX, 32 c top יהודה בני א' וכ' my son Judah shall succeed thee, none else (is worthy). Keth. 95 b my property I bequeath to thee ואַחֲרַיִיךְ לפ' and after thee it shall go over to …—אַחַר כָּךְ (abbrev. אח"כ) afterwards, subsequently. Pes. X, 2; a. v. fr.

sense.definition:
v. foreg. a.
חוֹרִי) [back of,] another, the other, stranger.
sense.notes: דבר א' (abbr. ד"א)
. Snh. IV, 5; a. v. fr. in Midr.

sense.definition: euphem. for idolatry, swine &c., v. דָּבָר.
A ḥ er, [apostate,] byname of Elisha ben Abuyah.
sense.notes: Ḥag. 14 b; a. e.— Pl. אֲחֵרִים others; 1) freq. in Mishn. for anonymous authorities differing in opinion, א' אומרים, v. Hor. 13 b אסיקו לר' מאיר א' R. Meïr is quoted under the word a ḥ erim.—2) freq. for strangers, gentiles. Snh. 52 b אשת א' the wife of a non-Israelite. B. Mets. 111 b; a. fr.—Fem. אֲחֶרֶת. Yoma I, 1 אשה א' a second (additional) wife; a. fr.—Snh. 104 a זאת ועוד א' this and something besides (shall happen).
v. אֲחוֹרָא

sense.definition: (foreg. wds.) prop. designated to step behind, substitute; hence, he who (or that which) is gone back to, obligated, pledged; surety, guarantor.
sense.notes: — Pl. אַחֲרָאִים, אַחֲרָיִין. Dem. III, 5 אין אנו א' וכ' we are not responsible for deceivers. Pes. IX, 9 אינן אחראין זה לזה they are not responsible to one another (need not care for each other). Y. Keth. VIII, end, 32 b, a. fr. כל נכסיו א' all his landed property is pledged for &c.

sense.definition: , אַחֲרוֹנָה f. (אַחֲרוֹנִית f. noun) other, next, last.
sense.notes: Meg. 21 b; a. fr. א' the last of those called up to read from the Torah.— Pl. אַחֲרוֹנִים m., אַחֲרוֹנוֹת f.—מים א' the washing of hands after meals before grace, opp. מים ראשונים washihg before meals. Ber. 53 b; a. fr.—דורות א' or only אחרונים the latter (present) generation, opp. ראשונים ancients. Yoma 9 b; a. fr.—Ber. 13 a צרות א' וכ' the latter (present) troubles bring the former into oblivion.—(ברכות) א' the three last sections in the Prayer of Benedictions. Ibid. 34 a; a. fr.—Erub. 53 b אַחְרוֹנִית second wife; v. אַהֲרוֹנִית.—בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה (adv.) last. B. Kam. 8 a; a. e.
v. אְחוֹרִי

sense.definition: (v. אַחֲרָאִי) surety, esp. mortgaged property, or property which may be resorted to in case of non-payment (even if sold).
sense.notes: —נכסים שיש להן א' property from which debts may eventually be collected (landed property), נ' שאין להם א' property which cannot be resorted to (movable property). Kid. I, 5; a. fr.—B. Mets. III, 11 חייב באחריותן is responsible for them (if lost). Men. 109 a; a. fr.—א' נכסים an obligation for which property is pledged. Keth. 34 b; a. fr.—Ib. 51 b, a. e. documents שאין בהן א' נ' in which the clause pledging property is omitted. Ib. a; a. e. א' טעות סופר הוא the omission of the clause pledging property is considered as the scribe’s mistake (hence has no legal consequences). B. Mets. 14 a, a. e. ראובן שמכר … בא' if R. sold to S. a field with surety (guaranteeing the title).
Targ. Y. II Deut. XXXII, 29; a. e.
v. אַחֲרָאִי

Y. Pes. I, end, 28 b ר' יושוע א' the other (last named) R. Josh.—Y. Ber. II, 5 b top פירקא א' last chapter.— Pl. אחְרָיִין. Y. Ter. VIII, 45 d bot. א' ומיתון those (drinking) later, drank and died.—אַחְרַיָּיא. Y. Meg. III, 74 b bot. תומנתי פסוקייא א' the last eight verses.—Fem. אַחֲרַיְתָא, אַחֲרַיְיתָא. Y. Taan. I, beg. 63 c. Y. Shebu. III, 34 d בא' in the last one.—Targ. Prov. V, 20 אחריתא stranger.—Ib. XXV, 8, a. fr. בא' at last, in the end.— Pl. אַחֲרָיָיתָא. Ib. XXIV, 14 Ms. (ed. sing.).
Ḥull. 12 a אינש א' another man. Bets. 28 a מידי א' something different.—לישנא א' (abbr. ל"א) another version. Pes. 97 b, a. fr.— Pl. אַחְרִינֵי. Yeb. 45 a; a. fr. Cmp. אָחֳרָן.
Y. Meg. III, 74 a bot.
v. אַחְרַיְיתָא s. v. אַחְרָיָיא.
Erub. 23 a מילתא א' another subject. Pes. 50 a; a. fr.

Targ. Ex. XX, 3; a. fr.—Fem. אוֹחֲרַנְתָּא, אוֹחֲרָנִית, אָחֳרָנִיתָא. Targ. O. ib. XXI, 10 (another, additional wife). Ibid. Gen. XVII, 21.—Lam. R. to IV, 2.—B. Bath. 16 a אחרניתא a stranger (not his own wife).— Pl. אוּחֲרנְיָן, אוּחֲרַנְיָין. Targ. O. Gen. XLI, 3; a. e. אָחֲרַנְיָיאתָא. Cant. R. to IV, 12.—[Targ. Y. Gen. XXXV, 8 אֹוחֲרַן בכיותא a repetition of weeping, v. אִלֹּון II.]
v. אַחֵר

sense.definition:
… m. pl. (h.
נים …) satraps, Persian governors.
sense.notes: Dan. III, 2; a. e.—Cant. R. to VII, 9.
v. אֶחָד
Targ. Jer. XXII, 18; a. fr.—Pes. 4 a; a. fr.— Pl. אַחֲוָותָא. Targ. Job. I, 4 (ed. אַחְיָ'); a. e.—Yeb. 32 b. Sabb. 13 a. Yeb. 66 a top ( twin sisters).

sense.definition: Atba ḥ, a formula of combination or interchange of two letters the numerical sum of which is either ten (e.g. א"ט = 1 + 9; ב"ח = 2 + 8) or one hundred (e.g. י"צ = 10 + 90; כ"פ = 20 + 80 = 100), whereby ה and נ, remain isolated or substitute each other.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 15 (allusion to ה̇ן̇ Num. XXIII, 9).—Succ. 52 b באטב"ח (של ר' חייא) קורין כ' לס̇ה̇ד̇ה̇ מ̇נ̇ו̇ן̇ in the Atbaḥ (of R. Ḥiya) sahadah finds a substitute in manon (v. Prov. XXIX, 21).

sense.definition: (אטט, cmp. חטט = b. h. אֵת, pl. אִתִּים), pl. אִטִּין plough-shares.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VI, 8 b bot. (expl. לאִתִּים (Is. II, 4) לאִ' (Ar. by cler. err. אבויין).
, Af. אַיְיטִי, v. יְטָא, יְטִי.

Men. 32 a א' דסיפרי clasp for fastening the leaves of books while reading.— Pl. (אַטְבְּעֵי) אַטְבֵּי. Sabb. 98 a Ar. אטבי (ed. באטבעי אטבעי, some ed. בא' בטבעי, corr. acc., Ms. M. only בטבעי, margin אטבי; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). Num. R. s. 6 (in Hebr. diction) א' של ברזל iron clasps (to fasten the boards on the wagon).
v. א"ט
v. אַטְבָּא
Gen. R. s. 100. Sot. 13 a.—Y. Ned. VI, end 40 a מדבר הא' the desert of Atad.— Pl. אֲטָדִין. Shebi. VII, 5; a. e. [V. Sm. Ant. s. v. Carduus.]
Targ. Gen. L, 10.—Targ. Ps. LVIII, 10. Ms. (ed. אֲטָדָא); a. e.— Pl. אַטְדִין. Targ. O. Gen. III, 18. (Y. אַטְטִין). Targ. Hos. X, 8 (some ed. אטטין).

sense.definition:
on account of, because of, for the sake of (h.
בגלל).
sense.notes: קנסו שוגג א' מזיד they fined the inadvertent transgressor for the sake of the wilful one (in order to prevent wilful sin). Git. 53 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (in questions expressing surprise, indignation) is it because? do you mean to say? Ib.
sense.notes: 7 a א' אנא לא ידענא do I not know it myself? Ib. 30 b א' ברשיעי עסקינן is it with wicked men we have to deal? (i.e. shall we presume deliberate sin?); a. v. fr.

sense.definition: (cmp. b. h. אֵטוּן; prob. fr. טוה to spin; for oth. etym.
sense.notes: v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v. אטן) rope, chord. Targ. Josh. II, 15. Targ. Job. XXX, 11 (ed. give all var. combined, v. שׁוֹשַׁלְתָּא).—R. Hash. 23 a א' דכיתנא (some ed. אטוני pl.) flaxrope.— Pl. אֵטוּנִין, (אַטּ') אֵטוּנַיָּא. Targ. I Kings XX, 31; a. fr. [Tosef. Maasr. III, 8 אטונין ed., ed. Zuck. עטינין, Var. אטינין q. v.]

sense.definition: (cmp. θύννος; v. Sm. Ant. s. v.) tunny-fish.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 66 b; Ab. Zar. 39 a Ms. M. (ed. אוט'). Tosef. Ḥull. III (IV), 27 אַנְתִּינִיס ed. Zuck. (Var. אַנְתִּינוֹס). Ib. Kel. B. Mets. II, 17 ליטול בטינס; (read as) Ḥull. 25 a להטיהו בטו' to polish a vessel with the skin of a tunny. *Cant. R. to I, 7 כמה מיני אנונס וכ' (read אטו'; Ex. R. s. 2 מזונות) how many kinds of tunny fish hast thou prepared for the lying-in among them? V. אכספטיאס.
Keth. 61 a bot., v. אַכְוַנְגָּר
v. אַטְדָא
Ḥall. IV, 11 (12) Ar., Ms. M.; ed. Talm. Y. בן א', Mishn. אנטינוס; Tem. 21 a Ar., ed. בן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס, q. v.
, v. אייניס
Targ. Y. Num. XI, 26; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 48 it does not read עומד (standing) but נצב (placed on his post), i.e. אט' ready (to proceed). Cant. R. to II, 9 אי'. Gen. R. s. 100.
v. אֲטִימִיטוֹן
v. next w.

sense.definition: (neut., or accus. of ἀτίμητος (something) invaluable, priceless.
sense.notes: Y. Peah I, 15 d bot. חד מרגלי טבא א' (read חדא) a pearl worth a priceless treasure. Gen. R. s. 35 end מרגלית אטימטון. *Ruth R. next to I, 18 מילא דאיסטופיטא read מרגליתא אטימיטא an invaluable pearl.
v. next w.
Num. R. s. 16, end.

sense.definition: (a contr. of אטעינין; נטע) herbs selected for planting purposes.
sense.notes: Tosef. Maasr. III, 8 אטי' ed. Zuck. (Var. עטי'; ed. אטו'). Y. ib. V, beg. 51 c עטנין. Cmp. שֵׁתֶל; שְׁתִילִין.

sense.definition: (נטף, cmp. טִיף) drop-like cavity in the cheese.
sense.notes: . Ab. Zar. 35 b ביני א'. Ar. (ed. אַטְּפֵי) between the holes.
Af. of נְטַל.
Erub. 68 b חוכא וא' derision and jest (Ar. a. Ms. Oxf. טְלוּלָא).
א' אבנין stoning to death. Targ. Y. Ex. XXI, 17; a. e.
, v. אִיטַלְיָא

ז or ס; cmp. אוּשְׁפֵּיז; v. טָלַל II, טְלַל I, II) a number of booths put up for a mercantile fair, or for popular entertainments; whence (cmp. חָנוּת) shops, bazaar (v. esp. Gen. R. s. 79, quot. bel.). Ḥull. 91 b א' של אמאוס the fair of Emmaus. Pesik. Asser p. 98 b. Arakh. VI, 5 (24 a) אם ממתינין אותה לאיטלס if they delay the sale for the market day; a. fr.— Pl. אַטְלֵסִין &c. Gen. R. s. 79 (ref. to ויחן ‘and he encamped’ = made a חנות Gen. XXXIII, 18) Jacob was the first מעמיד א' Ar. (ed. also הטלסין, v. הֶטְלֵיס) to put up stores and sell cheap; [Koh. R. to X, 8; Est. R. to I, 9, sing., some ed. אִיתְּלִיס, אַתְּלִיס (!)]. Cmp. עַטְלֵיז, אִסְטֵל [Tosef. Ḥull. I, 7 באטלס read באַטְלֵק by throwing ; cmp. Ḥull. 12 b זרק סכין וכ'.] V. אִיטְלִיסִית.
, v. אַתְלֵיט
, v. אטְלֵיז
Tosef. Ḥull. I, 7; v. אַטְלֵיז end.
Targ. Job. III, 4 באִטְלָקוּתֵיה (Var. אִיטַלָּ') on his being thrown.
Part. pass. אָטוּם, f. אֲטוּמָה
Zeb. 61 b א' באדמה filled up with earth, opp. חָלוּל. Ḥull. 47 b א' בריאה v. אֹוטֶם. Y. B. Bath. II, 13 c top כותל א' a solid wall.

Nid. 24 a גוף א' the stump of a human body (of the embryo). Ib. אתּ שגולגלתו א' an embryo whose scull is a shapeless lump (no scull discernible). Y. ib. III, 50 d top.— Trnsf. Snh. 44 b אֹוטֵם עונות he locks up the sins (makes them invisible, cmp. טָמַן); v. אִיטְמוֹן.

sense.definition: (v. foreg.) something solid, whence the solid part, flank.
sense.notes: Targ. II, Esth. I, 2.—B. Mets. 23 b אי דדפנא אי דא' Ar. (ed. או דדפקא או דא', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 3) whether from the ribs or from the flank. Ḥull. 42 b בוקא דא' the thickest part of the flank (the thigh, hip).—B. Bath. 73 b חדא דלי א' one (goose) lifted up its thigh (leg).— Pl. אַטְמֵי. Ḥull 8 a א' דקיימי לקורבנא solid pieces (roast) intended for a present. Sabb. 49 a.—אַטְמָתָא. Snh. 59 b ed. (Ms. אַטְמָהָתָא). Lam. R. to I, 1 אַטְמָאָתָא (רבתי).—Ḥull. 97 b הנהו אַטְמָהָתָא those solid pieces of the thigh. Erub. 57 b א' דשורא ed. (Ms. אטמאתא) flanks (projecting parts) of a wall. V. אִיטְמָא.
Esth. R. to I, 14, read אֲנוֹנִים, v. אְנוֹנָא
v. אַטִּיפָא

sense.definition: , prob. אֲטַקְטִין or אֲטַקְטֵי m. pl. (ἄτακτοι) undisciplined, irregular troops.
sense.notes: Pesik. Ekhah p. 122 b (explaining: ‘thy princes are rebels’ Is. I, 23) אדוניך מריונים דהוו מזיינין א' ‘thy lords are rebels’—for they equipped irregulars. [This seems to be the proper version restored from Ar. a. Var.; v. Pesik. l. c. note 75.]

), sub. יד ימינו one whose right hand is tied up or unfit for labor; left-handed. Sabb. 103 a אי' יד. Men. 37 a only א'. Tosef. Bekh. V, 8 א' בין בידיו וכ'; Bekh. 45 b א' בין ביד וכ' one either left-handed or left-legged (v. Rashi a. l.).

sense.definition: Tripolis, on the coast of Phœnicia.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. III, 6 c top; (Bab. ib. 45 b Sidon).
Targ. Cant. II, 3 (h. text תפוח, some ed. אֶתְ'). Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 a bot.
v. אִיטְרֹון

sense.definition: (נטר; cmp. הִטְּרִי a. טָרִית) prop. something preserved, hence dough preserved, vermicelli.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥall. I, 57 d bot. as I intend making אצוותי א' my dough into vermicelli. Y. Bets. I, 60 d הדא אטריתא וכ' to make verm. (on Holy Days), if for drying them, it is forbidden &c.

sense.definition: Trachonitis, a district east of Gaulanitis.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. II, Deut. III, 14 (h. Argob). V. טרכונא.
Git. 69 b (collect.).— Pl. אַטְרְפִין, אַטְרְפֵי. Targ. Ps. I, 3. B. Mets. 114 b (Var. טרפי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).
prefix, v. אִ־
fem. of אוּ q. v.

Targ. Cant. VII, 13; a. e.—Ber. 2 a, a. fr. אי הכי (abbrev. א"ה) if this be so (introducing an argument against one’s opinion).—R. Hash. 3 a כי משמש וכ' khi has four meanings, אי if, &c.—אי נמי (abbrev. א"נ) a) if you choose, it may also be said; or. B. Mets. 98 a; a. fr.—b) even if, v. נַמִּי. Ḥull. 12 a א"נ דילמא וכ' (Rashi א"נ שמע איניש וכ') even if somebody else overheard it; a. fr.—אי אמרת בשלמא (abbr. אא"ב = בשלמא אי אמרת) I grant, if you were to say … היינו then would be right what &c.; v. בשלמא. Yoma 17 b; a. fr.—אי … אי whether … or. Targ. Koh. XI, 6. B. Mets. 98 a; a. fr.
adv. of interrogation, v. אִין II. Targ. Job XI, 2 Ms. (ed. אין).
Git. IV, 5 אי אפשר it is impossible. Keth. XII, 3 אי אפשי I want not; a. fr.

sense.definition: (abbr. of אִית, as לי = לית) there is.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. VI, 23 b bot. אי בי וכ' there is in me (the possibility of) doing, i.e. I can do it. Ib. מה אי וכ' what is it thou canst do? (v. Y. Ḥag. II, 78 a top).

sense.definition: Interj. Eh! Oh! Woe! Targ. Y. II, Lev. XXVI, 29.
sense.notes: —Taan. 7 a אי חכמה וכ' Oh, for such a brilliant mind in such an ugly vessel (body)! R. Hash. 19 a אי שמים Oh heavens!; a. fr. Y. Shek. V, end, 49 b אי לי שאני וכ' woe unto me, that I thus see thee! Y. Yeb. XIII, 14 a top; a. fr. [Babli, usually אֹוי.]

sense.definition:
(אֵיי) h.
a. ch. (b. h. אֵי, אַיֵה) where? what? how?—אי מנן whence? Targ. Josh. II, 4; a. e.
sense.notes: —Hebr. אי זה (often אֵיזֶה, אֵזֶה in one word) who? which? Y. Kil. VIII, beg. 31 b לאי זה דבר נאמר with regard to what (in what way, sense) has it been said? Y. Shebi. I, beg. 33 a ואי זה זה and which (ploughing time) is this?; a. v. fr.—Y. Peah III, 17 c top ואיי דינו מירוג (= אידין) and what is the meaning of merog? Kerith. 6 b לאיי מיצרך צריכי what need is there (of the others)? Cmp. אֵיזֶה; אֵימָתי; כֵּיצַד.
v. אֵב
Targ. Gen. IV, 3; a. e.; v. אִנְבָּא.
Targ. Y. Num. XXX, 4; a. fr.
I, pl. איבְבַיָּא. Targ. I Kings VI, 38 (ed. Vien. אִבְּבַיָא).

entry.language-reference: אָיַב, √או or אב, cmp. אַבְאָבִית, אָוֶן, עָוֹן)

sense.notes: Snh. III, 5 an enemy is he who has not spoken to his neighbor for three days בא' in his grudge; a. fr.—משום (מפני) א' for the sake of preventing ill-feeling. Y. Dem. IV, 24 a; a. fr.
Y. Yoma VIII, 44 d bot. הכלה מפני א' the bride (is permitted to wash her face on the Day of Atone.) that she may not lose her attraction.

cmp. אבל) [ black], name of a bird (h. אֲנָפָה) vulture or kite. Targ. O. Lev. XI, 19; Deut. XIV, 18 (Targ. Y. אוכמתא). [Targ. Y. I, II Deut. XIV, 13; 14, gloss to v. 18; confounded with v. 13—h. text אַיָּה.]—אִיבּוּ pr. n. m., v. אִבּוּ.
Ab. Zar. 33 a אזיל לא' is wasted. Ḥull. 11 b משום א' נשמה to prevent loss of life (to save the convict). Bets. 22 a אִבּוּד ממון pecuniary loss; a. fr.
Yeb. IV, 10; a. e.
ch., v. אִבּ'
v. אֵבוּס
, v. אָמוּס

sense.definition: (אָבַס) stuffing, forcing food down the animal’s throat.
sense.notes: Erub. 20 b (first time) והא אי' כמאן וכ' in stuffing, is it not as if taking a vessel in hand &c.? [Second time והא א' כמאן וכ' omitted in Ms. M.]

sense.definition: (prob. contr. of איבעיר'; בער), א' דזהרא lamp-lighters, hand-maids who attended to the lights.
sense.notes: Y. Yoma III, beg. 40 b; Y. R. Hash. II, beg. 57 d R. … handled things forbidden to handle on the Sabbath על פום א' דז' (Y. R. Hash. l. c., insert פום) on the lamplighters’ declaring that night had set in (חשיכה מוצאי שבת). [The context proves that our w. designates a person or persons.]
. Targ. O. Gen. L, 10; a. e. ed. Berl., oth. ed. אֶבְלָא.
, v. אֲבֵילִין

sense.definition: (= אִי בָּעִית, v. בעי) if thou so desirest; or.
sense.notes: וא' אימא—א' אימא (abbr. אב"א) if you choose, I may say … or if you prefer (another solution) I may say … Yoma 28 b; a. fr.

Targ. Job. II, 4 (Ms. אֶיבְרָא). Yoma 25 b.—Trnsf. arm, wing, pinion. Sabb. 90 b א' דשמאלא left arm.— Pl. אֵיבָרִין, אֵיבָרַיָּא. Targ. Lev. I, 8, a. e. ( pieces). Targ. Ezek. XVII, 3; Deut. XXXII, 11 (wings).
Targ. Y. Gen. XIV, 2; I ibid. XLIX, 24.—[B. Mets. 84 a, v. אִיבְרָיָה.]

sense.definition: (אבר to be strong) indeed, to be sure.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 59 b א' חזינא ליה indeed, I should like to see him. Git. 56 b top א' מלכא את indeed, thou art a sovereign.

sense.definition: (v. next w.) enough for a meal in the household.
sense.notes: Erub. 82 b תרתי רִיפָתָא א' Ms. M. (ed. איכרייתא, Asheri, ed. Ven. כברייתא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) two large loaves of the household (or of mourners’ meals). [Rashi, expl. our w. as loaves of drivers of oxen, appears to have had before him the vers. of Ms. M. and to derive our w. from ברא, v. בַּר I a. אֲפַר.]
B. Mets. 84 a א' דר' וכ' one meal of R. Ismael &c. (v. Rabb. D. S. to איבריאתא, Erub. 82 b, note
; cmp. Pesik. B’shall. p. 90 b sq., a. Ber. 44 a). [Some read אֵיבָרֵיה v. אֵיבָרָא 2).]
Y. M. Kat. III, 82 b bot. read אִיכָּרָיו; v. אִיכָּר. [V. however, אִיבְרָיָאתָא end.]
Y. M. Kat. III, end, 83 d, v. הֹובְרָיָּא
, v. אֵגֶד
v. אֵגֹור a. אֲגֹורָא.
. Targ. Zeph. I, 5 (pl.) אִיגּוּריָּא (ed. Vien. אֱגֹו').
v. אֵגֹורִי
Gen. R. s. 20, end.
v. אִגְלָא
Arakh. 32 a; Meg. 5 b שור א' a city line formed by joining roofs, opp. חֹומָה.—

sense.definition: (also אִיגּ' with Dagesh) const. אִיגַר same.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XXI, 9; a. fr.—Ruth. R. to I, 17 (Par. 3) איגר פלטין roof of the palace. Git. 85 b (Rashi איגרת, corr. acc.), v. אִגֶּרֶת.— Pl. אִיגָרַיָּא, אִיגָרַיָּיא; אִיגָרֵי. Targ. II Kings XIX, 26; a. e.—Y. Pes. VII, 35 b (Cant. R. to II, 14 אברייאה, corr. acc.); v. זֵיתָא I. Lam. R. introd. (R. Yoḥ.
ולא' סלקין and they ascend the roofs. Pes. 111 b דבי א' those (demons) dwelling on roofs.
q. v.
, v. אִגֶּרֶת

sense.definition: f. אִיגְּרָא m. (= h. אִגֶּרֶת) letter &c. Targ. II Kings V. 5; a. fr.—Y. Ned. X, end, 42 b, a. e. א' דאיקר letter of honor, recommendation.
sense.notes: Sabb. 115 a; a. fr.—B. Mets. 83 b; Snh. 82 a; 96 a (prov.) קריינא דא' איהו ליהוי פרוונקא let him who composed the letter be himself its carrier.— Pl. (of אִיגְּרָא) אִיגְּרִין. Targ. Y. II Num. XXII, 7 אִגְּ'.—Targ. Is. XXXIX, 1.—אִיגָּרָן, אִיגָּרָאן, אִיגָּרָתָא, אִיגָּרָאתָא. Targ. I Kings XXI, 9; a. fr.—Y. Keth. II, 26 b bot. Y. Ned. VI, 40 a bot. Y. Snh. I, 19 a top.
Gen. R. s. 13, v. אֵד.

Ab. Zar. 7 b יום אֵידָם the very day of their festival.— Pl. אֵידִים. Ib. I, 2, a. fr. (של נכרים) אֵידֵיהֶן. Ib. 2 a; Y. Erub. V, beg. 22 a (controversy as to spelling with א' or with ע). [As to cacophemistic designation, cmp. אבידן &c.]
Targ. Esth. I, 3. Targ. Prov. VII, 20.
, v. אֵידֵין a. הֵידָא.

sense.definition: (= ידא; v. אִ־) hand (only in Targ. Y.).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. IX, 26; a. fr.— Pl. אִידַיָּא, אַיְדַיָּא, אִידֵי. Targ. Ps. XXIV, 4; a. fr.

sense.definition: (= אִי דָא, v. אוּ a. דָּא) this, the same.
sense.notes: Y. Erub. III, 21 b bot. הדא אמרה אי א' אי א' this proves this is this, this is that, i.e. it is the same. [Ib. היא הדא היא הדא.]
Succ. 35 a; v. הִידֹור.
v. אַדְווּתָא
pl. of אִידֵּךְ.
Y. Yoma VII, beg. 44 a. Snh. 38 b; a. e.

sense.definition: who now? what now? which now? ( quisnam, quidnam).
sense.notes: Targ. I Sam. VI, 20. Targ. Jer. II, 10; a. fr.—Tam. 32 a א' מתקרי חכים who is to be called wise? Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד מאת' 4) אחמי לי אידא וכ' show me now which of these is from a white goat &c. Y. Pes. II, 28 c top ואיידא אמר דא what (passage) now says this (is this derived from)? Y. Sot. V, 20 c bot. ואיידי חובתא עבדית and what is the sin I have committed? Lam. R. to III, 7 באידנא אסטרטיא וכ' by which road did you come?

sense.definition: (ellipt.) what do you want? Y. B. Kam. V, beg. 4 d, v. הֵידָא.

sense.notes: , v. אוּדְ'
, v. אִידִי

sense.definition: a. fem. (= דֵּךְ, with אִי prosth.
sense.notes: ) this, that, freq. the other, another. Yeb. 62 a; a. fr. תניא א' another (author or Boraitha) teaches. Ib. 22 b בא' קרא in another verse. B. Mets. 98 b וא' לא ידענא and as to the other (cow), I don’t know; a. fr.— Pl. אִידֵּי.—א' וא' these and those, i.e. both. Yeb. 8 a; a. fr.
v. אִדְכָּרוּ

sense.definition: (אדד, v. אוּדְרָא) low-cotton, &c., esp. bast twisted for a wick.
sense.notes: Sabb. II, 1, expl. in Babli (20 b) אחוינא, v. אַחְוָונָא 3), in Y. (4 c) עידניתא.
v. אֵידֵין

—הָאִידְּנָא this time, now, to-day. Targ. Y. Deut. I, 6 (usu. with ע).—Yeb. 62 a לילא דהא' this night. Yoma 19 b הא' יומא וכ' to-day is the Day of Atone. Ber. 4 a כי הא' at this very time (hour). Kid. 71 b והא' דאיכא רמאי but now-a-days when there are deceivers; a. fr.
v. אִדַּר
, read
Y. Shebi. III, beg. 37 b

idrânu, v. Fred. Del. Hebr. Lang. p. 24; cmp. חֵדֶר) an enclosure, chamber, esp. dark alcove, bed-room. Targ. Job XXXVII, 9. Meg. 26 b איד' דהוה וכ' a room where the corpse was placed before burial. B. Bath. 7 a השתא משוית לי איד' ed. (Ms. M. והשתא אינד') now thou makest my (formerly open) compartment a lightless alcove. Ḥull. 52 b; a. e.—Men. 33 b (fem.) א' מעלייתא a fine room. B. Kam. 85 b, v. הַרְזֵק. Taan. 25 a עיילא לאינ' she went up to the bed-room.
= preced.
v. דְּרִי II

, Koh. R. to IV, 7 זו אידרתו של מלאך המות (Var. in Y’dê Mosheh a. l. של א"ה), a corruption of a mutilated clause, part of which is to be found in Deut. R. s. 2 where Prov. XXIV, 21 is reprehended and Solomon is made to emend it with Koh. IV, 8 יש אחד ואין שני. The passage restored would probably read: זו ירא את ר' בני ומלך עם וג'. אמר ר' אחא כעס הקב"ה … חזר ופירש את הדבר יש אחד ואין שני וכ'.

sense.definition: Y. Dem. V, 24 d, a corruption; prob. אִינֹוקְפֵילַיָּא m. pl. (οἰνοκάπηλοι) keepers of wine-shops, opp. שפייא; q. v.

sense.notes: Git. 35 a א' מרי A. Mari, surname of one Aḥa b. Hidya.

sense.definition: (v. next w. a. הָא) that, the same.
sense.notes: Targ. Ruth I, 16.

sense.definition: , אִיהִי f. (= הוּ, הִי, v. אִ־) he, himself; she, herself.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. V, 3. Targ. Esth. I, 1; a. v. fr.—Gen. R. s. 49 יסב א' וכ' let himself take ashes; a. fr.— Pl. אִינְהוּ m., אִינְהִי f.; נִיהוּ, נִינְהוּ; אִינָךְ, אִינוּן m., אִינִין f. (contr. אִנּוּן, אִנִּין); very freq.—Y. Bicc. II, end, 65 b דינון מרין = דאינון אמרין. Y. Meg. I, 71 a top אילין אינין are there only these (differences between the Sabbath and Festivals)?
v. foreg.

sense.definition: , א' דַקִּירָא (האי) pr. n. pl. Ihi Dakkira, Is, a city on the W.
sense.notes: banks of the Euphrates, and upon a little river of the same name; (v. Rapap. Er. Mill. p. 33, a. Sm. Class. Dict. s. v. Is). Kid. 72 a א' ד' (Ar. האי). B. Bath. 24 a Ms. R. א' דקי' (ed. האי דקרא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). Ber. 59 b (v. Rabb. D. a. l.).
Bets. 37 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Job, the personage after whom the Biblical book (ספר א') the Book of Job is named.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 14 b; 15 a sq. Y. Sot. V, end, 20 cd. Nid. 52 ab; a. fr.
Yalk. Ex. 376, read אוותנטאות, v. אַוְותֶּנְטִי
, v. אִוְיָא

sense.definition: , pl.אִיזַיָּא m. (אזז, cmp. גזיזא, חזיז, אזד) prickly twigs.
sense.notes: Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 b bot. (to one who dreamt that people ran before him—meaning power) דאת מייתי א' וכ' thou wilt carry prickly twigs and everybody will run away from thee. [V. Lam. R. quot. s. v. גְּבַב.]
, v. אֵזֹוב

sense.definition: (Targ. Y. עִזְגַּד, עַזְגַּד) m. (contr. of גזגזדא, ג softened into א or ע, cmp. אזד, אדרזדא; also מזדנדז = מזדעזע, s. v. זעזע; Massorah אִיסְגַּד־, אִסְגַּד־, Ispe.
sense.notes: of גזז; Berl. Targ. O. II, pp. 63, 68; cmp. Mand. אשגאנדא, Nöld. Mand. Gr. lithog. table; v. גּוּז, גזז) runner. Targ. Y. Gen. XLIX, 21 ע' קליל a light runner; a. e. In gen. messenger. Pl. אִיזְגַּדִּין, אִיזְגַּדַיָּא, עִזְ', עַזְ, אִיסְ'. Targ. Is. XVIII, 2; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: (for איזדגרד) Yesdigerd, Yezdjird, a Persian King.
sense.notes: Zeb. 19 a top. Keth. 61 a bot. אזגוד (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: , pl. אִיזְגָּרִין (גרר, v. אֵגֹור; prefix איז', cmp. אִיזְמֵל a. אִיזְגַּד) mounds.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 74 בחקל דאית ביה א' וכ' in a field in which there are mounds (behind which people may hide) talk no secrets. [Muss. incorr. ד for ר.]
v. זְקַר

sense.definition:
, אֵיזוּ f. (b. h.
אֵיזֶה = אֵי זֶה, אֵיזֶה הוּא, אֵי זוּ) who? what? which? Ab. IV, 1 איזהו חכם who is wise?; a. v. fr.—באיזה צד in what manner, v. כֵּיצַד.
sense.notes: [Chald. אֵידֵין, אֵידָא.]
, v. foreg., a. אֵיזִי.
, v. אֵז'

sense.definition: (v. אֵיזֶה = b. h. אֵיפֹוא, אֵפֹה, אֵפֹו) now, then, pray.
sense.notes: Yoma 30 b אודו לי א' (miss. in Mss., Ms. M. 2 זי) admit then at least. B. Mets. 70 a אימא לי איזו tell me now; a. e. V. הֵידֵין.

51 b אי' ומקרבי קיטרי a net in which the knots are close. Erub. 28 b אוזלתא דאיכרי Ms. M. (ed. אוזילתא, Ar. איזולתא) the twist (of bunches) of the farmer.— Pl. אִיזְלֵי. M. Kat. 11 a. Git. 60 b אוּזְלֵי; v. אוֹהֲרָא.—Erub. 8 a פסק ליה לסורא באו' (ed. Sonc. אי') he separated the court-yards of Sura with nets ( hurdles, matting).
m., v. הִיזְמָא. Tosef. Kil. I, 11 ed. Zuck. (ed. corrupt אזמאזמא).

sense.definition: (זמל √מל; cmp. b. h. סמל; cmp. אִיזְגָּרָא) cutting tool, knife, esp. surgeon’s knife.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XVI, 9; a. e.—Ḥull. 31 a א' שיש לו קרנים a knife which has hornlike projections as ornaments. Y. Sabb. XIX, beg. 16 d אנשון מייתי או' they had forgotten to bring the knife (for circumcision). Ex. R. s. 26 man מכה באי' וכ' wounds with a knife (operating) and heals &c. Pl. Chald. אִזְמֵלַיָּיא; אִזְמַלְוָון (f.). Targ. Is. XLIV, 13. Targ. Josh. V, 2.
, Y. Shebi. IV, 35 a, v. זְמַר I
, v. אִסְקוּפָה

sense.definition: (אחי, Pi.) the act of stitching together seam, esp. with ref. to the rent of garments in mourning.
sense.notes: Y. M. Kat. III, 83 b top; a. e.—M. Kat. 26 b א' אלכסנדרי Alexandrian (invisible) seam.
Y. Meg. III, 74 b top.
Targ. Ps. LXXXIX, 52, const. אִיחוּר.

sense.definition: (Ithp. of חטא) one in the habit of sinning.
sense.notes: Y. Taan. I, 64 a top הוה א' בלישניה was foul-mouthed; v. Arakh. 15 b

sense.definition: (ἦτα) the letter (η) of the Greek Alphabet, the numerical value of which is eight ; used in the way of a phonetic play (ἤτω, or ἰτά as though an adj. verbale of ἰέναι) to indicate going or death.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 14, beg. (proving that a seven months’ child can live, while an eight months’ child cannot) מדידכון אנא ממטי איט"א אוכ"טא, לכון זיט"א אפ"טא from your own (Greek) language I will prove it to you, ‘ Live (ζήτω) seven, Go, eight’ (ζ = ἕπτα, η = ὄκτω). Y. Yeb. IV, 5 d top; Tanḥ. B’midbar 18 (corr. acc.); Ibid. (ed. Buber) 21.
, v. אִיטַלְיָא
v. אִיטָא
Y. Snh. I, 18 d top א' עבדתני וכ' how thou hast been the cause of my putting rabbis to shame!
v. אֱטִימוֹס
, v. אֱטִימַ'
v. אִטְל'

sense.definition: Italy, esp. the southern part of the peninsula, called Magna Graecia.
sense.notes: Meg. 6 b ed. Ven. (omitt. in later ed.) א' של יון זה כרך גדול של רומי וכ' (Ms. M. שברומי v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) Greek Italy, that means the great city of Rome &c. Gen. R. s. 37 beg. Ib. s. 67 איטאליה.—Targ. Ezek. XXVII, 7; a. e.—Targ. I Chr. I, 7 אִיטַלְיֹון.
, v. אַטְלֵיז
Pl. אִיטְלִיסִיֹּות. Tanḥ. Masé 11; ib. (ed. Buber אִיטְלֵסִיֹּות); v. אִסְטַלִּי.
, v. אַטְלָקוּתָא
Kid. I, 1 איסר הא' As Italicus, Italian as. Snh. VIII, 2 באיטלקי Y. ed. (Bab. הא', corr. acc.); Lev. R. s. 37 באיטלקית in Italian measure. Y. Sabb. XVIII, beg. 16 c; a. e.
Lam. R. to I, 1 (העיר), דא' read דְּאִיטָא v. דְּיִיטִי
Kid. 70 b

sense.definition: Itmon, surname of the angel Gabriel ( coverer of sin).
sense.notes: Snh. 44 b; v. אָטַם.

sense.definition: (אטט; cmp. חטט, a. אָטָט) calamus, a reed used for writing (cmp. b. h. עֵט).
sense.notes: Tosef. Kil. III, 14 Var. ed. Zuck. (text אוטם, prob. אִיטִּים). Y. Kil. V, end, 30 a חִיטִּין. V. הִיטְּנֵי.
Sot. 48 b א' של אבר (Y. Sot. IX, 24 b bot. a. Ar. טני) a leaden tube (Rashi = גּוּבְתָּא). V. טְנִי.
v. אִטֵּר
B. Mets. 39 b; B. Bath. 29 b Ms. M., v. עִיטְרָא
Targ. Is. IX, 13; XIX, 15.
read אִיסְטְרַטִּילָטִין, v. אִסְטְרַטִּילָטָא

, v. אִבּוּ
, v. אֵידֵין
Sabb. 109 b א' פומיה through his mouth.—Naz. 2 a א' בהמה through the instrumentality of the animal; a. fr.
א' דתני … תני נמי as the compiler had to state this, he incidentally mentions also the other. Kid. 65 a; a. fr.
Snh. 106 a, v. זְנֵי
Af. of אֲכַל.
&c., v. איל'

sense.definition: (= אי הלין) where are those?, which?.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. II, 5 b א' רבנן which rabbis?
, Pi. of אָיַם.
, Pi. of אָיַן.

sense.definition: (cmp. הֵיינוּ) is it he? Cant. R. to V, 16 א' בריך is this thy son?

sense.notes: read אִסְפְּלָנִית.

sense.definition: Y. Dem. VII, 26 b, R. S. to Dem. VII, 3 אטימויי', אטימוס, prob. אֲטֹונֹוס m. (ἄτονος) languid, feeble.
(אור; cmp. b. h. זִיו) Iyar, the second month of the Hebrew calendar, of twenty nine days, varying betw.
sense.notes: the tenth of April and the eighth of June. R. Hash. 3 a; a. fr. [V. Schrader K. A. T. glossary.]

sense.definition: (אור; cmp. יְאֹר esp. Job XXVIII, 10; v. H.
sense.notes: Dict. s. v.) channel, duct. Y. M. Kat. I, 80 b bot. א' דציפורין וכ' the duct of Zepph. was damaged during the festive week.
v. ארי, אֲרָא.
) woolen. Esth. R. to I, 6 (ref. to Aquila’s translation).
v. אַיְשַׁר
Targ. Prov. XX, 20; a. fr.
Targ. O. Gen. XXXVII, 16 (ed. Berl.); a. e., v. אֵיכַן a. הֵיכָא.

sense.definition: there is, there are ( sunt qui).
sense.notes: א' דאמרי (abbrev. א"ד.) some say. Ḥull. 3 b; a. fr. א' בינייהו they differ in this &c. Ib. 4 a; a. fr.—מאי א' למימר what is there to say? how can it be explained? what can you reply? Ib. 12 a top; a. fr.—
Targ. Prov. XIX, 7. [Prob. to be read אִינָא.]

sense.definition: how then! how! Targ. O. Deut. I, 12; a. e.; V. אֵיכָא.
oh how! oh! Gen. R. s. 19; a. fr.
Ekhah, name of the Book of Lamentations, also מגילת א'.
sense.notes: —א' רבתי Ekhah Rabbathi ( Lam. R.), Midrash Rabboth on Lamentations.

sense.definition: (= (= אי כה) if now; oh that.
sense.notes: Bets. 4 b top א' השתא אשתלאי if I (had given my decision forthwith) I should have made a mistake. Yeb. 46 a.—Snh. 107 a א' זממא וכ' oh that a muzzle had been put on my enemy’s (euphem. for my) mouth! i.e. oh that I never had said this!
Taan. 35 a what is thy name? She said, Ikhu.—Said he א' נמטו כשוריך oh that thy joists were sufficiently long!
Y. Ber. IV, 7 b top, a. e. א' איברים the consumption on the altar of the pieces of the daily offering; v. אֵבֶר. [V. עִיכּוּל.]
Y. Sabb. II, 4 d ההן א' black naphta.
v. אוּכָּף

where, &c. Targ. Gen. XXXVII, 16. Y. Ber. I, 3 b bot. א' יצאת בת קול where did that divine voice come forth? Ib. III, 6 a bot. מא' ללמוד one from whom to learn. Ib. IV, 7 a מא' למדו וכ' whence did they derive the obligation of three prayers?—עד א' how far? how long? Y. Peah VIII, beg. 20 d. Cant. R. to VI, 4; a. e. [In Babli הֵיכַן q. v.]
Esth. R. to I, 1 b בני אי' (Var. אוכ'), v. אוּכַּיְיפָא
v. אַכְפָּה
Arakh. VI, 3 (23 b) אם היה אי' (Mish. אכ') if he is a husbandman; a. e.— Pl. אִיכָּרִים. Y. M. Kat. III, 82 b bot. איבריו (read אִיכָּרָיו) his farm-hands. [V. איבריו.]

Targ. Is. XXI, 10; a. e.— Pl. אִיכָּרִין, אִיכָּרַיָּיא, אִיכָּרֵי. Targ. Jer. XXXI, 23; a. e.—Erub. 28 b, v. אִיזְלָא.—*Denom. אִיכַּרְיָיתָא f. pl. Erub. 82 b רפתא א' farmer’s loaves; v., however, אִיבְרָיָאתָא.
v. אִכְ'
v. אִיכָּרָא

sense.definition: superiority, patronage, arbitration; v. Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXXVIII, 5.
sense.notes: Ib. to Ps. CIV, 29 (ref. to Is. LVII, 19 peace, peace &c.) אילולי (אֱיָילֹו) אֱיָלֹו של וכ' but for the peace-making arbitration of the Lord &c.

B. Kam. 65 b if one stole טלה ונעשה א' a lamb and it grew to be a ram. Ib. א' בן יומו קרוי א' a ram one day old is called a ram ( ayil is used in a general sense, irrespective of age). R. Hash. 16 a; a. fr.—[* Pl. אֵלִים. Tosef. R. Hash. III (II), 3 (Var. יעלים).]—
אַיָּל q. v.] a species of locusts. Eduy. VIII, 4; Pes. 16 a; Ab. Zar. 37 a אייל ed. (Ms. M. אייול), v. דְּכֵי.

sense.definition: prob. fr. אול = עול, cmp. Var. lect.
sense.notes: of אַיֶּלֶת II; cmp. אלל) [ the climber], hart. Ḥull. 28 a; a. e.

sense.definition: ; trnsf. beak of a ship (a beam to which the head of a ram was attached), prow.
sense.notes: Ned. 50 a

sense.definition: projection from a lateral wall, buttress, &c. Targ. Ezek.
sense.notes: XL, 48; a. e. (Var. אֵלָא).—

sense.definition: (cmp. אַיִּל 2) name of a worm or mite in grapes.
sense.notes: Sabb. 90 a איל (Rashi a. Ms. Oxf. איי').
Targ. O. Deut. XIV, 5; a. fr.—Bekh. 7 b.— Pl. אַיָּלִין, אַיָּלַיָּא, אַיָּי'. Targ. Y. Deut. l. c. (ed. Vien. אִילְיָן!) Targ. Lam. I, 6.
; a Tannai. Bekh. IV, 5 (29 a), a medical expert כא' ביבנה like I. in Yabneh’.
an Amora. Yoma 73 b; a. fr. [Other forms אילעא, אילי, הילא; v. Frankel M’bo p. 75 b.]
v. אֶלָּא. Y. Shebu. I, 33 b bot. לא מסתברא דאי' v. חִילּוּפָא.
v. אִילְצָרָא
v. אֱלָהּ
B. Bath. 16 b top א' רחמה צר the hind has a narrow womb (vagina).

sense.definition: mostly אילת השחר the first rays (climber) of the morning dawn; cmp. Yoma 29 a.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 2 c; a. fr.; (cmp. Gen. XIX, 15 השחר עלה).
v. אֵלּוּ
, Pesik. R. s. 17 א' פילוס v. אִילְיֹופֹּולִיס

sense.definition:
(late b. h. = אִן
לוּ; cmp. Ez. III, 6) if (oh that!).
sense.notes: Targ. Ez. l. c.; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 12 א' היו … היתה נאה if the pillars had been higher, it would have looked better; a. fr.—וא' but if ( considering), whereas. Ber. 20 a; a. fr.—וא' ר' whereas R. Yudah &c.—א' … וא' while …, in this case on the contrary. Ib. 37 a דא' במעשה … ואי' וכ' for while over pot-dishes we say the benediction &c., here, in our case we say—; a. fr. Y. Shebu. I, 33 b top—ש אי' מי in the case of one who …—כְּאִילּוּ, כְּאִלּוּ, contr. כִּילּוּ as if, as though. Y. Maas. Sh. V, 56 d bot. כא' לפניו שינה as if the Lord were, so to say, asleep, when Israel is in trouble; a. v. fr.—Y. Kil. IV, end, 29 d כילו.

sense.definition: (elogium) record, bill of indictment, sentence stating the crime, verdict.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 15 שאעביר אי' שלכם I may set aside (cancel) your verdict. Ib. s. 31 אל'. [Corr. acc. Num. R. s. 16 אליגון; Gen. R. s. 28, beg. אגאליגין; Lam. R. to I, 14 אנלוגין, אולוגלוגין Ar.; Midr. Till. to Ps. I, 5 אגלין; Pesik. R. s. 44 אמלוגין, אמלגין.]
Git. 69 b, v. אַלְוָא
Targ. Job. III, 7 Ms. (ed. אִלְיוּתָא; h. text לִוְיָתָן).
. Targ. Y. Num. XIV, 37.

sense.definition: (b. h. לוּלֵי = אִילּוּ לֹא, ch. אִילּוּ לָא) were it not, but for (followed by h. שֶׁ־, ch. דְּ־, or by a noun without a verb; v. אִלְמָלֵא).
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. I, 1; a. e.—Mekh. B’shall., Amalek 1 א' שאמר משה but for Moses, who said &c; a. fr.

sense.definition: (followed by a verb without ש־ or ד־ = אִילּוּלֻא h. אִילּוּ) if indeed, if.
sense.notes: . Targ. Koh. VI, 6. Targ. Esth. VII, 4; a. e.—

sense.definition: oh that! Num. R. s. 2, beg. א' הוא מדגיל וכ' oh that He would allow His love to be a banner over me! [אלואי as in preceding lines?]—

sense.notes: Targ. Cant. VI, 11 א' פשן וכ' whether the sages among them increase &c.

sense.definition: (= preced. with פון = h. פֶּן) if not perchance, but for.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. XXXI, 42; a. fr. (in some ed. in two words אילולי פון).

sense.definition: (prob. fr. אַיִל; cmp. זָכָר a. דְּכַי) ( the man-like) barren, wombless, incapable of conception.
sense.notes: Keth. 11 a (etymol. from אַיִל) איי' דוכרנית aylonith means ram-like. Nid. V, 9 (47 b); a. fr.
, v. אִלְסִיס
, v. אֹולֹוסֵירִיקָא
Y. Ter. I, 40 c top.
, v. אִלְסִיס

sense.definition: (ילי, אלי, v. ילל; cmp. אֱלִי Joel I, 8) mourning, lamentation, dirge.
sense.notes: Targ. II Sam. I, 17; II Chron. XXXV, 25; a. fr.—Y. Sot. VII, 21 c top; Meg. I, 71 b bot. סורסי לאילייא Syriac is adapted for dirges; Esth. R. to I, 22 פרסי לאלייה (corr. acc.).

Ex. R. s. 15. [The words from סנדריאוס to אורח are a marginal gloss, prob. to be emended: (אלכ) סנדרוס איוס איליאו היה שמו והשמש וכ' Ἀλέξανδρος ὑιὸς Ἡλίου (Alexander the son of Helios) was his name, and the Sun is called a hero &c.]
Pesik. Vayhi p. 63 b Ar. (ed. פוליס); Pesik. R. s. 17 אילו פוליס (corr. acc.)

sense.definition: (= אִי if, and לֵימָא = לֵימַר) prop. if to say, hence a dialectic term in debate, you do not mean to say, or shall I say? B. Mets. 12 b א' כשחייב מודה shall I say (it means) when the debtor concedes (his indebtedness)? Kid. 74 a אהייא א' וכ' what does it refer to? You cannot say it refers to … Sabb. 150 b (some ed. אל').
sense.notes: Yoma 52 b; a. v. fr.
, v. אִילֵּין
Tosef. Kil. V, 26, ed. Zuck. קלא אילן, v. קלא אילן.
, v. אַיָּלָא

sense.definition:
com. pl. (h.
אֵלֶּה, אֵלּוּ) these, those.
sense.notes: Targ. Jud. XX, 17; a. e.—Y. Ber. V, 9 c top א' דמתרגמין those who translate; a. v. fr.—Y. Erub. III, 20 d top אילין אינון insert מאי, what are those (names mentioned)?
, v. אָלִיס
, v. אָלְיְתָא

sense.definition:
a.
h.; cmp. אִילֵּין) hither, thither.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XXII, 4.—(מכן) מכאן וא' from now and further on, i.e. after that. Targ. Esth. II, 14. Ber. I, 2; a. fr.—Men. 28 b אחד א' ואחד א' one in this, another in that direction. Erub. 55 b. [Diff. from. אִלֵּךְ.] V. הֵילֵךְ.
Y. Kid. IV, 65 d top; v. עילָם.
v. אִלְּמָא
, v. אִלֵּימְנָא

sense.definition: (cmp. b. h. אֵלֹון oak, v. אֵלָה) tree.
sense.notes: Shebi. I, 1, a. e. שדה הא' a field containing at least three trees within a distance of a S’ah (v. סְאָה). Ib. 3 א' סרק bearing no edible fruit, opp. א' מאכל.—Pes. 112 a (prov.) אם בקשת וכ' if you desire to be strangled, be hanged on a large tree, (if you must refer to an authority, select a good one).— Pl. אִילָּנֹות, const. אִילָּנֵי. Shebi. I, 2. Gen. R. s. 16; a. fr.

Targ. Gen. I, 11; a. fr.—Ab. Zar. 50 b, v. ברי ch.— Pl. אִילָנִין, אִילָנַיָּיא, אִילָנַיָּא, אִילָנֵי, אִלָ'. Targ. Gen. II, 5; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 12 מתקריין וכ' (insert פיריהון) א' fruits are named after the trees. B. Bath. 16 b; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 5 א' דסדום, v. אמבוניא.—[קלא א', תלא א', v. s. קְלָא a. תְּלָא respectively.]
, v. אָלִיס
, v. אִלְצָרִין

êlippu) ship, raft. Targ. Jon. I, 3; a. e.—Lev. R. s. 12, beg. כהדא א' like the ship tossed about on high sea. Koh. R. to III, 2 (prov.) at the time thou tiest thy Lulab (for the Feast of Booths) קטר אלפך tie thy ship (cease navigation). Ab. Zar. 10 b ווי לה לאי' וכ' woe to the ship which leades without having paid its toll (of a convert who died before circumcision).—Trnsf. the body of a chicken ( chest-bone resembling a ship). Lam. R. to I, 1 נסבית הדין אי' וכ' (רבתי) I took for myself this ship (of the chicken), for in a ship I came &c.— Pl. אִילְפַיָּא. Targ. Ps. CIV, 26; a. e.
Taan. 21 a; a. fr. [In. Talm. Y. חילפיי]. R. Hash. 17 b אילְפָי וא"ל א' Ilfay or, some say, Ilfa (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.)
, v. preced.
v. אַיָּלָה

אֵילַת) Ayeleth, one day’s journey south of Jerusalem. Maas. Sh. V, 2; Bets. 5 a עלת ed. (Ms. M. איילת); R. Hash. 31 b אילת ed. (Ms. M. עַיֶּילֶת; Ms. L. עלת corr. into עיי'; Ms. 2 עגלת; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). [Bets. a. R. Hash. l. c. read מן הדרום for מן הצפון a. vice versa.] Cmp. אַיָּל.
Targ. Jer. XIV, 5; a. e. Cant. R. to II, 9; a. e.—א' דשחרא (v. אַיָּלָה) morning dawn. Y. Ber. I, 2 c; a. e.— Pl. אַיָּילָתָא, אַיָּילָאתָא. Targ. Ps. XXIX, 9; a. e.

sense.definition: (√או, v. אֵיבָה) to feel aversion, fright.
sense.notes: Denomin. אֵימָה.

sense.definition: (denom. of אֵימָה; with על) to impress with awe, forewarn (witnesses).
sense.notes: R. Hash. 20 a מְאַיְּימִין על העדים we may try to intimidate &c. Yoma 4 b לְאַיֵּים עליו to impress him. Sot. I, 4; a. e.
, v. אֲמָא
my mother; v. אַבָּא. Targ. Gen. III, 20; a. fr.—Ber. 18 b אֵימא לה לא' tell my mother; a. fr.—א' זקינה grandmother. Meg. 27 b

sense.definition: trnsf. the flesh of a stone fruit.
sense.notes: Sabb. 143 a חזיין אגב אִימָּן may be handled on account of the flesh (with which they were surrounded when Sabbath cause).— Pl. אִימָּהָתָא, אִמְהָתָא. Targ. Jer. XVI, 3; esp. the arch-mothers of the Israel. nation. Targ. Y. Ex. XVII, 9; a. e.—Kid. 82 a א' דינוקי the mothers of school children. [V. also אִימָּה II.]
Imma. Y. Git. I, 43 c; Shebi VI, 36 c top א' שלום Imma (Mother) Shalom.
, v. אִמָּאוּס

sense.definition: (אמם, √אם to gather; cmp. אוּמָּה a. עמם I in Ges. H. Dict.) distaff.
sense.notes: Kel. XI, 6 (Ar. אימא, Var. עִימָּא).

Num. R. s. 9; Y. Sot. I, beg. 16 b אלא מתוך דבר של אמה (read אימה) but from a solemn conversation (v., however, Maim. Sotah IV, 18 a. comment.). R. Hash. 17 a; a. fr.— Pl. אֵימֹות. Sabb. 77 b חמש א' הן there are five sorts of fear. [Tanḥ. Tsav 2 (אימות) אימת שירוף, v. אִימּוּס.]
, v. אֵם
, v. אֵימְתָן
, v. אומולוגייא
, v. אִמּוּם. [Tosef. Kid. IV, 8 באימום read בבִימֹוס.]
Koh. R. to VII, 11, v. אִמָּאוּס
Sabb. 141 b, v. אִמּוּם

א' שירוף one disfigured by burns. Cant. R. to VII, 9 ונעשה א' ש' and he (Nebucadn.) became &c. [Tanḥ. Tsav. 2 (ed. Buber 3) ונעשה אֵימַת שירוף עליו and the fright (repulsiveness) of a burned face was put upon him. Midr. Till. to Ps. XXII אמבירוס, read אֶמְפּוּרֹוס, ἔμπυρος, fire-scathed.]
, v. אֲמַר

sense.definition: (אמר, v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.; cmp. Deut. XXVI, 17 sq.
sense.notes: ) devoted objects, sacrifices. Succ. 55 b אֲמוּרֵי הרגלים וכ' (Mish. ib. אֵימ') are not the festive Emurim (v. infra) the Lord’s, i.e. to be offered on the altar? Answ. מה שאמור ברגלים Emuré &c. means, whatever is consecrated as offering for festivals.—Esp. Emurim, Emurin, those portions of sacrifices offered on the altar. Pes. 71 a אֵימוּרֵי חגיגה וכ' the Emurim of the pilgrim’s feast offering. Zeb. II, 2; a. fr.

sense.definition: (מור, ימר) exchange (cmp. חליפין as to pl.).
sense.notes: בני א' hostages in place of their parents. Lam. R. to III, 13 ed. (Ar. אימְרָיָיא q. v.). V. also אֲמוּרְיָא.
, v. preced. ws.

sense.definition: (= איתמ', play on מִיטָּה and אמיטתא) those who go to bed with the setting in of darkness (a witty expression made up in oppos. to שיחרין, v. שְׁחַר).
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 47 למדו תורה דא' learn the teachings of those who rested well by night (as better fitted to teach).

sense.definition: Koh. R. to II, 17, prob. a. corruption of מקטרג a malicious informer.

sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c top, they lament over it מילני אי', μέλαινα ἡμέρα, oh, the black (luckless) day! V. Macrob. Sat. I, 15 dies atri

or accus.) tame, soft, gentle (opp. אַגְרִיאֹון q. v.). Gen. R. s. 77 end נמירון (corr. acc.). Num. R. s. 11; Pesik. Haḥod. p. 44 b אי מכון; Pesik. R. s. 15 אימרון; Cant. R. to III, 7 אדיבון (corr. acc.). Midr. Sam. ch. XVII (for אגריון read אימירון, for נימירון read אגריון).

sense.definition: (= h. מְעִיל; contr. of אימעלא; cmp. מִילְתָא) cloak.
sense.notes: Pl. אִימְלִין. Targ. Ez. XXVII, 24.
Y. Ber. III, 6 d top; a. e. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c top א' ארך the day growing longer.
Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. II, 6 read אִימּוּם.
, v. אָמַן
, read אימריי', v. אֵימוּרִים II a. אִימְרָיָיא.
, v. מְצִי
Targ. Num. XXIV, 3; a. e.— Pl. אִימְרַיָּא. Targ. Prov. IV, 5 Ms. (ed. מַאֲמָרֵי); a. e.

sense.definition: (אמר, √אם, v. אמם; cmp. עמרא, חומרא, צמר)

sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXX, 32; a. fr.—Ned. I, 3 ‘this be as forbidden to me כאימרא (Y. ib. I, end, 37 a כאימרה) as the lamb’—כאימר תמידא that means, ‘as the lamb of the daily offering’. Lam. R. introd. (R. Josh.

sense.definition: דהוה נכיס אמ' וכ' who slaughters a lamb and augurs from its liver.
sense.notes: Erub. 53 b (deriding the Galilean dialect) a Galilean cried אמר למאן וכ' who wants amar? (indistinctly pronouncing the vowels, as well as the guttural sound of א), when they said to him …, חמר למירכב או חמר למשתי עמר למילבש או אימר לאיתכסאה (for var. lect., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 10) do you mean ḥ ǎmâr (an ass) to ride on, or ḥ ãmar (wine) to drink, or ãmar (wool) for putting on, or immar (lamb) for slaughtering?; a. fr.— Pl. אִימְּרִין, אִימְּרַיָּא, אִימְּרַיָּיה, אִמְּ'. Ezra VII, 9; a. e.—Targ. Ex. XXIX, 38; XII, 5; a. e.—Y. Snh. I, 18 d top אי' רכיכין the lambs (of the spring) are yet tender (in a letter announcing the intercalation of a month); Bab. ib. 11 b א' עדקין (not ער'; v. Tosef. ib. II, 6); a. e.—Fem. אִימַּרְתָּא ewe. Targ. Lev. V, 6; a. e.—Ḥull. 51 a. Gen. R. s. 44 end, the sow (Rome) pastures with twenty (young ones), וא' ולא בחד and the ewe (Sarah) not even with one.—2) (cmp. חוּמְרָא) knot, bandage on wounds. Snh. 98 a כולהו שרי ואסרי אי' וכ' Ar. (in ed. a. Ms. our w. omitted) all of them untie their bandages all at once and tie them up all at once, but he attends to one at a time.
Targ. Ps. CXXXIII, 2. Targ. Y. Ex. XXVI, 4 (Var. אֶימְרָא). V. next w.

sense.definition: * pr. n. pl. כפר א' K’far Imra (Lamb-ville).
sense.notes: Y. Taan. IV, 69 a bot.; (Lam. R. to II, 2 נמרא).

sense.definition: fringe, border, skirt; trnsf. the bordered garment, (toga prætexta), state garment.
sense.notes: Taan. 11 b; Ab. Zar. 34 a חלוק לבן שאין בו אימרא a white plain frock without border (without official distinction; cmp. toga pura). Y. Kil. IX, 32 a top; Tosef. ib. V, 19 א' (ה)מפורסמת a conspicuous border garment. Y. Kid. IV, beg. 65 b (play on אִמֵּר Ezra II, 59) פירסמו וכ' they made themselves as conspicuous as the border on the frock. Sabb. 105 a; Tosef. ib. XII (XIII), 1.—Y. Yoma I, 38 d top; Y. Meg. I, 72 a bot. אִימְּרַת חלוקי the skirt of my frock; a. fr.—[Lam. R. to II, 17 explain. אִמְרָתֹו ib., פורפירא, v. בזע.] Pl. (of אוּמְּרִית) אוּמְרִיֹּות. Neg. XI, 10. Y. M. Kat. I, 80 d bot.; v. זָוַג.

sense.definition: trnsf. object of distinction, decoration (play on אֲמִירָה II); cmp. חְטִיבָה.
sense.notes: Mekh. B’shall., Shirah, s. 3 (ref. to האמר־ Deut. XXVI, 17) עשאני וכ' He made me (His) decoration (chosen people) &c.; Yalk. Ex. 244 אְמִירָה.

Lam. R. to III, 13 (rendering בני אשפתו ibid. ‘the children of those thrown down’ (into the dung, conquered), Rab explains ‘the children of his destruction’ (v. אֹופִיכָא), בני אִימְרָיֵיה the children of rebellion against him. (Editions vary, אימריה, רייא …, אמורים &c., v. אֵימוּרִים II). [Esth. R. to I, 1 b, independently interpreted, v. אוּכַּיְיפָא a. אֲמוּרְיָא.]

sense.definition: (= h. מָרֹון; v. אִימַר a. preced.) rebellion.
sense.notes: בני א' rebels. R. Hash. 18 a (translating בני מרון Mish.) (all creatures pass before the Lord for receiving their decrees) כבני א' like rebels (after surrender brought before a court martial; cmp. Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII, 1, s. v. אפופסין, a. Y. R. Hash. I, 57 b). [Rashi אמרנא = Syr. אֵמרונא ‘like young lambs passing singly to be marked for tithes’.]
Snh. 52 b Im. daughter of Tali (prob. pseudonyms).
17 a.—Ber. I, 1, a. fr. מאימתי from what time (of the day)? Shebi. I, 1, a. fr. עד אימתי; ib. II, 1 עד אימת how long (until when)?
Targ. Y. Lev. XXIII, 42; a. e. Y. B. Kam. III, 3 d top אי' דמתיבון וכ' when they quote the Mishnah in support of &c. Ab. Zar. 53 b כל אי' דבעינא לה whenever I desire it. Nid. 66 a
VII, 4.—לא' for what time? until what time? Targ. O. Ex. VIII, 5; a. e.
ch. = h. אֵימָה. Targ. O. Ex. XV, 16; a. e.—B. Kam. 28 a; a. e.
, v. אֵימָת, אֵימַת.
Targ. Jud. III, 30.— Pl. אֵימְתָנִין, אֵימְתָנֵי, אֵימָ'. Targ. Hòab. I, 7. Targ. Gen. XIV, 5 (Y. II, אמתניא, h. text אֵימִים).

Y. Meg. III, 74 a bot. ספרא הוה אימתן וכ' (ed. Krot. אימהן, corr. acc.) the school-master was a timid man and but for R. Abbahu that passed by, he would not have cleared the children out of the premises of the Synagogue. [Hebr. form, v. אֵמְתָן.]
אִיֵּין (= עִיֵּין, v. next w.) to look upon, investigate. B. Bath. 115 a (play on אִין) אַיֵּין עליו Ar. (ed. עַיֵּין) investigate his family relations. Kid. 4 a

sense.definition: (√או; cmp. אָוֶן, עַיִן) [b. h. naught], something rounded, decorative.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to III, 12 expl. as נֹוי, ref. to the shape of the human buttock, v. אֱפִיפְּיוֹן.

sense.definition: where? (only with pref. מ or ל).
sense.notes: לְאַ' whither? מֵאַ' whence? Y. Snh. X, 28 d bot; Y. Ḥag. II, 77 a bot. מא' ולא' whence and whither?—Aboth III, 1. Gen. R. s. 2 מא' הרגלים whence art thou coming? i.e. where hast thou been staying?—Y. Snh. X, 28 b top היה לו מא' ללמוד he had (a precedent) to learn from.—Contr. of מן אין: מִנַיִן, v. מִן.

Ber. 5 a אין עוף אלא וכ' uf (flight, Job V, 7) means nothing else but &c.; a. v. fr.—אֵינִי, אֵינְךָ not I &c. אֵינִי יודע I do not know; do I not know? B. Mets. 97 b; a. fr. Ber. l. c. but the Holy One … אֵינֹו כן is not so; a. fr.—אֵינֹו דין is it not a legitimate conclusion?, whence so much the more. Y. Naz. VI, 55 a; a. v. fr.—… אין לי אלא … מניין from this I could only prove …, whence, however, will you deduct …? Ḥull. 65 b; a. fr. [Y. Git. IX, end, 50 d אפי' כתב אינו read סימנו.]

Keth. 65 a השתא א' וכ' now,—yes, but not before. B. Mets. 98 a חדא א' בעידן וכ' as regards the one (cow)—well, she died &c.; a. fr.—אֵינִי = אִין הִי is it really so? indeed?, i.e. it cannot be. Ḥull. 96 b א' והאמר it cannot be so; for did not R. … say &c.? M. Kat. 20 a; a. v. fr.

Targ. Ps. VII, 4; a. e. [Apocopated: אִי q. v.]—אין תימר (h. אם תאמר) if thou wilt say (argue). Y. Macc. II, 31 d bot.; a. fr.—אין כיני (h. אם כן היא) if this is (be) the case. Y. Naz. VI, 54 d bot.—Lam. R. introd. end אן את יתיב וכ' if thou remainest here, or &c. Koh. R. to X, 5 אן אתת ענתה וכ' if the (my dying) time comes first, what of it? and if &c.

sense.definition: adv. of interrogation, introducing the alternative, or.
sense.notes: Targ. Job VI, 6; a. e.

sense.definition: c. (cmp. אִינְחוּ), followed by ד־, he who.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XI, 26; a. e. (also אִנָא ed.).

sense.definition: (= b. h. עֵנָב q. v.) berry, an excrescence on the eye.
sense.notes: Tosef. Bekh. IV, 2. [Mish. ib. VI, 2 עֵינָב. Talm. ed. 38 ab עצב (corr. acc.).]
, v. אִנְבָּא
58 a א' פוסתא וכ' go one page and a half further, (and you will find it). [Rashi: a little = אִי־נְגַד, v. אי III.]
, v. אֶנִּיגָרֹון

sense.definition: = next w.— Pl. with suffix of third pers.
sense.notes: sing. אִינְדְּרוֹי. Targ. Ps. CIV, 3 Ms. (ed. אכסדרוי). [The verse is variously corrupted and defective.]
, v. אִידְּרֹון
, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס
, v. אִיהוּ
Y. Git. IX, end, 50 d אפי' כתב א', read סִימָנוֹ, v. Bab. ib. 87 b

Sabb. XX, 2 (139 b) אי' Ar. (ed. אנ', var. in Mss. יינמילין, ינמי', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 20). Ab. Zar. 30 a defined as a mixture of wine, honey and pepper. Ter. XI, 1 יינומלין Ar. (ed. יינומלים; Ms. M. אט', read אינו'). Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 c top יינומילין.
pl. of אִיהוּ, אִיהִי.
, Gen. R. s. 29 ר' חנינא א', a corruption of אינייני or אנינייא, dialect. = חנינא; cmp. Frankel M’bo p. 64 b א' בן סוסיי with p. 88 a ח' בר סיסיי. [Our w. omitted in Yalk. Gen. 47, Job 908.]
Targ. II Esth. III, 3. V. אַנְחָתָא.
Tosef. Kil. V, 25, read with ed. Zuck. אִיסְפְּלָנִית.
= 1) = אֵין אֲנִי, v. אֵין
אִין הִי, v. אִין I
Cant. R. to VIII, 11. [Koh. R. to IX, 10 איבו.]
, v. אִנְבָּא
Y. Git. I, 43 d (Y. B. Bath. 16 c חייה). V. next w.
Y. Yoma III, 40 c; a. e. Y. [Maas. Sh. IV, 55 a bot. אינייא, seems to be a different person, v. preced. w. a. Frankel M’bo p. 64 b.] V. אינוניתא.
, v. אִינוּן
, v. אֱינָשׁ

sense.definition:
(a contraction of ἔλαιον μύῤῥινον; cmp. אניגרון as to נ for ל) unguent scented
with Arabian myrtle.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to IV, 14. [Muss. οἶνος μυρίνης; but the context requires an unguent.]
, v. אֲמַפְּלַי

Targ. II Esth. I, 2 א' די דהבא a suckling (kid?) of gold (lying, on the third step, opposite נמרא [not נשרא] the panther; ref. to Is. XI, 6). Pl. (אֶנְקִין) אֱנָקִין. Ib. (end) א' בכיין the sucklings were crying.

sense.definition: (נקר) a bird with traces of bites or wounds on its legs; [ black bird with white spots on its head, quot.
sense.notes: in Rashi; to be read אינקודי?].— Pl. אִינְקֹורֵי, אִנְ'. Ḥull. 57 a
, v. אנקלסיא

sense.definition:
(אנש, sec. r. of אוּשׁ; h.
אֱנֹושׁ, אִישׁ) being, esp. human being Dan. II, 10, a. fr. אנש.
sense.notes: —Ib. VII, 13 בר א' son of man (in Talm. freq. בר נש). Targ. O. Lev. XIII, 2; a. fr.—Y. Snh. VIII, 25 a bot., a. fr. כאי' דמר as if one says. Y. Ber.
