VIII, 12 a bot. אֲנָשָׁא רבא a great man. Shebu. 22 b; a. fr.— Pl. אֵינָשִׁין, const. אֵינָשֵׁי. Targ. O. Gen. VI, 4; a. e.—אִינְשִׁין, אִינְשֵׁי. Targ. Y. ibid.; a. e.—In Talm. mostly אִינְשֵׁי people. B. Kam. 92 b אמרי א' (text רבנן, corr. acc.). Snh. 95 b היינו דאמרי א' (abbr. ה"דא"א) this is what people say, it is a common saying (proverb). Ibid. 103 a; a. v. fr.—Git. 45 a אִינְשִׁין (our people?).

sense.definition: prob. a corrupt. for אַנְטִיפַּטְרוֹס Antipater.
sense.notes: Targ. II, Esth. III, 1.

sense.definition: a prefix for the formation of (verbal) nouns (Ispeel nouns), affecting the first radical in the same way as the prefix of the Hithpa. or Ithpe.; e.g. from סגי, אִסְטַגְיֹות (pl.) rims; from סוַר = שור to walk, stride, אִיסְתְּוָורָא ankle, &c. Before dentals איס and אס interchange with אִיצְ־ and אִצְ־.
sense.notes: [Words not found under איס־ must be looked for under אִס־ and vice versa.]
Ex. R. s. 15, v. אִילִיאֹוס.

sense.definition: Isa, an Amora, disciple of R. Yoḥanan.
sense.notes: Y. Ter. I, 40 c top. V. אִיסִי.
, v. אסגנטירין
Targ. Gen. XXVIII, 11; a. e.—Ber. 56 a אאיסדָן by our head-side.—[Ib. בי סדיא pillow.]
f. = אָסוּ.
Targ. O. Num. V, 17 ed. Berl.

sense.definition: (ἰσοπολιτεία) civic rights granted to strangers, isopolity (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Civitas).
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 15 עבדות וגרות בארץ לא להם וענו אותם ארבע מאות שנה אפילו [על] א' שלהם Ar. s. v. פלטיא II (ed. איספטלים, איספטליס, corr. acc.) ‘slavery and stranger’s condition’ (indicated Gen. XV, 13) were in a land not theirs (in Egypt), but, ‘and they shall afflict them four hundred years’ refers even to their isopolity (in Canaan, from the birth of Isaac); Cant. R. to II, 17 באיספטלייה … (corr. as above.). Gen. R. s. 44; Yalk. Gen. 77 לאספטיא … (corr. as above.). Pesik. Hahòod. p. 47 b note 96.
Ber. 28 b אין אֵיסוּרֹו א' עולם the imprisonment which he decrees is not everlasting (as he may die and his successor may relieve me).
Ex. R. s. 30 he burst the prison open והוציא האיסו' (ib. also האֵיסָרִין) and set the prisoners free [prob. to be read אסירין].
a proselyte. Ab. Zar. 70 a. B. Bath. 149 a
an expert on coins. B. Kam. 99 b bot.

sense.definition: (אסר; cmp. b. h. אֵסוּר, a. אֵיסוּר)

sense.notes: Succ. 45 b (ref. to Ps. CXVIII, 27) כל העושה א' לחג וכ' he who creates a circle for the festival with eating and drinking, i.e. social pleasures. [Oth. explan.: he who makes an addition to the number of festive days;—hence the popular name of אסרו חג for the day following the festivals.]

sense.definition: prohibition, interdict; also the forbidden object.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 3 b bot. דברי תורה יש בהן א' וכ' the Biblical law contains prohibitions and permissions.—א' ערוה an obstacle to marriage by the existing laws of incest, e.g. a man prevented from performing a levirate marriage because his late brother’s wife is his own wife’s sister; &c.—א' מצוה a marriage (or sexual connection) permitted in the Torah but forbidden by Rabbinical enactment;—so called because obedience to the Rabbis is a meritorious act (מצוה); א' קדושה marriage restrictions incumbent on priests on account of their sacred office; (another opinion inverts the last two definitions). Yeb. II, 3 (20 a).—אין א' חל על א' one prohibition can take no legal hold where another prohibition already exists; i.e. you can punish, or impose sacrificial expiation, only for the first one; e.g. if you eat the meat of an unclean animal which, besides, has not been slaughtered according to ritual (נבלה). Ib. 13 b; a. fr.—Exceptions to this principle (adopted by most authorities) are when the acceding act is: 1) א' כֹּולֵל a more comprehensive prohibition, i.e. having a wider range of prohibited objects; e.g. the law imposing abstinence from food on the Day of Atonement includes food in general, i.e. food otherwise allowed as well as food forbidden at all times; א' מֹוסִיף a more extensive prohibition, i.e. having a wider range of persons concerned; e.g. the sister of A’s wife is forbidden to him (אחות אשתו) but not to his brothers. If, afterwards, his brother B. marries that sister of A.’s wife, she is forbidden in marriage (after B.’s death) to all the brothers as a brother’s wife, and to A. both as his own living wife’s sister and as his late brother’s wife (אשת אח);

sense.definition: א' בַּת אַחַת a coincidental prohibition, i.e. two prohibitions taking effect at the same moment, e.g. the Day of Atonement coinciding with the Sabbath day, in which case the restrictions connected with each take effect at the same time (night-fall);

א' חָמוּר a heavier prohibition, i.e. a prohibition imposing larger restrictions, e.g. the law prohibiting any profitable use of thing (א' הנאה), compared to the lighter prohibition, א' קַל, not to eat or drink a thing (v. infra).
sense.notes: Yeb. 32 b sq; Shebu. 24 ab; Ḥull. 101 a sq; Kerith. 14 b.—א' תורה a Biblical prohibitory law; א' דרבנן a Rabbinical prohibitory enactment.—א' לאו a prohibition expressed in the Law by a plain (לֹא) ‘thou shalt not’, without defining the penalty, in which case the latter consists of thirty nine lashes (v. מַלְקוּת).—א' כרת a prohibition to which the Bible attaches the penalty of excision (by the hand of God).—א' מיתה a prohibition the transgression of which the Bible punishes with death (execution).—א' אכילה the law not to eat (meat boiled with milk); א' הנאה not to make any use (of it, as selling &c.); א' בישול not to boil (meat with milk). Ḥull. 115 b; a. fr.—א' במות, v. בָּמָה.— Pl. אִיסּוּרִין. Ḥull. 98 a sq. כל א' שבתורה (בטלין) בששים all things Biblically forbidden are neutralized if mixed with a quantity sixty times as large; ib. במאה—in a quantity one hundred times as large; a. fr.

Targ. Ezek. III, 25.— Pl. אִיסוּרִין. Targ. ib. XVI, 4 (bandages).—2) as the preced. 2). Ḥull. 9 b; a. fr.—B. Bath. 92 b כי אזלינן בתר רובא בא' בממונא לא we follow the majority principle (that a doubtful thing is presumed to have the legal status of the majority of its class) only in ritual questions, but not in civil law.—עבד א' to commit a crime, euphem. for prostitution, &c. Ab. Zar. 18 a. Git. 38 a.— Pl. אִיסּוּרֵי, אִסּוּרֵי. Sabb. 60 b בבלאי שרי א' a Babylonian permitter of forbidden things (R. Ḥiya).—Nid. 24 b, a. fr. הלכתא כרב בא' Rab is the adopted authority in ritual law. [Kid. 12 a זול איסורי &c. read אִיסָרֵי; v. אִיסָר.]
Pl. אִיסוּרִין. Targ. Koh. III, 10. Targ. Jer. XXX, 11 (Var. יסורין).
, v. אִיסְ־. For words under איסט־ not found here below, v. אסט־, איצט־, אצט־.

sense.definition: [also ָה, a. with one ו] m. (Ispe. noun of סב, סבב = h. אִיסְטֵיב q. v., b. h. מֵסֵב; v. אִיסְ־) a surrounding, attachment, whence
balcony, colonnade, portico (also an independent colonnade), esp. הָאִ' the Itst’ba (Ist’ba) the Temple portico.
sense.notes: Pes. I, 5 (11 b) על גג האיצ' Ms. M. (Bab. ed. incorr. גב, Var. אִסְטְוָה, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). Ib. 13 b one recited על גב on top (inside) …, say על גג הא' on the roof of the Its. (so as to expose it to public view). Y. Sabb. I, 2 d bot. איסטוה וכ'; Bab. 7 a איצ' שלפני העמודים a balcony in front of the columns (projecting into the street, used as a stand for dealers, v. אִיסְטֵיב). Ib. דוקא א' דלא ניחא תשמישיה Ms. M. (ed. א' הוא דלא) only the colonnade the use of which for passers by is not convenient. Num. R. s. 12 two columns of silver which were placed in front of the Ark כמין איסטווה (Cant. R. to I, 11 אִיסְטְוִוין pl.) forming a kind of balcony; Y. Sot. VIII, 22 c תנם לא' allow the surplus of three handbreadths (over the space occupied by the Tablets) for the balcony.—Yoma 49 a דעבוד מעשה אסטווה Ar. (ed. איצ') they (the laymen) served only the purpose of a portico (holding the bowls up to view, v. Pes. I, 5, but not handing them to the altar).—Y. Succ. V, 55 a bot., v. דִּיפְּלֵי.

sense.definition: (cmp. הֶסֵּב, הֲסִיבָּה) something to recline on; couch, seat.
sense.notes: Kid. 70 a, (to one using the high-toned קרפיטא q. v.) א' דאמרי אינשי call it itst’ba as the people do.—M. Kat. 10 b למבני א' Ar. a. ed. (Var. as Yoma l. c.) to build a temporary banqueting place for guests during the festive week, cmp. אַכְוַרְנְקָא, (Rashi: stone building, Ms. Rashi כסא).— Pl. אִיצְטְבָאֹות (h. form). Ex. R. s. 31 (basilicas).—אִיצְטְבֵי (Chald. form). Pes. 65 b דמסגי אא' they (the priests) walked alongside the walls on balconies (projecting boards made for them that they should not tread on the blood); Y. ib. V, 32 c bot. מִסְטְוָיֹות, V. מִסְטְוָה.

sense.definition: (Ispe. of סגלל, r. סגל; cmp. סגלגל a. b. h. אֶשְׁכֹּול) cluster, a crowded band.
sense.notes: Ber. 51 a א' של מלאכים וכ' Ms. Beth Nath. (Ar. אִסִתַּלְגִּינִית, ed. אִיסְתַּלְגָנִית. transpose איסתגל', Ms. M. איסתלתנות read אִיסְתַּלְתָּלִית fr. תלתל; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) a cluster of angels of destruction.
, v. אִסְטַ'
, v. אִסְטְרֹופֹומָטָא
&c., v. אִיצְטַ' a. אִסְטַרְיָא.
, v. אִיצְטַדִּין a. אִסְטָרִין.
, v. אִיסְטְרִידָא
Yalk. Gen. 44 (a legendary personage).
, v. אִיסְטְבָא

sense.definition: ( m.?) (Isp. noun of סוי; cmp. b. h. סוּת, מַסְוֶה) cover, blanket, ( coarse) cloak.
sense.notes: Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 b מרקען—א' דההוא גברא אית ביה (ed. Krot. … בָּהּ … מקרען rents) this man’s (thy) blanket has twelve patches (Lam. R. to I, 1 חד כותאי, 1 has מרדעא).
v. supra.
Targ. II Kings XI, 14; II Chron. XXXIV, 31, a. e. נֵיה … the balcony (of his palace).

sense.definition: (v. אִיסְטְבָא) a system of colonnades, colonnade with double rows, basilica (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Basilica).
sense.notes: Pes. 13 b א' היתה נקראת (the itst’ba of the Temple being of double rows) was called ist’vanith, v. אִסְטֵיו, סְטֵיו. Ohol. XVIII, 9 (ed. נִיֹּות … pl.). Tosef. Sabb. I, 4; a. fr.— Pl. אִיסְטְוָונִיֹּות. Ohol. l. c., v. supra.—Tanḥ. Mishp. 14 (ed. Bub. 6 איסטוטין corr. acc.). Tosef. Oh. XVIII, 12 אִיסְטְוָנֹות (prob. incorr.).
, v. אִיסְתְּ'
, v. סוּט ch.
, v. אִסְטְלִי
, v. אִיסְטְוָונִית
, v. אֲטִימִיטֹון
1882 s. v. Statio II, B, 4) seat of the fiscal officers in the Roman provinces, also the staff of officers. Gen. R. s. 66 (play on Shulamith Cant. VII,

the people of Israel שמשלמת אִיסְטַטְיֹונֹו של עולם וכ' that preserves the (divine) government of the world complete (filling the vacancies) both in this world &c. Cant. R. to l. c. איסטטיונרון, read אִיסְטַטְיֹונָרִין (stationarii) the number of officers (of the divine government). Cmp. צַדִּיק. V. סְטַטְיֹונָר
, v. אִיסְטַטְיֹון
, v. אִסְטָנִית

— Pl. אִיסְטַטָּנִיֹּות. Gen. R. s. 45. [Deut. R. s. 6 אִיסְטְסֹונִיֹּות, אִיסְטְסָנִיֹּות; Ar. סְטִיסְיָאנֹות, denom. of סִיס, סוּסְיִא, scratching like a bird; v. Gen. R. l. c. quot. s. v. חָמַס, a. Ḥull. 62 a s. v. סְנוּנִית.] V. אִסְטָנִית.

sense.definition: (Isp. n. of סב in סבב; cmp. b. h. מֵסֵב, מוּסַב) an extension around the house (gen. with a stone bench) used as workshop or dealer’s shop, portico, colonnade (cmp. מִסְטֹובָא).
sense.notes: Y. B. Bath. II, beg. 13 b top, R.—drove a pastry dealer מא' לא' from portico to portico (it being private ground). Ib. III, end, 14 b a window שהיא פתוחה לא' וכ' opening towards a porch is made only for letting light in. V. אִיסְטְבָא.
Y. Succ. V, 55 a bot.; Y. Taan. III, 66 d bot.; v. סְטֵיו.
, v. סוּט
Y. Ab. Zar. II. 42 a bot. v. אִסְטַגְיֹות
, v. אִסְטָנִית
Y. Yeb. I, 2 c
Midr. Sam. ch. XI, v. אִסְטְלִי
Ex. R. s. 15, read אִיסְטֵיב; cmp. Tanḥ. Ḥayé, 3 איצטבא.

sense.definition: (ἰσάτις, isatis tinctoria) a plant producing a deep blue dye, woad.
sense.notes: Shebi. VII, 1. Y. ib. 37 b אסטים (corr. acc.). B. Kam. 101 b אס' Ar. (ed. סטיס, סטים; corr. acc.). Meg. IV, 7; a. fr.
, v. אִסְטָנִית
Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII, beg. כמין א' read אִיסְפַרְגִּיס, v. סְפַרְגִּיס. [V. אִסְטַרְטֵיגֹוס.]
Ex. R. s. 15, read אִיסְטֵיב, v. איסטיס
of √צם) something restraining (the hair from flying), band, chaplet (of woolen and other stuff). Sabb. 57 b (Ms. M. אצ'); v. בִּזְיוּנֵא. Tosef. ib. IV, 7, Kil. V, 26.
, Ms. M. איסתמי מייתי, Ar. אסטממיתיה, Ms. O. איסתמתיה, some ed. איסטמה, a word in a charm formula (apparently a fictitious denom. of סמי). Sabb. 67 a
, v. אִיסְטַפְנִינֵי
, v. אִיסְטַטָּנִית
, v. next w.

אסטפלינין P. Sm. 301, prob. of Semit. orig., rad. טפל) a kind of carrot, parsnip. Y. Maasr. II, end, 50 a bot. Y. Ḥall. IV, 60 a top אִיסְתַּ'. Ib. איסטנינותיא read איסטפנינִיתֵיה his parsnip. Y. Kil. I, 27 a bot. אסטפלינון R. Sims. to Kil. I, 4 (ed. corrupt). Tosef. Ukts. I, 1 אסטפונין.
, v. אִיסְתִּירָא

sense.definition: cone, also kernel of the stone pine, (nux pinea).
sense.notes: — Pl. אִיסְטְרֹובְלִין, אִיסְטְרֹובִילִין &c. Ab. Zar. I, 5 (13 b sq.); defined ibid. fruit of the cedar (stone pine); a. fr. Pesik. R. s. 10 אסטרובלית (read לִים— or לֹות—).

sense.definition: (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Mola) the cone or lower millstone (which is immovable, hence included in the sale of the house).
sense.notes: B. Bath. IV, 3. Zabim IV, 2.— Pl. אִסְטְרֹובְלִין, אִיסְטְרֹובִילֵי &c. Gen. R. s. 28; a. e. Keth. 69 a Ar. (ed. more correctly בל …, sing.).

sense.definition: Istrobilos (v. preced.; but prob. a corrupt. of אֲרִיסְטֹובוּלֹוס).
sense.notes: Y. Kil. IX, 32 c bot. (Y. Keth. XII, 35 b איסטריבוליא, corr. acc.).
m. pl., a. corrupt. of אִיסְטַרְטֵיגֵי, v. אִסְטַ'
and deriv., v. אַסְ'. [Koh. R. to I, 14, read לֹוגִיסְטֵס.]
Cant. R. to VII, 9, defining גדבריא Dan. III, 2, read אִיסְטְרַטִילָטֵי, v. אִסְ'
, Men. 103 b, v. אִסְטְרַטְיָא a. אִסְטַרְיָא.
, v. אִיסְטְרֹובִילֹוס

sense.definition:
(Ispe. of סרד, cmp. סְרִיד, סְרָדָא &c.) net-work, esp.
rigging, sail-yard, sails.
sense.notes: [If the vers. אִיסְטְדִירָא, אִסְתְּדִירָא, v. Rabb. D. S. to Sabb. 111 b note 2, be correct, it must be derived from סדר; cmp. b. h. סִדְרֹון, סְדֵרָה.] Sabb. 111 b קטרא דקטרי באי' the loop which they make when attaching the sail to the rigging. Ib. ודאי' גופה and the (permanent) knots in the rigging or ropes.
, v. אִסְטְרֹופֹומָטָא

sense.definition: (Ispe. of סרך; cmp. b. h. שְׂרוֹךְ) plaited chords, as a collect.
sense.notes: noun fem. a girdle of strips of cloth (used by washers). Y. B. Kam. X, end, 7 c הוה עביד ליה חדא א' וכ' used to make for himself one girdle of one kind of wool (so as not to be suspected of using strips of the cloths given him for washing).
of Joseph (v. Yoma 52 b הוא יוסף הוא א'), esp. known: I. b. Y’hudah, an Amora; (v. Frankel M’bo, p. 100 b). Ḥull. 115 b; a. fr.
, v. אִסְקָפָא

C.) scholasticus = causidicus, advocate, pleader. Y. Ber. IV, 7 d; cmp. Gen. R. s. 64, end, אסקולסטיכא דאורייתא Ar. (trnsp. כ a. ק; ed. ארכילוסטקיא; corr. acc.) pleader in behalf of the Jewish law.— Pl. אִיסְכֹּולַסְטִיקֵי. Cant. R. to VII, 9 איסכלוסקי, corr. acc.—אִיסְכֹּולַסְטְקִין Ex. R. s. 43 כקתדרה של אסט' (corr. acc., כו mistaken for ט) like the pulpit of the scholastici. [Also written סְכֹו'.]
Y. Meg. I, 72 d top, expl. תאנת שלה Josh. XVI, 6 (σκοπιά; cmp. Zeb. 118 b, as quot. in Yalk. Deut. 881).
, v. אִיסְכֹּולַסְטִיקָא
Y. Ber. III, 6 c bot.
Gen. R. s. 37, v. אוסיא
, Tanḥ. T’rumah, 9 א' נרמוז, v. אִיסְפֶנְדַּמְנֹוס
read אִיפָּטִּיקֹוס.
, v. איפופסין
, v. אִיסֹופֹּולִיטְיָיא
, v. אִסְפָּתִי
Tanḥ. T’rumah, 9, v. איספו
Yalk. Ps. 808, v. אִיסְפְּרִיטִין

sense.definition: , Lev. R. s. 5, read אֹופְּסָרִיאוּ (ὀψαρίου) = comes annonæ; v. D.
sense.notes: C. s. v. Comes.
, v. אִסְפּ'
Tanḥ. T’rumah, 9 איספו נרמוז ed. (Ar. אספינדמון; corr. acc.) Tidhar (Is. LX, 13) means &c.

sense.definition: (ספק) prop. feeder, supplier, hence vessel in which wine is put on the table (amphora).
sense.notes: Targ. O. Ex. XVI, 33 Ar. (ed. צלוחית). Git. 14 a. Cmp. זֶפֶק.
, v. אִסְקָפָא

sense.definition: (speculator, spiculator) arm-bearer, esp. guardsman of the Roman Emperor; mostly executioner, torturer (v. D. C. s. v.).
sense.notes: Sabb. 108 a. Num. R. s. 19. Lev. R. s. 26 ספ'. Lam. R. to II, 1. V. סְפִיקוּלָא.
…, רֵי … Targ. II Esth. V, 2. Targ. Y. Gen. XXXVII, 36.
Esth. R. to I, 14, read הא' של כולם (ממוכן = preparing).
, v. אִסְקְפַסְטֵי

sense.definition: asparagus, also shoots of cabbage, like asparagus in form.
sense.notes: Ned. VI, 10 if one vows abstinence from cabbage אסור בא' he is forbidden to eat asparagus (the latter being considered a species of the genus ‘cabbage’). Tosef. Dem. IV, 5 לקנב את הא' שׁבו to cut off the stalks thereon (and throw the remainder away).

sense.definition: asparagus, a beverage of wine or beer with asparagus.
sense.notes: Ber. 51 a. Pes. 110 b. Kid. 70 a אי' דקריוה וכ' aspar. as the educated call (the morning drink). [Yalk. Gen. 34 איספרגוס read אִיסְפַרְגִּיס (σφραγίς) seal, v. סְפַרְגִּיס.]

sense.definition: (Arab. safar-ḡel) ispargal, name of a fruit (called Persæa, Περσαία), plum; others: quince.
sense.notes: — Pl. אִיסְפַּרְגְּלִין. Y. Maasr. I, 48 d bot.; Y. Kil. I, 27 a, explain. פרישין = persæa. V. Löw Pfl. pp. 144, 289, a. Sm. Ant. s. v. Persæa
, Tanḥ. ed. Bub. T’rumah. 9, v. אִיסְפֶנְדַּמְנֹוס
B. Mets. 39 b Mari ben I. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.); Keth. 27 b
, v. איסקריטורי
, v. אִיסִקוּנְדְּרֵי

sense.definition: (Isp. of קוז = קוץ; cmp. קְזֹוזוֹת) cutting, trnsf. fate, doom; cmp. גְּזֵירָה.
sense.notes: Esth. R. to I, 14 (Ar. ed. Koh. ית …). [Levy Talm. Dict. s. v. אִסְקֹוזֹות, quotes היו א' … מתוקנות, pl.]
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (Pers. iskodâr, ἀσκάνδης, σαγγάνδης, ἀστάδης; v. Perles Et.
sense.notes: St. p. 113) prop. despatch-bearers, name of a game, a kind of chess. Kidd. 21 b באי' אטללתו Ar. (Var. Ar. בסק'; ed. איסקומדרי) you must have played at iskundré (instead of studying). Shebu. 29 a דילמא איס' וכ' (Ms. M. איסקודרי) perhaps he gave them checkers (tokens in game) and passed them for Zuzé. Ned. 25 a. Cmp. איסקרנדה.
, v. אִסְק'
Ned. 55 b. V. סְקֹורְטְיָא.
, v. אִסְקַרְיָא

sense.definition: , read אִיסְקְרִיטָרְיֵי m. pl. (σηκρητάριοι, secretarii) the sovereign’s private secretaries (Asecretis, v. D. C. Gr. a. Lat. s. v.).
sense.notes: Y. Keth. XII, 35 b; Y. Kil. IX, 32 c איסקבטיריי (corr. acc.).
, v. אִסְקְ'
iskodâr; Koh. Ar.; v. אִיסְקוּנְדְּרֵי) courier. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 d top יהב תרתין וכ' he gave two pounds of pepper to a courier (to go to Tyre), and he (the courier) went up and found &c.

sense.definition: (contr. of איסהר, cmp. איסתירא, an adapt.
sense.notes: of assarius = as) As, a Roman coin, usu. 1/ 24 of a Denar (v. Zuckerm. Talm. Gew. p. 22 sq.), called א' האיטלקי Italian As. Kidd. I, 1; a. fr.—Y. ibid. I, 58 d הא' אחד מכ"ד וכ' the As is 1/ 24 of the silver Denar.—Trnsf. coin. Taan. 19 b מדלית א' because there was a scarcity of coin.— Pl. אִיסָרִין. Y. Maas. Sh. IV, 55 b top.— Chald. Kidd. 12 a איסורי read אִיסָרֵי. [Gen. R. s. 42 א' לשם אלסר the Assar received its name from Elasar (Gen. XIV,

sense.definition: prop. band, hence vow of abstinence, (cmp. איסור).
sense.notes: Y. Ned. I, beg. 36 c.— Pl. אִיסָּרֹות, אִיסָּרִין, אֱסָרִין. Ibid. אין לוקין על הא' the punishment of lashes is not applied for breaking vows. Y. Yeb. XIII, 13 d אסורות (corr. acc.). Y. Ned. I, 36 d top. [אֵיסָר prisoner, v. אֵיסוּר.] [Gen. R. s. 42 א' לשם אלסר bands (chains) forged for Elasar, v. preced.]
Pl. אֵיסָרִין. Targ. Jud. XV, 14.
Targ. O. Num. XXX, 3 (Y. אִיסְרָא); a. e.— Pl. אֵיסָרִין, אֵיסָרֵי. Targ. O. Num. XXX, 5; a. e.—[Targ. Ps. II, 3 אֱסָרָתָא (some ed. אֵסָרוּ'), v. next w.]

sense.definition: אִיסְרָא, אֵיסְרָא; אֵיסַרְתָּא f. bundle, bunch, sheaf.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 18. Targ. O. Gen. XXXVII, 7; a. e.— Pl. אֵיסָרָן, אֵיסָרָתָא. Ibid. (ed. also אֵסרא, אֵסרתא). אֱסָרָתָא Targ. Ps. II, 3 (some ed. אֵסָרוּ') chains; v. preced.

Pes. 111 b א' דמזוני וכ' (Ms. M. שדא, read שרא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) the genius appointed over sustenance is named Cleanliness. Ib. א' דעניותא וכ' (in Ms. our w. omitted) the genius of want is named Filth. Yoma 77 a א' דפרסי Ms. M. (ed. שרא, in a passage omitted in many editions, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) the genius of the Persians (Pharsees).

f. same. Y. B. Bath. VIII, 16 c top אינה היא א' that is not the proper way (= לא זו הדרך), i.e. it is inconsistent that the same formula should be illegal in the case of a letter of divorce, and legal in the case of a donation. Y. Gitt. VII, 48 d אינה איסרתה (corr. acc., and supplement acc. to Y. B. Bath. l. c.).
, Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c מאילין דא', read דָּאנִיסְטִיסֵי, v. דָּנִיסְטֵיס

sense.definition: (= אסטרטין, pl. of στρατός) band or body of men.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 87 א' של נואפים (Ar. אסרטיון) bands of adulterers; א' של רוצחים bands of murderers; (Yalk. Gen. 145 איסטר').
, v. אִסְרָטָא
, v. אִיסְרָא I
Y. Gitt. VII, 48 d, v. אִיסְרָטָה

sense.definition: (Ithpe. or Ispe. of סְוַר = שָׁוַר to leap, stride; b. h. אֲשׁוּר; cmp. אִסְפֶּירֶס) ankle, foot-step.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXIII, 11; a. e. Yeb. 103 a; Arakh. 19 b האי אי' עד ארעא נחית (Ar. אסתוו') what is called ist’vira ( ankle, in an anatomical sense) goes down to the ground (the entire length of the foot from the ankle). Men. 33 a, דעבידא כי אי' a door turning horizontally like the foot from the ankle.— Pl. אִיסְתְּוָורִין, רֵי … Targ. Koh. XII, 5; a. fr. Cmp. אֲתוּרֵי.

sense.definition: Y. Maas. Sh. V, 56 b top תלת' א' וכ', read תלתא סִיטֹונֵיסִין (pl. of σιτώνης) three corn-dealers upon whose estimates he redeemed the second tithes.

sense.notes: , v. אִיסְתְּוָורָא

sense.definition: (contr. of אסתהרא &c., r. סהר, צהר; cmp. אִסְתַּהַר a. אִיסָר)
a silver coin, (with זוזא or פשיטא, or sub. זוזא &c.) equal to a common (provincial) Sela, or half a Zuz.
sense.notes: Keth. 64 a; Gitt. 45 b, v. טרפעיקא. B. Mets. 102 b. Bekh. 49 b א' סורסיא Syriac Istira (v. Zuckerm. Talm. Münz. p. 27). Kidd. 11 b.— Pl. אִיסְתִּירֵי Gitt. 14 a א' זוזי. Ḥull. 44 b א' פשיטי.—Ib. 105 a.

Tosef. Shek. II, 4 א' של זהב (Var. אִיסְטְרָאֹות) gold coins ( staters). Y. ib. III, 47 c איצטלי (corr. acc.). [Targ. II Esth. II, 7 יונית אִיסְתֵּירָא, a gloss to ככב נגהא, v. אִסְתַּהַר, confounding our w. with ἀστήρ.]
, v. אִיסְטַגְלִילִית
, v. אִסְטַנְדְּרָא

סניס, Ithpe. איסת', Ispe. איסט'; cmp. אִיתְנִיס; cmp. אִשְׁתְּמֹודַע as to Ishtafel) of feeble health, delicate, fastidious in diet. Yoma III, 5 איסת' Ms. a. Ar. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., note 10; Bab. ed. mostly איסט'). Pes. 108 a. Snh. 100 b (opp. דעתו יפה not choicy); a. fr.— Pl. אִיסְתְּנִיסִים &c. Gen. R. s. 11 Ar. (ed. איסט'). Lam. R. to IV, 2 סיה … (read … סִים).— Chald. Targ. Job VI, 7 ed. אסת' (Ms. אסט'). [Cmp. b. h. נָסַס, ch. נְסִיס.]
, v. preced.
, v. אִיסְטַ'
read איסטרט', v. אִסְטַרְטֵיג a. foll.
Yalk. Ex. 167, v. איפומנימא
Sifra Sh’mini ch. VII, Par. 6, v. חֵיפָה II
Ex. R. s. 40 (play on אֵיפֹה Job XXXVIII, 4) הא' שלך וכ' where was thy predestined temper suspended? (on which limb of Adam’s head, hair &c.?, v. preceding passage ibid.). Ib. אֵיפָתְךָ.
Sifré Deut. 294, both a small as well as a large Ephah קרויה א' is named Ephah.—Men. 45 b top אֵיפָתָן the Ephah belonging to the sacrifices; a. fr.— Pl. אֵיפֹות. Ibid.
, Pesik. R. s. 26, א' הינטין; ed. Lemb. אפוטונטריק לינטין, ed. Friedm. לינטין, read מִפַּלְטִין טְרִיקְלִין וְקִיטוֹן than the palace (with) triclinium and bed-chamber wherein I dwell.
, v. איפטיקוס
, v. אַפּוּ'
, v. אֲפֹולִים
Erub. 100 a דהוה סליק בא' Ms. M. (ed. והוה) (a palm-tree) which grew up through the impluvium. Kidd. 81 a. Ḥull. 51 a
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (Mus.), איפומטא, איפומניטא, איפומג' &c. (read: אֶיפִּיטִימְיָא) m. pl. (ἐπιτίμια, τὰ) the imposed penalty, sentence.
sense.notes: Deut. R. s. 2; Yalk. Gen. 77; Ex. 167. [Mus. reads נקרית sing. fem. = ἐπιτιμία.]
Pl. אֵיפוּסִין. Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXVIII, 52 איפוסֵיהֶן אין מתקנין … their feed is not prepared for them; (Ex. R. s. 24, in a passage otherwise miscopied, אפוטיקון).
, v. אִפֹּו'
, v. אִפֹּופֹּודִין, אִפֹּופְסִין a. אֱפִיפְּיוֹן.

sense.definition: ĕ fofé, a disguise of ĕ lohé (אֱלֹהֵי); cmp. אִשְׁקוּקָה, אֲלִיקִי.
sense.notes: Y. Ned. XI, 42 c top, how did you swear? He said, ‘I swore Efofé Yisrael’ (for, By the God of Israel), ‘I will not enter my house’. He replied, (you said) Efofe Yisrael, ולא עללת לביתיך (not עללה) and on that account you would not enter your house?
, v. אפופסין
, read אֹו', v. אָפֹּורְיָא
, v. אַפִּרְיָין

sense.definition: (ἱπποθόρος, sub. νόμος, שירת) a tune played to mares on being covered.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to I, 9 (being asked why they rushed into the water, the horses said) א' נעשית לכם בים (ed. איפתיסיס, איפתוסים, אפ' corr. acc.) a hippothoros is prepared for you in the Sea (a satire on Egyptian lasciviousness).
Gen. R. s. 14, beg.; a. e. V. אֵיטָא.

sense.definition: (ὑπατεία) prop. Roman consulship, consulate, in gen. era, dating from accession to government or an other important event.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 36 נמנה בא' של מלכים (Ahaz) was counted under the era of kings (under whom Isaiah prophesied). Num. R. beg. ואיזה א'—איזה יום what day, month, year and era (from the exodus from Egypt.). Pesik. Baḥod. p. 104 a היו מונין א' וכ' count ye a new era from my son’s redemption. Ib. Haḥod. p. 52 b sq. he wrote her marriage contract וכתב לה א' in which he stated the era of his government.

sense.definition: (incorr. איפוט', איפיט') m. (ὑπατικός) consularis, Emperor’s delegate, viceroy.
sense.notes: Mekh. B’shall. Amalek, 2, א' מבטל וכ' the Hypaticus annuls it over his (the Hegemon’s) hand (ignoring his authority).— Pl. אִיפָּטִיקִין. Tanḥ. (ed. Bub.), Vayesheb 2 אפסיקין (corr. acc., v. note 4). V. היפטיקוס.
, v. preced.
Bekh. 5 a, a. fr. אנן א' מתנינן לה our version is the reverse. Ḥull. 20 b, a. fr. אדרבא א' מסתברא, v. אַדְּרַבָּא. R. Hash. 20 a; a. v. fr.
, v. אַפִּיקִילְטָא

sense.definition: (אֲפִיצְטְלִין Mus.) m. pl. (pastilli) lozenges, pills of sugar.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to I, 2. V. פִּיצְטְלִין, פּסְטילֹוס; cmp. Yalk. Cant. 981.
, v. אַפְסָר
, v. אָנְפָּקִינוֹן
, v. אֶפְרָא
Zeb. 116 b I. Ormuzd, mother of king Shapur; B. Bath. 8 a bot; Taan. 24 b; Nid. 20 b אפ'.
, v. אִפַּרְוָורִין

, Midr. Sam. s. 5 א' משלו היה read הפְּרוּטוֹת … היו (v. פְּרוּטָה, esp. Pes. 50 b) he (Nebucadnezar) had to pay the writer’s fees (for the change of בר אלהין into מלאכיה Dan. III, 25; 28), i.e. had to suffer for it; v. אִימּוּס. Cant. R. to VII, 9 פריטין משלו היו read פרוטין.

sense.definition: (ὕπαρχος, ἔπαρχος) prefect of a province or town; governor, lieutenant.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 11; a. v. fr.— Pl. אִיפַּרְכִין, אִפַּ'; אִפַּרְכֵי, אִיפַּרְכַיָּא. Targ. Y. Num. XI, 28. Targ. Esth. I, 3; a. e.—Shebu. 6 b; a. fr.
, v. preced.
f. (deriv. of preced.) = next w.

Gen. R. s. 39; a. fr. [In Targ. also אִיפַּרְכָיוּתָא.]— Pl. אִיפַּרְכִיֹּות, אִפַּ'. Gen. R. s. 89; a. e. [Targ. Lam. I, 1 אַפְרִיכְיָא, read אִיפַּרְכַיָּיא. Targ. Y. II, Deut. III, 11 אפרכיון, read בֵּי אֵרְכִיוָן.] [Midr. Sam. ch. VII, לא' (Var. לאפי), v. אַפַּנְטֵי.]
, v. preced.

sense.definition: (Ithpe. denom. of פּוּרְסָן) he was taxed (by Roman officials), i.e. his property was seized for taxes.
sense.notes: Y. Kidd. III, 64 a top א' לוי Levy’s property &c.
, v. אַפֹּופְסִין
, v. אֶפֶשׁ a. אֶפְשַׁר.
, v. אִיפֹּותֹורֹוס
Gitt. 69 b א' רטיבא וכ' (Ar. אִצָּא) green twigs with which the river is dammed in (figur. for diarrhœa stopped). Cmp. הוּצָא.

Yeb. 121 b top, אגב איצצא מזקי (Ar. איצא) on account of the pressure (which the falling person exercises on the serpents in the pit) they injure him. Sabb. 144 b דאתי בתר איצצא Ar. (ed. איצצתא; Ms. M. אִיצִיצָא) (the juice) which oozes out of the grapes through the pressure of their non weight. M. Kat. 11 a salted fish made fit for immediate use אגב א' by squeezing (and washing) out the salt.— Pl. אִיצְצֵי. Ib. שיתין א' sixty times pressed and washed.

sense.definition: trnsf. depression, depreciation in the market; [oth.
sense.notes: opin. deterioration of quality]. Keth. 100 b אע"ג דנפל ביה איצצתא (read דנפלא; Ar. דהוי ביה איצא, Rashi איצצא) though there is a risk of depreciation (on account of large supply for the festive season) [or of getting sour].
, v. אֲצַבְתִּי

sense.definition: f. (orig. m. pl., Ithp. of צדי q. v.; sub. שדה &c.)

sense.notes: Y. Erub. II, 22 b את רואה את הא' כילו וכ' you look upon the debris near Tiberias as &c. (cmp. אלסיס).—* Pl. איצְטַדִּינִין. B. Bath. 103 b א' מהו if the stones in the field are debris, how is it? [Comment. diff.]

sense.definition: cacophemism for theatre (a place of destruction).
sense.notes: [The prevailing versions are אצטרין, אסטרין q. v.]
Tosef. B. Kam. VI, 28, read אצטבא or אצטווא.
, v. אִסְטָנִית
Yeb. 17 a, v. צרי
, v. אִצְיָיא

sense.definition: (אֲצַר q. v.) what is pressed out, juice.
sense.notes: Gitt. 69 b (Ar. עצרא).
, v. אַסְטְרֹולֹוגֹוס

sense.definition: (אוק = עוק; cmp. Lat. ambire, b. h. סבב) stallion-goat, buck.
sense.notes: Sabb. 152 a א' שליפא וכ' Ar. (ed. עיקרא, עקירא, Ms. Oxf. עיקר, Ag. Hatt. עקר, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 40) a goat, if castrated, sells for eight &c. [V. Sachs Beitr. II, 131 sq.]
, v. אַק'
, Lev. R. s. 5, v. דאיקוטטא.
= אִיקֹונֹומֹוס.
Koh. R. VI, 3 אוקו' (corr. acc.); Gen. R. s. 32 יקו' (corr. acc.) (play on y’kum Gen. VII, 4).
, v. אִיקֹונֹומֹוס

Targ. Y. Gen. V, 3.— Pl. h. אִיקֹונִין, אִיקֹונֹות; ch. אִיקֹונַיָּא, אִיקֹונָתָא. Ex. R. s. 30 (של מלך) א' emperor’s statues; a. fr.—Y. Ab. Zar. III, beg. 42 b איקוניות, איקינות read אִיקֹונֹות. Ib. 42 c top; a. e. V. אִיקֹונִין. [Midr. Till. to Pss. XV, XVII, v. אִיקוֹנְיָא.]
Y. B. Mets. IX, beg. 12 a. Y. B. Bath. IV, 14 c bot. איקומנוס (corr. acc.). B. Bath. 68 b אינקלמוס, אנקולמוס, אנקל', אונק' (popul. corrupt.).
Midr. Till. to Ps. XV (ref. to Is. XXXI, 9, applied to the Roman empire or emperor) ‘his rock’ זה א' this means the statues with the likenesses of the emperors (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Statuary).

sense.definition: (pl. as a collect. noun) (denom. of אִיקֹון) a procession in which portable images are carried.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII א' של מלאכים וכ' a procession of angels passes before man and they cry, Make room לאיקוניה של וכ' (read לְאִקֹונָיו or לְאִיקֹונֹות; Yalk. Ps. 670; Deut. R. s. 4 לאִיקֹונִין) for the images of the Lord (man being created in the image of God). Deut. R. l. c. או' מהלכת (corr. acc.).
, v. preced.
read אִיקֹונִין.

sense.definition: (εἰκόνιον) picture, image; Targ. Y. Gen. IV, 5 features (pl.); a. fr.—Ex.
sense.notes: R. s. 15. Deut. R. s. 4, v. אִיקֹונְיָא II; a. fr.—Esp. זִיו א' the brightness of expression, features.—Gen. R. s. 53; a. fr.—Ex. R. s. 35 א' נאה (sub. זיו) fine appearance; Cant. R. to III, 11 אותונין (corr. acc.).— Pl. v. אִיקֹון
, Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 d, read with some ed. איקרין, v. אִיקָר
Ithpe. of קְלַס.
. Yalk. Job 919.

sense.definition: (= h. יְקָר, v. אִי־) honor, glory.
sense.notes: —Targ. Prov. XI, 16; a. fr.—Y. Ber. I, 2 d איקרִי וכ' my honor counts for nothing before the honor of my Maker. Ib. II, 4 b מה את פליג ליה א' (not אתפליג) what honor dost thou pay it (by passing by)?; Y. Shek. II, 47 a top.—Y. Peah VIII, 21 b bot. פרנסה דא' an honorable livelihood. Y. Ḥag. I, 76 d top איגרא דא', v. אִיגְּרָא.— Pl. אִיקְרִין presents, greetings. Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 d (some ed. איקלין).

sense.definition: (אור, cmp. חור) white substance, undyed wool or cotton.
sense.notes: Sabb. 11 b; (Tosef. ib. I, 8 missing). Ib. 79 a דוגמא לא' a sample color for the wool (given to the dyer).— Pl. אִירִין. B. Kam. 119 b, the remnants of wool in the hands of the dyer. [R. Hanan. reads אִידָּא q. v.] [Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. I, 4 אִירָה; Kel. XXI, 1 עִירָה.]

sense.definition: (v. preced.) made of white clay, unburned and flat clay-dish, a kind of tray extemporized for immediate use in the field.
sense.notes: — Pl. אִירֹונִיֹּות &c. Eduy. II, 5 לפסין אי' ed. (Ms. אלפסין ארנ', Mish. Nap. ארו'). Y. Sabb. XI, 13 a ארו'. Bets. 32 a חיר' Ms. M. (ed. חר') expl. = עיר' Ms. M. (ed. ער') = צעי חקלייתא field-dishes. [Rashi; from עיר used in country towns(!), hence coarse, unfinished.].

sense.definition: (supposed to be = ἴρις) Erus, a lily with an aromatic root.
sense.notes: Kil. V, 8, expl. Y. ib. 30 a bot. אִירְסַיָּה (pl. of אִירְסָא, v. P. Sm. s. v.). Tosef. ib. III, 13. Ohol. VIII, 1.

sense.definition: (prob. from its use, v. ארס a. deriv.) erus, a musical instrument used at weddings and funerals, drum, taboret.
sense.notes: Sot. IX, 14 על האי'—גזרו the use of the erus at weddings was interdicted; v. expl. Bab. ib. 49 b; Y. ib. 24 c top. Kel. XV, 6 הא' (used at funerals).
, v. אֵרוּסִין
Targ. Y. Num. XXIX, 35 (= h. מִקְרָא).
, v. אִרְיָא
, v. אֱרִימִין
Koh. R. beg. (play on Jeremiah).
, Y. Maasr. V, 52 a, read אֶירֶס.
, v. אֶרֶס
, v. אֵירוּס I
, v. אָרַע, אֲרַע.

sense.definition: , v. אֱינָשׁ) being, man; husband; lord.
sense.notes: —א' ירושלים a native or citizen of Jerusalem Aboth I, 4; a. fr.—Yoma I, 7 אִישִׁי כה"ג my lord the High-priest. Sot. 17 a א' ואשה husband and wife; a. fr.— Pl. אֲנָשִׁים, v. אֱנֹושׁ.
, v. אֶשְׁבֹּורָן
— Pl. אִישִּׁים, אִשִּׁ'. Ned. 13 a. Zeb. V, 4 כליל לא' altogether to be burnt; a. fr.
(v. אֲשַׁן a. b. h. אִישֹׁון) essence, exact time, season. Targ. Y. Gen. XVIII, 5. Ib. XXVIII, 10; a. fr. (in Targ. Y.).— Pl. אֲשׁוּנֵי, אִשׁוּנֵי. Targ. Y. Lev. XV, 25; Deut. XXXI, 10. Cmp. אֵיתָן.

Cant. R. to VIII, 11 אישורְךָ היא it is thy praise. Y. Succ. III, 54 a top, with ten var. expressions of praise are the psalms headed באי' with the word ashré, &c.—2) (v. אָשַׁר Pi. 1) legal attestation. Y. B. Mets. I, 8 a bot; v. אַשָּׁרָא. [Some ed. אֵישֶׁר.].

Ab. Zar. 36 b דאורייתא א' דרך חתנות biblically intermarriage with gentiles is forbidden only in the way of legal marriage (opp. concubinage, &c.). Y. Kidd. I, 59 c bot. שִׁפְחוּת אחר א' servitude after marriage, i.e. a father selling his daughter after she had been married and had returned to her parental home in widowhood &c. Yeb. 76 a, a. fr. לשום א' with the intention of establishing a matrimonial relation.
Y. Erub. II, 20 a א' קנים, v. חִיצָה II
, v. אִיסְטַ'
, v. אַשְׁפָּה
, v. אוּשְפַּרְתִּי

sense.definition: (Af. of אֲשַׁר) good luck! Y. Shebi. IV, 35 b what means ‘we salute them’? Ans.
sense.notes: (Saying) אי' good luck. Ib. איי'. Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot.; a. e.
of אָשַׁר.—אֵישֶׁר, v. אִישּׁוּר.
, v. חִישָׁה

Targ. I Chr. XII, 24; a. e.—Y. Sot. VIII, 22 c bot. אמתא א' a cubit has six handbreadths. Y. Snh. I, end, 19 d חד מן א' one sixth. Ib. X, 28 b top אש' ירחין six months.— Pl. אַשְׁתִּין sixty. Targ. Y. II, Num. XII, 16. Cmp. אֲשִׁיתָּא.
Ḥull. 95 a bot. מברא דאי' the ford of I.
, v. אִשְׁתִּיתָא
formative prefix, v. אִתְ־. [Words not found here below, will be found under אִתְ־.]

entry.language-reference: יֵשׁ; אות, cmp. יַת, אִישׁ, אֵת &c.)

sense.definition: prop. being, existence, hence there is, are; est qui &c. Targ. Gen. XVIII, 24; a. fr.—Y. Ber. VI, end, 10 d א' תניי תני וכ' one Tannai reads … R. Hash. 11 b, a. fr. כדאיתא as it is, i.e. as stated.
sense.notes: —אית לי I have, I hold (the opinion).—Snh. 90 a, a. fr. מר כדאית ליה וכ' the one in accordance with the opinion he holds, and the other &c.—B. Mets. 5 a, a. fr. אם איתא לדר' … if the opinion of R. … has (had) any substance, i.e. if we must adopt his authority.—Yoma 41 a מאי א' לך למימר what hast thou to reply?—B. Mets. 3 a מאי א' לי גבי וכ' what have I to do with the hired man?—Yeb. 116 a כי אִיתְנֵכוּ בש' when ye are in Shili &c.—Compounds אית־כא, contr. אִיכָּא; לא איתא contr. לֵיתָא. [אִיתָאִי, אִיתִי, my existence, I am = h. עֹודִי. Targ. Ps. CIV, 33; a. e.] Cmp. אִיתַי.
come!, Imp. of אֲתָא.

sense.definition: (cmp. אִית a. אִישׁ; = h. אִשָּׁה; (cmp. אִנְתָּא) woman, wife.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. II, 22; a. fr.—Y. Maasr. V, end, 52 a חדא איתא a certain woman. Y. Taan. I, 64 b bot. איתה. Y. Ber. II, 5 c bot. איתתֵיה דאבוהי his father’s wife, step-mother (fig. for Babylon); a. fr.

sense.definition: (preced.) = h. אִישׁוּת matrimony; לא' in matrimony, as wife.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XII, 19; a. fr.
of אֲתָא.—[Pes. 50 a איתו אנן, v. אִיתַי.]
Targ. Hos. XIV, 3.

sense.definition: , אִיתַיי (pl. of אִית) there is, there are.
sense.notes: Dan. II, 10; a. fr.—Y. Shebi. X, 39 c ל' יום לא איתיי (Y. Macc. I, 31 a … איתי) a loan on thirty days does not exist, i.e. does not come within the rule whereby a creditor may secure collection by announcing legal action before the Sabbath year limitation takes effect.—*Pes. 50 a כי היכי דאיתו אנן אִיתִינָן וכ' (read דאיתי or דאיתינן; Ms. M. אתינן; diff. vers. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) as we are esteemed here (in this world) so are we there (in the world of the beatified).
Kerith. 24 a
Targ. Ezek. XXVII, 6 (ed. Vien. אִתְיָטְרוּן).

sense.definition: (= אִית, אִיתַי a. אֲמָא) some say.
sense.notes: —שׁמואל וא' ר' יוחנן Samuel or, as some say, R. Johan. Bets. 6 a; a. fr. [Diff. fr. ואי תימא.]
, read אֱטִימוֹס.
, v. אִיתַי and אִית.

sense.definition: (const. אִיתְכַּל) m. = h. אֶשְׁכֹּל (q. v.) bunch of grapes.
sense.notes: Targ. Num. XIII, 24; a. e.— Pl. אִיתְכָּלִין, אַתְכָּ', אִיתְכָּלַיָּיא. Targ. I Sam. XXV, 18; a. e.—Trnsf. scholars, opp. עילייא (leaves), the untutored. Ḥull. 92 a ליבעי רחמי וכ' let the grapes pray for the leaves (the scholars for the untutored); for but for the leaves, the grapes could not exist. V. אֶשְׁכֹּל.
, v. אַטְלֵיז end.
Targ. Ps. X, 14; Job XXXI, 17 Ms. (ed. יתם).
Targ. Ex. IV, 10; a. e.—Erub. 15 a; a. e.

entry.language-reference: אית; cmp. אִית, עוּת, אִישֹׁון, אֲשַׁן)

sense.notes: Nidd. 48 b חזר לאֵיתָנֹו obtained again its normal condition. Sot. 36 b שבה קשתו לא' his membrum resumed its normal condition. (Cmp. Ex. XIV, 27).

R. Hash. 11 a א' לישנא דתקיפי ethan means strong.— Pl. אֵיתָנִים. Ib. אֵיתָנֵי עולם the mighty of the world (patriarchs). Gen. R. s. 98 (play on ãthono Gen. XLIX, 11) בנים אֵתָנִים וכ' mighty sons (heroes) are destined to descend from him.
Succ. 18 a (Ms. M. נתן); a. e.
Koh. R. beg., v. אַוְותֶּנְטְיָא

sense.definition: (= אתנסיס, אתנסס, v. נסס; or Ithpe. of נוס or ניס) to be taken sick.
sense.notes: Sabb. 145 b אִיתְנַסִּי (Ms. M. אִיתְנַיֵּיס אִיתְנַיְּיסִי Ithpa.) I should have grown sick; (Ms. Oxf. איסתכני I should have been in danger). Git. 56 a אִתְנִיסָא (or אִתְנַיְּסָה) she grew sick (from aversion), fainted. Cmp. אִיסְתְּנִיס. [אִיתְנִיס = אִתְאֲנִיס, v. אֲנַס.]
, v. אִית
, v. אִסְקוּטְלָא I
, v. אִיתָּא

Pes. 5 a אך חלק the word akh (Ex. XII, 15 ‘but on the first [preceding] day’) intimates a division of the day between two categories as to the laws concerning that day. Kerith 7 a; a. fr.— Pl. (אַכִּים) אַכִּין the word akh in the Biblical texts. Y. Ber. IX, 14 b bot., a. e. א' ורקין מיעוטין the akh and the rak intimate limiting qualifications.
B. Mets. 59 b; v. חֲכָךְ. Gen. R. s. 32, end; Tanḥ. Noah 9, ed. Bub. 3, cmp. preced.
Targ. Prov. XXII, 18 (ed. Vien. אֵיךְ).

sense.definition: (כאב) fever connected with pains, חמה וא', a vers. for אַבְאָבִית; q. v.

sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 38, end (ed. אבאטיס corr. acc.).
, v. אַבָּכָא
Kidd. 71 b Ar. (ed. בגדא, בגדת); v. אֲוָנָא II.
= אֵיכְדֵין.
, Targ. Ps. CIV, 3 Ms., read אִינְדְּרֹוי or אַכְסַדְרֹוי; v. אִינְדְּרָא
Y. Succ. V, 55 b bot. read מִכְוַור.
, v. אַכְוַר'

sense.definition: , עָכוּז m. (כוז, v. כּוּז) [hollow, arched pitcher], euphem. for buttocks or extremity ( testicles &c.).
sense.notes: Bekh. VI, 6 (40 a) ע'. Erub. 53 b (question as to spelling) א' or ע? (Ms. M. אבוד, עבוד, Rashi אבוז, עבוז; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). V. P. Sm. s. v. כוז 1691 sq. V. אֵבוּז, הַרְגִּיז.
ch. (v. preced.) = כּוּזָא. Taan. 20 b Ms. M., ed. כוזא.

Y. Snh. X, 29 c (Bab. ib. 110 b כ' עַכֹּו; Joseph. B. J. II, 20, 6 Καφαρεκχώ); Tanḥ. (ed. Bub.) B’resh. 25 עכו (Var. איכוס); Ḥull. 55 b עִיכּוּם; Y. Sot. VII, 21 c bot. אמוס (corr. acc.; Bab. ib. 37 b עכו).

sense.definition: (Pers. Kh wangar, Kh walgar, Fl.) table-steward, seneschal.
sense.notes: Keth. 61 a כו' Ar. (ed. אטורנגא read אַכְוַונְגְּרָא; Var. in Ar. כונדקא, corr. acc.).— Pl. אַכְוַנְגְּרֵי. M. Kat. 12 a (Ar. אכנ', ed. אבו', corr. acc., Ms. M. אכוורנ', cmp. Rabb. D. S. a. l., a. vol. VIII, p. 75). [Pes. 40 b Ms. M. בורדיקאי, ed. בורדיקי, Ar. כוורדקי, prob. corrupt. of our w.]

Khawarnak, Fl.) dining place, dining hall in the garden. Targ. Y. Deut. XXXII, 50, א' … קי דמלכיא a royal banqueting hall (put up for the wedding). Taan. 14 b; Meg. 5 b (distinguishing between בנין, erection of a building, and נטיעה, putting up a temporary structure), what is meant by ‘putting up a tent of joy?’—זה הנוטע אכ' של מלכים Ms. M. (Ar. כ'; ed. אב', corr. acc.) it means one putting up a regal banqueting tent (for his son’s wedding). Erub. 25 b אכ' וכ' (ed. אב') the Resh Gelutha was to have a banquet (on a Sabbath) in his garden.
Targ. I Chr. I, 7 ed. Rahm.; Targ. Y. Gen. X, 4 אכזיא, v. אֲכָיָיא

sense.definition: (b. h.) Achzib (Ecdippa, Ecdippon), a sea-town in Northern Palestine.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. V, 36 b bot. he who travels מעכו לא' (Git. 7 b; Tosef. Oh. XVIII, 14 מעכו לכְזִיב) from Acco (Ptolemais) to Ach. (Chezib).
Denom. Nithpa. נִתְאַכְזָר to show one’s self merciless. Num. R. s. 8.
. Targ. Job XLI, 2 (

sense.definition: ; a. e.—Lam. R. introd. (R. Joh. קטילא א' merciless slaughter.
sense.notes: — Pl. אַכְזְרָאִין. Targ. Deut. XXXII, 33. Targ. J. II ibid. אַכְזְרֹואֵי.

sense.definition:
, אַכְזָרִית f. (b. h.,
r. כזר) cruel, merciless; also strictly just.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to VII, 16; a. e. B. Bath. 16 a bot.— Pl. אַכְזְרִיִּים, אַכְזָרִים; fem. אַכְזְרִיֹּות. Pesik. R. s. 44. Num. R. s. 8. [Ib. s. 9 מדת אכזרית, read אַכְזְרִיּוּת.]
, v. אַכְרְזִיאֵל
Succ. 14 a; Num. R. s. 10 (p. 239, ed. Amst.) מדת א' the divine justice. Ib. s. 9, v. אַכְזָרִי.—Esth. R. to I, 15 שלא כדת אלא בא' not according to law but with cruelty.
, v. אַכְזָרִי
, Ab. Zar. 34 b Ar., v. אַבְטָא
Gen. R. s. 14 beg.; a. e.; v. אִיטָא. Tanḥ. (ed. Bub.) B’midb. 21 אקטו.

sense.definition: Achaia, the Roman province including Peloponnesus and northern Greece, south of Thessaly.
sense.notes: Targ. I Chr. I, 7 אכזווייא (Var. איטליון); Targ. Y. Gen. X, 4 אכזיא; Y. Meg. I, 71 b bot. אביא (Gen. R. s. 37 איטליא), (for b. h. כִּתִּים). [Sifré Num. 131 אביא, v. אסיא.]

Y. Sabb. I, 4 a top, a. e. אֲכִילַת בן דרוסא (דרוסאי, דור') the food Ben D’rosa used to eat, i.e. third done. Yoma 80 b א' גסה excessive meal. Ib. 81 a, a. fr. א' בכזית wherever אכל (to eat) is mentioned in the Bible text, the size of an olive is meant. Y. Sot. III, 19 b top אכילת מזבח the consumption (of sacrifices) on the altar. Zeb. 31 b; a. fr. א' פרס, v. פְּרָס. Kil. II, 10, v. אָכְלָה II.— Pl. אֲכִילֹות. Pes. 78 a. Gen. R. s. 86, beg. (play on אוכיל Hos. XI, 4) א' הרבה (some ed. אוביל—אבילות corr. acc.) purveyances
Targ. I Kings XIX, 8 (ed. Vien. אֲכִילָתָא).
Y. Gitt. VII, beg. 48 c א' גו סמיק, v. סמיק; (Y. Ter. I, 40 b אבוס read our w. or אִכּוּם = אִיכּוּמָא); cmp. Gitt. 67 b
Y. Ber. III, 6 a א' בר נש וכ' is it thus man deals with his neighbor? Y. Keth. II, 26 c bot. אתמול אמרת א' וכ' yesterday thou saidst so, and to-day thou sayest otherwise; a. fr. V. הָכֵין.
Af. of כסס.
, v. לָאכִיסִין

sense.definition: (אכך, cmp. כַּכָּא) ground or pounded drug, poultice.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXX, 24, Var. for אספלניתא.
Targ. Prov. VII, 10, read אַסְכְּמָא.
Inf. in Y. freq. לוֹכַל = לֶאֱכוֹל. Ber. I, 1; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: trnsf. to absorb, occupy, take away.
sense.notes: Y. Shebu. VII, 38 a בשרבית אֹוכֶלֶת בו when interests gnaw on (absorb) the property. Y. Erub. IV, 21 d bot. ד' אמות אֹוכְלֹות וכ' four cubits entering into the area of Tiberias. Num. R. s. 4 כמה לוחות אֹוכְלֹות how much space did the tablets occupy &c.? B. Bath. 14 a (interchanging with איגרות, Var. אוגדות, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 5, 6).
Keth. V, 9, differ. of opin. ib. 65 b; Y. ib. 30 b top a. bot.

sense.definition: to be eaten &c. Zeb. I, 3; Ber. I, 1; a. fr.

sense.notes: Tam. I, 4 המְאוּכָּלֹות הפנימיות (Talm. ed. המעו') the thoroughly lighted coals in the centre; Y. Yoma II, 39 c

sense.definition: to give to eat, cause to eat.
sense.notes: Keth. V, 3 היבם אינו מַאֵכִיל וכ' the Yabam does not transfer the privilege of eating T’rumah to his sister-in-law. Kidd. 31 a יש מאכיל וכ' one may feed his father on pheasants &c.; a. fr.

sense.definition: to be consumed, burnt up, digested.
sense.notes: Ber. VIII, 7 עד כדי שיִתְאַכֵּל וכ' Ar. (ed. שיתע') until the food is digested (or absorbed) in his bowels. Tam. II, 1; a. e.
Snh. VI, 12 Y. ed. נתא' הבשר (Mish. 6 נתע') when the flesh of the corpse was gone. Cant. R. to IV, 4 שלא נתא' אחת מהן none of them was worn off. Kidd. 59 a נתא' המעות the money was spent; a. e.
ch.
Targ. Gen. II, 16; a. fr.—Y. Ter. VIII, 46 a כד אתון יֵיכלון when they came and were about eating; ib. (more corr.) אתון מיכל; a. fr.

sense.definition: with קרצי prop. to eat ( the bread of) destruction, eat the informer’s bread, hence to inform against.
sense.notes: Dan. III, 8; VI, 25.—Targ. Ps. XV, 3; a. fr.—Gitt. 56 a איכול בהו קו'; Lam. R. to IV, 2 איכול קרצהון I will inform against them.

sense.definition: to give to eat, to support.
sense.notes: Y. Ter. X, 47 b bot. אוכלה ליה he gave it to him to eat. Gen. R. s. 48, end (read:) אוכלית אשקית לוי hast thou given (thy guest) to eat? to drink? do escort him, i.e. perform thy duties fully. Y. Kidd. I, 61 b הוה מייכל לאבוי וכ' fed his father on &c.; a. fr.

Targ. Ps. LXVIII, 23; a. fr. Tanḥ. Emor, 6 ומה דהבא מִתְאֲכִיל וכ'; Lev. R. s. 27 ומה זה וכ' what is this? do they eat gold &c.? Kidd. 59 a קא מתאכלי were eaten up (spent). [אכלי Af. of כלי to cry, v. כלי.]
Ned. 51 a ליכיל לי מר please measure for me. Ruth R. introd. 2. הא … סאה תקום אכול (read סאתה קום) here is the bag and here the measure, get up and fill it; v. כּוּל.
, v. אֹוכֶל
Targ. Jud. XIV, 14.

sense.definition: , Targ. Ps. CIV, 21 Ms., ed. אכלין, v. כְּלִי to cry.
(כלב; v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.; cmp. כְּלוּב, כְּלִיבָה; Var. lect.
sense.notes: אַכְלְכָא, v. infra) shed, store-room. B. Mets. 63 b חיטי … באַכְלְבָאִי (v. Var. lect. in Rabb. D. S. a. l.; Mss. a. Ar. אכלכא) would my wheat have gone to ruin in my granary? Taan. 24 a (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).— Pl. אַכְלְבֵי. Gitt. 56 a אכלבא … שתין א' וכ' one shed of wheat requires sixty sheds of wood (for baking). B. Mets. 72 b חיטי דא' (Ms. M. באכלכי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) wheat stored in granaries &c.

sense.definition: , (אכל) א' טִינָא mud-eater, name of a parasitic worm in fishes.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 73 b (Ms. M. אבל' טינא; oth. var., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

Kil. II, 10 Y. ed. אָכְלַת הגפן (Mish. ed. אֲכִילַת; Y. Gem. 28 a אוֹכְלַת) the soil occupied by the vine roots, א' הקבר the ground needed for the formation of the cave, i.e. as far as the roots &c. extend.
, v. אֹוכְלֹוסָא
, v. כְּלֹונָס
B. Mets. 77 a; v., however, אַבְלֹושֵׁי.
Targ. Ps. CIV, 24 אָכְלִין, some ed., read אַכְלִין.
Targ. Job IV, 10; a. e.
Y. Ab. Zar. IV, 43 d, v. אֹוכֶל
Y. Maasr. III, 50 d bot.
, v. אֲלַכְסִין

sense.definition: (√כם; cmp. חם) to be sun-burnt, black, dark-colored.
sense.notes: Nithpa. to be blackened. נִתְאַכֵּם. Sot. 15 b נִתְאַכְּמוּ פניו the outside of the pot grew black (Var. נתפחמו).

sense.definition: (= חכ', onomatop.; cmp. חכך Pi.) to cough.
sense.notes: Kidd. 81 b top. א' שדא ביה כיחו he coughed, and threw his phlegm into the cup. [Perh. כסא אַ' a black, dirty cup?]
, v. אָכֵין
, v. אַכְוַנְגַּר
Tosef. Ḥull. III (IV), 27, v. אכספטיאס
(?) Gitt. 69 a (a word in a charm formula). Cmp. אַכְתָּנָא.
, v. אָכְסִיגָרֹון

sense.definition: (ἐξέδρα, exedra) (Greek) a covered place in front of the house; (Roman) recess, parlor, hall for conversations and discussions.
sense.notes: Targ. Jud. III, 23. [ Pl. Targ. Ps. CIV, 3, v. אִינְדְּרָא.] B. Bath. 11 b א' דבי רב the hall of the school house (philosophers’ exedra, v. Sm. Ant. s. v.), contrad. to א' רומייתא (Ms. Oxf. דרומיתא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 10) Roman exedra (open but surrounded by a railing). Ib. 25 ab עולם לא' וכ' the world resembles an exedra the northernmost side of which is not covered (מסוככת Ms. M., ed. מסובבת not surrounded); a. fr.— Pl. אַכְסַדְרָאֹות. Tam. 28 b א' של בנין exedras forming, or belonging to, a structure (opp. to open exedra with plants).
Lev. R. s. 18 אכסי' (Ar. כסוריא) (corr. acc.).
Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. VII, 4 א' קמטרא, read with R. S. to Kel. X, 1 עף [אף] כסוי קמטרא also the lid of a chest.

sense.definition: (ὀξύγαρον, oxygarum) a sauce of vinegar and garum; in gen. a sauce of all kinds of vegetables.
sense.notes: Ber. 35 b bot. Ms. M. (ed. אנס'); Yoma 76 a; Shebu. 23 a. Tosef. Bets. II, 16. Y. Shebi. VIII, 38 a top אָקְסִי'; Tosef. Ter. IX, 10; ib. Shebi. VI, 3 סְנִיגְרֹון.— Pl. אָכְסִיגָרִיֹּות, abbrev. סִגָּרִיֹּות vegetable sauces, vegetables used for oxygarum. Shebi. IX, 5 ed. (Var. סנריות, סנדיות, סגדיות, Ms. M. הנידיות); Tosef. ib. VII, 13 אגוטרי read אָגְזוּגָרִין; Sifra B’har Par. II ch. 3 סנדריות (Rabad סנדיות; corr. acc.). [Koh. R. to XI, 9 ארגסטירין read אֹוגְסִיגָרִין.]

Midr. Till. to Ps. VI, end אחרים מקבלים אנ' וכ' (corr. אכ') others receive the petition presented to him אני איני מבקש אלא אנסיומין שלי (corr. acc., insert שאתה תקבל) I only ask that thou mayest receive my petition thyself. Ib. to Ps. CII אל תתן א' שלי בתוכה (read שלו); [the entire passage is obscure and seems out of place].
Gen. R. s. 46, v. אַקְסְיֹוס
, read אֶכְסִיטֵירִין, v. אֶגְסִיטֵרִין
Tosef. Kil. V, 26, Var. of כליסים, v. אכסלי
, v. אֶכְסֹורִיָּה

Men. 97 a כליא' common wooden vessels; Ḥag. 26 b כלי אכסלגס Ar. (ed. אכסלגים Ms. M. אבלוגסין corr. acc.).—Zeb. 94 a כלי אַכְסִלְגְּיָא (Ms. M. אכסלמוס) forester’s apparel (leather covers &c.); v. אַבְלוּסְמֹוס.
, v. אַכְסִילְגֹּוס

sense.definition: , Tosef. Kil. V, 26 (ed. Zuck. כליסים הגרגים, Var. כליסיס, אכסילין) prob. כלים אַכְסִילִינִין (ξύλινος) cotton clothes.
(denom. of אַכְסָן II) to harbor a guest.
sense.notes: Nithpa. נִתְאַכְסֵן to be received; to lodge with. Midr. Till. to Ps. CXVI.

sense.definition:
(transpos. of אסכנא, v. סִכָּא; h.
יָתֵד) weaver’s pin.
sense.notes: Targ. Jud. XVI, 13; 14; a. fr.—*Sabb. 151 b אפי' מליא כא' דגרדאי Ms. Oxf. a. Ar. (ed. כאביסנא; Ms. M. מלי אכסניא וגרדאי) even if the painting stick is as thick (with paint) as a weaver’s pin.
pl. אַכְסָנִים, v. next art.
, read:

sense.definition: (deriv. of אַכְסַנְיָא) stranger, guest, lodger; also (ξένος) hired soldier.
sense.notes: Y. Erub. II, end 20 b יֵעָשֶׂה כא' let him be considered as a stranger (transient lodger). Tosef. Shebi. V, 21 אכסנא some ed. (ed. Zuck. אַכְסְנָיִין pl.) soldier, v. אַכְסַנְיָא 3).—Arakh. 16 b א' דאקראי an occasional guest. Ib. א' פוגם ונפגם a traveller (constantly changing his lodging place) discredits others a. himself; a. fr.— Pl. אַכְסְנָיִין (v. supra), אַכְסְנִין Lev. R. s. 27.—אַכְסְנֵי, אַכְסְנַיָּא, אַכְסְנָאֵי. Targ. Y. II Gen. XLVII, 21 א' גילולאי exiled strangers. Gen. R. s. 50 הב לאילין א' give these travellers &c.—*אַכְסָנִים. Num. R. s. 10 (p. 239 c ed. Amst.) מנהג הא' custom of hospitality [prob. אכסניא].

sense.definition: (v. אלכסנדרית) an Alexandrian merchantman (Alexandria navis); trnsf. a high mast (satyrically for cross, gallows).
sense.notes: Targ. II, Esth. VII, 10 the son of Hamdatha wants to ascend לא' דבר פנדירא (Ms. לאַלַכְסַ') the mast of the son of Pandira (is to be hanged). Neg. XII, 1 באכסנדריא (marginal vers. in Mishn. edit., text אסקריא, Var. אסדא, אכסדיא, אסכדיא q. v.) in the rigging

Ex. R. s. 35 א' נעשו וכ' (Pes. 118 b, corr. acc) they were a lodging place to my children in Egypt (they offered hospitality to &c.).—בעל א' host. Pesik. R. s. 11; cmp. אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָן.—B. Mets. 85 a תורה מחזרת על א' שלה scholarship likes to come around to its inn again (to be hereditary in the family); a. fr.
B. Mets. 87 a one must inquire בא' שלו after the health of his hostess.

sense.definition: quarter given to troops on march or to transient poor men; also the passing troop, or the passing poor; (individ.) beggar.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXXI, 32; a. e.—B. Bath. 11 b א' לפי בני אדם the quartering (of soldiers takes place) in proportion to the number of inmates (of each house). Dem. III, 1; v. Y. ib. 23 b top. Tosef. Shebi. V, 21 אין מאכילין אכסניין וכ' ed. Zuck. (Var. את אכסניא) you are not allowed to give … to soldiers quartered with you. Y. Ber. IX, 13 b ההן א' עלובתא this poor beggar. Ib. א' עלו' poor beggars. Lev. R. s. 34. Lam. R. to I, 1 (חד מירו') בר נש א' a poor man.

sense.definition: a gathering of scholars entertained by the hospitable of the place.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. IV, 8 b top נפיק לא' leaving for the scholars’ meeting. Bab. ib. 63 b פתח בכבוד א' opened his speech in honor of hospitality to scholars.
Sot. 36 b
Mekh. B’shall. Shirah 4; Yalk. Ex. 246; a. e. (interchanging with אפסניא q. v.).

sense.definition: (read אכסנופרוכא Xenoparochus) one who provides for strangers or soldiers, quartermaster.
sense.notes: Y. B. Kam. III, 3 c top ההן א' פ' … שרי למיחשדוניה וכ' (read למישחדוניה) it is permissible to bribe the quartermaster (to let you off) before the Romans enter (the place), but not after that (when one man’s release from quartering duty is a direct injury to the other inhabitants).

66 b, Ab. Zar. 39 a אקונס ואפונס … וא' (v. Var. lect. Rabb. D. S. a. l.), Tosef. Ḥull. III (IV), 27 קולייס ופולמוס כספתיאס אכנס וכ', restore (א)קולייס ופילמוס (א)כסיפיאס (כסיפייס) ואתניאס (ואתנייס) וכ' κολίας, πήλαμυς, ξίφιας, ἀθνίας, names of fishes (v. Greek Dict.) Colias, Pelamys, Xiphias, Athnias and Thunny; v. אֲטוּנָס.
Tosef. Ohol. XVIII, 5, v. אסכדיא a. אכסנדריא.—[V. also next w.]

sense.definition: (used as adverb; a comp. of אך a. סרח less or more, v. נכי) in a lump, on measuring by sight.
sense.notes: Dem. II, 5 (Ms. M. אסכרא); Y. ib. III, 23 c מוכרן א' he sells them in a lump (as many as there may be). Maas. Sh. IV, 2. Sifra B’ḥukk. Par. 4, ch. X; a. e.

sense.definition: (b. h. אָכַף, √כף, v. כפף), denomin. of אוכָּף, to ride on a saddled ass.
sense.notes: Nid. 14 a הא דמֵיכַף וכ' Ar. (ed. דמַכַּף = מְאַכַּף Pa.) in the one case it means that he rides on a saddled ass. [מיכף Snh. 36 a, v. כּוּף.]
B. Bath. 69 a אבני דא' stones to weight the sheaves down to protect them from the wind.

sense.definition: a contrivance to carry loads, as a hand-barrow or hand-basket.
sense.notes: Sabb. 66 b חמרא דא', v. אָנְקִטְמִין. Bets. 30 a (var. אכיתפא on the shoulder, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (אכף; cmp. b. h. אֶכֶף) burden, care, solicitude, followed by ל־ of the person concerned.
sense.notes: Targ. I. Chr. XXI, 13 אִיכַּפַת.—Y. Sot. V, 20 b top וביתא מאי אכפה ליה what concern is the Temple to him? Taan. 25 a מאי אי' לך why should that trouble thee? B. Mets. 40 a וכי מאי א' וכ' what do the mice care whether &c. Koh. R. to IV, 1 זה מה אי' ליה what concern is it to this one (if the other sinned), i.e. why should he suffer for it?; a. fr. Pesik. R. s. 10, beg. אי' להם will people care for them (miss them)? Git. 62 a מכפת לא אכפת ליה should he not care for it? Cmp. כפת.
, v. אִי'
, v. כַּרְגָּא
Y. Sabb. III, 5 d top. Num. R. s. 7.—Y. Bets. V, 63 a קולסי א' cabbage heads.
א' אוכמין כקדרא a coating of blackness like a pot. Targ. Jer. VIII, 21 (h. text קדר). Targ. Joel II, 6; Nah. II, 11 (h. text פארור). Cmp. קְרוּם.
Y. Maasr. I, 48 d top, read אַכְרוּב; cmp. קֶלַח.
f. h. = ch. אַכְרַזְתָּא. Y. Meg. IV, 75 b top, expl. אגרת בקורת, v. אִגֶּרֶת; Y. Keth. XI, 34 c; Y. Snh. I, 19 b top.

sense.definition: [ the herald of God], Akhr’ziel, an angel.
sense.notes: Yalk. Deut. 940. Deut. R. s. 11 אכזרי' (corr. acc.)

sense.definition: (= h. הַכְרָזָה; כרּז) proclamation announcing public sale, whence, auction, cmp. אִגֶּרֶת.
sense.notes: —B. Mets. 35 b ימי א' time appointed for public sale. Keth. 100 b נכסי דא' property sold at auction. Ib. for capitation-tax &c. we sell בלא א' without previous announcement; a. fr.

sense.definition: Midr. Till. to Ps. XIX, 5, Yalk. ib.
sense.notes: ברטניא pr. n., prob. a corrupt. of איי בריטניא Britannic Isles

sense.definition: (כרע) prop. balancing, hence balances, scales, weighing.
sense.notes: Pesik. B’shall. p. 82 a בא' דאכרעון וכ' in the way they weighed, they were weighed. [Cmp. Buber l. c. note 43.]
Targ. Koh. X, 10.

sense.definition: (contr. of אַד כְּעַנְתָא הִי) a scholastic term in Talm. Bab., still, even now, yet.
sense.notes: Meg. 2 a וא' מבעי ליה וכ' and still the plural form is needed. Yoma 27 a; a. fr.—מִדְּאַכַּתִּי since, up to that time. R. Hash. 10 b

sense.definition: (אכת, v. P. Sm. 191; cmp. אכסא, עכס, עכסה, עכן) venomous, vindictive.
sense.notes: Targ. Prov. XII, 28 Ms. Luzz. (v. Pesh., a. LXX b. c.); [some ed. אבהתנא, v. בְּהֵת; עַוְתָנָא; h. text נתיבה אַל וכ'!]
, cmp. סמוקר) greenish, blighted. Y. Dem. II, beg. 22 b is there no rice in Hulta? א' הוא it is greenish.

sense.definition: (כתר) [divine crown], pr. n. Akhtriel, a divine surname (attribute).
sense.notes: Ber. 7 a

sense.definition: Albam, a formula of permutation of letters wherein the first interchanges with the twelfth, the second with the thirteenth, &c. Num. R. s. 18 טבאל באלב"ם רמלא Tabel in Albam reads Ramla.
sense.notes: Sabb. 104 a

sense.definition: a prefix, = עַל; e.g. אַלְתּוּסְבְּרָאוֹת (= על האוצרות) appointed over treasures, v. אַ־.
(b. h.) not, no (according to Talmud a milder form of prohibition than לֹא; v. Y. Pes. VI, 33 b).
sense.notes: Aboth I, 3.—אל תקרי (abbr. א"ת), v. אֶלָּא. Taan. 11 a א' יראה וכ' shall not live to see &c.; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: אול to turn) prep. to, toward.
sense.notes: — Pl., with prefix מ a. suffix of pers. pron., of itself, of my ( his &c.) own accord, on my ( his &c.) authority. Yoma 5 b לא מֵאֵלַי not on my own authority. Orlah I, 2 העולה מֵאֵלָיו growing spontaneously.—Y. Peah VII, 20 b bot. its sacred character מֵאֵלָיו למדו they did derive from itself (i.e. from the wording of the law itself).—Hence מִמֵּילָא, v. מֵילָא.
Shebu. 35 a divine names which dare not be erased are El &c. Taan. 6 b bot.; a. fr.
Targ. Cant. VIII, 5; v. אַלָּתָא.

Targ. O. Ex. XV, 11 לית אִ' את none but thou, none besides thee; a. e.—Ber. V, 1 אין עומדין … א' וכ' one must stand up for prayer in no other disposition but that of humility.—Snh. 4 a לא נתן א' שלשה he did only three times. Ber. I, 1 ולא זו בלבד (אמרו) א' וכ' and not only in this case they said so, but wherever &c. Ib. 5 a אל תקרי תְלַמְּדֶנּוּ א' תְלַמְּדֵנוּ read not th’lamm’dennu (thou instructest him) but th’lamm’dçnu (thou teachest us); a. v. fr.

sense.definition: (ellipt.) (you cannot say anything except …) but, a logical inference excluding all other explanations &c. Ib.
sense.notes: 30 b א' לא שנא but (the conclusion is proven) there is no difference. Ib. א' אמר ר' but, said R. … we may derive it &c.; a. fr.
, read קְלִאוֹ', v. קלפטרא

sense.definition: (אלב to cut; cmp. חלף, חֵילֶף, חִילְפָא &c.) a bundle of shoots, broom.
sense.notes: Y. Meg. II, 73 a (for b. h. מְטַאְטֵא).

sense.definition: (v. preced.) young shoot of the palm-tree, thin pointed branch.
sense.notes: Pl. אִלְבָּנִין, אִלְבָּנַיָּיא. Cant. R. to VII, 9 the palm … has no less מן תלת אילנין אלבנין (strike out אילנין) than three new (cutting) shoots. Ib. in our place they call לאלבנייא סנסנייה the young shoots sans’naya (h. סנסנים). [Num. R. s. 3, beg., in Hebr. diction, אִנְבּוֹנִין, fr. אנב, cmp. אֵב; prob. to be read אִלְבּוֹנִין.]

sense.definition: Job XXVIII, 18, a. Targ. a. l.
(= b. h. אַלְגּוּמִּים) name of a tree.
sense.notes: Targ. II. Chr. II, 7 (8). [Ib. IX, 10; 11 אלמוגייא, reading the h. text as in I Kings X, 11.] V. אַלְמוּג.
Tosef. Maasr. III, 14 Var. ed. Zuck., v. גָּרִיס
= אלהי, אלהים, v. אֱלוֹהַּ

entry.language-reference: אלה, √אל to point, cmp. ארר a. הר)

sense.notes: Sot. II, 5 (17 a); a. fr.— Pl. אָלֹות. Ib. a. e.

sense.definition: c. pl. (b. h.; v. preced.) these, those (cmp. הרי).
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 30 v’elleh (and this) adds to the preceding (continues), elleh (these) restricts. V. אֵלּוּ.
Shebi. VII, 5.
Sabb. 90 a Ar., v. אֵילָא 3.
Kel. XVI, 8 חפוי הא', v. חִפּוּי. Pes. 57 a אוי לי מֵאַלָּתָן woe to me (I am afraid) of their fork (weapon). Sabb. VI, 3 (63 a) ed. (Ms. אלא); Y. ibid. 8 b (expl. דייקרן).

sense.definition: sign-pole, used in the barn as a mark.
sense.notes: Ib; Y. Maasr. I, 49 a bot.; Tosef. Ter. III, 11 משתיעקר הא' (ed. Zuck. משיתעשר, corr. acc.) as soon as the sign-pole (fork) is removed (indicating that the grain is ready for use and priestly gifts).

Dan. III, 28; a. fr.—Targ. O. Deut. XXXIII, 26; a. fr.—Lev. R. s. 5, end את אלה רב Ar. (ed. אלוה). Y. B. Mets. II, 8 c אלההון דיהודאי the God of the Jews. Y. Snh. X, 28 b.— Pl. (also plur. majest.) אֱלָהִין. Dan. II, 11; a. e.—אֱלָהַיָּא. Jer. X, 11. Targ. Ps. CXXXVI, 2 אלהי אלהיא the God of gods. [Gen. R. s. 26 כומריא גנבו א' וכ' (read אלהון) when priests rob—who would swear by their god?] Ib. (ref. to Gen. VI, 2).—Lev. R. s. 33 תמן קריין … אֱלָהַיָּיא there (in Rome) they call their kings gods.

Gen. R. s. 46 כדי לאלוהותו—שאין העולם the universe and what it contains, are but inadequate manifestations of his divinity; a. e. Ib. s. 66 ויתן לך אלוהותו (some ed.) may he impart to thee his divine power; v. next w.—אֱלֹוהוֹת, v. אֱלוֹהַ.
Targ. Cant. VIII, 1; a. e. Gen. R. s. 66 Ar. (v. preced.).
, v. אֱלֹוהַּ

sense.definition: (= אלא הן) but that, unless, except, only.
sense.notes: Targ. Gen. XXXII, 27; a. fr.—אף א' even only, i.e. so much the more (or less), not to say. Targ. I Kings VIII, 27; II Kings V, 13. V. לָהֵן; cmp. אֶלָּא.

sense.definition:
c. pl. (b. h.
אֵלֶּה, q. v.)

sense.notes: B. Mets. II, 1; a. v. fr.—א' וא' both. Zeb. V, 2; a. v. fr. *[

sense.definition: (interrog.) which? Pesik. R. s. 29 (—30, ed. Friedm. p. 138 b) לאילו נאמין in which of them shall we trust? Pesik. Naḥãmu p. 127 b sq.
sense.notes: ; Yalk. Is. 307 לאי זה, לאיזו.]
, v. אִילּוּ
Dan. II, 31; a. e.
orig.) the impissated juice of aloes, used as a purgative. Git. 69 b Ar. (ed. אילווא).
, v. אקסילאליאיין

sense.definition: oh that! Targ. Y. II Num. XXIII, 10; a. e. Targ. Ex. XVI, 3, a. fr. (לוי).
sense.notes: —Targ. Y. ib. XXXII, 30 (h. text אולי)—Num. R. s. 2. Gen. R. s. 9; a. fr. *[Targ. Y. II Num. XXIV, 23 אַלְוַוי, Y. I וַי, woe!]
Y. Keth. VII, end, 31 d; Gen. R. s. 15, v. אַלְמוּג. V. also אַלְוִוין.

Pl. majest. אֱלֹהִים, cmp. אֵל.—האלהים by God! Sabb. 145 a; a. fr. [ד is freq. substituted for ה as אלדים, אלדי, ידוד esp. in Targ. Y. ed. Sab.] אלקים, ch. אלקא, adopted in order to avoid uttering the divine name. B. Kam. 106 a; cmp. אלעיקי, איפופי &c.— Pl. אֱלֹוהֹות
Y. Ber. IX, beg. 12 d. Lev. R. s. 4.

sense.definition: biblical verses containing the word El, Elohim &c. Y. R. Hash. IV, 59 c.

sense.notes: , v. אֱלָהוּת
, v. אֱלֹוהַּ
, v. אַלְוָא, אַלְוָה.
, v. אַלְוַאי
(אלווס Ar.), v. אַלְוָה

sense.definition: (v. אַלְוָא) the herbaceous plant aloe, a kind of cress.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. IV, 35 b bot.; Tosef. ib. I, end (ed. Zuck. עלוא', oth. ed. עלויין, עלווין) ומקיימין את הא' וכ' you may (in the Sabbath year) let the aloe grow on the top of the roof, but you must not water it.

sense.definition: (= h. לְוָיָה) escort, reception on arriving and leaving.
sense.notes: Y. Maasr. II, 49 d other people דלית אלוויתיה שכיחא לון (read … תא) who do not frequently meet with a reception (an offer of refreshments &c.). Ib. דַּלְוַויָיתֵיה וכ' (= דאל) who may fairly expect a reception. Cmp. אִילַּוָּיוּתָא.
, v. אֲלוּנְטִית II
Ar. read אַלְוִוים.
B. Bath. 73 a, v. אִלִּיתָא a. אַלָּתָא.

sense.definition: (b. h.) Elul, the sixth month of the Hebrew calendar, containing twenty nine days, varying between the seventh of August and the second of October.
sense.notes: R. Hash. I, 1. Ib. 19 b; a. fr. Y. Shek. III, beg. 47 b bot. בני א' animals born in Elul. Targ. Y. Num. XIV, 37 אילול. Targ. II Esth. III, 7.
, Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. VI, 9 read אַנְלֹוגִין.
Pl. אֱלוּלִיִּים, אֱלוּלִיִּין. Y. Shek. III, beg. 47 b; a. e.
, v. אִילּ'

sense.definition: (אלם; √אל, cmp. חלם, חלב &c.) a mucilaginous plant (cmp. Lat. Alum), prob. Silphium, a kind of Laserpitium or Asafœtida.
sense.notes: T’bul Yom I, 5 (Var. in Ar. אילום, הלום). Cmp. אֱלָל.
— Pl. אֲלוּמַּיָּיא. Targ. Ruth II, 7; 15.
Peah VI, 9 (10) נתנה … לא' grain stalks intended for binding sheaves thereof (but not for binding the latter into bundles of sheaves עֹמֶר, Maim.)—[For binding sheaves therewith R. S.].
Ex. R. s. 31.— Pl. אֲלוּמֹּות. B. Mets. 22 b sq. large sheaves, opp. כריכות.

— Pl. אַלֹּונִים. Gen. R. s. 15 א' בלוטין the bibl. allonim means b’lutin, v. בָּלוּט. [Ib. אלמוגים א' read אַלְוִים, v. אַלְוָה, אַלְמוּג]. R. Hash. 23 a א' בוטמי, v. בּוּטְמָא; B. Bath. 80 b א' בוטני, v. בּוּטְנָא. [Gen. R. s. 60 (play on hallazeh Gen. XXIV, 6) א' זה he is an oak (of fine appearance); Rashi refers to next w.]
) another. Gen. R. s. 81 in Greek allon means אַחֵר; Pesik. Zakh. p. 24 a א' תרי (read אַחֵר) another (one more).

sense.definition: (אֲלוּנְתִּית) (interchanging with לוּנְטִית q. v.) f. (לוּט, to cover, wrap, cmp. I Sam. XX, 10, a. לאט in H.
sense.notes: Dict.; נ inserted) wrapping cloth, sheet, bathing clothes. Sabb. 40 b מיחם אדם אלונט' (Ms. M. אלונת', Tosef. ib. III (IV), 7 אלונתת) one may warm a sheet on the Sabbath to put it on the stomach; Y. Sabb. XIX, 17 a bot. [Gen. R. s. 80 to put on a wound, prob. next w.]—Sabb. 147 b (Ms. M. always אלונת', Ar. לונט'). Men. 72 a.—Y. Erub. VIII, 25 b top.— Pl. אֲלוּנְטִיאֹות Sabb. XXII, 5 (147 a). Ib. 147 b בעשר אלונטית (read טִיאֹות …, or … טִיֹּות). Tosef. ib. XVI (XVII), 15 אֲלוּנְטָאֹות (Var. אֲלֻנְטִיאֹות, לֻנְטִיאֹות). Ib. 17 אנלונטאות (Var. אלנטיאות).

sense.definition: corr. אֲלוּנְתִּית (אֲלַנְתִּית) f., אֲלִינְתִּין m. (a corrupt. of οἰνάνθη, οἰνάνθινος, œnanthe, œnanthinus; cmp. אניגרון as to נ a. ל) made of the grape (or leaves) of wild vine (œnanthe), whence

sense.notes: Y. Ber. VI, 10 d he who sprinkles אלינת' œnanthe.

Y. ib. I, 3 a top סכין אלוונ' וכ' (corr. acc.) you may oint a sick person with œn. on the Sabbath. Y. Sabb. XIV, 14 c bot. אלינתין. Y. Shebi. VII, beg. 37 b יצאת א' … לתְּפֵילִין (read … תית) except œn. which is only for children (after circumcision).

sense.definition: a wine (vinum œnanthinum), used esp. after bathing.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 30 a (expl. as a mixture of old wine, pure water and balsam); Sabb. 140 a אלונט' ed. (Ms. M. אלונת'). Ḥull. 6 a wine to be put לתוך הא' into a mixture called ãluntith; Tosef. Dem. I, 24. Y. Bets. I, 60 d top.
, v. אֲלִנִסְטִי
Pl. אֲלוּנְכֵי. Git. 70 a בא' דפרסאי (Ar. בלונכי) with Persian (poisoned) javelins.
, v. אַלַּנְקֵי
, v. אֲלוּנְטִית
, v. אַלַּס
Gen. R. s. 20 beg. אלופֹו של עולם the world’s chief ( Aleph, i.e. Adam).

sense.definition: (b. h.) Alush, one of the stations of the Israelites on their journey to Kanaan.
sense.notes: Yoma 10 a. Gen. R. s. 48 (play on lushi, Gen. XVIII, 6). Y. Bets. II, beg. 61 a
Pesik. R. s. 22 כ"ד א', read בּוּלָאֹות, v. בּוּלִי
Bets. 33 b; v. אַלָּתָא.
, v. אִלִּיתָא a. אַלָּתָא.

sense.definition: , Gen. R. s. 8 א' שלך Ar., ed. תכסיס א' שלך …, Yalk. Ps. 834 תכסיס אלתמסין, prob. אַלְטַכְסִיסִין (v. אַל־ a. טַכְסִיס) chief of the court-ceremonies (i.e. the angel of Truth); Rashi: seal (?).

sense.notes: Tanḥ. T’rum. 9 ברוש א' Bibl. b’rosh means firs

sense.definition: , a corruption of יַאנְטִינֹון for יַאנְתִּינֹון m. (ἰάνθινον, Aquila Ex. XXV, 5) violet-colored.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to I, 9 אלט'; Y. Sabb. II, 4 d (expl. bibl. תחש as a color לשם צבעו, v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v. תַּחַשׁ). [Esth. R. to I, 6 טיינון (Var. סיינון) read יקינטינון].
. Sifré Num. 18 (ref. to Num. XVIII, 2
לאלה שיהו אָלִין בה וכ' ‘as a curse’ means that people shall curse by her (pointing to her), ‘may happen unto thee what happened to …’.

sense.definition: (= ילל, v. אִילְיָא) to lament, wail.
sense.notes: Targ. II Sam. I, 17; a. e.
same. Targ. Jud. XI, 40 לאַלָּאָה (some ed. לאֲלָאָה).
, v. אִילְיָא
read אִילִיאֹוס q. v.

sense.definition: (= אַל־לי' = עַל־לי') according to the opinion, in the sense of.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 13 a, a. fr. א' דמאן in whose sense? in accordance with whom? Sot. 21 a א' דהלכתא in accord. with the adopted decision. Sabb. 28 b, a. v. fr. א' דר' in the sense, developing the opinion, of R.—.

Ab. Zar. 25 a (ref. to I Sam. IX, 24) what means v’heãleha (and that which is upon [or by] it)? שוק וא' that means the leg (with thigh) and the fat-tail. מאי והעליה וכ' and why is it called ‘and that which is upon it’? Because the leg is near the fat-tail (back). Ḥull. 117 a; a. fr.—כלפי א' (Ar. s. v. כלפי; ed. כלפי לָיָיא, Mss. לָיָא) towards the tail! i.e. just the reverse!, reverse it. Pes. 5 b; Sabb. 93 b; Ab. Zar. 75 a; a. fr. [Rashi: כלפי ליֵיא where are you turning to?]
Keth. 5 b

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Eliyahu, Elijah, the great prophet in the days of Ahab, freq. represented, in Talmud and Midrashim, as intervening in behalf of the pious and punishing wrong-doers, and expected, in the Messianic days, to clear up doubts and prepare the heavenly kingdom; cmp. Mal. III, 23.
sense.notes: —Ber. 58 a, a. fr. אתא א' אידמי ליה וכ' E. came and appeared to him in the disguise of &c. Gen. R. s. 33, a. fr. אתא א' זכור לטוב E., whose memory be blessed, came &c. B. Mets. I, 8 (37 a), a. fr. יהא מונח עד שיבוא א' let it be deposited until E. shall come (and decide to whom it belongs, i.e. an indefinite time until the matter be cleared up). Men. 45 a; a. fr.—סֵדֶר אֵלִיָהוּ־ Seder Eliyahu, name of a lost Talmudic treatise, divided into Seder Eliyahu Rabba (Large) and S. E. Zuta (Small). Keth. 106 a (of legendary origin).

sense.definition: (b. h.) Elihu, one of Job’s friends.
sense.notes: Y. Sot. V, end, 20 d. Yalk. Job 919. B. Bath. 15 b

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Elioenai, a highpriest.
sense.notes: Par. III, 5.
Pl. אַלְיוֹנִים. Pesik. R. s. 31 אַלְיוֹנֵי ידיהם their thumbs; Midr. Till. to Ps. CXXXVII. 4; Yalk. a. l.

Targ. Ex. XXIX, 20; a. e.—Git. 69 a טופרא דאִלְייוֹנָא (Rashi אליינא, corr. acc.) the nail of the thumb.— Pl. אִלְיוֹנַיָּא. Targ. Ps. CXXXVII, 4 קטעו לואי אִלְיוֹנֵיהוֹן בככיהון (missing in some ed.) the Levites cut their thumbs off with their teeth; v. quot. in preced.
, v. אִלְיַסְטוֹן
, v. אֶלְיְהִוֹ'
, v. אִילְי'
Targ. Job III, 7; v. אִילַּוָּיוּתָא.

sense.definition: (Ἐλευθερόπολις) Eleutheropolis (Freetown), an Idumean town corresponding to Hori (Gen. XIV, 6).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 42 (ed. corrup. מטרופ') read with Ar. ואת החורי א' ולמה קורא אותה א' שבררו … אותה ויצאו להן לחירות they selected it for their residence and made themselves independent.

sense.definition: Alli ḥ rok, name of an Egyptian eparchy or nomos, prob. Heracleotes.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. X, 6; I Chr. I, 8 (h. text פוט), ed. Rahm. אלייחרק (Var. אליחרק).
, v. חֲלִיטָא III
, v. אִילְיָא
, v. אִלְיַסְטוֹן
Kel. XVI, 7 רביעית של א' the wailer’s musical instrument. Ib. XV, 6.—Ch. אָלְיְתָא q. v.

sense.definition: (אלל to roll, sec. r. of אול; cmp. חול a. גִּלּוּלִים)

sense.notes: Ab. Zar. IV, 3 (Talm. ed. ע"ז); a. e.— Pl. אֱלִילִים. עבודת א' (abbr. ע"א) idolatry; also idol (cmp. יִרְאָה). Snh. 97 b. Yoma 9 b; a fr.
— Pl. אֱלִילַיָּא. Targ. Y. Lev. I, 2.
. Targ. Is. XV, 4 (XIV, 3
Pa. of אֲלַל.
— Pl. אַלִּילֵי. Targ. Gen. XLII, 9; a. e. (ed. Berl. אָלִי').

sense.definition: בֵּית א' pr. n. pl. Beth-Elim, near Mount Tabor.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 99 beg. Mekh. Yithro s. 5 (אלהים).
אֵלִים pl. of אַיִל q. v.
, v. אֲלַם

Targ. Y. Gen. XXV, 23; a. e.—Git. 60 b, a. fr. כל דא' גבר whoever is in power wins (right of possession in cases in which the judge is unable to decide). Ḥull. 39 b איניש אלמא a powerful man (defying the law).—Keth. 14 a א' ליה בריא to him the positive assertion is the stronger argument.— Pl. אַלִּימֵי Ḥull. 76 a thick (sinews). Kid. 59 a באגא דא' a village community of violent men.—Fem. Kidd. 44 b מי א' כיד אביה is she as strong, has she the same authority as her father has? B. Mets. 34 a מי א' ממתניתן is (the Boraitha) stronger (less pliable) than our Mishnah?—Ḥull. 48 b אַלִּימְתָּא the strong, thick (pin).— Pl. אַלִּימָתָא. Yeb. 43 a א' strong, thick combs.
, v. preced.

sense.definition: (= (= אִין if; לי = לָא not; מא quidem, somehow) unless, but for (followed by ש־; cmp. אִלְמָלֵא .
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 18, end אי' מֵי … שמעמ' וכ' but for the sticky substance in the nose intercepting the evil smell.

sense.definition: (= אִילּוּ־מָא if somehow) if (ruling the verb without mediation of a relative; cmp. אִלְמָלֵא 2).
sense.notes: Ib. א' תופשת וכ' if (the harsh ringing sound) should take a permanent hold of his ear, it would be bound up (with his body, sub. בלבו as in Tanḥ. Ḥukkath 1, where our w. is substituted by אִלְמָלֵא).
v. אִילֵימָא
. Targ. Y. Ex. IV, 11.—
Ḥull. 76 b
Targ. Job XXX, 21. Targ. Y. Ex. XXV, 2. Cmp. אוּלְמָא.
Targ. Ps. XXXVIII, 14 Ms. (ed. אִילְּמָנָא).
, v. אַלִּים
, v. אֲלוּנְטִית

sense.definition: , only in pl. אֲלִיסִים, אֲלִיסִין &c. (אלס, cmp. אלץ in Hebr. Dict.
sense.notes: a. רסס, רצץ) ruins, debris. Lev. R. s. 19 (referring to Amos VI, 1

הדין רסיסה אית מיניה אל' (read רסיסא) of what is demolished by making breaches, there remain ruins, והדין בקיעא לית מיניה אי while of what is demolished by chopping, no ruins remain; Koh. R. to X, 18 (corr. acc.); Cant. R. to IV, 14. Cmp. בִּיזָא and אִלְסִיס.
, v. אֲלַס

, fr. ἡλιάζω, v. Gr. Dict.) a luscious wine (vinum dulce) for which the grapes were to be dried in the sun for three days, after which they were gathered and trodden on the fourth during the full fervor of the midday heat (Sm. Ant. s. v. Vinum; Columella XII, 27). Men. VIII, 6 אליוסטון Mish. (Ar. ed. Koh. אלייס', Talm. ed. 86 b הליסטיון, היל'). B. Bath. 97 b אלייסטון Ar. (Var. a. ed. היליסטון; Ms. והלאסטון, והיליסטיון; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). Tosef. Men. IX, 9 (from which B. Bath. l. c. is quoted) אליסטון.

servant of Abraham. Gen. R. s. 44; a. fr. 2) several Tanaim: a) E. ben Hyrcanus; E. b. Jacob, E. bar Zadok, disciples of R. Johanan b. Zaccai of the second gener.—b) E. b. Judah, E. b. Matathias; E. b. Ḥisma, of the third gener.—c) E. hak-Kappar, a late member of the fifth gener.
, v. אֲלַף
, Y. Shebi. IV, 35 c top, read אִלְסִיס.
… κα) wind-lass for launching ships. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c top, read: ההן דמגפר אעין למני וחבלין לא' he who pitches wood for vessels or ropes for a wind-lass.

sense.definition: (a disguise of אלהים for the purpose of avoiding the utterance of the divine name, cmp. אֱלֹוהַּ) by God! forsooth (ironically).
sense.notes: Pesik. Baḥod. p. 104 a אלי' אני תובע בה Ar. (ed. אל אהא, Ms. Oxf. אליקי איני) forsooth, I shall propose to her, i.e. do you believe I shall &c.? Cant. R. to I, 4 אלעי' אני נותן וכ' forsooth (do you believe) I shall give &c. [V. Pesik. l. c. note 81.]
Ab. Zar. 58 a R. El. attendant of Rabba.
read אִלַּרְיָא.
the prophet. Ber. 10 b. Gen. R. s. 25; a. e.
E. ben Abuyah, surnamed אַחֵר, q. v. Aboth. IV, 20. M. Kat. 20 a
one E. surnamed בעל כנפים ‘winged’. Sabb. 49 a; 130 a. Y. Ber. II, 4 c bot.
, v. בֵּלְשָׁפָט
, v. אַלְיָית
Pl. אָלְיָתָא. Targ. Jer. IX, 16 (17) ed. Ven. אֲיֵלִיתָן, ed. Vien. אֶלְיָתָא.
f. = אַלְיוּתָא. Gen. R. s. 15, end; Pesik. Ron. p. 142 b א' ובכיתא wailing and weeping; v. אַלִּיתָא
Targ. Ex. XXIX, 22; a. e.—Ḥull. 127 a בשמתא נרש … ואליתיה excommunicated be Narash with its fat, skin and tail, i.e. all its inhabitants.

—בְּרַת א' name of a fig species. Gen. R. s. 15, end ברת א' וכ' Ar. (ed. אלי) it is called brath alitha (daughter of mourning, v. אַלְיָתָא), because it has brought wailing and weeping into the world (as the fruit of the tree of knowledge).

sense.definition:
wood of the fig-tree, used as kindling wood on the altar (h.
form אֲלִיתָה).
sense.notes: Tam. II, 4 (Mish. תא …, Talm. 29 a … תה). Yoma 24 b. Y. ib. II, 39 c top.— Pl. אַלִּיתֹות. Par. III, 9.

sense.definition: (pronunc. and meaning doubtful) Illitha, something supposed to render fire-proof or extinguish the fire.
sense.notes: Snh. 108 b יש לנו דבר אחד וא' שמה Ar. (ed. וע') we have something, its name is Ill. [perhaps to be read דבר אחר a (female) idol]; Yalk. Job 906 עיל', Ms. עליונה]. [B. Bath. 73 a ומחינן ליה באלי' Ar. Var. s. v. אלתא, ed. אַלּוּתָא, Rashi אַלְוָותָא, Ms. Oxf. ואית לן, אלוותא pl. of אַלָּתָא. The use of the masc. gend. in connection with the word, makes the passage appear spurious.]
= אִילֵּין. Dan. III, 12; 13.
Y. Keth. V, beg. 29 c R. Al.—Ib. IX, 33 b א' אמר לו ר' מנא (read לר' מנא); Y. Shebu. VII, 38 a bot. ליכסה וכ' name of a gentile judge.
ἀλλάξ)
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VIII, 5 two feet &c. of a bed cut off א' crosswise; (Kel. XVIII, 5 לוכסן).

sense.definition: אֲלַכְסֹון, ch. form אֲלַכְסֹונָא m. diagonal line, diameter.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 101 b; Succ. 8 a כל אמתא … באלכסונָהּ a figure of one square cubit has a diagonal line of 1 2/ 5 cubits (approximately). Men. 35 a; Meg. 24 b must be square בתפרן ובאֲלַכְסֹונָן both as to their seams (not warped) and as to the measure of their diagonal lines. Erub. 59 a מידת העיר ואלכסונָהּ Ms. K. (ed. בא', v. Rashi a. l.) the measure of the circumference of the town plus its diameter. B. Bath. 99 a ודילמא בא' הוו קיימי perhaps the Cherubim in the Sanctuary were placed across the room; a. fr.

sense.definition: (v. אֲלַכְסָא) Alexandrians, name of a nut, prob. a species of pistachio.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 14 a אלכסין ed. (Ms. M. אלכסנדרין, Ar. אכלסין). Cmp. אִלְסָרִין.
Y. Dem. II, 22 c top, (an Amora of a place called Tsadoka). Cant. R. to IV, 12; v. אֲלֶכְסַנְדְּרִי.
A. the Great, מוקדון the Macedonian. Targ. Cant. VI, 8; Targ. II, Esth. I, 2.—Tam. 31 b; a. fr.
name of a judge and of a robber. Y. Ber. IX, 13 b top (for אלכסנדריאה ib. read our w.).
Sifra B’ḥukk. chap. V, Lulianus the Alex.

sense.definition: pr. n. m. Alexandri, an Amora.
sense.notes: Y. R. Hash. IV, 59 c bot; a. e.—Cant. R. to IV, 2 דרא … (corr. acc.).

— Pl. אֲלֶכְסַנְדְּרִיִּים; fem. אֲלֶכְסַנְדְּרִיֹּות. Men. 100 a Alexandrians. Ib. 28 b כוסות א' (Yalk. Ex. 369 … רִיֹּות) Alexandrian cups (lengthy and narrow). Tosef. Meg. III (II), 6 בה"כ של א' a Synagogue built by Alexandrians in Jerusalem.
Targ. Ez. XXX, 15; a. e.—Y. Ḥag. II, 77 d; a. fr.—Kel. XV, 1, v. next w.—Midr. Till. to Ps. XIX, a ship coming מא'. V. אַכְסַנְדַּרְיָא.

Kel. XV, 1 ספינה א' Mish. ed. (Talm. ed. ס' אלכסנדריא) Alexandrian ship, i.e. Sea ship with water reservoirs. Sabb. 90 a, a. e. נתר א' Alex. nitron. Tosef. Nid. IV, 17 Cleopatra מלכת א' (ed. Zuck. יס—) Egyptian queen.— Pl. אֲלֶכְסַנְדְּרִיֹּות, v. אֲלֶכְסַנְדְּרִי.

sense.definition: (sec. r. of אוּל, v. אֲוַל; cmp. עלל)

sense.notes: Pi. אִילֵּל to go around; to espy, track. Cant. R. beg. (play on תּוּר a. תֹּורָה) אחר ד"ת אִילַּלְתָּ thou didst search after the words of the Law. Pesik. R. s. 47 ḥ afar (Job XXXIX, 29) לשון מְאַלֵּל has the meaning of espying (ed. incorr. יליל, v. ed. Friedm. p. 190 b).—[

sense.definition: to tie around; to be strong; v. אֵל, אלי I, אֵלָה, אִילָּן &c., a. אלם.

sense.notes: Targ. Num. XIII, 2; a. fr.—Deriv. אַלִּילָא, מְאַלְּלָא.

sense.definition: ch. m. (b. h. אֱלִל Job XIII, 4; v. אֱלִיל; cmp. הלל) soft, lax object, whence fatty substance, offal of meat.
sense.notes: Targ. Job. l. c.—Ḥull. IX, 1 (Gem. 121 a, diff. of opin. as to what kind of offal is meant in the Mish., v. מַרְדְּקָא). Ib. הא' המכונס the offal gathered (as a ball). Zeb. III, 4.—Toh. I, 4 אֱלִיל. Meil. 7 a א' כיון דלית ביה וכ' ãlal, because there is no substantial value in it. Zeb. 35 a פיגל בא' if one had an inappropriate thought about ãlal of fowls (which is fit to eat).

sense.definition: (אֲלַל; cmp. b. h. דָּרַךְ) treading the wine or olive press; quantity put into the press at a time.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 105 a הא באתרא … בא' Ar. (ed. או') the one Rabbi treats of a place where they ordinarily put one khor (measure) into the press at a time, &c. Esth. R. to I, 2 (referring to Esth. l. c., and Neh. XIII, 15 ‘in those days’; play on al’la a. al’lay; v. next w.) א' וּוַי וכ' ‘ wine pressing’ (on Sabbath, Neh. l. c.) and ‘woe’ (persecution as punishment) were those days marked for.
Lev. R. s. 17, a. e.; v. next w. Tanḥ. Aḥaré 2, אלילים (corr. acc.); ed. Bub. 3.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) woe-makers, a word coined for playing on הֹולְלִים (Ps. LXXV, 5, a. e.).
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 20; a. e.; v. וַויָּנַיָּיא for correct vers.
חגר); intr. to be tied up, excluded, lonely, mute; v. אִלֵּם, אַלְמֹון II, אַלְמָנָה, אוּלָם.

sense.definition: to grow, be strong, v. אֲלַם.
sense.notes: Cmp. אַלְמֹון I. [Cmp. אֵלֶם Ps. LVIII, 2, LXX ἄρα, a. v. אוּלָם I.]
אֲלֵים (אַלֵּים Pa., עלים) (v. preced.)

sense.definition: to be or grow strong, to grow.
sense.notes: Targ. I Chr. XXII, 12 (13) אֲלַם (h. text אֱמָץ, Var. עילם). Targ. O. Deut. XXXI, 6; 7; 23 ed. Vien. א' (ed. Berl. ע', v. Berl. Targ. O. II, p. 59).—B. Bath. 124 a; 135 b (he left them) דיקלא וא' a slender palm-tree and it grew thick.
