Targ. II Chr. XI, 17; a. e. Part. pass. f. מְאַלְּמָא resolved, insisting upon. Targ. Ruth I, 18 (h. text מתאמצת).—B. Kam. 90 a אַלְמוּהָ רבנן וכ' the Rabbis fortified the husband’s right (gave him superior privileges). Kidd. 43 a אַלּוּמֵי קא מְאַלִּימְנָא למילתיה (Rashi אַלְּמוּהָ) we (the court) give him privileges.
Sabb. 156 b אַלְּמֵיה יצריה his appetite overwhelmed him.

sense.definition: to make one’s self strong, to summon strength.
sense.notes: . Targ. Job XXXVI, 19.
Targ. Ps. XXXIX, 10. Targ. Koh. XII, 6. [Targ. Ps. XC, 10 מִתְאַלְּמִין (for h. text בָּהֶם?). [Targ. Job VI, 6 Ms. Vers. מִתְאַלֵּם (?), h. text חלמות!.]

sense.definition: cmp. חֵרֵשׁ) mute, unable to speak, also ignorant.
sense.notes: Ter. I, 6; a. fr.—Ruth. R. to IV, 1 (ref. to almoni, Ruth. l. c.) א' היה מד"ת he was unable to speak of (excluded from) the Law (ignorant).— Pl. אִילְּ' אִלְּמִין אִלְּמִים. Snh. 71 a; 100 a.—Fem. אִלֶּמֶת, אִילֶּ'. Num. R. s. 9. Ḥull. 79 a. Sot. 10 b אי'; a. e.
Targ. Ex. IV, 11.— Pl. אִילְּמֵי &c. Ḥag. 3 a; Yalk. Ex. 356; Deut. 440. [Ḥull. 76 b חד אילימא, v. אִלֵּימָא II, 2.]

sense.definition: (cmp. b. h. אֵלֶם, v. אָלַם) confirmation; (dial. term) consequently.
sense.notes: Pes. 2 b א' אור וכ' consequently ôr means day-light. Sabb. 151 a; a. fr.

sense.definition: (= על למה) why?, wherefore? Erub. 3 a אלמא אמר וכ' why did R. … say &c.?—Yoma 2 b אלמה לא ניבעי וכ' why should separation not be required &c.?; a. fr.

sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 13; Kel. XIII, 6; Sabb. 59 b; Y. ib. VI, 8 b top.

sense.definition: pl. אַלְמוּגִים, אַלְמוּגִין a species of cedar-tree, prob. coral-wood (v. infra as to various opinions).
sense.notes: R. Hash. 23 a; B. Bath. 80 b sq. א' כסיתא almugim is coral (apparently a confusion of coral and coral-wood). Y. Keth. VII, end, 31 d א' אלוים alm. is the aloe-wood (agallochum); (Gen. R. s. 15 beg. אלווס Ar., ed. אלוום, אלונים corr. acc.). Pesik. R. s. 33 (ref. to II Chr. II, 7 a. I Kings X, 12); v. גלומי.
Targ. I Kings X, 11; 12. II Chr. IX, 10; 11.

sense.definition: (v. אלם) a cedar species, oak [or terebinth].
sense.notes: . R. Hash. 23 a; B. Bath. 80 b; v. בּוּטְמָא a. בְּלוּט.

sense.definition: , v. אלם) [ tied up, secluded; cmp. Targ. I Sam. XXI, 3 טמיר for h. אלמני] widower.
sense.notes: Keth. 7 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: m. (b. h. אַלְמֹנִי unnamed, unknown, v. preced.) pr. n. m. Almoni.
sense.notes: Ruth R. to IV, 1 פלני א' וכ' the man’s name was Ploni Almoni. Cmp. אִלֵּם.
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 13 read אַלְמוּג.
Y. Succ. II, beg. 52 d בנתונה בא' when the ship lies in port.

sense.definition: (= (= אילו־מא־לָא) if in any way not, if not, but for (usu. without verb or followed by שֶׁ־ or דְּ־; cmp. אִלֵּימָא I, .
sense.notes: Snh. 49 a א' דוד וכ' but for David (studying the Law), Joab could wage no war. Meg. 12 b א' אגרות וכ' but for the previous letters. Tanḥ. Ḥukkath 1 (ed. Bub. 1 אם לא); a. fr.

sense.definition: (= אִילּוּ־מא־לֻא: cmp. אִלֵּימָא I, 2) if indeed.
sense.notes: Meg. 24 b אלמלי אתה לוי [Ms. M. אלמלא לוי אתה) if thou wert a Levite. Keth. 33 b אלמלא נגדוה וכ' if they had lashed Hananiah &c. Sabb. 118 b; a. fr. [A differentiation of spelling which may have existed for the two opposite meanings of our w., is untraceable; v. Lowe, Pesachim, p. 28.] Cmp. אִילּוּלֵי.

sense.definition: (deriv. of next w.) to reduce to widowhood, bereave, desert.
sense.notes: Pes. 49 a ומְאַלְמֵן את אשתו will be forced to desert his wife (to leave his home).— Nithpa. נִתְאַלְמְנָה to become a widow. Y. Keth. II, beg. 26 a (Mishn. ed., a. Talm. Bab. נִתְאַרְמְלָה, v. אִרְמֵל).
Keth. I, 1; 2, v. אֵרוּסִין. Kidd. 75 a אַלְמָנַת עיסה the widow of one of spurious descent; v. עִיסָה; a. fr. Trnsf. דלת א' a frameless door (or made of one piece). Erub. 101 a; v. גַּשְׁמָה.—Denom.
B. Bath. VI, 4 בית א' (98 b; Ms. M. אַרְמְלוּת) a house in which to live in case of widowhood. Yeb. 45 a; a. e. Y. Keth. V, 29 d bot. הרי אני מיגדת אַלְמְנוּתִי, v. אָגַד II.
, v. אֲלוּנְטִית I

Tanḥ. Tsav, 2 [a gloss] לשון א'קטבך קטאב"א in Greek katab’kha (Hos. XIII, 14) means κατάβα descend; v. Yalk. Jer. 333. Y. Sot. VII, beg. 21 b שמע קלון קריין שמע אלונ' heard them read the Sh’ma in Greek.

sense.definition: , אֲלוּנְקֵי f. pl. (= על־ענקא on the neck) poles used to carry burdens on the shoulder of two or more persons (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Falangæ, phalangæ, which is of Semitic origin).
sense.notes: Bets. 25 b what means ‘provided no carrying on shoulders takes place’? Ans. באלנקי … Ar., Ms. M. (ed. באלו') by means of alanke (phalangæ). Ib. למיפק אאלו' ed. (Ms. באל') to be taken out &c. (carried in a sedan chair through which poles are put). Ib. Am. and Mar Zut. allowed themselves to be carried on shoulders of men בשבתא דריגלא באלנ' Ar., Ms. M. (ed. our w. absent) on a Sabbath during the festive week on phalangæ (to the lecture room). V. בְּלוּנְקֵי.

sense.definition: , Pa. אַלַּס, אַלֵּיס (contr. of אלעס, v. לעס) to craunch, bite.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 84 a. Git. 70 a
an Amora. Y. Kil. I, 27 a top.
(?) Snh. 64 a Sabta son of A.; v. אַבְלַס

[That Italian places are meant in quot. below, is obvious from Targ. Ezek. XXVII, 7, v. אִיטַלְיָא.] Targ. Y. I Gen. X, 4 א' וטרסס (h. text אלישה ותרשיש) Hellas and Taras (Tarentum, v. טַרְסִיס); Targ. Y. II ib.; Y. Meg. I, 71 b bot. אלסטרסס; Gen. R. s. 37, beg. אלוסטרוס, אלסיט' (corr. acc.). [Targ. Y. a. Midr. reflect geograph. a. ethnograph. conditions and notions of their own days.]

sense.definition: [the final ס freq. read ם in ed., as אֲלִיסִים &c.] f. (v. אָלִיס) pr. n. pl. Ilsis &c. (grottoes near Tiberias; v. Jos. B. J. II, 20, 6) ruins of fortified caves.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to III, 9 אלס'. Y. Shebi. IV, 35 c top אליפיס; Gen. R. s. 34 אילטיס; Ruth. R. to I, 17 (או') אילוסיס; Yalk. Ezek. 351 אלפטס; cmp. בְּטִיטָא a. אִיצְטַדִּין.
, v. אִלְצָרִין
E. b. Poïra, counsellor of John Hyrcanus. Kidd. 66 a

Several Tanaim: a) E. b. Azariah; E. b. Arakh. of the second generation; b) E. b. P’rata; E. of Modim, of the third gener.—c) E. b. Jacob; E. b. Shamua; E. b. Simon (bar Yoḥai); E. b. R. Yose the Galilean, of the fourth gener.

Several Amoraim: a) E. b. Antigonus; E. b. R. Yannai, of the second gener. Y. Ber. V, 9 b bot.; a. e.—b) E. bar Abina. Ib. I, 3 c bot.—c) R. Lazar or E. (in Babli E. b. P’dath) one of the most renowned Amoraim of the third gener. Erub. 65 b; a. v. fr.
, v. אֲלִיקִי
Du. אַלְפַּיִם.— Pl. אֲלָפִים.—א' אלפים a million. Gen. R. s. 8 שני א'; a. fr.—Ex. R. s. 5 אַלְפַּיִם two thousand (men); a. e.

Targ. O. Ex. XXXVIII, 25 אַלַּף ed. Berl. (Y. אלפא); a. fr.—Snh. 95 b חד א' one thousand. Bekh. 8 b מאה א' זוזי one hundred thousand zuz; a. fr.— Pl. אַלְפִין, אַלְפַיָּא. Targ. Ex. XXXVIII, 26; a. fr. Targ. I Sam. XVIII, 8; a. fr.—Y. Dem. VII, 26 b bot.; a. fr.

sense.definition: , √לף to join, be joined) to become used; to learn, study, train one’s self.
sense.notes: —אֲלִיף accustomed, used to. Targ. I Sam. XVII, 39. Targ. O. Num. XXII, 30.—Targ. Deut. V, 1; a. fr. (v. also יְלֵיף).—Cant. R. to II, 2 צבי רבי דייליף would you like to study? B. Bath. 111 b top גוד לית דין צבי למילף take me away from here, this man has no desire to learn (but only to argue). Taan. 4 a man is bound למֵילַף נפשיה בניחותא [prob. למַלֵּיף, v. infra] to train himself to be gentle; a. fr.

Targ. Ps. XVIII, 35 מַלֵּיף (= מְאַלֵּף). Targ. Prov. XI, 25; a. fr.—Koh. to IX, 10 thou didst emigrate למילף for the sake of studying, והוא גלי לאַלָּפָא but he emigrated for the sake of teaching. Y. Dem. I, 22 a top ולא כן אַלְּפָן רבי (not איל') did you not teach us thus?—א' זכו, v. infra.

sense.definition: as Pa. Lev. R. s. 30 (מַלֵּיף) מֹולִיף עלי זכו offers arguments in my favor.
to exercise, practice, exert one’s self.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. II, 4; XXVI, 9.

sense.definition: Alef, the first letter of the Alphabet.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. I, 18 a bot.; a. fr. Y. Yeb. IV, 6 a כל שהוא בה"י רבה באל"ף רבא (referring to harbah arbeh Gen. III, 16) the embryo that counts harbah with Hé, (the numerical value being 212—days), will grow; that which counts arbeh with Alef (i.e. 208 days, or less than seven months) will lie down (die); (cmp. הַרְבָּה for differ. versions).—B. Bath. 168 b א' בית וכ' mere Alef Beth (arbitrary words). Gen. R. s. 1 הא' קרא תגר the Alef complained.—Y. Sabb. XVI, 15 c top א' בי"ת אחד one of the alphabetical acrostics (chapters) of Lamentations.— Pl. אלפ"ין. Sabb. 103 b. Ex. R. s. 38; a. e.—אָאִין. Y. Ber. II, 4 d bot. they pronounce עיינין א' Ayins like Alefs.—[Sabb. 103 b אלף אלף דאאזרך וכ' ed. (Ms. M. omits דאאזרך) they differ as to one who wrote on the Sabbath two such letters as Alef, Alef (of ãazzerkha Is. XLV, 5) being merely vowels; v. בגלטורי.]

Cant. R. beg. the poet כד עביד א' בית"א when writing alphabetical acrostics. Lam. R. introd. (R. Ḥama b. Ḥ.) מן תלתא תלתא פסוקי בא' בית"א belonging to the alphab. acrostics (in Lamentations) of three verses for each letter.; a. fr.

sense.definition: (ἄλφα) Alpha, the first letter of the Greek Alphabet.
sense.notes: Shek. III, 2. Men. VIII, 1 א' לסולת best quality of flour. Ib. 6.
, v. אֲלַף I
Ruth R. to III, 13 (ed. אלפנטרין, אלפבתרין, corr. acc.).
m., pl. אַלֶּפְבֵּיתִין same. Koh. R. to I, 13; v. אלפ"א
, v. אלפבטרין

sense.definition: c. (= לֶפֶס q. v.) a tightly covered pot, stew-pot, contrad. to קדירה a boiling pot.
sense.notes: Ned. 51 a a dish goes first in a pot קודם שיורד לאי' before it is put in a stew-pot for steaming. Y. Ḥall. I, 58 a top.—Pes. 37 a מעשה אי' stew.—Gen. R. s. 1, end כא' וכיסויו as a pot with its lid.— Pl. אִלְפְּסִין. Bets. 32 a, v. אִירֹונִית.

sense.definition: (Syr. אלסרא P. Sm. 155; 212; an abbrev. of אלכסנדרין, v. אֲלַכְסִין) a species of pistachio (tree or fruit).
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, beg. 22 b; Y. Maasr. I, 48 d bot. אלצ'.—Tosef. ib. I, 1 אילס'. Ib. III, 14 אִילָאסָרִין ed. Zuck. (Var. אלרסין).
Cant. R. to I, 11 שלמד א' בדעתו של הקב"ה, a corruption; read: שלמד אונקלס (עקילס) בן אחותו של הדריינוס; cmp. Tanḥ. Mishp. 5. [The entire clause seems to be a gloss.]

sense.definition: (b. h.) a symbolized pr. n.: No-Standing.
sense.notes: Y. R. Hash. I, 57 a bot. ומלך א' עמו but the King (the Lord)—no standing (on his decrees) is with him; he desires not to insist upon his decrees (but permits repentance to set them aside).
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (ἑλικτή, sub. κλῖμαξ; v. also הִילְקְטִי) winding staircase.
sense.notes: Tosef. Erub. VIII, 11 (V, end) five compartments הפתוחות לא' ed. Zuck. (ed. אלקט) opening towards a common winding staircase. Ib. ואסורין בהילקטי ed. Zuck. (ed. באלקטון, Var. בדיאלקטו corr. acc.) and are forbidden the use of &c.

sense.definition: , pl. אִלְקְטִיֹּות (לקט, v. הֶילְקֵט) stack of grain, shed for stacks in the field.
sense.notes: [Comment. fr. קייט summer.] Maasr. III, 7 the stores in הבורגנין והא' (Ms. M. אלנקטיות) turrets and sheds in the field are exempt from tithes (until brought home).
= אֱלָהָא, אֱלֹהִים, v. אֱלֹוהַּ
Pesik. R. s. 21, ed. Fr. p. 108 a, read ולוּקְיֹוס, v. גַּייוּס

inscript., Zeitschr. der Deutsch. Morgenl. Ges. XVIII, 89—90; Syr. ארזבד, Pers. arzabedes; v. Perl. Et. St. p. 105) Arkafta, a high dignitary in Persia. Targ. Y. Gen. XLI, 44 (ed. Vienna אַלְקַפֶּטַע); a. e.—Shebu. 6 b אלקפ'. Y. ib. I, 32 d bot. ארקב'. Y. Ber. II, 5 a top Ar. (ed. בסא …, corr. acc.).—Zeb. 96 b (prov.) ארקפת' נקטן ביד ריח' אתי ליה ליד Ms. M. (ed. אלקפתא נקטן ריחא …) the Ark. took us by the hand, and the scent came into the hand (undue pride of accidental acquaintances.
, v. אַקְלַפְרִין
= אַלְקַפְטָא.

sense.definition: (ἱλάρια) day of rejoicing, both private and public; esp. days of public rejoicings appointed by a new emperor, consisting of games, masquerades &c. Pesik. Sh’mini p. 193 b while the King is engaged בא' שלו וכ' in his hilaria, ask of him what you need.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to IV, 4 לא היו עומדין באלירא וכ' (corr. acc.) (at Mount Sinai) they did not stand (as) in hilaria, but in awe, trembling &c.

sense.definition: a disease; prob. a corruption of אִילְיָיא (εἰλεός, ileus) iliac passion, spasm of the abdominal muscles connected with vomiting.
sense.notes: Git. 70 a מיושב אחזתו א' Ar. (ed. דלריא as in the sentence following).

Targ. Josh. XXIV, 26 (ed. Vien. I אילנא).— Pl. (of אלותא) אַלְוָותָא. Targ. Is. VI, 4 אַלְוַות (ed. Vien. אֵילָוַות.) B. Bath. 73 a ומחינן ליה באלוותא Rashi (ed., sing. אלותא) and we struck it with clubs; v., however, אִלִּיתָא. Bets. 33 b ויהיב לן א' א' and gave us each several branches (Rashi), v., however, אַלְוָתָא.

sense.definition: (אַל = עַל, a. תוס', v. תּוּסְבְּרָא; cmp. I Chron. XXVII, 25); v. אַל־) comes thesaurorum, chief-treasurer.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XV magor (his resort, stores) that is א' שלו his (the Roman Emperor’s) chief treasurer (or plur. treasurers).

sense.definition: Iltith, name of a large fish (prob. from its place, v. חוּלְתָּא).
sense.notes: Makhsh. VI, 3 (Mish. ed. אלתות). Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. V, 7.

sense.definition: (= עַל־אֲתַר) on the spot, forthwith, always with לְ־.
sense.notes: Gitt. III, 3 (Mish. Talm. Y. על אתר). R. Hash. 6 a; a. v. fr. (in Hebr. phraseol.).

Mekh. Yithro, end כל א' שבתורה רשות every Im (If) in the Torah refers to voluntary actions (which you may or may not do) except three &c. Y. Gitt. VII, 48 d בגין דאמר א' because he said, If (I die), i.e. conditional divorce. Succ. 53 a א' אני כאן when I am here; a. fr.

Yoma III, 1; a. fr.—א' … א' whether … or. Y. Pes. VI, beg. 33 a א' פסח וכ' whether or not the Passover ceremonies supersede the Sabbath; a. fr. [Ib. אם יש תוחלת read יש וכ' אפשר, as before.]—אִם כֵּן (abbrev. א"כ) if this be so. Ber. I, 1; a. fr.—אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן (abbr. אא"כ) only when indeed, not until, unless. Keth. 76 a; a. fr.

entry.language-reference: אמם, אמה, √אם; to press, embrace, join, support, lead; v. אמן, אמר, אמץ &c.; cmp. אָב)

sense.notes: Sabb. 134 a; a. fr.—Y. M. Kat. III, beg. 81 c הניח חק אִמֹּו left his mother’s lap (Palestine).—Num. R. s. 10 (ref. to immo Prov. XXXI, 1) אמו זו … התורה וכ' ‘his mother’ that means the Law which trained Solomon and which is called a mother of those studying it, as you read (Prov. II, 3; text אִם is read אֵם çm).

Ḥull. III, 2 (54 a) ניטלה האם וכ' if the mouth of the womb is absent, cut out. Bekh. IV, 4 (28 b).—Trnsf. legitimate existence, authority. Succ. 6 b, a. fr. יש א' למסורת the traditional Scripture text (letters without vowels) is authoritative in Biblical interpretation, opp. יש א' למקרא the traditional reading (vowels) must guide us, e.g. בחלב (Ex. XXIII, 19) may be read בַּחֲלֵב as the traditional vocalization, or בְּחֵלֶב in the fat of.— Pl. אִמָּהֹות, אִימָּהֹות. Kidd. IV, 4 her genealogy must be traced back ארבע א' to the mothers of four generations (on each side) which is eight mothers. Y. Snh. II, 20 b bot. they are not אֲמָהוֹת אלא אִימָּהוֹת maid-servants but mothers (of the nation).—Trnsf. א' של בצלים seed-onions. Peah III, 4. Erub. 29 a; a. e.—Ch. אִימָּא. [Koh. R. to XII, 7 א' דבצלי', v. אַמָּה.]
, v. אִימָּא
f. = h. אָמָה. Targ. O. Deut. XXIII, 18; v. אַמְהָא

יֵימָא, imper. אֵימָא (√אם to join, v. אמר) to say, speak, think. Targ. Y. Gen. XXXIII, 10.—Freq. in Talmud.—אפילו תימא even if you will say, i.e. it may come right even if you assume that &c. Succ. 13 b; a. fr.—מי לֵימָא, (מי)נֵימָא, or לימא must it be said, does it mean to say? Ib.; a. fr.—(ואי) וכי תימא and if you should object. Ib.; a. fr.—אלא אימא but rather say, i.e. the correct version is. Ib.; a. fr.—אימא סיפא now read the second clause, i.e. how will you understand &c.? Ber. 21 b; a. fr.—אֵימָא I might think. Ib.; a. fr.—הוה אמינא I might have thought, I might have been led to believe. Erub. 74 b מאי הוה א' what might I have been led to believe?; a. fr.—נימא כוותיה let him express his opinion in agreement with his authority, i.e. why does he not say so expressly? Taan. 3 a; a. fr.—Pes. 7 b היכי נימא what else should he say? נימא למול should he use the expression lamol?—Gitt. 47 b, a. fr. ס"ד אמינא it may occur to you to think; v. דַּעְתָּא. Yoma 85 b אי הואי התם הוה אמינא had I been there, I should have said.—קאמינא = קא אמינא I say, speak of, v. קָא. Gitt. 47 b; a. fr.

sense.definition: (Ἐμμαούς, Ἀμμαούς, hellenized form of חמה, חמתה) Emmaus, Ammaus, a town in the plain of Judæa (or Philistæa), renowned, in Talmudic days, for its warm springs and luxurious life.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to VII, 7, a. e. [Ib. 11 אימוניס prob. אימאוס.] Cmp. דימסית. [Other forms: עמאוס, עמיס, אמאום, עמאים. For other places by that name, v. Neub. Géogr. p. 100.]

sense.definition: (= עַל מַאי = אַלָּמָּה) wherefore? why? א' לא why not? Sabb. 48 a.
sense.notes: Erub. 70 a; a. v. fr.

sense.definition: (= עַל מַאן) to whom?, v. אַ־ and מַאן.
(Pers. anbûh, Perl. Et. St. p. 18; cmp., however, מבוא עם Ezek.
sense.notes: Ezek. XXXIII, 3
Yoma 87 a; Snh. 7 b. Succ. 55 a

sense.definition: , pl. אִמְבֹּולִין (= עִינְבֹּול; ענב) little grape, i.e. clapper in the bell.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VI, beg. 7 d עשה להן אמבולי (corr. acc.) he put clappers in. V. אִנְבֹּול.

sense.definition: , Lev. R. s. 5 על א' דסדום Ar. (ed. by cler. error אילנייא) read אַמְבְּטַיָּא towers, battlements; v. אַנְבְּטַי.

sense.notes: C. s. v.) wrapper, cover, bundle. Y. B. Mets. IV, beg. 9 c המחליף א … ין בא' Ar. (read … ון; ed. אברוקלון באמבירוקלון, corr. acc.) if one exchanges one bundle for another; cmp. ציבור ibid.— Pl. אִנְבּוּרְקְרָאֹות. B. Kam. 114 b ed. (Ar. אנבקראות, Ms. M. אגבו', v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
Gen. R. s. 68, v. דְּיִיטֵי.

sense.definition: (√בט, v. אַבְטָא; מ inserted) bath-tub, bathing reservoir.
sense.notes: Ned. IV, 4 (Var. טיא …). Ḥag. 15 a אב' Ar. (ed. אמב'); a. fr.— Pl. אִמְבְּטִיֹּות, אַמְבְּטָאֹות (אמבטיאות). Y. Sabb. III, 6 a.—Bab. ib. 40 a אמבטי' (Ar. אבטאות); Tosef. ib. III (IV), 3 ed. Zuck. אבטאות (Var. אמבטאות) baths in large cities with ambulatories (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Baths). [Y. Pes. III, beg. 29 d א' של בצק (?), prob. a corruption.] Cmp. בְּטַח II.

sense.definition: (ἀναβάτης, contr. ἀμβάτης) prop. rider, traveller on horseback &c.; hence (sub. חמור) an ass used for marching through the desert alongside of (and sometimes tied to) the camel.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. V, 7 b top מהו א' what is an ambates? חמר סלק the ass of the traveller (from Egypt to Asia). Y. Kel. VIII, 31 c אבהנוס, אבחטס (corr. acc.). V. לִיבְדְּקֹוס.

sense.definition: (deriv. of אמבטי) water of the bath-tub, waste of the bath-tub.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VIII, 11 c ההן דמשזג (גו) א' וכ' he who washes (his anus) in &c., is liable to a disease of the rectum.
Midr. Till. to Ps. XXII, v. אִימּוּס.
Keth. 105 a smelt at (was an expert of) א' דחמרא (Rashi, pl.) wine stores.— Pl. אִמְבְּרֵי. Gitt. 56 a קלנהו להנהו א' וכ' set fire to all those stores of wheat and barley.
Sabb. 109 b מא' אליבא וכ' from eating a nut on an empty stomach. Men. 35 a כי א' in the shape of a nut; a. e.— Pl. אֶמְגּוּזֵי. Ḥull. 59 a. B. Mets. 60 a

sense.definition: magus, magian, a Persian priest and interpreter of dreams; magician, sorcerer.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. I Ex. VII, 15; VIII, 16.—B. Beth. 58 a. Yoma 35 a (Ḥull. 62 b) פרוה א' Parvah is the name of a Persian magus after whom the cell in the Temple was named.—Sabb. 75 a א' רב ושמואל Var. (read אַמְגּוּשְׁתָּא).— Pl. אַמְגֹּושֵׁי. Snh. 98 a אי בטלי יהירי בטלי א' when (in Israel) the haughty shall cease to exist, the magians (among the Persians) shall cease.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) a follower of magianism, believer in sorcery.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 18 a

sense.definition: (deriv. of preced. ws.) magianism, magian practices.
sense.notes: Sabb. 75 a א' רב ושמואל Ms. M. (ed. מגושתא, Var. אמגושא) as to magianism Rab and Samuel differ, one declaring it to be sorcery, the other—blasphemy.

sense.definition: referring to ( the blood) which made him a proselyte (circumcision).
sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 a top ולא הוון אלא א' his visions as to bloodshed had reference only to that (blood) which made him &c.; v. גּוּר.

sense.definition: (√מד; v. מָדַד) to form an approximate estimate, to guess; to appraise, judge, deliver an expert’s opinion.
sense.notes: Erub. 58 b אוֹמְדוֹ וכ' he forms an approximate estimate of the height of the hill, and passes on. Snh. 78 b אֲמָדוּהוּ למיתה they (the experts) declared his injuries to be fatal; (Y. ib. IX, 27 a bot., also עמד') א' לחיים the opinion was that he would recover; a. fr.—Ḥull. 51 a אמדה נפשה the animal before taking a leap measures its strength.
same. Gen. R. s. 64 שהאמידו אותה they had appraised it (the field,—as to how much it would yield). V. אוּמָד

Bekh. 61 a להכי אמדתיך I guessed this was thy intention. Keth. 68 a הא דאמידניה in the one case it means that we have formed an opinion about him (know whether he is stingy or liberal).— Part. pass. אָמִיד. Arakh. 20 a הא א' וקאי he stands appraised, he has been valued before this.—Hence אָמִיד believed to be wealthy. B. Kam. 62 a איניש א'. Keth. 85 b ידענא ביה דלא א' I know he is not rich. B. Bath. 8 b.—Ib. 52 a אם אֲמִידָא לך if you believe her to be wealthy. V. אוּמְדָּנָא.

sense.definition: (= על מדלא, על מיד'; דלי; cmp. דָּלִית) watchman’s lodge on top of trees.
sense.notes: Sabb. 155 a דרגא דא' Ar., Ms. M. (ed. דמַדְלָא) ladder for climbing up to the lodge.
a word in a charm formula. Sabb. 67 a Ms. M. a. Ar. (ed. אמרלאי).
Y. Hor. III, end, 48 c
Sot. 12 b; Ex. R. s. 1 אמתה חד אמר ידה the word אמתה (Ex. II, 5)—one says it means אַמָּתָהּ, her arm, the other says it means אֲמָתָהּ, her maid-servant (v. אָמָה).—Lam. R. introd. (R. Josh.

sense.definition: א' דבצלי' an arm (direction-post) &c.; v. בְּצַל; Koh. R. to XII, 7 אם.
sense.notes: —אַמַּת (בית) השחי the arm up to the axilla, arm-pit, name of an opening in a Temple door; v. however, infra. 4).—2) cubit, a measure equal to the distance from the elbow to the tip of the middle-finger. Keth. 5 b; Men. 11 a זו א' this one (the middle-finger) is used for defining the cubit measure. Kel. XVII, 10 אַמַּת הבנין וכ' the standard cubit of the Temple proportions was six, that of the vessels five hand-breadths. Sabb. 31 a א' הבנין the builder’s cubit (instrument).—א' על א' square-cubit. Yoma 31 a; a. e.—Zeb. 62 b (גרומה) א' גדומה; Y. Yoma IV, 41 c bot. גמודה a reduced cubit; v. גָּדַם; also called א' בת ששה עצבות a cubit of six hand-breadths pressed together (sorrowing), opp. to א' (בת ששה) שוחקות a cubit of six wide-spread (laughing) hand-breadths. Erub. 3 b. Y. Shek. VI, end, 50 b.—Gen. R. s. 31 (א') תביקין Theban (Egypt.) cubit(?). B. Bath. 99 b אמה בית השלחין land for digging a dyke of one cubit’s width; א' בית הקילון (Var. קלון, סילון) land for a creek or pond for watering cattle and washing clothes, of one cubit’s width.
Sabb. 108 b. Nid. 13 a sq. B. Kam. 19 b

sense.definition: prop. river-arm, hence canal, dyke, sewer.
sense.notes: Peah II, 2 אַמַּת המים.—Yoma V, 6 אלו ואלו מתערבין בא' the blood of both was mixed in the sewer; Tam. III, 6; B. Mets. 33 a; Y. Hor. III, 48 b top אמת (בית) השחי a sewer in the Temple called the duct of the arm-pit (from its shape; v. Grætz Monatsschr. 1880, p. 289; [emendation שית unnecessary]; v. supra.— Pl. אַמֹּות cubits. Kel. XVII, 10; a. fr.
Sot. 12 b, v. preced.; a. e.— Pl. אֲמָהֹות. Y. Snh. II, 20 b bot.; v. אֵם; a. e.
Targ. Job XXXI, 13. Targ. Gen. XVI, 1; a. fr.—Y. M. Kat. III, 81 d.—Meg. 18 a; a. fr.—Erub. 53 b.— Pl. אַמְהָתָא; אַמְהָן. Targ. Gen. XX, 17; a. fr.

sense.definition: w. Targ. O. Ex. XXI, 7 a. e. (Concrete: servant.
sense.notes: ); cmp. אִיתּוּ.

sense.definition: (אָמָה) servitude of a maid, servile condition.
sense.notes: Mekh. Mishp., sect. 3 קידוש אחר א' the father’s privilege of giving away his daughter in marriage is valid even after having hired her out as a servant.
, v. אַמְהָא
, pl. of אַמְּתָא.
R. Hash. 23 a; B. Bath. 74 b Ms. a. Ar. (ed. בר אמוראי).
Y. Snh. IX, 27 a, read אוּמָדִין, pl. of אוּמָד.

sense.definition: (= אמאום, denom. of אֵם) model, form, shoe-maker’s last, &c. Kel. XXVI, 4; XXIII, 1.
sense.notes: —Ib. XVI, 7 הא' של גודלי וכ' the block of the cap-makers; של עושי וכ' of dressmakers. Sabb. 141 b Ms. M. (ed. אימוס, corr. acc.); a. fr.

sense.definition: artist; (homilet.) a) = אֹומֵן, tutor; b) = אָמוּן nursed ( well-covered) ; guarded; c) = next w., metropolis, (great).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 1.

sense.definition:
(b. h.
נוא א') No-Amon (Thebes) in Egypt.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 1 (= Alexandria, the metropolis).—[
A., near Tyre. Y. Dem. II, 22 d top; Tosef. Shebi. IV, 9 עמק.]

B. Bath. X, 8, a. e. לא על אֱמוּנָתֹו הלוהו at the time he extended the loan, he did so not because he was relying on his (the friend’s) surety. Ib. שכן על א' וכ' for in this case he did &c. Ab. Zar. 55 a אנו נאבד את אֱמוּנָתֵנוּ shall we abandon our honesty? Ḥull. 133 b אין א' בכותים Samaritans are (usually) not trusted. Tam. 28 a א' יתירה scrupulous honesty. V. אֲמָנָה.
, Y. Sot. VII, 21 c bot., v. אִכּוּם

sense.definition: speaker, lecturer, interpreter; esp. Amora, one who, in lengthy popular discourses, expounds what the lecturer (Tanna, v. תַּנָּא) says before him in brief and in a low voice; often called מְתוּרְגְּמָן.
sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 8, end כשם שהדורש … והא' וכ' as the lecturer sits … and the Amora speaks in his presence.—Snh. 7 b קום עליה בא' stand by him as an expounder. Taan. 8 a, a. fr. אוקים … א' עליה ודרש S. … placed an Amora by his side and lectured. Sot. 40 a ואמר אֲמֹורֵיה חד טעמא and his Amora gave a different reason. Ḥull. 15 a do people listen to the Tanna? לא' צייתי they listen to the Amora.

sense.definition: in a particular sense אֲמֹורָא, Amora ( Amoraïm), that class of Talmudic authorities who lived after the final redaction of the Mishnah, and whose discussions on the opinions of the Tannaïm or authors of the Mishnah and Boraitha, are deposited in the Guemara, thus adding a second element to the development of the oral law, called Talmud.
sense.notes: — Pl. אֲמֹורִין. Y. Ber. I, 2 c top, a. e. תרי א' two Amoraïm differ, for which Babli usually: … אֲמֹורָאֵי נינהו ואליבא two Amoras differ in their relation (or conception) of the opinion of … Shebu. 40 b; a. fr.
Targ. Job III, 17.— Pl. אֲמֹורָאִין. Targ. Y. I, Num. XXI, 29.
Targ. Gen. XV, 16; a. fr.—Keth. 112 a בר א'.— Pl. אֱמֹורָאֵי. Targ. Ex. III, 8; a. fr.—פרק א' the chapter treating of idolatrous practices (v. אֱמֹורִי). Sabb. 67 a, (v. Tosef. Sabb. ch. VII, sq.).
, v. אמודאי

Gen. R. s. 41 none among the nations are קשה מא' more obstinate than the Em.—Trnsf. Emorean, superstitious, heathen-like. דרכי הא' superstitious practices. Sabb. 67 a, a. fr. אין בו משום דרכי הא' is not to be looked upon (not forbidden) as an imitation of &c.; יש בו משום דרכי הא' it is forbidden because it has the appearance of superstitious practices.
Esth. R. to I, 1 b, בני אֲמוּרְיֵיה his hostages; v. אוּכַּיְיפָא for corr. vers.
, v. אֵימוּרִים

sense.definition: (abbrev. of next w.) on account of, for the sake of.
sense.notes: Ber. 56 a bot. א' זוזא וכ' for the sake of thy zuz (which has been refused, v. Ms. M. in Rabb. D. S. a. l.) shall the wardrobe of the king go to ruin? Lev. R. s. 27 א' בעירא כ' for the sake of the tender cattle.—א' הכי, א' להכי therefore. Naz. 25 a. B. Kam. 71 ab (Ms. H. הכי אמטול); a. fr. V. אָטוּ.

= preced., only with suffix of personal pronoun. Targ. Y. Lev. IX, 7 לָתָךְ … = h. בעדך. Targ. Job I, 10 לְתֵּיה … around him (protecting him). Targ. Ps. VII, 8 אַמְטֻלְתָּהָא for her sake; a. e.—Keth. 67 b אַמְטוּלְתֵּיה for his sake.
, v. אַמְטוּ
Pesik. B’shall. p. 82 a; v. אַכְרַעְתָּא.
, v. אַמְטוּל'
, v. אֲמִיטְתָא
, v. אֲמָא
, Af. of מוּט.
, v. אַמְיַינְטֹון
Tosef. Maasr. III, 6 ed. Zuck., v. הֵמְטַלְיָא

sense.definition: (אמט, עמט; √אם, עם, v. אָמַם; cmp. חוּמְטָא I) darkness, dense cloud, mist.
sense.notes: Targ. Deut. IV, 11. Targ. II Chr. VI, 1, ed. Beck. עמ'; a. e.—Gen. R. s. 44 (transl. עֲלָטָה).

sense.definition: (ἀμίαντος, ἀμίαντον) amiant, a variety of asbestos from which the reputed asbestos linen was spun, which was cleansed by being thrown into the fire.
sense.notes: Cant. R. to IV, 11; Pesik. B’shall. p. 92 a. [Deut. R. s. 7, end אסיטון; Midr. Till. to Ps. XXIII, 2 הסיטון; Yalk. Deut. 850 אמיטון; corr. acc.]—Deriv. המיינטון, read הַמְּיַינְטֵן he who cleanses the amiant. Y. Sabb. VII, 10 c top.
Snh. 44 a Ar., v. מִילְתָא
, v. אַמְיַינְטֹון

sense.definition: (part. pass. of אֲמַר) told, proclaimed, commanded.
sense.notes: Targ. Mic. V, 1. Targ. Mal. I, 6; a. fr.
Gen. R. s. 5, beg. לא א' לא דיבור no (power of) speech or word; a. fr.—הא א' this is speech, i.e. this is right. Y. Snh. IV, 22 b top; VI, beg. 23 b. Y. B. Kam. IX, beg. 6 d (contracted) הא' same.

sense.definition: the word amar (אמר) in the Scripture text.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. VII, 25 b bot. נאמר כאן א' וכ' here amar is used &c.; as well as amar here indicates that the word is considered a deed &c.; a. e.

Kidd. I, 6 אֲמִירָתֹו לגבוה וכ' dedication to the Lord (by word of mouth) is equal to what delivery is in private transactions.— Pl. אֲמִירֹות mostly in the sense of 2). Num. R. s. 14, end א' וציוויים texts in which amar and tsivvah occur; a. fr.

sense.definition: (v. preced. 3); cmp. Ps. IV, 5; XCVI, 10; Is. III, 10)

sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 29 when a human king יוצא לא' וכ' comes forth for a reception of homage, he comes forth singly (not with his army).
Yalk. Ex. 244, v. אִימְּרָה.

sense.definition: (אמם, חמם) ammi, Bishop’s weed (v. Löw Pflzn. p. 260; Rashi = מינתא mint).
sense.notes: Tosef. Sabb. XIV (XV), 13 א' (Var. ח'). Sabb. 128 a; 140 a, v. נִינְיָא. Tosef. Kil. III, 12, Var. (ed. Zuck. חמיטא).
, v. אֱמֶת
Y. Ber. VII, 11 c. Gen. R. s. 70 do ye not admit יעקב א' that Jacob was truthful? Ib. s. 78. [In later Hebrew: real.]
Af. of מוּךְ or מְכָא.
Koh. R. to VI, 1 או חד א' וכ' prob. to be read או חד מַכִּיתֵיה או חד מעקיציה וכ' either one bites him (v. נְכַת) or one stings him—what benefit has he (the keeper of the obnoxious beasts) of them?
, v. אֵילֹוגִין
, v. אוּמְלָל
, v. הִימַלְתָּא,

sense.definition: (μέλαθρον) main-beam of the ceiling, ceiling; beam projecting outside the house, cornice.
sense.notes: Erub. 3 a (differ. opinions as to the meaning of our w.).— Pl. אֲמַלְתְּרָאֹות, מַלְתְּרָאֹות. Erub. l. c. א'. Midd. III, 7 מ'.

entry.language-reference: עמם; √אם, עם to be pressed, dark; cmp. אֵם; חמם a. deriv.; v. אמיטתא)

sense.definition: to grow dim, (in b. h. also to obscure, excel; v. infra).
sense.notes: Sabb. 77 b; Ber. 53 b; Pes. 75 b גחלים אֹומְמֹות (or עֹומְמֹות) dying coals (question as to spelling decided in favor of ע by reference to Ezek. XXXI, 8 ‘the cedars did not obscure him, i.e. excel his beauty).

sense.definition: , v. אֵם; cmp. אַמָּה) to arrange in lines, array.
sense.notes: Ukts. II, 5 nuts שאֲמָנָן which one arranged (Var. Ar. שחמרן which one piled).—Denom. אוּמָן expert, skilful, whence
Sabb. 103 a מְאַמֵּן את ידו he trains his hand (practicing). V. next w.

sense.definition: (√אם, v. אֵם; cmp. preced.) to be strong, enduring; (act. v. אָמַן to support, v. II Kings XVIII, 16 אֹמְנֹות).
sense.notes: — Pi. אִימֵּן, אִמֵּן to support; trnsf. to confirm, verify, approve. Tosef. Ter. I, 4 it is not the minor that made it T’rumah אלא אביו שאִימֵּן אחריו Var. (ed. Zuck. שאומן) but his father who confirmed his act (= ib. קיים על יד); Y. ib. 40 b א' על ידו. Ib. c top מְאַמֵּין.

sense.definition: part. נֶאֱמָן m., נֶאֱמָנֶת f. approved, trustworthy, reliable.
sense.notes: Peah VIII, 2 נֶאֱמָנִים על וכ' (the poor) may be relied upon concerning garnered fruit &c., i.e. if they declare the fruits to be the poor man’s share, they are exempt from tithes. Keth. I, 6 נאמנת her statement is acted upon as true. Ab. Zar. 16 b נ' עלי הדיין my judge is a reliable witness concerning me, i.e. I appeal to thy own judgment that I could not have engaged in such follies.—Dem. II, 2 if one resolves להיות נ' to be one of the reliable (conscientious in giving tithes); a. fr.
Y. Sot. II, 18 b top אמן יֵאָמְנוּ הדברים Amen means, May the words (of the oath) be fulfilled.

sense.definition: (b. h.) to declare trustworthy, to trust, believe in.
sense.notes: Dem. VII, 1 והוא אינו מַאֲמִינֹו but he (the invited guest) trusts him not in tithe affairs. Ib. 3; a. fr.—Ab. Zar. 16 b הואיל וְהֶאֱמַנְתַּנִי עליך ed. Pes., En Yak. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note; ed. הָאֳמַנְתִּי Hof.; since thou didst declare me a reliable witness unto thyself (appealing to my judgment), v. supra; [Ms. M. האמנת עלי thou reliedst on me]. Ch., v. הֵימַן.

sense.definition: Amen!, true! so may it be! Shebu. 36 a א' בו שבועה וכ' in Amen is implied an oath, a promise, and a prayer for fulfillment.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 65 a; a. fr.

Ber. 47 a א' חטופה an Amen hastily pronounced ( ’men); א' קטופה an Amen cut short ( ame-); א' יתומה an orphan Amen, the responder not having heard the benediction to which the Amen refers; Tosef. Meg. IV (III), 27.

B. Bath. 48 b; Keth. 19 b if witnesses say א' היו דברינו our statement (over our signatures as to having seen the loan handed over) was a matter of trust (that the negotiation would be consummated afterwards). Ib. שטר א' a bill of indebtedness signed on trust (that the loan would be consummated subsequently). B. Mets. 63 a א' בפירות advanced payment at present prices for future delivery; א' בדמים with the option of paying the difference. Gen. R. s. 100 end, שמר א' to deal in good faith with. Tosef. B. Bath. V, 8 אֲמָנַת המדות honesty in measures. B. Mets. 49 a מחוסרי א' (the way of) those lacking honesty (unfair dealing); Bekh. 13 b מחוסר א'; a. fr.
Mekh. B’shall. s. 6, v. הַאֲמָנָה. Sot. 48 b אנשי א' men of faith, trusting in God; ib. קטני א' wanting in faith; Gen. R. s. 32 מחוסר א' same; a. fr. Cmp. אֱמוּנָה, הַאֲמָנָה.

sense.definition: (b. h.) Amanah, Abanah (Banas), a river crossing the city of Damascus.
sense.notes: (Banas), a river crossing the city of Damascus. Targ. II Kings V, 12.

sense.definition: אֲמָנָה, (אמנם) אֲמָנֹוס, אֲמָנֹון Amanah, hellenized Amanos, Amanon &c. (Banias), a mountain range forming the northern limits of the Holy Land.
sense.notes: Tosef. Ter. II, 12 אמנוס (Var. אמנון, סמנון). Ib. Ḥall. II, 11 אמנוס (Var. אמנון). Git. 8 a ון … (Ar. אמנים, סמנים); Y. Ḥall. IV, 60 a bot. אמנם (ref. to אמנה Cant. IV, 8). Shebi. VI, 1; Ḥall. IV, 8 (Ms. M. ם …); Ex. R. s. 23. V. טַוְורֹוס.
, v. preced.
Y. Keth. IV, 28 d top, v. אוּמְנוּתָא
, v. אֲמָנָה II
, v. אמפומטא
, v. אֲמַפְּלַי
Pesik. B’shall. p. 86 b, Yalk. Sam. 152, corrupt. of אִסְטְרֹופֹומָטָא, or אִסְטְרֹופֹוטָא q. v.
ch. XLII חלונות א' Ar. (in ed. our w. omitted); read אֹופְסְיָינִיֹּות (denom. of אָפְסְיָין q. v.) glass-windows
, v. אִמְפְּרָטֹור

Targ. Y. I Gen. XXV, 3 (a gloss to preceding תגרין; Targ. Y. II inserts אומנין for לְטוּשִׁם; h. text אַשּׁוּרִים). Ib. XLVI, 23 (h. text חשים). [Gen. R. s. 61, quoting Targ. Gen. XXV, 3, reads לופרין!]

sense.definition: (pl. of ἐμπίλιον, impilia) (pair of) felt-shoes, in gen. shoes, socks.
sense.notes: Kel. XXVII, 6. Yeb. XII, 1. Ib. 102 b א' של בגד cloth-shoes; א' של עור leather-covered shoes; a. fr.— Pl. אִנְפִּילָאֹות, אִנְפִּלָ', אִמְפִּילָיֹות, אִנְפִּילִין pairs of &c. Sabb. 120 a; Y. ib. XVI, 15 d שתי א' two pairs &c. Gen. R. s. 61. Yeb. 102 b

sense.definition: (נָפַל; cmp. אוּנְקְלַי as to form) the merchant’s money-chest into which receipts are dropped through a slit.
sense.notes: Shebu. VII, 6 (45 a) אמפלי Mish. Nap. (Ar. אמפו', ed. אונ'; Y. אנ'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 10). Tosef. Maas. Sh. IV, 11 ed. Zuck. אינפו' (ed. אונקלי, אונקולין). Ib. Shebu. VI, 4 אונכלי ed. Zuck. (corr. acc.; oth. ed. אוּנְפְּלָא). Cmp. אוּנְפִּיל.
Lam. R. to I, 5 ביבי דומיני א' Ar. (ed. וביבא מארי אפלטור, v. בִיבֵי) be saluted, my lord, the Emperor. Tanḥ. Mikkets, 9 אמפורטור, אומפירטור (corr. acc.)
אֹומְצֵי הלב hard-hearted. Tosef. Sot. XIV, 7; v. infra.
Y. Taan. III, 66 d all shall be מְאַמְּצִין כחך strengthening thy power (assist thee). Snh. 44 b מאמץ עצמו וכ' who concentrates his energies for prayer.

sense.definition: to press, close; to make impervious.
sense.notes: Sot. 47 b מאַמְּצֵי הלב those who close their hearts, the hard-hearted; v. supra. [Sabb. XXIII, 5 מאמצין את המת Y. ed. (Mish. מעמ', Bab. 151 b מעצמין, Ms. M. מעמ') to close the eyes of a deceased person. Tosef. ib. XVII (XVIII), 19 לעַמֵּץ ed. Zuck. (Var. לאַמֵּץ). Sabb. 77 b מעמצין או מאמצין וכ' is m’amm’tsin (l. c.) spelt with ע or with א? Answer by ref. to עוצם Is. XXXIII, 15(!).] V. אוּמְצָא.
Tosef. l. c. מִתְאַמְּצֹות מאיליהן they will be closed of themselves.

sense.definition: (v. מְצַע; √מץ; cmp. b. h. תָּוֶךְ, תֹּךְ, תְּכָכִים) [ lying in a press], whence—בא' in the centre, between two extremes.
sense.notes: Y. Ḥag. II, 77 a bot. יהלך בא' he must walk between the extremes. B. Mets. 70 b יד הנכרי בא'; Y. Ab. Zar. I, 40 a top אצבע הגוי בא' the hand [finger] of the gentile is between, i.e. he has a share in it; a. fr.—2) common fund, estate. B. Bath. X, 7 השכר לא' the profit belongs to the common fund. Ib. IX, 3 השביחו לא' they improved for the common fund, i.e. the profit must be equally divided. Ib. 144 b מן הא' from the estate; a. fr. Cmp. מְצַע, מִיסְוָון.—[Also in Ch. Targ. Job II, 8 (Ms. מצע) Targ. Y. II, Num. XXII, 24 בא' between.]
Y. Snh. I, 18 a bot. מ"ם באמצעותה the Mem is in the middle of the alphabet.

—Erub. V, 2 הא' the intermediate village, opp. חיצונים; a. fr.—Shebi. III, 4 הא … ית the central part of the field, lying in the middle. Kil. IV, 8; a. fr.— Pl. אֶמְצְעִיִּים, אֶמְצְעִיִּין m.; אֶמְצְעִיֹּות f. Y. Peah II, 17 a top; a. e.—Y. Ber. II, 4 d bot. הא' (sub. ברכות) the intermediate (central) sections of the benedictions (between the first three and the last three). Kil. V, 2 הא' the central garden beds; a. fr.
also as a noun. Y. B. Kam. IV, 4 b top I was present ברישא … ובא' at the discussion on the first, the last, and of the intermediate clause (or case). Ber. 3 a; a. e.

sense.definition: (a) to join, knot; to be knotted, thick; b) to heap up; c) transf.
sense.notes: to join words, compose, cmp. דבר; d) to contract, bargain, exchange. [As to Assyr. to see, cmp. חמא.])

sense.definition: to speak, think, say, relate &c. … א' ר' … א' ר' Rabbi … related in the name of R. … Ber. 3 b; a. v. fr.—Part.
sense.notes: pass. אָמוּר expression. Yoma 70 b, a. fr. הוא הא' וכ' it is the same expression (‘ one ram’) used here and in the Book of Numbers. Sifré Deut. s. 334, a. fr. אֱמֹור מעתה say from now, i.e. from this draw the conclusion. Gen. R. s. 39 תאמר שהבירה וכ' (usu. שמא תאמר) will you say (is it possible), this castle has no commander?—אֲמוּרִים דברים במה (abbr. בד''א) in what case are these words said? i.e. this applies only. Ḥull. 3 a; a. fr.—זאת אֹומֶרֶת this tells, i.e. this proves. Ber. 11 b; a. fr.—אָמְרוּ it is said, told &c.; v. next w.—Inf. לֹומַר = לֵאמֹר. Ḥag. 14 b; a. fr.
אָמוּר (לגבוה) devoted to the Lord. Succ. 55 b; v. אֲמִירָה I, 3, a. אֵימוּרִים.

sense.definition: (b. h.) to be said, to read … נא' כאן … ונ' להלן we read here … and we read there … (the same expression is used here and there in the Scriptural text).
sense.notes: Ber. 9 a; a. v. fr.—שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר (abbr. שנ', שנא') for it is said in the Scriptures (as evidence in favor of an opinion). Snh. X, 1; a. v. fr.; also כמה שנ' (כמו) as it is said.—מִשּׁוּם שנ' because it is said in the Scriptures, i.e. you may possibly be misled by a certain expression to think …, therefore another term is used in its stead in an analogous case, or added to the ambiguous word; v. שׁוּם.

Targ. Gen. I, 3; a. v. fr.—א' מר above you quoted an authority, or, it has been stated. Ber. 2 a; a. fr.—א' קרא the Scripture says. Ib. 13 a; a. fr.—Y. Orl. III, end, 63 b, a. fr. אמרונה בשם … (in Bab. heb. אֲמָרוּהָ) they said it in behalf of … i.e. as a tradition.—Y. Ber. I, 2 d מילתיה אמרה his word (statement, opinion &c.) proves.—הדא אמרה = זאת אומרת; v. preced.—אַמְרֵי (h. אָמְרוּ) they say, it is said. Sabb. 19 a אמרו עליו על … ואמרי לה וכ' it is told about R. …, and another relation refers this to R.—; a. fr.—קאמר, קאמרי &c. = קא אמר &c. Ḥull. 85 a; a. fr.—מנא תימרא whence dost thou prove? Sabb. 23 a; a. fr.— Inf. מֵימַר, מֵימְרָא. סבר מ', סבר למ' originally he was of the opinion. Y. Sabb. VI, 8 c top; Keth. 87 b; a. v. fr.—לְמֵימְרָא does this mean to say? Sabb. 15 b; a. fr. לא אמרן אלא … אבל … this has been said, i.e. this applies only to a case … but if … Ber. 43 b; a. fr.—כְּלֹומַר as if saying, meaning to say, viz; v. כִּילּוּ.—Y. Kil. IV, 32 c bot. אימורין לבני וכ' say ye to &c.—מאי איכא למימר, v. אִיכָּא; Answ. אֵימוּר say … Sabb. 6 a; a. fr.—Hor. 13 a א' כולה who orders every thing (as an etymol. of אֲמַרְכָּל).—2) to praise, proclaim. Targ. Is. VIII, 13; a. fr.—Part. pass. אָמִיר q. v.

sense.definition: , contr. אִתְּמַר, אִיתְּ' it is said, taught.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XXXIV, 31.—Y. Yoma V, end, 43 a אתאמרת, contr. אִתַּמְרַת it has been said with refer. to the opinion of …—אִתְּ', אִיתְּ' it has been said ( above) ; we have been taught. Succ. 15 a; a. fr.
same. Targ. Gen. XXII, 14; a. e.

sense.definition: , v. אָמַר I, a) to be thick, strong.
to thrive; to boast, vaunt, be oppressive (cmp. Ps. XCIV, 4).
sense.notes: Sot. IX, 15 (49 b) יוקר יַאֲמִיר the nobility shall be oppressive (Snh. 97 a יְעַוֵּת; Der. Er. Zut. X יעוות; Cant. R. to II, 13 הווה).—*[
Sabb. XXIV, 3 (155 b) Bab. מַאֲמִירִין, Ms. Oxf., Mish. a. Y. מַמְרִים, מַמְרִין, v. מרי.]
, v. אֵימַר a. אִמְרָה.

*Gen. R. s. 42 play on Amraphel, א' אפילה (quot. in Ar. s. v. אספרון) obscure speech (ed. שהיתה אֲמִירָתֹו אפ').— Pl. אֲמָרֹות, constr. אִמְרֹות. Pesik. Parah, p. 30 b ( promises); Tanḥ. Ḥukk. 4. Pesik. R. s. 14.
Af. of מרי.
, v. אמוריא a. אוכייפא.

מַרְכָּל, מַרְכֹּול m. (= מלכל; fr. מלך; ר for ל for euphony) counsellor, officer &c. Targ. Is. XXII, 23 (h. text יתד, LXX ἄρχοντα). Targ. Y. Num. I, 6 sq. (corresponding to ראש בית אב, נשיא, פקיד &c.; O. ib. III, 32 אַמַרְכְּלָא); a. fr.—Esp. Amarkal, one of the seven Temple trustees superintending the cashiers. Tosef. Shek. II, 15 (etymol. מר על הכל mastering all, v. מַר; cmp. Hor. 13 a אמר כולא). Y. ib. V, 49 a; a. fr.— Pl. (h.) אֲמַרְכְּלִים, אֲמַרְכְּלִין (ch.) אֲמַרְכְּלַיָּא, אֲמַרְכֹּולִין &c. Targ. II Kings XXII, 4 (h. text שמרי הסף); a. fr.—Shek. V, 2. Tosef. l. c.; Y. l. c. (= פקידים II Chr. XXXI, 13); a. e. V. מלך a. deriv.
, v. אמדלאי

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Amraphel, King of Shin’ar; v. אִמְרָה.

sense.notes: Pesik. Vayhi p. 63 b; Pesik. R. s. 17 מא' (ו)עד חצות from nightfall to midnight.

Meg. 3 a, a. e. א' ביטלתם וכ' this evening you neglected the evening offering.—Snh. 40 b א' הרגו last night he killed him. B. Mets. 60 a שמרים של א' dregs of last night (yesterday), opp. to היום; a. fr.

sense.definition: (b. h.; = אמנת; אמן) truth, faith, reality.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. XI, 30 c top לחם א' bread of truth, unfeigned hospitality. Gen. R. s. 96 חסד של א' true (unselfish) charity. Y. Meg. I, 70 a top כאֲמִיתָּהּ של תורה as the Law itself, i.e. as though the Scroll of Esther were the Pentateuch. Y. Shebu. VI, 37 a top אֲמִיתָּן של דברים the truth of &c. Num. R. s. 12 א' של תורה וכ' the truth of the Law is a weapon (of protection) to its owner.—בא' אמרו in fact they said that &c. Sabb. I, 3; a. fr.—B. Mets. 60 a, a. e. כל בא' אמרו הלכה היא wherever an opinion is introduced with the words ‘In fact they said’ it means to say that it is an established legal rule. Y. Sabb. I, 3 b bot., a. e. כ''מ ששנו בא' וכ' wherever the Mishnah says, ‘In fact’, it indicates a rule dating from Moses on Sinai, i.e. an ancient tradition; v. Frank. Darké p. 286.—הא' indeed? Tanḥ. Noah, 10 (ed. Bub. 15, corr. acc.); v. אֹונְטֹוס.
Targ. Ex. XXV, 10; a. fr.—Y. Sot. VIII, 22 c bot. א' אישתא a cubit has six hand-breadths; a. fr.
M. Kat. 17 a טרקיה אאַמְּתֵיה stung him on his membrum.
א' דריחיא enclosure of the millstones, mill. Ber. 18 b.— Pl. אַמִּין (fr. אַמָּא). Targ. Ezek. XL, 5; a. fr. אַמָּהָתָא. Ḥull. 59 b תשע א' nine cubits.

sense.definition: the use of the word אֲמָת־.
sense.notes: Ber. 31 b שלש א' three times אֲמָת־ (I Sam. I, 11; Ms. M. אֲמָהֹות).

sense.definition: (Y. מַתְלָא) m. (cmp. h. משל) something tangible (= דבר שיש בו ממש); plausible reason for correcting or retracting an evidence.
sense.notes: Keth. 22 a אם נתנה א' וכ' if she offers a reasonable explanation of her contradictory statements, her second one is accepted. Gitt. IX, 9 ובלבד שלא יהא שם א' provided no reasonable explanation is offered to show how the report may have arisen by mistake; a. fr. V. מַתְלָא.

sense.definition: Amathlai, legendary name of Abraham’s mother (א' בת כרנבו), and of Haman’s mother (א' בת עורביתא).
sense.notes: B. Bath. 91 a

sense.definition: (denom. of אֵימָה; י absorbed by preceding א; cmp. next w.) one who rules through fear, tyrannical.
sense.notes: Pl. אֵמְתָנִין. Der. Er. II, beg.; cmp. R. Hash. 17 a. V. אֵימְתָן.

Dan. VII, 7 (quot. Gen. R. s. 44 אימ'; Ex. R. s. 25 אימתנו; Lev. R. s. 13 אימ' a. אמ'; Yalk. Gen. 77; Lev. 536 אמ'). [Ges. H. Dict. אֶמְתָּנִי, not found in editions, fr. מתן to be strong; cmp., however, אֵמְתָן a. אֵימְתָן.] [Edit. Letteris, Berl. 5644 a. m., אֵימְתָנִי.]
Ab. III, 1.

sense.definition: ; (interrog.) where? Targ. Gen. IV, 9; a. e.
sense.notes: —Y. Yoma VIII, 44 d bot. אן מן הדה (read … מן אן) wherefrom this? i.e. where is your authority? Y. Yeb. XII, 12 d bot. ההן סבא לְאָן ליך of what use is this old man to thee?; a. e.—(relat.) where, wherever. Lev. R. s. 27 beg. א' את יהיב וכ' (Yalk. Ps. 727 הן) wherever thou givest, thou givest abundantly.
Succ. III, 9. Yoma VI, 2.

אֲנָנָא ch. = h. אֲנִי, I. הא אנא contr. הָאנָא. Targ. O. Gen. XXII, 7; a. fr.—Ḥull. 2 b א' וכ' as to myself &c. Y. Taan. IV, 68 d bot. דאננא משלים וכ' that I myself should surrender the country.— Pl. אֲנַן we. Targ. Y. Gen. XLIII, 8; a. e.—Ber. 49 b נחזי א' let us see; a. fr.—אֲנַחְנָא, נַחְנָא. Targ. O. Gen. l. c.; a. fr.—
Dan. IV, 9.—Targ. Job XXXI, 12; a. e.

sense.definition: אִינְבָּא f. (= עִינְבָּא) [berries], eggs of lice, nits.
sense.notes: Naz. 39 a. Taan. 22 b מתחזי ליה כי אנ' Ar. (Ms. M. ומחזי כי אינ', ed. מתחזי איניבא) looked as small as &c.; v. יניבא.

sense.definition: (v. נַבְגָּא; whence ἄμβικος, ἄμβιξ, ambiga) a small cup; a measure containing one fourth of a Log.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 58 b on the gates of … it is written, אנבג אנפק וכ' (Ms. differ. order) Anbag, Anpak a. Antal (as the same measures). Kid. 70 a לישתי מר אנבגא will you take a cup (of wine &c.)? [Popular pronunciation: anpak.] Sabb. 109 b אנפקא; a. e.

sense.definition: (= עִינְבֹּול, v. אִמְבֹּול) clapper of a bell.
sense.notes: — Pl. אִנְבֹּולִים, ין … Zeb. 88 b Ar. (ed. עינבלין). Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. I, 13 עשה לה האנבילים ed. Zuck. (read … להם אנבולים) if he put clappers in. Ib. אנביליהן (corr. acc.).
, v. אִלְבָּנָא
, v. אִמְבּוּרְקְלוֹן

sense.definition: (נבט; = b. h. מצפה) observatory, watch-tower, battlement.
sense.notes: Pl. אַנְבְּטָאֹות. Ex. R. s. 12 the hailstones formed א' א' lines of battlements; (Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXVIII כותל). V. אמבוניא.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) platforms or elevations erected for public spectacles.
sense.notes: Yalk. Esth. 1058 all the people shall go out להדין א' (read להנהו א'; Lev. R. s. 28, end להון פרטי, corr. acc.) to the spectacular elevations, for a Jew (Mordecai) is to be hanged. V. אמבוניא.
, v. אִנְבֹּול
, v. אַגְבִּין
, v. אִמְבּוּרְקְלוֹן
, v. אגניטוס

sense.definition:
Yalk. Ps. 794; אגוסטוס Gen. R. s. 12, א' במדינה (Ar.
אגבאסטס) read (אגב') אַגְוִיסְטֹור m. (quæstor, κυαίστωρ) quæstor provincialis, assistant of the consul.
sense.notes: א' … ביא שלו (read שלה) the quæstor in the province is appointed over its roads, v. בִּיָּא.
, v. אַרְגֶּנְטָרְיָא
Y. Ter. VIII, 46 c top, read אֲרֹוגְנַוְטִיס.

sense.definition: read אָנְגִּיסְטֵיר m. (ὀνυχίστηρ = ὀνυχιστήριον) knife or scissors for cutting nails.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. III, 12 (ed. Zuck. אגניסטר corr. acc.). Nid. 17 a גנוסטרי; M. Kat. 18 a גנוסטרא (Ms. M. נגוסטרי, v. Ar. s. v. גנסטר).
St. p. 113) messengers, angels. Targ. Job XV, 15; a. e.
, v. אַנְלָגִין

sense.definition: (read אַנְגִּירָא?) pr. n. pl. Ancyra, a city of Galatia in Asia Minor.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 46 b דינר אניאקא ואנגרא Ms. M. (ed. אנקא ואניגרא, Var. נְיָיקָא, אַנְיָיקָא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, Ar. Compl. ed. Koh. s. v. אנגרא) the Bithynian and the Ancyrean Denars, one of which was repealed by the central Government, the other by the local authority. V. אֵנְיָאקָא. [Ancyra prob. of Semitic origin, v. נִיגְרָא a. אַנִּיגְרָא.]

sense.definition: (ἀγγαρευτής, ἀγγαρευτάς) commissioner or superintendent of forced public labor; v. אַנְגַּרְיָא.
sense.notes: Pesik. B’shall. 92 b אתמני א' (for Var. v. Bub., note) was appointed angareutes.
, Gen. R. s. 64 והלך א', prob. to be read זו אַנְגַּרְיָא …, as in Esth. R. introd. [B. Bath. 8 a; Ned. 62 b אַרְנֹונָא.]
, v. אֶנִּיגָרֹון

sense.definition: (ἀγγαρεία, angaria) forced labor, service, esp. seizure for public services or works.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 2 d bot. איתצדית בא' וכ' I was pressed into service to carry myrtles &c. B. Mets. VI, 3 (78 a) נעשית א' (the ass) was seized for public service. Ib. 78 b בא' חוזרת in the case that the animal pressed into service is sent back again. Lev. R. s. 12 שמעון א' במדינתא they heard that seizure for public service was to take place in the country. Esth. R. introd. והלך זו א' hãlakh (Ezra IV, 13) means angaria (v. אנגרוטינא). Snh. 101 b; a. fr.— Pl. אַנְגַּרְיֹות. Lev. R. s. 23 אע"פ שהן נגבין … וא' though annonæ and angariæ are collected from them. Yalk. Esth. 1051 א' של נשים levies of women (for the king).—Trnsf. בא' as a forced labor, reluctantly. Midr. Till. Ps. CXII.—Pesik. R. s. 21 שלא באנגריס (corr. acc.) not as a forced labor.
v. preced.
, v. אַנְגְּרַבְטֵיס
corrupt. of אַגְרֹונִימֹוס.
, v. אנדכ'

sense.definition: (a Babylonian adoption of ecdicus, v. אגדיקוס, אנדיקוס) syndics, state-officials.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 55 a אבל אצלוהו א' וכ' Ar. (ed. omit אצלוהו) but if the syndics exempted him from taxes, it is like a divine grant.
m., אַנְדִּיפָה f., v. next w.

sense.definition: locks or ringlets falling from the temples.
sense.notes: Sabb. VIII, 4 כדי לעשות א' enough toilet material to make side curls (Mish. Pes. אנטיפי, Nap. אנטפי, Talm. אונד'). Ib. 80 b מאי כלכול ומאי א' what locks are meant by kilkul, and what by andifé? Answ. the upper and the lower &c. Ib. אמר ר' יצהק דבי ר' אמי אנדיפה וכ' Ms. M. (ed. אלא אמר ר' … אמר … אאַנְדִּיפָא) R. Isaac of the school of … (in reciting that Mishnah) used the word andifah (in the sing.) upon which R. … asked ‘Will a person waste his money’ (i.e. of what use is the material for one curl so as to make a person guilty of a transgression when carrying it on the Sabbath)? Ib. מאי אנדיפא אפותא by andifa (in the sing.) is meant the lock on the forehead. Ib. מחתיה באַנְדִּיפֵיה וכ' Ms. M. (ed. incorr. באנדיפי) it stung him on his forehead and he died. [Rashi: = דיופי!]

sense.definition: , a popular corrupt. of ecdicus, v. אֶגְדִּיקֹוס a. אַנְדִּיסְקֵי.
Esth. R. to I, 12, a corruption; according to the sense it may have been קטָּאדִיקִין (κατάδικοι) convicts.
, a corruption of אוּנְדִּיקְטָא or אֲוִינְדִּיקְטָא f. (vindicta, Gr. form βινδίκτα, οὐινδίκτα) manumission of a slave by declaration before court (v. Sm. Ant. s. vv. Manumissio and Pileus).
sense.notes: Gitt. 20 a but does not go free בכתב שע"ג כיפה וא' (ought to have read בכיפה וא', v. infra) by referring to his wearing a freedman’s cap or to a vindicta; Y. ib. IV, 45 d בכפה והרנירק טיאניס (read ובוינדיקטא); Treat. Abadim ch. III (ed. Kirchh.) יוצא באנטוקטא (corr. acc.). [Commentators to Gitt. l. c., misled by בכתב שע"ג וכ', guess at embroideries &c. V. Révue des Etudes Juives 1883, Nr. 13, p. 150.]
Ab. Zar. 29 a, some ed.; v. אַגְדָּנָא
Y. Keth. IX, 33 a top אילין דבר א' those of the family of B. A. (who were very rich). V. אַנְדְּרַיי.
Bicc. I, 5; a. fr.
, read אַנְדְּרִיאַנְטֹוס.

sense.definition: (read אַנְדְּרֹולֵימְסְיָא), אַנְדְּרֹולֵמְסְיָה f. (popular pronunc. of ἀνδρολημψία = ἀνδροληψία; cmp. λῆμψις for λῆψις) seizure of men, a Greek right of reprisals (v. Sm. Ant. s. v.), in gen. punishment of men regardless of guilt or innocence.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 26 א' באה וכ' an androlepsia comes which kills the good and the bad; Lev. R. s. 23; Num. R. s. 9; Y. Sot. I, 17 a top.—Num. R. s. 5 in case of a rebellion עוש' בה א' the king orders an androlepsia. [Gen. R. s. 32 דרולמוסיא; Pesik. Vayhi, p. 67 a; Tanḥ. Bo, 4; Pesik. R. s. 17 דורמסיאות, דורמסיות, דורמייס' (corr. acc.); cmp. Pesik. R. suppl., ed. Fr. p. 197 a.]
Yeb. 115 b, read דוד בר נהילאי as Asheri Gitt. ch. IV, to p. 34 b
, v. אנדרולומוסיא
, v. אִידְּרֹון

Gen, R. s. 8 אדריינטיס אני עושה אותה Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. אינדרטין; corr. acc.) I shall make it into (use the vacant ground for the erection of) a banqueting hall. [The context forbids the identification of our w. with אַנְדְּרִיאַנְטֹוס.]
, v. אִדְרֹופּ'

sense.definition: (a. contract. of ἀνδριάς‚—άντος) statue, also portable bust, image.
sense.notes: Targ. Esth. III, 2—5 (some ed. pl., incorr.). R. Hash. 24 b a synagogue דאוקימו בה א' Ms. M. (ed. הוה בה א') in which they placed a bust (of a Persian king). Snh. 62 b; a. fr.— Pl. אַנְדְּרָטֵי, אַנְדְּרָטַיָּא. Ab. Zar. 40 b א' של מלכים royal (imperial) busts. M. Kat. 25 b אתעקרו כל א' Ms. M. (ed. אתקציצו) all royal statues were overthrown. Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 c top. [Gen. R. s. 8 אינדרטין, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס.]

sense.definition: , Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. IV, 8, prob. אֹודֹונְטֹוטִי (ὀδοντωτή, sub. ξύστρα) a teethed strigil; cmp. Kel. XIV, 3 מגירה.

sense.notes: Ex. R. s. 27 נפלה … של אנדרואנטיא (read נפלטה לתוך ידו של א') it escaped into the hand of a (royal) statue; (v. ibid. ישבה על איקונין של מלך). Tanḥ. P’kudé, 4 אדריונטוס (corr. acc.); Ex. R. s. 51. [Gen. R. s. 8 אינדרטין, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס; v. Ar. s. v. אדרינטיס.]
Y. Meg. IV, 75 b; cmp. אַנְדְּרַאי.
, v. אַדְרְיָינֹוס. Ex. R. s. 51.
, v. אַנְדְּרֹונִיטִיס, a. אַנְדְּרִיאַנְטֹוס.
, v. אַנְגְרַבְטֵיס
Ar., v. אנדרולומוסיא

sense.definition: (prob. Pers.) Indrafta, name of two species of birds, one called Shabur And.
sense.notes: , and permitted, the other Peruz And., and forbidden. Ḥull. 62 b
, v. אני

sense.definition: (Inf. Af. of נהר used as a verbal noun) lighting, illumination.
sense.notes: Targ. Ex. XXXV, 14; a. e.
Targ. Num. IV, 16. Targ. Y. Gen. II, 7.
pl. of. אֲנִי.
Pesik. R. s. 21; Yalk. Ex. 286 (in Egyptian) אנכי א' Anokhi is Anokh. Esth. R. to I, 22 לשין יחנך (corr. acc.).
, v. אִינֹומִילִין
, pl. of אִיהוּ.

sense.definition: (annona) prop. annual produce, hence ration, or portions of provision granted to courtiers as salaries or pensions.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 47 the king מעלה לו א' raised an annona in his behalf, i.e. granted him a pension. Ib. s. 87 אני חותכת א' שלך Ar. (ed. פרנסה) I shall cut down (reduce) thy pension; a. fr.— Pl. אַנֹּונֹות, אַנֹּונִיֹּות. Ex. R. s. 41 אנונית (corr. acc.). Lev. R. s. 23 נגבין אונניות (corr. acc.) annonæ are collected from them. Ib. s. 10 אַנֹּונִים Ar. (ed. אַנֹּונָס annonas, acc. pl., incorr. ed. אנינוס). [Cant. R. to I, 7 read אֲטוּנָס.] Cmp. אַרְנֹון, אַרְנֹונָא.
, v. preced.
Targ. Koh. VII, 7 (h. text עֹושֶׁק).— Pl.אָנֹוסִין, אֲנֹוסַיָּא (אני'). Targ. Jer. VI, 6 ed. Ven. I אני' (ed. Vien. אֹונְסִין, oth. ed. אנו'). Targ. Is. XXI, 2; V, 7, a. e. Cmp. אַנָּס.
, read אֲנִיקֵי, v. אֲנַנְקָא

— Pl. (of אִישׁ) אֲנָשִׁים, const. אַנְשֵׁי. Ex. R. s. 25; a. fr.—א' כנסת הגדולה (abbr. אכה"ג) the Men of the Great Assembly, Synagoga Magna, a religious and judicial authority said to have been established by Ezra. Aboth I, 1; a. fr.; cmp. כְּנֶסֶת.—(ות) א' בית אבthe division on duty of priests having charge of the services of the day; א' משמר the division of priests alternately on duty during one week; א' מעמד the division (of Israelites) assisting the priests on duty, by prayers &c. on the platform (מעמד) and divided in parties corresponding to the priestly divisions. Taan. II, 6; 7; a. fr.

sense.definition:
v. preced. a.
אִישׁ) strong, severe, overwhelming.
sense.notes: . Num. R. s. 7 (ref. to Is. XVII, 1

sense.definition: א' לשון גבר anush has the meaning of strong; Lev. R. s. 18.

sense.notes: Targ. Esth. VII, 4 the adversary is (of) no value or gain בא' דמלכא against the King’s loss. [Levy Targ. Dict. reads אוזניקא expense(?), v. אוּזִינְקָא.]
Hithpa. הִתְאַנֵּחַ to sigh. Ber. 59 a, v. next w. Yalk. Ex. 391 מִתְאַנֵּחַ על כבודו וכ' is anxious for the honor of the Lord &c.

Targ. Lam. I, 4; 11.—Targ. Is. XXIV, 7; a. e. Contr. אִתַּנַּח. Targ. O. Ex. II, 23 late ed.— Ithpe. אִיתְּנַח, אִתְּ'. Ber. 58 b. Ib. 59 a אִתְּנוּחֵי מתנח Ms. M. (ed. אנחה מִתְאַנֵּחַ) he sighs.—Pesik. R. s. 18, end; Pesik. Haom. p. 72 a שרי מיתנח he began to sigh.
Ber. 58 b; a. e.
Targ. Y. Ex. XVI, 13; 14.
Nidd. 7 a אנ' (Ar. a. T’bul Yom IV, 2 נ'). Gitt. 62 a; Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VI, 7 אנחותא.
pl. of אֲנָא, אֲנִי.
בית א' rest for beams. Targ. I Kings VI, 4.
Targ. Lam. I, 22.

sense.definition: Beth Ant’bila, name of a Jerusalem family.
sense.notes: Y. Peah VIII, 21 a bot. Tosef. Peah IV, 11 נבלטא ed. Zuck., אנטיבלאי &c. (Var. גבטלא, גלבטא).
, v. אנטי'
hindeb, prob. fr. נדב to flow, curl, cmp. אַנְדִּיפֵי) endive. Y. Kil. I, 27 a top אנטוכין (corr. acc.). Pes. 39 a הינדבי (Rashi הִינְדִּיבִי, Ms. הנדבי).
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (v. next w.) Antiochian, native of Antiochia, resident of A.
sense.notes: Gitt. 44 b אנטו'; Tosef. Ab. Zar. III (IV), 18; Y. Gitt. IV, 46 a top אנטיו'.— Pl. ch. אַנְטוּכָאֵי. Targ. Y. Gen. X, 18 (ed. אנטכואי, אנטוכיא corr. acc.; h. text חֲמָתִי).

sense.definition: Antioch, surnamed Epidaphnes, the capital of Syria founded by Seleucus Nicator, situated on the Orontes.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Num. XIII, 21; a. e. (Hamath in Bible).—Keth. 67 a. Gitt. 44 b; a. fr.—Y. Shek. VI, 50 a bot. דפני של א' Daphne near Ant.; Lev. R. s. 19 כייא …

sense.definition: the country or district of Ant.
sense.notes: , Antiochene. Y. Dem. II, 22 d top; Y. Nidd. III, 48 a bot.; a. e.; v. חֹולַת, חוּלְתָּא a. חֲמַת.
, v. אַנְטוּבִּין
Y. Dem. V, 24 d bot.
, v. next w.

sense.definition: Antoninus, 1) a Roman emperor freq. mentioned as a friend of R. Judah Han-Nassi, and supposed to be Ant.

sense.notes: a Roman emperor freq. mentioned as a friend of R. Judah Han-Nassi, and supposed to be Ant. Alexander Severus (Graetz) or Ant. Marcus Aurelius (Rap. a. oth.). Ab. Zar. 10 a אסוירוס בר א' Severus son of A.; Ib. b A. son of Severus.—Y. Meg. I, 72 b bot. אית מילין וכ' there is one report that A. embraced the Jewish religion, another &c.—Y. Snh. X, 29 c אנטוני' a. אנטולי'; cmp. Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top.—Koh. R. to IX, 10 אנטלימוס וכ' (corr. acc.)
א' זעירא A. junior, grandson of the former. Ibid. to X, 5.—[
(?) a Roman general mentioned in conversation with R. Joh. b. Zaccai; v. אגניטוס.]
, v. אוֹנְטוֹס
, v. אנתוסאי
, v. אנדכתרי

sense.definition: (Ἀντίγονος) Antigonus, 1) A. of Sokho, disciple of Simon the Just.

sense.notes: A. of Sokho, disciple of Simon the Just. Aboth I, 3.—2) Bets. 34 a, a. fr. R. Elazar son of A.—Tem. 21 a ed. (Ar. אטיטס). [Y. Snh. I, 19 d, v. אגניטוס.]
Targ. Esth. III, 14 Mus. (ed. דיטגמא); Esth. R. to ibid. (explain. פתשגן ib.).
Gen. R. s. 67 הב לי א' Ar. (ed. אנטיגרפא, corr. פי …) give me an answer (to the emperor’s letter). Ib. הן א' where is the answer?

sense.definition: (ἀντίδικος) opponent in a suit, in gen. adversary.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 82.—Ib. s. 100 אנטירוקוס (corr. acc.); Pesik. Naḥa’mu p. 126 a; a. fr.— Pl. אַנְטִידִיקִין parties to a suit. Deut. R. s. 5 האנטיריקון (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: Antiochos (III) of Syria. Targ. II Esth. I, 2.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 23; a. e.
, v. אנטוכ'
, v. אַנְטְיוֹכוֹס

sense.definition: , corruptions; read אִימַטְיָא m. pl. (pl. of ἱμάτιον) blankets used at the bath which may also serve as cloaks (v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Pallium).
sense.notes: Y. Kil. IX, 32 a bot.; Y. M. Kat. III, 82 a (explain. the sort of בלנרי in question).
, read אַנְטַרְרּוֹס.

mutilat. incitega) a receptacle for vessels, a stand for hanging in kettles, tripods &c. Sabb. III, 4 (41 a); Gem. ib. one opin., בי כירי antichi (in the Mishnah) means a vessel suspended between fire places (heated bricks); another opin., בי דודי a metal vessel suspended within a caldron-like vessel, the vacant space beneath being filled with coals. Ib. (in evidence of the latter opin.) א' אע"פ שהיא גרופה וכ' Ms. M. (ed. אע''פ שגרופה וקטומה) an antichi, even when cleaned of coals &c. Y. Sabb. III, 6 a bot. Tosef. Bets. III, 20. Y. ib. I, 60 c bot. כהדא א' נפלת וכ' as in the case of an antichi which fell &c.—*M. Kat. 28 b (in a funeral dirge) גוד גרמא מככא ונמטי מיא לא' take the bone (pin) out of the jaw (the base in which the vessel is suspended) and let water be put into the antichi, i.e. body and soul are now separated, the latter being the vessel going back to the (divine) spring; cmp. Koh. XII, 6 sq.; [Ms. M. … מבבא … לאנטוכיא, v. Rabb. D. S a. l. note.]

sense.definition: (ἀντίχρησις) an agreement allowing the creditor the use of a pledged object (in place of interest on the loan).
sense.notes: Y. B. Mets. VI, end, 11 a הדא א' ריבית הוא antichresis is considered usury.
, v. אַנְטְלַיָּא
, v. אֲטִימְטוֹן
Y. M. Kat. III, 82 a, v. אנטיטיה
= אַנְטִיפִּיטָא.
, read אנטיפטריס.
, v. after next w.

sense.definition: Antipatris, a town north-north-west of Jerusalem, founded by Herod the Great and named after his father.
sense.notes: Gitt. VII, 7 (76 a) (the second ט freq. dropped). Y. B. Mets. VII, end, 11 c. Y. Taan. IV, 69 b top … פריס; a. fr. Tosef. Gitt. VII (V), 9 אנטיפרוס, פטרוס …, (corr. acc.)
Sabb. 90 a נתר א' Ms. M. (ed. אנפנטרין, Ar. אנטיפטרין); Nidd. 62 a אנטפטרית Antip. nitrum.
, v. אנטיפטריס
, v. אַנְדִּיפֵי

sense.definition: … m. (corrupt. of אַנְתּוּפָּטָא ἀνθυπατος) proconsul (residing in Cæsarea).
sense.notes: Y. Meg. III, 74 a; Y. Ber. V, 9 a top; Koh. R. to III, 6. [Ib. to XI, 1 אוטפיטא, אנטפיטי and var. corrupt. in var. ed.]
, v. אַנְטִיפַּטְרִיס
, v. אַנְטִיפִּיטָא

sense.definition: (Ἀντι-Καίσαρος) Pro-Cæsare, the highest dignitary next to the Emperor; in gen. vice-roy.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 53; s. 85, end (also אנטקיס').
, v. אֲפִיקֵירֹוס
, v. אַנְטִידִיקֹוס
m. pl., v. אַנְטַרְדֹּוס
, v. אִסְטַכְטֹון

sense.definition: (נטל) Antal, one fourth of a Log (liquid measure).
sense.notes: B. Bath. 58 b; v. נַטְלָא. V. אַנְטְלַיָּא.
Y. Snh. II, beg. 19 d וימנה לו א' (ed. incorr. ליה אנטלר) let him appoint a mandatary. Ib. וא' בשבועה can the mandatary take an oath for his client?

sense.definition: (of אנטל; from which Greek ἄντλος, ἄντλον &c. and our w. ἄντλεία, antlia) baling out bilge-water, pump (with wheels and buckets).
sense.notes: Ruth R. to II, 19 גלגל אנטי'; Lev. R. s. 34 אנטל' (ed. אנטילא, corr. acc.) the pumping wheel. Tosef. Makhsh. III, 4 מפני א' שלהן on account of their baling machine (besprinkling the wheat). Ib. Mikv. IV, 2 אנטיליא.
, v. אַנְטֹונִינֹוס
, v. אֶנְטְלִי
(ed. Kirchh. p. 22) perh. Antoniana, a cloak; v. אבטיגא.

sense.definition: Midr. Till. Ps. XV beg., perh.
sense.notes: מֹונִיטִין or מֹונִיטַיָּיא (monetæ) mints; cmp. אַלְתּוּסְבְּרָאֹות.
, v. אַנְטֹונִ'
, v. אַנְטִיפַּ'

sense.definition: (Ἀντάραδος) Antaradus, a Syrian town opposite the Isle of Aradus.
sense.notes: Y. Bets. III, 62 a top. Y. Sabb. I, 4 a bot. אנטייריס (corr. acc.).—Cmp. עַנְתּוּרְדַּיָּא.—Deriv. אַנְטְרִידָנָאֵי inhabitants of Ant. Targ. Y. II, Gen. X, 18.
Pesik. R. s. 24, p. 122 b ed. Friedm. מטיילין בא', v. אסלטין
, v. אַנְטַרְדֹּוס
Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a bot. משקע בא', v. באנטרין
, prob. corrupt. of אַנְטִיפַּטְרִיס q. v. Y. Gitt. IV, 46 a א' שרי if a slave escaped to A., he may be extradited; v. אֹונִי II.

sense.definition: (= b. h. ינה, sec. r. of און, cmp. אָנַן a. b. h. ענה); Pi. (אִנָּה) אִינָּה to press, wrong, oppress; to impose, overreach in dealing, v. אֹונָאָה.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 59 b המְאַנֶּה את הגר he who wounds a stranger’s (proselyte’s) feeling. Ib. 49 b תן לי מה שאִינִּיתָנִי return to me the amount with which thou hast overreached me. Ib. 50 a top מה שאניתני (Ms. R. 1 שנִתְאֹונַנְתִּי, v. infra). Ib. 51 a שאניתני (Ms. M. שאֲנַנְתָּנִי, fr. אָנַן; Mish. IV, 2 שאֹונִיתָנִי, v. אֹונָאָה, Ms. R. 1 שהֹונִיתָנִי, v. הֹונָאָה, Ms. R. 2 שאונתני, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
Ib. 49 b מי נ' which of them has been overreached? Ib. 50 b מי שנ' (Ms. M. מִתְאֹונֶה); a. fr. [Nithpol. of אנן, נִתְאֹונֵן, v. supra.] [In. Y. אֹונָה, v. אֹונָאָה.]
Succ. 53 a; a. v. fr.—[Ib. IV, 5 אני והו (Y. והוא), reverential transcription of אנא יהוה, to avoid the utterance of the Tetragrammaton.]— Pl. אָנוּ. Keth. I, 6; a. fr.
, v. אֹונְיָא

sense.definition: (v. אוּנְיָיקִי) an abbreviation of בית אונייקי, Bithynia, a district of Asia Minor.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 46 b דינר א' the Denars issued in Bithynia; v. אַנִּגְרָא for var. lect.
, v. אֱנִּיגָרֹון
pr. n. pl. v. אַנִּגְרָא; cmp. next w.

sense.definition: (= על ניגרא by the creek) shore; v. נִיגְרָא, נִגְרָא.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 107 b; a. e.
Pes. 112 b, a word in a charm formula against thirst (var. lect. Rabb. D. S. a. l.), prob. = next w.

sense.definition: (ἐλαιόγαρον, נ corrupt. for ל) a sauce of oil and garum (to which wine is sometimes added).
sense.notes: Ber. 35 b sq. א' מיא וכ' elaiogaron contains the juice of beets; oxygaron the sauce of all kinds of boiled vegetables. Yoma 76 a. Shebu. 23 a ודילמא ע"י א' perhaps if used as an admixture to elaiogarum? Tosef. Bets. II, 16 א' ואכסיגרון ועליהן וכ' (Y. Bets. II, end, 61 d אינגורין ובתוכן וכ', corr. acc.; cmp. Rashi to Shebu. l. c.). Tosef. Ter. IX, 10; 12; Shebi. VI, 3. Koh. R. to I, 18 אגרטין (corr. acc.).
, v. אֹונְיָא
, v. אַנְיָאקָא
Y. M. Kat. III, 83 c bot., read אניא, contr. of אהניא, v. הני
, v. אָנַן, אֲנַן.

sense.definition: (אָנַן) grief, retired mourning, esp. the status of the mourner between death and burial of a kinsman, contrad. to אֲבֵילָה, אֲבֵילוּת.
sense.notes: Lam. R. introd. (R. Abbahu 4) א' מבפנים ãninah is indoor (retired) grief. Y. Hor. III, 48 a top איזהו א' וכ' what is ãninah?—The time from death to &c. Y. Pes. VII, 35 a top אֲנִינַת לילה תורה observance of ãninah by night is biblical. Gen. R. s. 85 he is named Onan שהביא א' לעצמו because he brought mourning over his early death.
f. same. Kidd. 80 b; a. fr. in Babli.
Targ. Lam. II, 5; a. e.
, v. אֲנַנְקָא a. אֲנִיקָא.
, v. אָנֹוסָא
Targ. Is. I, 13; a. e.
Targ. Koh. V, 7; a. e.
Tosef. Ter. II, 12; Ḥall. II, 11; (also נסין a. ניסין; Y. Shebi. VI, 36 d ניסים; Gitt. 8 a נסין).

(v. נִיסְכָּא) made of cast metal, opp. ארוקתא of wrought or stretched metal. Sabb. 59 b דא' כ"ע וכ' (Rashi ed. דניסכא) as to those made of cast metal there is no difference of opinion. Ib. א' עיקר (prob. to be read מיקר, v. Ms. M.) what is made of cast metal is more precious (original).

sense.definition: Targ. II Esth. I, 2 read אֶפִּיפָנֵיס pr. n. m. ( Antiochus) Epiphanes, King of Syria.

sense.notes: Af. of נוּץ.

sense.definition: (אנץ, ענץ, sec. r. of אוץ, עוץ) [ tight bundle], only in pl. const. (עֲ) פשתן אֲנִיצֵי flax-stalks after they are soaked, beaten and baked.
sense.notes: B. Mets. II, 1 (21 a). Y. Succ. I, 52 b bot.; Bab. ib. 12 b (Ar., Ms. M., Tosef. ib. I, 6 עניצי); a. fr. V. אוּנִין.
, v. אַנְיָאקָא
Targ. Y. Gen. XXII, 20; a. e.— Pl. אֲנִיקֵי, אֲנִיקִין (often used as a singular). Targ. Lev. XXI, 10 (affliction by death in the family); a. e. Cmp. אֲנַנְקָא.
f. same. Targ. Ps. CII, 21.

sense.definition: to rub, polish, finish, esp. to glaze vessels, to line (with onyx).
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. I, 3 כלים … שאֲנָכָן באנך וכ' (or שאִנְּכָן Pi.) clean vessels which one lined with unclean glaze (onyx); v. אָנָךְ.

sense.definition: (cmp. חֲכָךְ) to make sore, to grieve.
sense.notes: Denom. אַךְ II.
B. Mets. 59 a all gates are sometimes closed except the gates (of prayer) of those wronged by men (v. אוֹנָאָה), for it says, (Amos VII,

sense.definition: “Behold the Lord stands on the wall of anakh and in his hand he holds anakh (oppression).
sense.notes: ” Ib. אונאה דכתיב ובידו א' the Lord hears the prayer of the wronged, for it says &c.; v. אוֹנָיָתָא.

sense.definition: prob. fr. a demonstr. אן, cmp.
sense.notes: הן, דּוּךְ &c., a. אֲנִי, אָנֹכִי) plummet, plumb-line. Lev. R. s. 33, beg. a. e. א' זה סנהדרי וכ' by the plummet (Amos VII, 7) the Great Sanedrin are meant whose number(7
corresponds with the numerical value of א̇נ̇ך̇.

sense.definition: ) Onyx Agate, a semipellucid stone of a fine flinty texture.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 8 b Ar. אנך (ed. אינך).

sense.definition: a variety of gypseous alabaster, onyx; a glaze.
sense.notes: Ib. 11 bומחפין … בא' Ar. (ed. באי') the streets are paved with &c. (for the procession). Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. I, 3, v. אָנַךְ. Lev. R. s. 33 nothing makes the kettle durable אלא אֲנָכָהּ וכ' but its glaze lining; so says the Lord אֲנָכְכֶם וכ' I am your lining (stay) in trials (incorr. in some ed. a. Ar. s. v. נך).

sense.definition: v. אֲנָךְ II; cmp. אִינָּךְ) I.
sense.notes: Pesik. R. s. 21, v. אָנוֹךְ. Sabb. 105 a א' נוטריקון anokhi may be interpreted as an acrostichon א̇נא נֹפשי כ̇תבית י̇הבית I myself have written, have given (the Law). Pesik. Baḥod. p. 109 b; v. אָנוֹךְ.— Pl. אֲנַחְנוּ, נַחְנוּ. Ber. 14 b; a. fr. V. אֲנִי, אָנוּ.
, v. next w.

Kel. XVI, 7 Ar. אנלגין (Var. in R. S. אנליגין, ed. אנגלין; corr. acc.). Y. Meg. III, 73 d bot. אנג', אינג' (corr. acc.). Tosef. Kel. B. Kam. II, 3 או לולגין פרוס' וכ' ed. Zuck. (Var. אלו לגין, ed. אולו לוגין read אנאלוגין; used as fem.) a reading desk spread out is clean, folded together is unclean (susceptible of levitical uncleanness).
, v. אֲלוּנְטִית I

sense.definition: , v. אָוֶן) to press, oppress, wrong, v. אָנָה.
sense.notes: —אוֹנָן one who feels grieved, mourner, esp. Onan, mourner before the burial of a kinsman, contrad. to אָבֵל; v. אֲנִינָה. M. Kat. 14 b מקדיב א' may officiate at sacrifices though being an Onan.— Pl. אוֹנָנִין. Snh. 47 b לא היו מתאבלין אלא א' they observed no mourning ceremonies but lived in silent and retired mourning.—Fem. אוֹנֶנֶת. Keth. 53 a.—Denom. אָנִין complaining, fastidious, feeble. Pl. אֲנִינֵי הדעת fastidious of taste, easily taking an aversion, delicate. Pes. 113 b. Cmp. אִיסְתְּנִיס.

sense.definition: to feel wronged, complain of being overreached, v. אָנָה.

sense.notes: Targ. Koh. VII, 4.—Denom. אָנִין; f. אֲנִינָא, with דעתא = h. אָנִין, v. preced. Ḥull. 112 a א' דעתיה he was fastidious, delicate. Ber. 24 b; B. Bath. 23 a א' דעתאי I am &c.
pl. of אֲנָא.
= אֲנָא אֲנָא, v. אֲנָא

Targ. Y. Gen. XXXVIII, 25 אננקִי my distress.— Pl. אֲנַנְקֵי troubles. Targ. II, Esth. V, 1. Targ. Y. II Gen. XXII, 14 (Y. I אֲנִיקֵי). Cant. R. beg. none tells א' דידיה (some ed. אונ') his troubles except after his release; Koh. R. to I, 12 אנוקי, read אֲנִיקֵי.—Targ. Y. II Gen. XXXVIII, 25 אֲנִינְקֵי Ar. the distressed (ed. עייקיא). Cmp. עוק a. deriv.

sense.definition: adv. (ἀνάγκῃ) perforce, of necessity (corresp. to בנוהג שבעולם).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 12 if a human being spreads a tent א' ע"י שהות וכ' it must in course of time become loose. Cmp. Y. Ber. I, 2 d top.

sense.definition: (= h. אֲנָקָה II, נְאָקָה) a full grown camel.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to CIV, 24 and the lion took pity on him (the dog), for she (the camel), (read דהיא) is a friend of the lion, וכלבא סעדא דא' and the dog is a friend of the camel; Yalk. ib. 862 אקנקיתא, אקניקתא, Zay. Raan. a. l. אַנְקִיתָא.

entry.language-reference: sec. r. of אוס, √או; cmp. אוץ, אנץ, חוס; as to meaning cmp. כוף, אנן &c.)

sense.definition: to bend, force; to do violence; to outrage &c. Ḥull.
sense.notes: 45 a א' בסימנים if one in cutting presses the windpipe and gullet out of their natural position. Ib. אָנְסָה עצמה if the animal strained its neck so as to dislocate the organs. Gitt. 44 b; Ḥull. 131 a הרי שאָנְסוּ וכ' if royal officers took forcible possession of (seized,) his barn. Keth. III, 4 האֹונֵס he who violates a woman. Part. pass. f. אֲנוּסָה an outraged woman. Y. Yeb. VI, 7 c; a. fr.—Masc. אָנוּס the victim of an accident, unavoidably prevented. Ned. 27 a א' רחמנא וכ' the Merciful (the Law) acquits from responsibility him who is the victim of an unavoidable accident; a. fr.
Num. R. s. 14 לאַנְּסָהּ to violate her.

sense.definition: to be forced, overcome, to meet with an accident.
sense.notes: Ber. 13 b נ' בשינה overcome by sleep. Ḥull. 31 a נֶאֶנְסָה וטבלה if she dipped in the water by an accident Ib. 45 a ובלבד שלא תֵּאָנֵס provided the animal is not forced so that its organs be dislocated. Keth. I, 10 נאנסה she was outraged; a. v. fr.
יֵינַס ch. same;

sense.definition: to take by force, snatch, rob.
sense.notes: . Targ. II Sam. XXIII, 21; a. fr.

Targ. I Sam. XII, 3; 4; a. fr.—Arakh. 16 a ואזלין ואנסין ליה and they (violent men) go and rob him (or force him to feed them, v. Rashi a. l.). Lev. R. s. 34 (אַנְסִינֹון) אַנְסִינָן אקימנן וכ' he forced them, made them managers of public charities.
Targ. Amos. IV, 2; a. fr.; v. אָנֹוסָא.

B. Bath. 57 b one must למַינַס נפשיה restrain himself (turn his eyes away forcibly). Ḥull. 133 a א' ליה עידניה time pressed him.—Part. pass. אָנִיס 1) wronged &c. Targ. Hos. V, 11; a. e.—2) unavoidably prevented, forced, v. preced. Naz. 23 a מינס א' he had no will of his own (being drunk). Ned. 27 b; a. fr.
Targ. Jer. VII, 6 (h. text ינה).

sense.definition: to be robbed; to be fined, (of official extortion); &c. Targ. Is. XXI, 2.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 34 דאנון מארסוון (read דאתון מִתְאַנְּסוּן or דאינון מאנסכון; Yalk. Lev. 665 דאתון מזדמיין, v. זמי) that you will lose through extortion &c.

sense.definition: to meet with an accident, be unavoidably prevented.
sense.notes: Ned. 27 a איתניס ולא אתא he met with an accident and did not come in time. Ib. והא מֵינַס איתניס was he not unavoidably prevented (since he died during the appointed time)? Keth. 16 b אִתְּנוּסֵי הוא דאתניסו they were prevented from forming the bridal procession [prob. alluding to government interference; Rashi: through excessive drinking]. [איתניס to grow ill, v. אִיתְנִיס a. נְסַס.]

sense.definition: (preced. ws.) one who acts violently, a violent man.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 45 a סתם נכרי א' הוא as a rule the gentile is violent (lawless). Y. Kidd. I, 60 c top.— Pl. אַנָּסִין אַנָּסִים. Ḥull. 94 b מפני הא' on account of the lawless (among the gentiles).—Esp. (law) Annas, one who is in possession of property bought from one who obtained it by force or consfiscation, owner of reclaimable property. Kil. VII, 6 (5) הא' שזרע וכ' if an Annas put seeds into a vineyard (creating Kilayim), and it is reclaimed. Ib. from what time and onward נקרא א' is one called an Annas (who may consider himself in undisturbed possession)? Answ. משישקע (v. Y. ib. 31 a) from the time the name of the original owner is sunk (when the property is no longer named after him).— Pl. as above. Y. Succ. IV, beg. 54 b, v. הֶפְקֵר.
Targ. Y. II Gen. X, 2, v. אוסיא
read אָכְסִיגָרֹון.
read אַכְסְיֹומָא.

language-reference.xref: sec. r. of אוף; v. אפף)

sense.definition: to swell, blow, whence, to be angry.
sense.notes: —Pi. אִנֵּף to quarrel. Hull. 63 a why is it called Anafah? שמְאַנֶּפֶת עם וכ' (not שמנאפת, v. Rashi a. l.) because it quarrels with its kindred.

sense.definition: face, front; freq. in pl. אַנְפֵּי.
sense.notes: . Targ. Ps. LXXXIV, 10; a. fr.

sense.definition: with prep. ב, in sight of, before.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 86 a לבבא באנפיה … he locked the door before him.— Pl. בְּאַנְפֵּי (Targ. also על א'). Targ. Y. Gen. XXIII, 10; a. e.—Ḥull. 121 a בא' נפשיח (= h. בפני עצמו) for itself, singly. Targ. Y. Deut. I, 6; a. e.—B. Mets. 22 b.—Keth. 7 b באנפייהו in their presence; a. fr.
Targ. Y. II Lev. VII, 30 (20) (some ed. אַנְפֹּוי).
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. VI, 5 ed. Zuck., read אנפיליא.
read אנפקינון.

Pl. אַנְפֹּורָאֹות. Pesik. Shek. p. 18 b עשה שתי א' made out two military returns (census); Num. R. s. 2 אנפריאות; Pesik. R. s. 11 אפונראות (corr. acc.). [Not to be confounded with אַנְפָּרִיֹּות, pl. of אַנְפָּרוּת.]

sense.definition: (ἐμπορία) journey for business, traffic, trade; also merchandise.
sense.notes: כלי א' merchant’s implements (straps, poles &c. for carrying goods). B. Mets. II, 2 כלי א' אינו וכ' merchant’s implements (if found) need not be publicly announced (for return to the owner). Ib. 23 b sq.; Y. B. Mets. II, beg. 8 b; Tosef. ib. 1 (definit. of our w.). Midr. Till. to Ps. CXVIII, 20 התקין א' שלו arranged his journey with the caravan. [Also אַנְכֹּורְיָה.]
read אַפַּנְטֵי.
Tosef. Ḥull. III (IV), 27, Var. נפיא, v. אפיין

sense.definition: (ἐπίλογος, epilogus) concluding speech, argument, inference; peroration.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to X, 16 התחיל א' וכ' (Solomon) in his wisdom began a concluding argument; (Midr. Till. to Ps. LXXII פיו נובע!)
, corr. as preced.
, v. אַפִּילְיֹון II
, v. אִמְפִּילְיָא
, v. אָנְפַּקִינֹון
, v. אַנְבַּג
, v. נַפְקוּת
, corr. as next w.

sense.definition: (ὀμφάκινον, sub. ἔλαιον) oil made of unripe olives.
sense.notes: Targ. Esth. II, 12 אַנְפֵּ'.—Pes. 43 a אנפיקנין (Ms. M. אנפיקנון). Men. VIII, 3; a. e.—Gen. R. s. 98 טן … (corr. acc.). Cant. R. to IV, 8 איפק' (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: (פרר or נפר √פר) a break, division, whence
the purchase of an odd object, of one of a pair.
sense.notes: Sabb. 80 b (ref. to אַנְדִּיפָא q. v.) וכי אדם עושה מעותיו א' will a man buy a half of a thing (as a cosmetic for one temple)?

sense.definition: partial payments, an agreement (invalid according to Jewish law) of term payments with the condition of forfeiture on missing one term (v. אַסְמַכְתָּא), esp. such an agreement forced upon a Jew by a gentile ( Roman) individual or authority.
sense.notes: Gitt. 44 a (v. אָנַס) אם בא' if his crop was seized in consequence of an anparuth, he is exempt from paying the tithes (of his produces, since he is the loser, whereas if distrained for a real debt, he enjoys the legal benefit of being released of a debt, and therefore must pay the tithes, as if he had sold the crop). Y. Keth. X, end, 34 a בארנונה וכ' with reference to annona, capitation tax and forfeiture. Gitt. 58 b הבא מחמת חוב ומחמת א' וכ' if a gentile (Roman) obtained possession of a Jew’s property in consequence of seizure for a debt or of forfeiture and subsequently sold it to a Jew, the Sicarion law finds no application (and the property must, without any indemnity, be restored to its original owner; v. סִיקְרִיקֹון); וא' עצמה וכ' and the property seized for forfeiture must have been in the possession of the gentile for twelve months (during which the Jew might have had a chance to reclaim it as illegally seized; v., however, the objection, and subsequent emendation of סיקריקין for א', ibid.). Ib. אין א' בבבל in Babylon (under the Persian government) there is no anparuth, (which is interpreted) אין דין א' וכ' the laws concerning the purchase by a Jew of property which a gentile had seized for forfeiture find no application in the well regulated Persian state because the owner might have gone to court, if he felt himself aggrieved. Tosef. Gitt. V (III), 2.— Pl. אַנְפָּרִיֹּות. Y’lamd. Sh’laḥ. (quot. in Ar.) אני נוטל מהן א' וכ' I (the Lord) take from them promises to pay in instalments (promises of amending their ways, repentance) and give them extension. Tanḥ. ib., end, a citizen was paying annonæ וכותב א' and signing agreements of forfeiture; (Num. R. s. 17 אפכיות, v. אַפּוּכִי). [Ibid. s. 2 אנפריאות, v. אַנְפֹּורָא pl.]

sense.definition: (sec. r. of אוּץ, v. אָנִיץ) to squeeze in, fasten.
sense.notes: Targ. Koh. XII, 11 דאנצין, read דאֲנִיצִין which are fastened (h. text נטועים; gloss דאציתין, clerical error for דאניצין or דנציבין, embodied in the text of some ed.). Targ. I Sam. XIII, 21, Ar., v. נְצַב.
Y. Bicc. I, 63 d bot. מאונקות, v. אָבַק

sense.definition: (sec. r. of אוק, v. חנק), Pa. אַנֵּק to press, choke.
sense.notes: Part. pass. מְאַנַּק choked, grieved. Targ. Ezek. IX, 4. Cmp. דְּנַק. V. אֲנִיקָא, אֲנַנְקָא &c.
B. Mets. 46 b, v. אַנְיָאקָא

sense.definition:
(b, h.;
אנק) a species of lizzard.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Balak. 9; Num. R. s. 20.
, v. אִינְק'

sense.definition: (a contr. of אנק קטמין, or לולי קטמין, v. אונקלי a. its bibl.
sense.notes: equivalent לוּלַי) loop or hook for stumped limbs, a sort of artificial arm (or leg; v. infra). Sabb. VI, 8 א' טהורין Mishn. a. Y.
