sense.notes: Targ. Deut. III, 14, O. אפקי'; Y. II קריית אפיק' (Y. I corrupt קורוי ואנטיקירוס). Targ. Josh. XII, 5; XIII, 11; 13.
, v. אוֹפִיקְיָלִין
, v. אַפְקָרוּתָא
, v. אַפְקַרְסִין
, v. אֲפִיקֵירוֹס
, v. אַפְקַרְסוּת
; v. אַפְקְרָסִי.—אַפִּיקַרְסִין, v. אַפְקַר'.
, v. אפורטן
, v. אַפִּרְיוֹן
Y. Shek. V, 49 c bot., read אפַּרְסְמוֹן.
, v. אפסתקי

Kil. II, 3 say not I will plant ואח"כ אוֹפַךְ and then turn the soil over (destroy the previous seed) אלא אוֹפֵךְ Ar. (ed. הוֹפֵךְ) but one must first uproot &c. (cmp. אוכל fr. אָכַל). Ter. IX, 1; Tosef. Kil. I, 16 יוֹפַךְ he shall &c. Ib. end לייפך ed. Zuck. (Var. לוֹפַךְ) to uproot.

sense.definition: to turn (act. a. neut.) also to turn around, to flee; to make turn around, to beat.
sense.notes: Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 9. Targ. I Chron. VIII, 13; a. fr.—Y. Kil. IX, 32 c top אפיך אפיך turn around, turn around. Men. 25 b, a. fr. איפוך reverse it, or, I reverse it. Ib. ומי מצית אפכת לה how can you reverse it? Gitt. 69 b ונַפְּכֵיה let him reverse it; a. fr.—(With שבועה) to reverse the oath, shift the oath over to the opponent. Shebu. 41 a in a case where the Biblical law prescribes an oath לא מַפְכִינָן we allow it not to be shifted over to the claimant; a. fr.—Sabb. 31 a אפיך ליה he reversed it, i.e. recited the alphabet to him in inverted order. Yeb. 63 a א' לה he said to her just the reverse. Gitt. 67 b מֵיפַךְ אפכי they will do the reverse; a. fr.
Taan. 25 a דאפכיה לעלמא מרישא (Ms. M. דאחרב) that I should destroy the world.

sense.definition: (cmp. אִיכְפַּת) to have to do with, care for, mind.
sense.notes: Y. Bets. I, 60 a bot.; Y. Shebi. IX, 38 c top; Y. Erub. III, 21 b bot. (read:) מה אפך לן פתילה גבי וכ' what does the law about wicks concern us when speaking of the egg, i.e. what relation is there between the two? Y. Ter. VIII, 46 a top מה אפך לן מִצְוֹת וכ' what relation is there between religious laws and sanitary precautions concerning snake-bitten fruit? Ib. מה אפכיי וכ' (corr. acc.).
Ab. Zar. 31 b כ"ע אפכי all the people are about, on the road.

sense.definition: to pay in return, to retaliate, v. הֲפַךְ a. אַפּוּכִי.

sense.notes: Bets. 10 b איתפוכי אתפך (old ed. correctly אתְּפוּךְ, mod. ed. אתהפוכי אתהפוך, Ms. M. והפוכי) they changed places. Deriv. אַפּוּכִי, אִיפְּכָא.
, v. preced.
, v. אַפּוּכִי

sense.definition: , only in Hif. הֶאֱפִיל (denom. of אָפֵל q. v.) to make dark, obscure.
sense.notes: Sabb. 86 a bot. מַאֲפִיל בטליתו he makes dark by spreading his cloak (cover) over himself. Y. B. Bath. III, 13 c top עומד ומא' the tree stands there and takes the light away.—2) to be late in ripening, giving birth, &c.; to have late crops. Y. Shebi. V, beg. 35 d שנים מַאֲפִילֹות years slow in ripening, when the crop is delayed. Gen. R. s. 99 שהיא מַאֲפֶלֶת which has late crops.
Pa. אַפֵּיל as foreg. Hif. 1). B. Bath. 7 a קא מאפלת עלי thou makest my building dark, obstructest my light.

sense.definition: (√אף, v. אפף; cmp. אבל, הבל) [thick vapory,]

sense.notes: Sabb. 86 a, a. fr. בית א' a dark (windowless) house.—אֲפֵילָה f. dark place. Y. Naz. IX, 57 d top; Pes. 81 b בא', במים in water or in a dark place (cave).— Pl. fem. אֲפֵילוֹת. Lev. R. s. 9 מבואות א' dark alleys; a. fr.
Denom. האפיל, v. אָפַל.

sense.definition: Keren Afel (Dark-Horn), name of a height.
sense.notes: Taan. 22 b עד שישב וכ' Ms. M. (ed. שיעמוד) until one sits on Ker. Afel and can bathe his feet in water. Ib. חזייא לי קרן א' … ed. (Ms. ההיא דוכתא) I have seen (that place) K. A.
, v. אֲפֵילָא
, v. אַפַּלְיוֹן
Syr. = אִמְפְּרָטוֹר q. v.

sense.definition: (pallium, παλλίον) pallium, a sheet worn as a cloak and used for bed-cover.
sense.notes: Sabb. 120 a Ar. a. Rashi (ed. אפיליות, Ms. M. פיליון, corr. acc.). Y. ib. XVI, 15 d top פיליון (corr. acc.). Nidd. VIII, 1 וכן בפליום Mish. (Bab. ed. פוליוס, corr. acc., Var. פליון). Treat. S’mahoth XII מאפלוני, read מֵאַפַּלְיוֹנִי.
, v. אַפִּיקִילְטָא
, v. אַפַּרְסְמוֹן

sense.definition: (= פַּמְיָיס q. v.) Paneas in Northern Galilee (Cæsarea).
sense.notes: Y. Kil. IX, 32 c bot. ימא דא' the lake of P.—Y. Ḥall. IV, end, 60 b (?).
= פַּנְתֵּירִין.

—לא' (= εἰς ἀπαντήν, h. לקראת) to meet, to receive. Tanḥ. Emor 22 לא' של טלך to salute the king. Pesik. R. Ten Command. 1 לא' של מלך וכ' (some ed. לאנפטי, corr. acc.) to salute his father the king. Cant. R. to I, 12 לאפנתי (corr. acc.). Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 b bot. לפגטי; Midr. Sam. ch. VII לאפרכי דידיה (corr. acc., or Var. לאפי). [Yalk. Esth. 1058 לאנפטי some ed., read: אַנְבְּטֵי.]
Pesik. R. s. 31 translating kadd’ma panav (Ps. XVII, 13). [Correct: אין לנו זוג להזדווג לה אלא אתה קומה ד' קדמה פניו א' לה; v. Midr. Till. to Ps. l. c.]

sense.definition: (transposition of קַפְרִיסִין, with נ inserted) caper-fruit.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. III, 5 d top א' Ar. (ed. פ'). Ib. I, 3 c bot. פנקריסים (read … ין); Y. Ab. Zar. II, 41 d פ'. [In parallel places קַפְרִיסִין q. v.]

sense.definition: (פנה, v. פנים; cmp. אַפּוּתָא fr. אַף) upper, ( front), a kind of legging connected with a shoe or sole over which straps are drawn for fastening; corresp. to h. מַנְעַל.
sense.notes: Taan. 12 b מסיימי א' (Ms. M. פַּנְתָּאֵי pl.) having put on appantas (on a public fast-day). Yeb. 102 a הוה ליה א' מֵעַל וכ' (ed. פ'; v. Ar. ed. Koh. s. v.) the panta is one ‘from on’ (referring to Deut. XXV, 9 ‘and she shall strip his shoe from on his foot’), and the thong a ‘from on’ of a ‘from on’, i.e. panta and thong are two coverings. Ber. 43 b ולא אמרו אלא בא' (ed. בפ') this applies only to the panta (upper).
, v. אַפַּנְטֵי
—Dual אַפְסַיִים. Yoma 77 b. Cmp. אוּפְסַיִם.
—[As a noun: there is an end of …] B. Bath. 111 a אפס (דברי) זכריה (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) (the words of) Zachariah (to whom you refer as an authority) are (is) gone, i.e. they are no authority.

sense.definition: homiletically used as though a Greek word (ἄφες) let go, leave alone.
sense.notes: Pesik. Vattomer p. 130 a (ref. to heäfes, Ps. LXXVII, 9) לשון יוני הוא כמד"א אָפֵיס it is a Greek word, as if you were to say, afes (let alone); Lam. R. to I, 2 וכמד"א אמר אפס (strike out ואמר, a. read אפיס); Ex. R. s. 45 לשון יוני אפס הניח in Greek aphes means, (he) let go; Yalk. Ps. 816.—[Gen. R. s. 40 (ref. to efes Jud. IV, 9); omitted in Yalk. Gen. 67,—an interpolation from passages quoted above.]
Sabb. 59 b; a. fr.
dialect. for אָפַץ q. v.
, read:
Tanḥ. Tsav 1 כבר שלחתי אפסונין וכ' (some ed. גין …) I have already sent the marketing to thy house (bribing the market commissioner); Yalk. Lev. 479 אופסנון; Mic. 555 אופסיטן (corr. acc.).

, Treat. Der. Er. VIII, beg. היו הולכין את א' וכ' (v. Var. lect. ibid.) a corrupt and defective passage, to be restored from Lam. R. to IV, 2 a. Tosef. Ber. IV, 8, our w. being a remnant of מטפחת. V. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v. I, 224.
Erub. 100 b, supposed to be pr. n. pl. (Var. in Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 60 אשפיא, אישפיטא, אשפיפיא). V. Neub. Géogr. p. 348.

sense.definition: (redupl. of פס, v. פסס) rake or pitchfork.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. VII, 10 a bot. if one works on flax stalks (on a Sabbath) בא' חייב וכ' with a rake (spreading them apart), he is guilty of an act resembling winnowing.

sense.definition: (πιστάκια, τὰ) the fruits of the pistachio-tree.
sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, beg. 22 b; Y. Maasr. I, 48 d bot. איפ'; cmp. אִלְצָרִין.

sense.definition: , prob. denomin. of אֶפֶס (אפס דמים I Sam. XVII,

sense.notes: Y. Dem. II, 22 c bot. תמרין א' Ephes dates.

sense.definition: (obsianus, ὀψιανός) obsidian, a stone used as glass.
sense.notes: Tanḥ. Naso 23. Yalk. Ps. 842 אפוטיין (read אוֹפְסְיָין). [Midr. Till. to Ps. XCI; Num. R. s. 12 קליפין.] Cmp. אָפְזְיָינֵי. V. אמפומיות.
Ab. Zar. 30 a מר א' the bitter wine is that of absynth (absinthites); v. פסינטון.
, v. אַפְסְקִימָא
, v. אַפְסָרָא

sense.definition: (ὀψώνιον, cmp. אָפְסוֹנִין) provision, esp. supply and pay for an army.
sense.notes: Snh. 18 b מלך משום א' the king (is excluded from the court deciding on the intercalation of a thirteenth month) on account of the soldiers’ pay (it being to his interest to create an embolistic year). Ib. II, 4 (21 b) (Mish. a. Gem. ed. אספ' throughout the whole page, Ms. M. אפס') כדי ליתן א' as much as is required for the stipends he has to pay. Y. Snh. II, 20 c top אפסנייא.— Pl. אָפְסַנְיוֹת (doubtful, prob. אַכְסַנְיוּת). Cant. R. to I, 2 שהיה מהלך א' (read מחלק, ed. אפסיניות, אפיסניות). Sifré Deut. 328; Yalk. ib. 946 אָפְסַנְיָאוֹת.

sense.definition: (a corruption of σκίφινος) ( rope) twisted of palm-leaves, (v. Löw Pfl. p. 118).
sense.notes: Erub. 58 a ed. a. Ms. (Ar. אפקימא).

sense.definition: (Pers. afsâr, Fl. to Levy Targ. Dict. I, 418 b; ψάλλιον) bit.
sense.notes: Sabb. V, 1; a. e.

Targ. Y. Num. XIX, 2.—Trnsf. the means of taking possession, as possession is taken of the horse by seizing it by the bit. Kidd. 27 a שטר דא' דארעא וכ' the deed is valueless in itself as it is merely the bit of landed property. B. Bath. 53 b מצר א' דארעא the balk is &c. (taking possession of which is equal to taking possession of the fields to which it belongs).

sense.definition: (supposed to be an adapt. of ὀψοθήκη) wallet.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 70 when Laban could not see אפי' אפסתקיתיה (יתי …, Yalk. Gen. 124 אפסתיק' without אפי', Ar. omits אפי', Lonz. אפיסטוקתיא, Rashi אפסט' without אפי') even his (Jacob’s) wallet. [Prob. to be read חמי אַפּוֹתִּיקִי דידיה … or אַפוֹתִּיקַיָּתֵיה, cmp. Targ. Y. Gen. XXIV, 10.]

sense.definition: (contr. אָפָא; corresp. to h. צָבוּעַ; אפע to color, cmp. אפה) [the checkered,] hyena or leopard.
sense.notes: Pl. אַפְעַיָּא. Targ. I Sam. XIII, 18 (h. text צְבֹעִים).

sense.definition: , v. אוּפְיָא; cmp., however foreg. w.) [the foaming,] viper, adder.
sense.notes: Bekh. 8 a. Gen. R. s. 20.

sense.definition: to swell, to bend; to press, to surround, to heat, to darken, (v. אפי, אנף, אפל, אפץ &c.).
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII, 5, v. next w.—Denomin.

sense.definition: m. (or אֲפָפִין m. pl.) thick web.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XVIII, 5 (explain. ãfafuni ib.) when a woman weaves with two double threads הן נקראין א' they are called ãfafon (ãfafin); so did David say אפפוני וכ' troubles wove around me and came over me doubled.

sense.definition: (√אף, v. אפף; cmp. חפץ) to press, squeeze, contract.
sense.notes: —Part. pass. אָפוּץ. Ohol. IX, 3 a gap which was filled with straw או אֲפוּצָה or was made narrower by squeezing the parts together (e.g. pressing the lid down). Tosef. ib. X, 6 אֲפוּסָה a narrowing of the gap by pressing. Y. Sabb. III, 6 c באפוצה when the wick is compressed in the candlestick. Ib. V, beg. 7 b באֲפוּצִים when the vessels are closely packed. Y. Pes. I, 27 c top אֲפוּצוֹת.

sense.definition: , esp. to use אַפְצָא q. v., to dress or prepare with gall-nut juice.
sense.notes: —Part. pass. אָפִיץ, עָפִיץ. Meg. 19 a top ולא א' Ms. M. (ed. ע') a skin not moistened with gall-nut. Gitt. 19 a הא דאֲפִיצָן Rashi (ed. אפיץ) in the one case it means when the parchment has been dressed &c. Ib. 11 a; 19 b.—Ib. 22 a; Sabb. 79 a ע'.
Gitt. 19 a; Sabb. 104 b (מי) א' gall-nut juice.— Pl. אַפְצֵי, עַפְצֵי. Shebu. 41 b sq. Ms Fl. א', ed. ע'.—V. עֶפֶץ.

sense.definition: (Af. of נפק q. v.) to bring out, take away.
sense.notes: —לְאַפּוּקֵי to the exclusion of. Ned. 41 a; a. fr. = למעוטי, להוציא, v. מעט, יצא.
, v. אַפִּיקוֹרִין

sense.definition: (אפק, v. אָפִיק) that which branches off the trunk,

sense.notes: Targ. Y. Lev. VII, 30(20). Targ. I Sam. IV, 18 Ar. (Var. אפרק', פרק', פקותא).

sense.definition: א' דדיקלא that portion of the palm-tree where the ramification starts (Oth. opin. the ramification, upper portion).
sense.notes: Succ. 13 a. Nidd. 24 a אַפְקְתָא וכ'.
, v. אַפְסְקִימָא
, v. אַפִּיקִילְטָא
, v. אוֹפִיקְיָלִין
, read אִסְטַקְטוֹן.
דמלכא א' a special royal dispensation (with reference to the suspensions of rights connected with the Sabbath and Yobel years). B. Mets. 106 a; 109 a.—Ib. 39 a

sense.definition: (פקר; v. אַפִּיקוֹרוֹס) making free, irreverence, contempt of the Law and its teachers.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 16 a לאפיק' לאלתר for contempt of the Law excommunication is pronounced forth with (without warning). Snh. 100 a מי מיחזי כי אפק' Ms. M. (ed. incorr. נמי מיחזי כו') does that look like showing irreverence (to one’s teacher)? Erub. 63 a same (with מתחזי for מיחזי). [Snh. l. c. second time כה"ג מיחזי א', corr. as above.]
, v. אַפְקַרְסִין
, Treat. Der. Er. X, Ar., read … סוּתוֹ; v. אַפְקַרְסִין
f. denom. of אַפְקַרְסִין q. v.
f. (v. אפיקורוס) = אַפְקָרוּתָא. Targ. Y. Deut. I, 12.

sense.definition: (v. preced.) of an irreverent, rebellious disposition.
sense.notes: Y. Snh. X, 27 d bot.

sense.definition: f. pl. (also used as sing. a. m.) (פקר, with format.
sense.notes: ס; v. אפיקורוס; cmp. אַבְרְקִין, פַּקְרְסִין, סַבְרִיקִין, סְפַרְקִין, a. אוּנְקְלַי II) undress, ( negligee), whence underwear, the garment next to the skin, shirt, bathing or night gown, sheet. Y. Ber. II, 4 c top אפיק' היה וכ' he had an undergarment on beneath; cmp. Pesik. R. s. 22.—Pesik. Shek. p. 15 b sq. אפיקריסין (sing. a. pl.); Lev. R. s. 24; (Ib. s. 2 פרקסין, פקרסין). Y. Pes. VIII, 36 b top המעביר בא' he who carries a skeleton wrapped in sheets; Y. M. Kat. I, 80 d top.—Ib. III, end, 83 d אין א' מעכבת (Bab. ib. 22 b אַפִּיקַרְסוּתוֹ) his underwear (shirt) forms no check (but must likewise be rent; diff. in Rashi a. l.). Treat. S’maḥoth XII אפיקריסין (Tur Yor. Deah 203 אפרסקא). [Pesik. R. l. c. אפיקריתים, אפיקרייתם corr. acc.]—Deriv. אַפְקַרְסוּת, אַפִּי' &c., underwear. Ber. 23 b one may wrap up &c. &c. באפקרסותו Ar. (Ms. M. באפקרי', ed. אפרק') in his sheet. Nidd. 48 b נישוף בא' is rubbed against their underwear (corset &c.). Ḥag. 26 a וֹ לתוכו—ואפי' נפל א Ms. M. (read נפלה, ed. נפל omitted) even if his underwear fell into it, (the vessel remains clean). Mikv. X, 4 הקשר של אפרקסותו שבכתף Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. שבפרקסים) the knot of one’s bathing sheet which is on the shoulder.

sense.definition: (Ms. M.) pr. n. m. Afkashion, Afkashian.
sense.notes: Yoma 28 b (Var. אפקישן).
, v. אַפְקוֹתָא

sense.definition: , Y. Bicc. II, beg. 64 c bot. א' חמשים, א' שתין—.
sense.notes: The entire passage is corrupt, and allows no inference that אפר means (= עבר) to pass, be past. The text possibly read: אפי', אפי' (בן) חמשים ועשה דבר שהוא בהיכרת (בן) ששים ועשה דבר שהוא בעון מיתה מת בהיכרת כהא דתני ר' חנינ' וכ'. [אבל רב חדי a. אבל חדי ibid. (read: אבל רבתי) is a gloss referr. to S’maḥoth ch. III.]

Ohol. II, 2 א' שרופים ashes of persons burnt to death (by accident). B. Bath. 60 b; Taan. II, 1 א' מקלה calcined ashes (symbol of mourning, supplication &c.). Y. ib. II, 65 a אֶפְרוֹ של יצחק the ashes of (the ram substituted for) Isaac. Gen. R. s. 49. Lev. R. s. 36; a. fr.

sense.definition: (√פר, cmp. Ges. H. Dict. s. v. פרא) pasture-ground (outside of the town), in gen. meadow.
sense.notes: Bets. V, 7. Pes. 8 b; a. fr.
Targ. Y. II Ex. II, 3; 5 (Var. אפרה; Targ. O. יערא). [Y. Sabb. I, 3 b חד אפר, v. חוֹחָא.]

ch. = h. אֵפֶר. Targ. I Chr. XXI, 15 א' דעקדת' וכ' the ashes of Isaac’s offering, v. אֵפֶר.—Y. Taan. II, 67 a a foolish son א' בעיני וכ' is ashes in the eyes of his mother (תוגת by permutation אפרא; v. א"ת).

sense.definition: (ἀπραγία, ἀπραξία) inactivity, cessation of labor, holiday.
sense.notes: Pesik. Sh’mini, p. 195 a (v. Buber note 66 to p. 193 a) if both of us open (sales) at the same time הרי אנו עושין אפרגיא במדינה (Ar. Var. אפרגיזא, אפרגינה, read אפרגזיא) we shall create a cessation of labor in the district (as all the laboring people will run to the market town on one and the same day; Yalk. Num. 782 זול from misunderstanding); Cant. R. to VII, 2 אפרגייס (read אפרגייא or אפרגסייא). Pesik. R. s. 41 R. Yonathan … had goods with him והייתה אפרגיס (corr. acc.) and there was inactivity and dull business in consequence thereof [for which Yalk. Ps. 758 ולא היה יכול למוכרה—prob. to be read אַפְּרַטוֹס ἄπρατος unsaleable].
, v. preced.
Mekh. Yithro 6 מא', read, as Yalk. a. l., מאה פ', v. פַּרְגוֹל
, v. אפדכסוס
, v. פרהנג, פַּרְהַנְגַּרְיָא.

Ab. Zar. III, 4 מרחץ של א' a bath where A. has a statue. Ib. we do not say, the bath has been built נוי לא' וכ' as an ornament of A., but we say, A. is an ornamental attachment to the bath. Y. Shebi. VIII, end 38 b מזלפין להדא א' squirting water (as a libation) to A.
, read:

sense.definition: , (אִיפַּרְוָון) אִפְּרוֹרְוָן f. pl. (v. פַּרְוָר, פַּרְבָּר, פַּרְוָורָא, פַּרְוִילָא) those appointed over the outworks of a fortress, runners.
sense.notes: Targ. Ezek. IV, 2; XXI, 27 (h. כָּרִים).
Bets. 6 b; Tosef. ib. I, 1; a. fr.—Gen. R. s. 37 אתמול א' וכ' yesterday a chicken, to-day an egg (lost prestige).
— Pl. אֶפְרֹוחִין Targ. Deut. XXII, 6 (Var. אִפְרָחין); a. e.—אֶפְרוֹחיָּיא. Y. Ber. II, 5 a
, v. איפרו'
, read אִיפּרְכוֹס, v. אִיפַּרְכָא
Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. IV, 6 sq. V. פְּרוֹמְבְּיָא.
, read אפופסיס.
, v. אַרְזַפְתָּא
Y. Sot. III, 18 c bot., v. פְּרַח
, v. אֶפְרוֹחָא
, read with Mus.:
Y. Keth. II, 26 d; (Y. Gitt. III, 45 a top איסטרטיות camps).

entry.language-reference: אַפִּרְ'; = על פריון, פּוּר, פָּרַר; cmp. אפיפיירות, פיפיורא, פּוּרְיָא &c.)

sense.definition: [ on a frame,] frame and hangings of a palanquin, litter of parade, esp. for a bride in the wedding procession.
sense.notes: Sot. IX, 14 (49 a); Tosef. ib. XV, 9.—Sot. 12 a הושיבה בא' (Pesik. R. s. 43 בפוריא), a. e. he placed her in the litter, arranged a wedding procession for her. Num. R. s. 20, end, לישב בא' to take her seat in the litter (for the wedding procession); a. e.
B. Bath. 6 a
, v. next w.

m. ch. = h. אַפִּרְיוֹן. B. Mets. end א' נמטייה לר' שמעון ed. (Ar. הבו ליה אפרייא לר"ל, Var. אִיפּוּרְיָיא, איפרייא; Ms. M. אפרין. Ms. H. אפריון, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) let a palanquin be put up for R. Sh., i.e. he deserves a triumphal procession. Cmp. פִּיפְיוֹרָא.

sense.definition: son of Joseph, progenitor of the tribe of Ephraim.
sense.notes: . Gen. R. s. 98; a. fr.

sense.definition: name of the expected Messiah, also called the Messiah, son of Joseph, in contradist.
sense.notes: , in contradist. to the Messiah of the tribe of Judah. Pesik. R. s. 36; 37.
a disciple of R. Meïr. B. Mets. 87 a; Gen. R. s. 85 א' מקשאה E. the disputant.
*E. the Scribe, a disciple of Resh Lakish. B. Mets. end (Ms. M. א' מקשאה, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).
, v. אפִּרְיָין

sense.definition: (Africa, Ἀφρική) Africa, esp. Northern A., the Africa Propria or Vera of the Romans.
sense.notes: Y. Shebi. III, 36 c bot. the Girgashite הלך לו לא' emigrated to Africa (Carthage). Ib. ‘a land like your own’ (II Kings XVIII, 32) זו א' that means A.; Lev. R. s. 17; Deut. R. s. 5.—Snh. 91 a אפריקיא (corr. acc.). Tam. 32 a sq. מדינת א'; (Lev. R. s. 27; Pesik. Shor p. 74 a קרטיגנא, v. חֹשֶׁךְ). Lam. R. to I, 5. דוכוס דאפריקא Duke (military governor) of A. (Egypt &c.).—Denom. אַפְרְקִיִּים, ch. אַפְרִיקָאֵי Africans (Negroes). Sabb. 31 a.—Targ. II Chr. XXI, 16.

sense.definition: (supposed to be) Phrygia, in Asia Minor.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. X, 2 (h. text גֹמֶר); Gen. R. s. 37, beg.; (Y. Meg. I, 71 b bot.; Yoma 10 a גרממיא). [Y. Ber. IX, 13 c top; R. Hash. 26 a (of R. Akiba’s journeys)—perh. belonging to preced.]
, v. אִיפַּ'
pr. n. pl., prob. אֲפִּיכִירוֹס = אֲפִּיקִירוֹס q. v. Y. Gitt. IV, 46 a א' צריכא if a slave fled to Ep., it is undecided whether he may be extradited; cmp. אנטריס.
, v. אִיפַּ'
, Sabb. 45 a ed., v. פַּרְכִיל, פַּרְכָל.
transpos. of אַרְפְּכָס.

sense.definition: (פרכס q. v.) [the grinder, moving to and back,] the hopper, grain-receiver on top of the millstone.
sense.notes: Hag. 3 a; Ḥull. 89 a עשה אזנך כאפ' (ed. כארפ') make thy ear like the hopper to receive the teachings &c.; Y. Kidd. I, end, 61 d נקב אזנך כאפרכס הזו perforate (make open) thy ear &c.; Pesik. R. s. 10 הרעישה אזנך וכ' shake thy ear, like a hopper, to receive &c.
f. = next w. Targ. Y. Ex. XXXV, 28.—Kerith. 5 b. R. Hash. 23 a. Ber. 43 a. Ab. Zar. 28 b Ms. M. (ed. אספסתא).

sense.definition: (v. פִּרְסֵם, פִּרְצֵם; cmp. also בלסם, בלסמון)

sense.notes: Yoma 38 b sq. Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 c top; a. fr.—Lam. R. to IV, 15 אפל'.
Ber. 43 a
Maasr. I, 2; a. fr. V. פַּרְסֵק.
Ber. 13 b; Nidd. 14 a גני א' lies on his back. B. Bath. 79 a top.
, v. אַפְרִי'
= אַפְקַרְסוּת. Ber. 23 b; 24 b ed.
Targ. Is. LVII, 16; a. fr.

sense.definition: separation, setting apart for a sacred purpose, as the heave-offering (T’rumah, for the priest), or a sacrifice (Korban); also isolation on account of levitical uncleanness, or on acc.
sense.notes: of sacredness. Trnsf. the thing set apart, offering, gift. Y. Yoma I, beg. 38 a; Tosef. Parah III (II), 1 זה (הַ)אַפְרָשָׁתוֹ בטהרה וכ' (Babli Yoma 8 b פרישתו) the one is isolated for the purpose of purification (because of uncleanness), the other for sanctification (for the services of the Day of Atonement). Y. Dem. VII, 26 b bot. תלוי בה' depends on the act of setting apart. B. Kam. V, 7 הַפְרָשַׁת הר סיני the isolation of Mount Sinai prescribed as preparation for the giving of the Law (Ex. XIX, 13); a. fr.— Pl. אַפְרָשׁוֹת, הַפְרָשׁוֹת. Y. Shek. II, 46 d top שלש א' three kinds of sacred gifts.
Gen. R. s. 6 הפרשת וכ'; Lev. R. s. 25 פָּרָשַׁת.
Targ. Ezek. XLV, 1; a. fr.— Pl. אַפְרַשְׁוָתָא, constr. אַפְרַשְׁוַת. Targ. O. Num. XVIII, 8; 19 (some ed. אַפְרָשׁוּת sing.).

Y. Keth. XII, 35 a top יוסף א'; Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top יוסי א'; (Gen. R. s. 100 הַפְּרָתִי).— Pl. אֶפְרָתִים. Ruth R. to I, 2 expl. פלטיאני courtiers, noblemen.—Ch. אֶפְרָתִין. Targ. Ruth l. c. א' רבנין (in Ms. our w. omitted).

sense.definition: (אפש, √אף, cmp. הפץ; corresp. to b. h. נֶפֶשׁ, v. Jer. XV,
desire, pleasure; [only with personal pron. as suffix].
sense.notes: Naz. IV, 5 אי אַפְשִׁי וכ' I will not live with an offensive woman. Keth. XII, 3 אי א' לזוז וכ' I cannot leave my husband’s house. Y. Yoma VII, 45 b bot. אי א' שיכפר וכ' I do not want the Day of Atonement to bring me forgiveness. Y. Yeb. XIII, beg. 13 b א' בנישואיך I am willing to marry thee. Num. R. s. 13 (alluding to Gen. III, 2

אמר אדם אי א' said Adam, I cannot (do penitence). Said the Lord, ‘And now’,—said Adam ‘pen’, ‘by no means’, ‘I will not’. Y. Keth. VII, 31 b bot. אי א' אשה (read באשה). Y. Pes. VIII, 35 d bot. א' שתמנה (read אי א'). Y. Gitt. VI, 1; a. fr. Gen. R. s. 38 אי אַפְשֵׁנוּ וכ' we desire neither him nor his divine protection.
, v. פְּשַׁח
, v. אַשְׁפְּלָה

sense.definition: (פשר) division, space between, alternative, whence possibility; it is possible.
sense.notes: Targ. Job XIV, 14; a. fr.—Ḥull. 11 b היכא דא' א' where it is possible (to ascertain facts), it is possible (we must do), but where it is impossible &c. Yeb. 61 b sq. אין דנין א' משאי א' we cannot form an analogy between a case where there is an alternative and one where there is none. Sabb. 129 a לא א' ליה he has no means. Y. Sot. VII, 21 c bot. אי א' לומר you cannot say. Taan. 3 b אי א' לעולם וכ' the world cannot exist without &c.; a. fr.
Ber. 40 b quot. in Ar., prob. from misreading ריפתא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. Ms. M.

sense.definition: (archit.) a chamber or wing projecting from a building (with stairs from outside), balcony-chamber.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 61 a (explain. יציע). Ḥull. 92 a ב"כ דתותי א' a synagogue named ‘under the balcony’.
Lam. R. to I, 16, end כהדא א' דקרא וכ' like that tuber of cabbage, the larger the latter grows, the smaller gets the former.

sense.definition: pl. אַפְתֵּי, only with רַמְשָׁא, spreading of night, nightfall.
sense.notes: Y. Ab. Zar. I, beg. 39 a. Y. Bath. II, end, 13 c. Lev. R. s. 25; Koh. R. to II, 20.—בפתי רמשא = בא' ר'. Y. Ab. Zar. l. c.; Gen. R. s. 78.
, v. אִיפּוֹתּוֹרוֹס
, v. אֶוְותַּנְטִי

sense.definition: (פתק, cmp. הֶפְתֵּק) ladle with which provision is dealt out.
sense.notes: Snh. 39 a מחא ביה בא' (Rashi באפתקיה, Ms. M. מחייה בהפתקיה) he (the servant) warned him (Ms. M. struck him) with his ladle; (Rashi: struck him on his neck(!), v. אַפְקוֹתָא).
Targ. Y. I Num. XIII, 21 Ar., v. פַּתְרָן
, v. אִיצָא I

sense.definition:
(b. h.; = עצבע; עצב,
√צב, cmp. Job X, 8; cmp. טבע a. טבעת)

sense.notes: Men. 11 a זו א' with this (the fourth from the little finger) the measure of ‘a finger’ is taken; Keth. 5 b. Y. Taan. IV, 68 d bot.; Lam. R. to II, 2 (מטיפי) מקוטעי א' who had their finger cut off (in evidence of devotion to the cause). Yoma I, 7 א' צרדה; Tosef. ib. 9 explained א' גדולה middle finger; cmp. Tanḥ. Bo, end, expl. אמצעית.—Keth. 71 a הוא נותן א' וכ' he (the husband) puts his finger between her teeth (and must expect to be bitten), i.e. has to take the consequences of not interfering with her vow in due time.

sense.definition: any projecting limb resembling the shape of a finger.
sense.notes: Ḥull. 61 a א' יתירה the projecting toe on a bird’s claw. Tam. IV, 3 (31 a) א' הכבד the lobe of the liver.—Fig. (like יד) share, part. Y. Pes. IV, 31 a top; Y. Ab. Zar. I, 40 a top, v. אֶמְצַע.— Pl. אֶצְבָּעוֹת. Ḥag. 15 a; a. fr. (mostly in the sense of finger’s length).—Pes. 112 b; Nidd. 66 a euphem. for membra virilia.— Dual אֶצְבְּעַיִּם, אֶצְבְּעַיִּים, Cant. R. to VIII, 11 גידם א' one whose (index) fingers were lopped (stump-like). Ib. that whole trade of mine אינה נקנית אלא בא' cannot be acquired except by learning how to use the index-fingers.—Pes. 109 a, a. e. two finger lengths

Targ. Ex. XXXI, 18; a. e.— Pl. אֶצְבְּעָתָא. Targ. Y. Gen. I, 7; a. fr. Targ. Ps. VIII, 4 אצבעותך. Ned. 49 b באצבעתיה with his fingers. Erub. 53 a we are כי א' בקירא לסברא (Ar. אוצבתא) as to reasoning like fingers on wax (hard to be impressed upon), ולשכחה וכ' but as to forgetfulness like fingers put in seed (leaving no trace), v. בִּזְרָא; a. fr.

sense.definition: of a finger’s length, dwarf of the smallest size.
sense.notes: Bekh. 45 b
, v. אֶצְבְּעָא
Ohol. XIII, 4 (Var. אֲסַפְתִּי); Tosef. ib. XIV, 4 לאִיצַבְתּוֹ, ed. Zuck. (Var. ולא לצבתו) and for the snuffers belonging to it (the candlestick).
Ar., v. אַצְוָותָא
, v. next w.

sense.definition: , pl. אַצְוָתָא, אַצְוָותָא (צוי, cmp. צבי a. סבב) creeper, vine.
sense.notes: Pes. 39 a (expl. חרחבינה) אצווא דדיקלא Ar. (ed. אַצְוָותָא, Ms. M. אסיתא, read אַסְוָתָא, R. Ḥan. אַסְוָא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Keth. 50 a אַצְוָתָא. Erub. 26 b אצוותא חרזייתא דדיקלא Ar. (ed. דדיקלא omitted, also in Ms. M., cmp. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) arkablin are the prickling creepers of the palm-tree; v. חַרְזָא. V. אַצְוָותָא.
Targ. Ezek. VII, 14.

sense.definition: (אצי, √אץ, cmp. חצב a. denom., a. אֲסִיתָא) trough, kneading trough; also a trough-full, the quantity of bread baked at a time, batch.
sense.notes: Targ. Deut. XXVIII, 5; a. e. (also as plur.) Targ. Ex. VII, 28; a. e.—Pesik. B’shall. p. 91 a כל א' וכ' the entire batch of bread. Ib. b (correct acc. to Buber note 198; Var. Ar. אָצוּ, אַסְוָותָא, v. Koh. Ar. Compl. s. v.). Cmp. אֲצִיצָא. V. אַצְוָוא.
, v. אִצְוַוחְ'
, v. אַצְוָוא a. אִצְוָותָא.
, for words not found here, v. sub. אִסְט', אִיסְט' or אִיצְט'.
Targ. Prov. XVII, 14 (h. text התגלע; for אטעי ib. read אַטֵּישׁ, v. נטש).

sense.definition: (cacophem.) theatre, arena; prevailing vers. אִצְטַרְיָא q. v.

sense.notes: as preced. 2); v. אִצְטָרִין
, v. next w.

sense.definition: (טלל, v. אִסְטַלִּית) covering, lining of a shoe.
sense.notes: Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. IV, 6 שניטל האונטלית שבו ed. Zuck. (R. s. to Kel. XXVI, 4 שניטלו האונטלים; Var. ed. Zuck. האצטלו'; ed. האצטלוס) read שניטלה א' the lining of which is off.; v. זרב.
, v. אִצְטַרְיָא
, v. אִסְטְרוֹפוֹמָטָא

sense.definition: (סרר, cmp. אסטרניא, אצטרניא P. Sm. 304 a. quot.
sense.notes: ibid.; cmp. אֲבֵידָן) place of debauchery, an opprobrious name for the theatres, arenas &c. of the Romans, and a phonetic perversion of theatrum, θέατρον. Ab. Zar. I, 7 (16 a) you must not build … גרדום אצטדייא וכ' (Ms. M. אצטריבא, prob. אצטרינא, v. supra; in Gem. 18 b repeatedly אצטר', Mishn. Nap. אצטדיא, in comment. ib. אצטרדיא), expl. ib. 16 b בסיליקי של גרדום וכ' a building for public execution (court) or for public entertainment (amphitheatre &c.)— Pl. אִסְטַרְיוֹת. Sifra Aḥare IX, 13. [Men. 103 b איסטריא של מלך royal amphitheatre(?), v. אסטרטיא.] [Tanḥ. B’resh. 2 אִסְטְרָטָאוֹת, Var. אִסְטְרָאוֹת theatres.] Ab. Zar. 18 b לא הלך לאיסטרטאות Ms. M. (ed. טַרְטְיָאוֹת q. v.; En Yak. תרט'). [For the vers. אִצְטַדְיָא v. s. v.]

sense.definition: [אִיצְטַדִּין, v. preced. end] f. (prop. pl. of אצטרא, אסטרא, v. preced., used as sing.
sense.notes: ) same. B. Kam. IV, 4 (39 a) שור האיצטרין Ms. M. (ed. אצטדין, Ms. H. a. R. a. Mish. Nap. אסטדין, Y. ed. איסטדין) an ox of the arena (that killed a person). Tosef. Ab. Zar. II, 7 היושב באסטרין וכ' Var. (ed. Zuck. איסטרטון, ed. איסטרין) he who attends the arena as a spectator is like a murderer (countenancing bloodshed); Y. ib. I, 40 a היושב באיצטדין (interchanging with תיאטרון theatrum). Pl. אִצְטְרִינִין &c. Ab. Zar. 18 b אין הולכין לא' מפני ש"ד Ms. M. (ed. לאצטדינין מפני מושב לצים …, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note) you must not go to the arenas on account of bloodshed (ed. to theatres on account of ‘scorners’ seat’, Ps. I, 1). Ib. Ms. M. repeat. אִצְטָרִינָן, cmp. אֲבֵידָן. Tosef. l. c. 6 לאיצרטיונין (Var. לצטרדיונין, לצטריונין); 7 לאיצטריונין (Var. לטריונין, לצטריונין), cmp. טַרְטְיָאוֹת.
Gen. R. s. 60. Koh. R. to XI, 1.
, v. אִסְטְרוֹפוֹמָטָא

sense.definition: (אצי, v. אַצְוָותָא) cut, depression, (agric.) bed as a measure, row.
sense.notes: — Pl. אִצְיָיתָא, אִצְיָאתָא, אוּצְ', אִיצְ'. B. Bath. 12 a תלת א' וכ' (Ms. M. איצ', Ms. F. איתייתא(?)) three rows containing twelve vine-trees each; (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). Ib. 41 b he encroached on his neighbor’s ground תרתי או' ed. (Mss. אי') two bed-widths

sense.definition: the joint which touches the rib, elbow (with or without יד).
sense.notes: Arakh. 19 b עד הא' up to the elbow.— Pl אַצִּילִים, constr. אַצִּילֵי. Zeb. 19 a top כנגד א' וכ' corresponding to the elbows (where the elbow in natural position touches the body). Y. Yoma V, 42 b bot.; a. fr.—(Chald.) Lev. R. s. 8, beg. ודין אצילים פריך some ed. (read אצילֵיה) and the other has his elbow (arm) broken.

sense.definition: (v. צִיפָּא) matting used for bailing dates, cmp. חוֹתָל.
sense.notes: [Oth. opin: the flesh sticking to the stone of half-ripe dates.] Gitt. 89 a a woman was betrothed בא' דתוחלא (Ar. אצפא) with &c. (an object of no value).

sense.definition: (אצץ, cmp. אַצְוָותָא) a common bellied vessel.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 144 a אפי' א' דהרסנא Ms. (ed. ע') even a pot in which fish-hash is kept. Meg. 16 a א' דבית הכסא Ar. (ed. ע', Ms. O. עסיסא) night-chamber. [Targ. Esth. V, 1 ריעא עֲצוּצָא, read דְּעַ' … of the night-chamber.] Hebr. עָצִיץ.
, Targ. Koh. XII, 11 a gloss of אנצין, missing in ed. Buxt. a. oth.; v. אֲנַץ

sense.definition: (√צל, v. נצל) to protect, spare, exempt from taxes.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 55 a, v. אַנְדִּיסְקֵי.—[Bets. 14 a אצלי, v. צלי.]

sense.definition: (b. h.) pr. n. m. Atsel, Atsal, mentioned I Chron. VIII, 37 sq.
sense.notes: ; IX, 43 sq. Pes. 62 b בין א' לא' וכ' (Ms. מן א' …, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, for var. lect.) the explanation of the repetition of I Chr. VIII, 29 to 38, and IX, 35 to 44 and the verbal discrepancies between the two records would load four hundred camels with discussion; cmp. Rashi to I Chr. l. c.

sense.definition: by the side of, near, with.
sense.notes: B. Mets. V, 1 הרי אֶצְלִי בהן יין thou hast wine with me instead, i.e. I owe thee &c. Ib. 85 b א' מי אתה תקוע by whose side art thou lodged (in the world to come)?; Koh. R. to IX, 10; a. fr.
Targ. Is. XXXIII, 20; a. e.
, v. צְלֵי

sense.definition: clasp or brooch for fastening dresses on going out, in Talm. knee-band; v. בִּירִית.
sense.notes: Sabb. 63 b בירית זו א' what the Mishnah calls birith is the Biblical etsadah; modified ibid. בירית תחת א' וכ' birith has the function of the etsadah (Rashi: birith around the knee serves the same purpose as etsadah on the shoulder, to save inconvenience in walking).
Targ. Prov. XVI, 23 בכל מן דא' לך (h. text עצב) in whatever is a trouble to thee.
, v. אֲצִיפָא

entry.language-reference: sec. r. of צור, cmp. אסר)

sense.definition: to lock up, hoard, gather ; cmp. גָּנַז.
sense.notes: B. Bath. 90 b אוֹצְרֵי פירות those who store up fruit (for speculation). Ib. אין אוֹצְרִין וכ'; Tosef. Ab. Zar. IV (V), 1 (אצר a. עצר used promiscuously) you must not hoard up (for speculation) such things as are necessaries of life; [correct אין א' דברים שיש … כגון יינות שמנים וסלתות ופירות]. Ib. לֶאֱצוֹר (Tosef. לאַצֵּר Pi.). Ib. לא יְאַצֵּר Pi. (Tosef. ולא יַעֲצוֹר, read לא; Var. לא יַאֲצִיר). Gen. R. s. 45 end (play on נבוכדרא̇צ̇ר̇) שאֲצָרָן וכ' he locked them up in the desert &c.—Y. Dem. VI, end, 26 a; Tosef. ib. VI, 4; Ab. Zar. 71 a אוֹצֵר (עוֹצֵר) government’s store-collector, commissary (apothecarius), or read אוֹצָר q. v.
, v. supra.
*Targ. O. Gen. XLI, 35 וייצרון, Var. ויוצרון, ויצרון). B. Bath. 90 b פוק אצר לי וכ' (prob. אַצַּר Pa.) go out and buy up for me for storage &c.
Targ. Is. XXIII, 18.

sense.definition: w. (preced.) אַצַּר פירי speculator in provision.
sense.notes: Yoma 83 a; B. Bath. 90 b
Bekh. 21 b א' חיותא contraction of the womb (and consequent destruction of the fœtus).

sense.definition: , read אוֹצְרוֹת רוּחַ (v. אוֹצָר) stores of wind, name of the cavities in the pearl-shell in which the pearls are seated, and which contain a kali; v. אַשְׁלְגָא.
sense.notes: Y. Sabb. IX, end, 12 b top.
, v. אַקְוָוא
Targ. Amos IV, 6 (h. text נקיון וכ') אקהיות שנין = perplexity. Cmp. אַקְוָוא.

sense.definition: , m. (accubitum, ἀκκούβιτον) dining couch of the Roman nobility of the imperial period in place of the older triclinium.
sense.notes: Lev. R. s. 7 מיסב על א' וכ' (Pesik. Eth. Korb. p. 61 a הקוביטין; Yalk. Num. 777 איק'; ib. Lev. 479 קוב', קנב'; ib. Ps. 791 הננ' &c., corr. acc.; Pesik. R. s. 16, p. 83 b ed. Fr. הקובטין) reclining on his accubitum.—לחם א', or ריפתא (ד)א' bread used at the meals of the nobility, fine bread. Targ. Y. II Gen. XL, 16 ריפתא קקבטון (read ריפתא דאקקובטון) bread of the nobles (h. text חרי). Pesik. R. l. c. p. 82 a (ref. to לחם הפחה Neh. V, 18) הקקבטין sub. לחם; Pesik. l. c. p. 59 a קקבטון (corr. acc.).
, B. Bath. 73 a bot. Ar., v. קוּפְיָא a. קוּבְנָאָה; cmp. אֲקוּנְבִּי.

sense.definition: (קהי) what blunts or loosens the teeth, weakening ; fig. (v. Mekh. Bo 18, end) refutation, arguments.
sense.notes: Pl. אַקְוָותָא. Yeb. 110 b יתבי וקמקוו א' (Rashi Var. מקהו אַקְהָתָא) they were sitting and raising arguments. Cmp. אַקְהָיוּתָא.
, v. אִיקוֹנוֹמוֹס

sense.definition: reed-basket, used as a fisher’s cauf.
sense.notes: Kel. XII, 2; XXIII, 5.
v. אֲקַן
, v. אִיק'

קומבא, Nöld. Mand. Gr. p. 105) cupola, arched vessel. Pl. אֲקוּנְבְּיָאוֹת. Tosef. Kel. B. Mets. II, 8 א' שבמגדלים ed. Zuck. (Var. אקובנ', cmp. קובנאה) cupolas on turrets (a piece of house furniture), ornamental vases.

sense.definition: , a corruption of קוֹלְיָיס m. (κολίας) colias, name of a small fish.
sense.notes: Ab. Zar. 39 a; Ḥull. 66 b top; Tosef. Ḥull. III (IV), 27 קולייס.

sense.definition: (נקף, קף) curlings of the web, anything sticking out of the web (threads, knots &c.).
sense.notes: Sabb. 75 b האי מאן דשקיל א' וכ' whoever takes threads out of clothes on the Sabbath, is guilty of an act of finishing; v. פַּטִישׁ. Cmp. אַקָּפוּתָא.
, v. קופיא
, v. אַקְרַפְטָא
, v. אַקְרוֹקְתָּא

Targ. Y. Lev. XX, 10.—Keth. 39 b. Sot. 4 b, opp. רכיכא. Sabb. 65 a כל מידי א' anything hard.— Pl. אָקוֹשֵׁי. Sabb. 155 a חרובין א' ed. (Ms. M. דאשוני, Ar. דאשינא).—Targ. Ps. LVIII, 10 אָקוֹשָׁן (some ed. אַקְשׁוּן).

sense.definition: (actor) actor publicus, an officer who had the supervision of slaves and state property.
sense.notes: — Pl. אַקְטוֹרִין. Mekh. B’shall. Par. 1; Yalk. Ex. 230 או'.—Targ. Y. Ex. XVI, 5 אוֹקְטָרַיָּא.

sense.definition: Ctesiphon, a town on the Eastern bank of the Tigris.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Gen. X, 10 ק' (for Bibl. Kalneh). Yoma 10 a (for Bibl. Resen) זה א' (Ms. זו אקטספון; Var. קטיספון; טיספוס). Gitt. 6 a. Erub. 57 b אקיסט' (corr. acc.; Ms. M. קטי'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note).

sense.definition: (קטר) whatever raises dense smoke when ignited, hence roots, twigs &c. Taan. 24 b bot. ושדייא א' (Ms. M. adds. בתנורא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) she used to throw twigs into the stove (to make people believe she was baking).
, read: אִיקִי (εἶκε) make room! Y’lamd. to Deut. XI, 22 quot.
sense.notes: in Ar. (v. Tanḥ. Ekeb, 4); cmp. Midr. Till. to Ps. XVII.
, v. אַקְסְיוֹס

sense.definition: (Var. עֲקִילֹוס), pr. n. m. Akilos (prob. identic with עקילס q. v.).
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 1 R. Yudan relates בשם א'.
, v. אִקְטִיסְפּוֹן
, v. אֲקַקְיָא
, v. אַקְלִידָא a. קְלַד.
, v. קְלִיבוֹסֶת

Sabb. 89 b ככא דא' (Ar. s. v. קלד: בבא, Var., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 400) the tooth of the key, key-bit (Ar. ‘ the key-gate’); Men. 57 a; a. e.—Fig. א' דמטרא the key (to the store) of rain; א' דת"המ the key (to the gate) of resurrection. Snh. 113 a (Var. קלידא, מפתחא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 30).— Pl. אַקְלִידֵי, אַקְלִידַיָּיא. Targ. I Chr. IX, 27.—Gitt. 56 a; a. fr.—Denom. אַקְלַד, v. קְלַד.
, read קאלנדס, v. קַלֶּנְדָּא
Ithpe. of קְלַס.

sense.definition: (aquiliferi) eagle-bearers, bearers of the imperial standard.
sense.notes: Midr. Till. to Ps. XLV (some ed. אלק' corr. acc.).
Lev. R. s. 34 א' פרנסין, read אוקמינון, v. קום.
אמקתא?, v. P. Sm. 243) spider. Targ. Prov. XXX, 28.

sense.definition: (deriv. of קני) to grow in stalks, produce stalks Gitt. 30 a לא צריכא דאָקוּן (Var. דהדר ואקון) in the case before us it means that the seeds which had been despaired off produced stalks (blades) again מהו דתימא אֲקַנְתָּא מילתא וכ' when you might think this shooting up is something (enough to awaken new hopes of recovery), therefore &c.; Taan. 19 a.
sense.notes: —Denom. אֲקַנְתָּא growth of stalks; v. supra.
, v. אִיקָנוֹס a. אַקְסְיוֹס.
, v. אַקְנָיָיתָא
Targ. I Sam. I, 16 (v. ib. v. 6).

sense.definition: pl., הַקְנָאָה h. f. (קני I) giving possession, whence שְׁטָרֵי אַ' or שְׁטַר ה' an agreement by which one’s landed estate is mortgaged in the form of a sale from date, independent of the loan to be consummated afterwards, so that at a certain date the creditor can claim the property, even if sold in the meantime, by referring to the priority of his purchase; deed of transfer (v. Bloch Civil-Process, p. 54, notes 5 a. 6 a. quot. ib.).
sense.notes: B. Mets. 13 a; 14 a; 16 b. B. Bath. 172 a שטרא אקניאתא (שטרי, Ms. M. ib. a. B. Mets. 16 b אקנייתא without שטר').—אַקְנָיָיתָא בְּמָנֵי transfers, or sales by symbolic delivery, v. מָנָא; whence Aknayatha B’mané, adaptation of the name of a Babylonian festive time and fair (cmp. יָרִיד). Ab. Zar. 11 b Ms. M. a. oth. (ed. אקניתא בחנוני, Var. אקניתיה); [cmp. Y. ib. I, 39 c where our w. seems to be rendered כנוני].
, v. preced.
, v. אֲנַנְקָתָא
, v. אָכְסִיגָ'
Gen. R. s. 46 ‘ I am God Shadday’ (Gen. XVII,

is translated by Aquila אקווס ואקנוס Ar. (ed. אכסיוס, אכסיוט, corr. acc.) ἄξιος and (καὶ) ἵκανος, adequate and sufficient (competent); cmp. ibid. דייך וכ' it is sufficient for thee that I am thy protector.
, v. next w.
Targ. Ps. XLV, 9 Ar. (ed. אַקְסִיל אַלוּאוֹן combine) (h. text אֲהָלוֹת).

sense.definition: (קפד, Hif.) getting excited, ebullition of temper, rashness.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 10; Y. Ned. I, 36 d bot. they make the vow of a nazir (ה') מתוך א' inconsiderately. Y. Ab. Zar. IV, 44 a. Tosef. Gitt. VII (V), 6 (opp. ברצון). Y. Naz. I, end, 51 c הקפדן, read: דָתָן …
Targ. Is. III, 24. Cmp. אַקּוּפֵי.
, v. אַקּוּבִּיטוֹן
Gitt. 69 b Ar. (ed. אקיקא, corr. acc.).

dial. q. v.; cmp. var. lect. bel.) fort, designation of various, mostly Babyl. places. Meg. 6 a א' דתולבקני (Ms. Oxf., L., F. עקרא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Kidd. 71 b, v. תולבקני. [Rashi: fortified ford.] B. Bath. 127 a, Kidd. 72 a, v. אַגְמָא. B. Mets. 86 a מא' לאגמא from Fort (Agma) to Agma (Var. lect. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.). B. Bath. 73 b, v. הגרוניא. Macc. 10 a, v. סְלִיקוֹס; a. fr. [The Gr. ἄκρα, orig. summit, is a phonetic coincidence.]
R. Hash. 29 b בית דינא דא' improvized court. Snh. 25 b, a. fr. א' בעלמא a mere chance.
, v. אַקְרַפְטָא

B. Bath. 73 b א' (Var. אקורקרתא, &c., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 3) דהויא כי וכ' a frog as big as Fort Hag. (others read בי, a frog which was in Fort H.). Ned. 41 a עקרבא דיתיבא על א' ועברה נהרא (corr. ed. acc.) a scorpion sitting on a frog and crossing the river.

M. Kat. 10 b למבני א' Ar. (ed. אקרפיטא, Ms. M. אקרפיטרא) to build up a raised seat (on a frame). [Rashi: אקרופיטא crib.] Kidd. 70 a ליתיב מר אקר' sit down, Sir, on the couch; (cmp. אִיצְטְבָא, the Chald. equivalent of our w.).

sense.definition: (Ms. M. ניר'; Ar. s. v. פלמודא: פדא or פרא) name of a fish or fish-brine; perh.
sense.notes: אֲרָאיָא ( Raia) ray or skate. Ab. Zar. 40 a

sense.definition:
Is. XXXIII, 7,
= אלאל, v. אלל, cmp. אמרכל) messenger, esp. (in poetry) angel.
sense.notes: Pl. אֶרְאֵלִים. Keth. 104 a א' ומצוקים וכ' the Erelim (angels) and the mortals seized the holy ark (strove for the soul of R. Judah); Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top יצוקים וא'; Y. Keth. XII, 35 a; Koh. R. to VII, 11; IX, 10; v. יָצַק, מָצַק.
, v. אֲרוֹנֵי

sense.definition: to press into holes, to make holes; to weave; join.
to look through a hole, to espy, lurk, lie in wait.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 44 b, a. e. (ref. to Deut. XIX, 11) וא' לו וכ' it says ‘And he lurks for him’ &c., that means the intention to kill that man.—Denom. ארובה, אורבא, ארבל', ארבא, ארבתא.
B. Mets. 101 b; B. Kam. 85 a; B. Bath. 168 a thou appearest to me כאריא א' like a lurking lion, i.e. I have no confidence in thee.

sense.definition: (ארב to join, cmp. ארגז, תיבה) boat.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 101 b א' דחמרא a boat-load of wine; a. fr.—Gitt. 6 a; Kidd. 72 a א' תנייתא וכ' Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. תניינא) to the second boat of the (floating) bridge; cmp. Kidd. l. c. והאידנא וכ' ‘and now the Persians placed the bridge higher up’. [Oth. opin., v. אֲרַבְתָּא.]— Pl. אַרְבֵּי. B. Mets. 72 b חיטי … וא' the wheat in granaries and ships.

sense.definition: a small silver vessel in the shape of a trough (= עֲרֵיבָה Ar.) B. Bath. 34 b (Comm.: ship).

sense.notes: Targ. II Chr. XVII, 11 (ed. Beck; oth. עֲרָבָאֵי).
Ex. R. s. 13; a. fr. V. כּוֹבֵשׁ.
v. הַרְבָּה

sense.definition: (ארב, cmp. ערב) confounding of colors, thickness, whence feeble sight.
sense.notes: Pes. 111 b the following three things יהיבי א' וכ' (Ms. Oxf. עוורונא; Ms. M. v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.) cause defective eye-sight.
, v. אַרְבְּלָא
, v. אַרְבְּעָה end.

sense.definition: Arbel, Arbela, in Galilee, near Zepphoris.
sense.notes: Y. Ber. I, 2 c בקעת א' the Valley of Ar.; Y. Taan. IV, 69 b ארכל (corr. acc.). Y. Shebi. VI, 36 d bot. Koh. R. to I, 18 coarse linen הבאין מא' coming from A.; a. e.

sense.definition: (denomin. of next w., v. עַרְבֵּל) to sift, shake.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 26 b דאייתי ארבלא ומְאַרְבֵּל Ar. (Ms. R. 2 מארביל, ed. וקא מַרְבֵּל = מארבל) that he brought a sieve and sifted the sand. Snh. 39 a וקמרבלינהו Ms. M. (ed. Sonc. וקא מא' להו, oth. ed. מהדר להו) and shook them.
Ḥull. 49 a מירבל הוא דרְבִיל it was shaken down (by the movements of the animal). [Targ. עַרְבֵּל.]
B. Mets. 26 b; Snh. 39 a, v. preced.—Macc. 20 b בארבילא (Ms. M. בארבי); Snh. 89 b אכיל תמרא בא' ate dates out of the sieve, i.e. did a harmless thing.—Targ. Amos IX, 9 ערבלא.—V. עַרְבְּלָאִין.

sense.definition: (אַרְבֵּל I) a native or resident of Arbel, Arbelite.
sense.notes: Ab. I, 6.— Pl. אַרְבֵּלִיִּין. Gen. R. s. 19, beg.; cmp. Koh. R. to I, 18.—[Tosef. Par. XII (XI), 16 כוש הא', v. next w.]—Fem. אַרְבֵּלִית. Y. Peah VII, 20 a bot.; Y. Sot. I, 17 b; IX, 24 b bot. סאה א' one S’ah of Arbelite wheat. [Ib. IV, end, 19 d top רבי מר עוקבא הורה בארבלי Arbeli, supposed to be a place in Babylon. The entire sentence is spurious both from Mar Ukba’s title of Rabbi as well as from comparison with Keth. 60 b.]

sense.definition: coarse weft, opp. to פשתין fine flax woof.
sense.notes: Parah XII, 8 כוש של א' (Var. רוֹבָן) the spindle used for spinning coarse material; [Tosef. ib. XII (XI) 16 כוש הארבלי the spindle used at Arbel; cmp. Koh. R. to I, 18 s. v. אַרְבֵּל I].
v. אוּרְבָּנָא
, v. אַרְבְּעָה

sense.definition: four, v. אַרְבָּעָא I a. אַרְבְּעָה.
, אַרְבַּע f. (b. h.) four (frequently represented by ד').
sense.notes: Ḥag. 14 b א' נכנסו וכ' four men entered into theosophical speculation; a. fr.—Constr. אַרְבַּעַת followed by singul. Y. Ber. I, 2 c אַרְבַּעַת מיל = אַרְבָּעָה מילין; Y. Yoma III, beg. 40 b; (cmp. Gen. R. s. 50).— Pl. אַרְבָּעִים (מ') forty. Sabb. VII, 2 א' חסר אחת thirty nine.—Macc. I, 1, a. fr. לוקה א' receives forty (thirty nine) lashes; v. ib. III, 10.

Targ. O. Gen. XIV, 9; a. fr.—Constr. a) אַרְבְּעַת Targ. Y. ibid.—b) אַרְבְּעֵי, אַרְבַּעְתֵּי Sabb. 73 a (omitting the object numbered); a. fr.—Targ. Y. Num. II, 3; a. fr.—Y. Gitt. V, 46 d top ארבעתי דינרייא four denars—אַרְבַּעְתָּא, אַרְבְּעִיתָא m. the fourth (day of the week). Gen. R. s. 11; Pesik. R. s. 23, beg. Ibid. p. 120 a ed. Fr. ארבעיא, ed. Prag ארבעיתא. Ibid. p. 115 b באַרְבַּעְתָּה on Wednesday.— Pl. אַרְבְּעִין forty. Targ. Gen. V, 13; a. fr.—Snh. 26 b א' בכתפיה forty (lashes) rest on his shoulders, i.e. he is punishable (v. preced.); a. fr.—אַרְבֵּיסַר, אַרְבַּעְסְרֵי, אַרְבַּע סְרֵי fourteen, fourteenth. Targ. Y. Gen. XIV, 5 בּירְבֵּיסְרֵי; a. fr. Meg. 2 b בא' on the fourteenth of Adar. Sabb. 98 b.—אַרְבֵּסְרָאָה the fourteenth. Targ. I Chr. XXIV, 13.
Targ. Is. VII, 25; LXV, 10 בית א' (Var. אַרְבְּעָא, רִבּוּעָא) couching place (for animals).
, v. אַרְבְּעָה

sense.definition:
(ארב, h.
עֲרָבָה, b. h. עֲרָבִים pl.) [ the thickly interwoven,] willow.
sense.notes: Pes. 111 b טולא דא' Ms. M., Ar. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.; ed. עֲ') the shade of a willow-tree.— Pl. אַרְבָּתָא. Sabb. 20 b (Ar. אַרְבָּאתָא; Mss. עַ'). [Gitt. 6 a; Kidd. 72 a ארבא וכ' the second willow after crossing the bridge; v., however, אַרְבָּא I.] V. עַרְבָא I, II a. עֲרַבְתָּא.
אֲרַג m. (v. רגג, h. ערג) something desirable … שפר א' the choicest of … Targ. Ps. XLV, 14. Targ. Y. Gen. XLV, 18.

sense.definition: , v. ארב; cmp. חרג) to plait, braid, weave.
sense.notes: Sabb. VII, 2 האוֹרֵג he who weaves on the Sabbath; a. fr.—Metaph. (cmp. טרי) to argue, conclude, spin out, deduct &c. Ruth R., Par. 2, beg. (play on or’gim II Sam. XXI, 19) they brought a subject up והוא אוֹרְגָהּ and he carried it to a conclusive decision. Ib. שהיו אוֹרְגִין עמו they argued with him.—Num. R. s. 4 (play on argaman, purple) שהוא היה א̇ור̇ג̇ … מ̇ן̇ וכ' for it (the purple-covered altar) argued Israel free from sin (pleaded in his behalf). Ib. s. 12 (same play on the word) והוא אורג וכ' and He wove (planned) the world so that all creatures should come forth each according to its kind. Ib. א' מַן the Sun weaves (ripens) food.
Y. Ter. XI, end, 48 b. Ex. R. s. 50; a. fr.

sense.definition: , part. מְאָרֵג (cmp. עֲרוּגָה) to follow the grooves of the garden bed, to range, esp. to select the green and tender onions (v. חָלַק Hif.).
sense.notes: Tosef. Peah I, 9 המארג, quoted in Y. ib. III, 17 c top המירוג (corr. acc.; v. מֵירוּג) a. explained ibid. המחליק וכ' he who takes out the green onions for sale and leaves the others to ripen for storage.
Snh. 48 b וא' בגד וכ' and where they weave a garment (directly) for a corpse.
, v. אַרְגְּוָון

sense.definition: pr. n. m. (b. h. ארגב) Argob.
sense.notes: . Targ. II Kings XV, 25.
v. טְרָכֹונָּא

sense.definition: (= b. h. גִּבְלִים) Giblean (v. גְּבָל); master-mason.
sense.notes: Pl. אַרְגּוּבְלַיָּא. Targ. I Kings V, 32 (h. text גבלים); II Kings XII, 13 (h. text גֹּדְרִים). Cmp. אַרְדִּיכָל.

sense.definition: (also … גְּוָנ') = b. h. אַרְגָּמָן purple ( garment).
sense.notes: Dan. V, 7; a. e.—Targ. Ex. XXV, 4; a. e.—Tam. 32 a לבישין דא' purple garments.— Pl. אַרְגְּוָונִים. Pesik. R. s. 33.—אַרְגְּוָונוֹת. Lam. R. to III, 19 א' טובות fine purple dresses (for females).
, v. אַרְגֶּנְטָרְיָא
, v. אַרְגְּוָו'

ז; cmp. אַרְבָּא) box, chest (joined with tenons &c.). Num. R. s. 4; Hor. 12 a; a. e.—Snh. 46 b kabor (to bury, cover) might mean only דעבד א' וכ' Ms. F. a. Ar. (Var. ארזג, ed. ארון) one makes a chest and puts the corpse in. [Pr. n. pl. v. אַרְגִּיזָא.]
Targ. Ezek. XX, 28 א' קורבניהון (prob. to be corr. אַרְגָּזוּת, v. next w.).
f. same. Targ. I Kings XXI, 22; XV, 30.
Y’lamd. Koraḥ (quot. in Ar.) ועשה אותו א' (read אותי) and made me (Korah) a working man (Num. VII, 9); Tanḥ. ed. Bub. Korah, p. 96 אור'.

sense.definition: Argiz, Argiza (ארזק Schr. KGF 228; Eragiza, Ptol.
sense.notes: V, 15, 14; modern Razek, Koh. Ar. s. v.). Sabb. 19 b; Erub. 63 a חדתא דא' Ms. M. a. oth. (v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. notes, ed. חרתא) Ḥadta (Newtown) [Ḥarta] near Ar. [Rashi: Argiz, pr. n. m. the builder of the town.] Gitt. 7 a ארגיזה, בי א'. Zeb. 18 b ארגיזא (Ms. M. אגוזיא, Ms. R. ארגיסיא, ארגזיא, Ms. K. ארגיזיא; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).
, read אֲרֹוגְנַוְטִין, אֲרוֹגְנַוְטֵיס q. v.
, v. כְּרִיסֹו

Ex. R. s. 40, beg. Lev. R. s. 23; Y. Succ. IV, 54 c top; Cant. R. to IV, 8 היא וכל א' וכ' itself (the brick) and all the implements for making it. [Y’lamd. B’haaloth., quot. in Ar. כלי א' implements of a ship.]
Sabb. 90 a. Kel. XXVII, 12; a. fr.; cmp. אַרְגְּוָון.
, v. אַרְגֶּנְטָרְיָא
, v. next w., a. אֲרֹוגְנַוְטֵיס.

sense.definition: (ἀργενταρία, argentarium) silver-case, plate, table service (of silver or gold).
sense.notes: Pesik. Baḥod. p. 106 b ארגנטין Ar. Var. (ארגנטרין ed. Koh.; ed. אנגיטירין); Yalk. Ex. 271 ארגניטין (cmp. versions ibid. a. Ar. s. v., in order to arrive at a correct reading of the whole passage). Y. Peah VIII, 21 b אגנטין, ארגנטורין (corr. acc.). Esth. R. to I, 4 ארגוטדיא, ארגנאטרייא (corr. acc.).

Num. R. s. 13 אני מביא רוח א' וכ' I shall cause to pass over the world an argestes in which both winds (the Northern and the Southern) shall do service; Cant. R. to IV, 16 ארג'; Lev. R. s. 9 ארגסטס; Ar. Var. אגרסטיס.
Koh. R. to XI, 9, v. אָכְסִיגָרֹון

sense.definition: (read אַרְגוּרֹון) m. (ἄργυρον) a small silver coin, also called milliarium.
sense.notes: Y. Peah VIII, 21 a top ובלבד וכ' provided you do not refuse him his customary argyron (the beggar’s penny); v. B. Bath. 9 a
Y. Sot. II, 18 a top, read אָרַר q. v.

sense.definition: (Syr. ערדא, v. Löw Pfl. p. 303) mushroom, morel.
sense.notes: Keth. 61 a Ar. (ed. אַרְדֵּי pl.)— Pl. אַרְדַּיָּא, אַרְדֵּי. Pes. 119 b ארדיא לי Ar. (ed. אַרְדְּלַיָּיא, אַרְדִּילַיָּא, אוּרְדִּילָאֵי, Ms. אַרְדִּילֵי, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note); Y. ib. X, end, 37 d ערדילו (read עַרְדִּילֵי or עַרְדֵּי לִי). Ber. 47 a ארדיא Ar. (ed. a. Ms. אַרְדִּילַיָּא). Ab. Zar. 38 a ארדי.

sense.definition: prefix of Persian proper nouns, Arda.
sense.notes: —Gitt. 14 b their names are bewildering א' וארטא … בריש beginning with Arda-, and Arta-, and Phile-.

ארדבא, ארטבא) Artaba, a Persian and Egyptian dry measure (v. Zuckerm. Jüd. Masse p. 47; Sm. Ant. s. v.). B. Mets 80 b א' לעריבה Ar. (ed. אדריב) an Artaba is an unreasonable additional load for a small boat called Arebah. Erub. 102 a Ar. (ed. אדריבא, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 20).
, v. אִדְר'

sense.definition: ; ch. form אַרְדִּיכְלָא (אדר') m. (prob. from a place or country, cmp. אַרְגּוּבְלָא) artist, artisan (v. P. Sm. 370 s. v., a. derivat.) esp. architect, key-stone-setter.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 118 b בנאי … לא' (ed. אדרי') when the builder has handed the key-stone over to the architect (to set it). Y. ib. X, end, 12 c ארדכל. Gen. R. s. 8 אר'; ib. s. 27 אד'.— Pl. ארְדִּיכְלִין. Targ. II Sam. V, 11 (h. text חרשי אבן קיר); a. e.—Erub. 26 a אַרְדַּ' Ar. (Ms. M. דאַרְדַּכְלֵי; ed. אדר').—אַרְדִּיכְלַיָּא Targ. Ps. CXVIII, 22; a. e.
— Pl. אַרְדִּילֵי, אַרְדִילַיָּא, אַרְדְּלַיָּיא
, v. אַרְדִּיכָל
, v. אַרְדִּילָא
Targ. Y. Gen. XXX, 37 דלוז וא', a corruption; prob. דלוז וּדְאַרְמֹון, v. אַרְמֹון III
m. ch. = h. הַרְדֹּופַנִּין; v. הַרְדַּפְנֵי. Targ. Y. I, II Ex. XV, 25.
, read אַרְדּקְסַט or

sense.definition: Artaxata, or Artaxiata, capital of Great Armenia.
sense.notes: Y. Erub. III, beg. 20 c. Bab. ib. 29 a עַרְדִּיסְקָא ed. (Ms. M. עַרְדַסְקִיס, Var. ערדסקוס, ערדיקס, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note). Tosef. ib. IX (VI), 4 ערדסקס, (Var. ערדסקוס, ערדסקין).
Gitt. 6 a בי א'. Erub. 57 b. B. Bath. 52 a, v. הֹורְמִיז. Yeb. 37 b דַּרְדְּשִׁיר = דְאַרְ', sub. הֹורְמִיז; Yoma 18 b דרשיש (corr. acc.).
, v. ארי

sense.definition: (ארי; v. אֲלוּ, cmp. הֲרֵי) lo!, behold.
sense.notes: Dan. VII, 6; 7; 13.

sense.definition: an aperture in the roof looking to the ground floor (answering to the Greek hypaithron, Roman compluvium), contrad. fr. חַלֹּון a garret window in the wall projecting above the flat roof.
sense.notes: Bets. V, 1 (35 b); cmp. Rashi a. l. Nidd. 20 b כסומא בא' like a blind man finding his way down from the ãrubbah, i.e. hitting the truth by chance. Ohol. X, 1; a. fr.— Pl. אֲרוּבֹּות. Ib. 4 sq.; a. e.

definition.italic: the opening panel of folding doors.

sense.notes: —Pl. as supra. Yoma 76 a. [Sabb. 43 a; 153 b; Kel. XV, 2 read with Ar. אֲרוּכֹות.]
Y. Succ. I, end, 52 c א' טמאה a mat (of twigs &c. for covering the festive booth) that became unclean.

sense.definition: (ἀρωγοναύτης sub. δαίμων) helper of sailors, Arogonautes, a demon.
sense.notes: Gen. R. s. 63; Y. Ter. VIII, 46 c top; Yalk. Gen. 110, variously corrupted ארגינטין, ארגיניטון, ארגניטין, אנגיטריס.
— Pl. אֻרְוֹות. Snh. 21 b
Gen. R. s. 37 (to Arvadi, Gen. X, 18).
Targ. O. Gen. X, 18 (Targ. Y. II אַנְטִירִידִינָאֵי; I לוּטָסָאֵי, Var. in Targ. I Chr. I, 16 לְטוּסָאֵי).
, v. אַרְוִיסָא
[Ar. chain, Perl. Et. St. p. 21 = Pers. arvîs rope.] Yeb. 46 a רמו ליה ארוו' וכ' Ar. ed. Koh. (ed. ארוי', Ar. ed. ארוסיה) they put a halter around his neck (to prevent him from claiming his liberty).
v. infra.

sense.definition: (= עָרוּךְ; cmp. אֲרִיךְ) well-arranged, well-balanced, thinker, a title of prominent scholars; cmp. אַרְיֹוךְ a. אֲרִיכָא.
sense.notes: [In legend intellectual eminence was identified with physical tallness.] Nidd. 24 b א' בדורו arukh (the tallest) in his generation. Kidd. 39 b עולם שכולו א' the world in which all is well-balanced (also called שכולו טוב) i.e. the hereafter.—Pl. אֲרוּכִים. Yoma 71 a חיים א' long life; a. fr.—Fem. אֲרוּכָה. Ber. I, 4 אחת א' one lengthy (benediction); a. fr.—Y. Hor. II, 46 d בא' by the long road, slowly; Shebu. 18 ab.— Pl. אֲרוּכֹות. Y. Ber. II, 5 c top, a. e. א' וקצרות long and short roads, i.e. in all directions. V. next art.
, v. אַרְכָא III

sense.definition: (noun) long board, longside of bedstead, bedside.
sense.notes: Succ. 15 b א' ושתי כרעים the long bedside with its two knees (supporters); 16 a.— Pl. אֲרוּכֹות. Ib. I, 8 (Var. ארובות, v. Rabb. D. S. ib. ad 15 a, note 1); Sabb. 43 a; ib. XXIII, 5 (151 b) א' המטה (some ed. ארובות, corr. acc.).—[Kel. XV, 2 א' של נחתומים Ar. Var. the long ranging boards used by the bakers: Maim.; the prevailing versions are אֲרוּבֹּות or אֲרֵיבֹות; Tosef. B. Mets. V, 4 ארובות, (Var. ארונות) basins or moulds in which loaves or cakes are shaped.—Var. Ar. עֲרִיכֹות.]

sense.definition: , v. Ges. H. Dict. s. v.) the web of new flesh or skin on a healing wound, healing.
sense.notes: העלה א' to produce a new cover, be restored. Ḥull. 77 a; 125 a; B. Kam. 91 b
v. 1) v. אֲרֵי.
v. אֲרִים
Erub. 51 b ed., Ms. M. רוּמָא q. v.
Pl. אֲרֹומָאֵי. Gitt. 17 a; cmp. אֲרַמָּאָה.
. Gitt. 17 a; v. אֲרָם, אֲרַמִּי.

sense.definition:
c. (b. h.;
ארן or ארי, √אר, cmp. ארגז, ארבא, עריבה &c.) [joined together,] chest, box, coffin, freq. (= אֲרוֹן הַקּוֹדֶשׁ) the Holy Ark, in the tabernacle and the Temple, or in Synagogues.
sense.notes: Yoma V, 1 הגיע לא' reached the place where the Ark stood during the First Temple. Y. Ber. IV, 8 c top; Gen. R. s. 55 (allegorical etymologies).—Keth. 104 a א' הקודש (figuratively) a good and learned man’s soul; v. אֶרְאֵל.—Kel. XII, 5 א' של גרוסות the grits-dealer’s chest. Y. Kil. IX, 32 b top; Gen. R. s. 100 אֲרוֹנִי נקובה (נקופה) וכ' ותהא let my coffin be perforated at the bottom. Snh. 98 b אין לך כל א' וא' וכ' there is no coffin in Palestine in which the Median horses do not eat straw (being used as cribs); a. fr.— Pl. אֲרוֹנוֹת. Sot. 13 a; a. fr. [Y. Keth. VI, 30 d bot. וארון, v. אֲרִי I.]

Targ. Ex. XXV, 10; a. fr. Targ. Gen. L, 26 (coffin).—Y. Meg. III, 73 d bot. the curtain על א' כא' over the ark containing the scrolls is as sacred as the ark itself. Y. Ber. II, 5 c bot. אֲרוֹנֵיה נפקא his coffin was carried out for burial.
, v. אָרְנָטוּס

sense.definition: (prob. pl. of ארונא, so called from closing and opening like chests) name of certain plants growing in marshes and closing their leaves at nightfall.
sense.notes: Sabb. 35 b בדברא עורבי באגמא חזו אדני Ms. M. (ed. עורבי א"נ אדאני …; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l., Ar. הרני, Var. ארוני, Rashi ed. Sonc., Asheri a. R. Niss. early ed. אראני) in the desert you recognize the entrance of the Sabbath (on a cloudy day) by the ravens, in marsh-land you look out for aroné
, v. אֹרֶן
, v. אִירוֹנִית
, v. אדנדקי
, v. אֵירוּס I, II.
, v. אַרְוִיסָא

sense.definition: (אָרַס) betrothal, preliminary act of marriage, answering to the Roman sponsalia; promise in marriage, disting.
sense.notes: fr. נישואין, or כניסה, marriage proper, the latter consisting in conducting the bride to the groom’s permanent (or improvised) home. [The betrothal carries with it almost all the legal consequences of marriage, excepting some modifications mostly of a civil (pecuniary) character, and is, according to Talmudic usage, preceded by a benediction (בִּרְכַת א'), while the act itself is performed by the bride-groom (or his mandatary) delivering into the hands of the bride (or her mandatary, or her father, if she be a minor) an object representing any value not below the smallest coin (P’rutah), whereby the purpose of the delivery is stated and assented to by acceptance.] Keth. I, 2 אלמנה מן הא' a widow whose betrothed died before marriage proper. Ib. V, 1; a. fr. Yeb. 43 a, a. fr. סעודת א' the repast following the betrothal.—Metaph. of the relation between Israel and God, covenant. Ex. R. s. 15, end; a. e.
, v. אַרְקְתָא I
, Y. Shek. II, end, 47 a דארורא צילמא, v. אֲדוּרֵי
, v. אֲרַר

sense.definition: to penetrate deeply, to take deep root.

sense.notes: Sabb. 155 a זירין דאַרְזֵי Zirin are called bundles of twigs which are hard. Ib. כיפין דא'; [oth. opin., v. אַרְזָא]. Denom. אוּרְזָא, אָרוּזָא, a. next ws.

Tam. III, 5 של א' of cedar wood.— Pl. אֲרָזִים. R. Hash. 23 a; Taan. 25 b; a. e.—Metaph. prominent men, scholars. Sabb. 118 b I planted חמשה א' five cedars (begot five sons who acquired renown). M. Kat. 25 b, v. אֵזוֹב.
ch.

sense.definition: same. Targ. Lev. XIV, 4; a. e.—Ab. Zar. 14 a.
sense.notes: R. Hash. 23 a; a. e.— Pl. אַרְזִין, אַרְזַיָּא, אַרְזֵי. Targ. Num. XXIV, 6; a. e.—Y. Ab. Zar. III, 42 c top. Sabb. 157 a.—Ib. 155 a זירין דא' (Ms. זירין סוכי דא' Zirin means twigs of cedars (Rashi דארזא); [oth. opin. v. ארז].

sense.definition: pr. n. pl. תֵּל א' Tel Arza (Cedar-Hill), in Palestine, scene of massacres during the Bar Kokhba war.
sense.notes: (Cedar-Hill), in Palestine, scene of massacres during the Bar Kokhba war. Yeb. XVI, 7.
Tam. VII, 3 בן א': Shek. V, 1 ארזה; Tosef. ib. II, 14.

sense.definition: (cmp. אַרְזוֹבָא) arz’bonith, a species of locusts; cmp. עַרְצוּבְיָא a. כַּרְזוּבָּא.
sense.notes: Sifra Sh’mini Par. III, ch. 5; Ḥull. 65 a הרזבנית.
, v. אַרְגָּז
, v. אַרְזָא
— Pl. אַרְזוֹבִין. Targ. I Kings VI, 7.
, v. אֲרָזִין
, v. אַרְזְלָא.—אַרְזִילֵי, v. אוּרְזִילָא.

sense.definition: (prob. plur. of אֶרֶז) box, chest (for collecting bones).
sense.notes: Tosef. Snh. IX, 8 (ed. Zuck. בארון, Var. בארזון). Treat. S’maḥ. ch. XII בגלוסקמא בא' (one word inserted by a glossator to explain the other). Ib. בידין (corr. acc.). [Tur Y. D. Abeluth 403: ארזים.]

sense.definition: (dimin. of עֶרֶס, עַרְסָא) cradle, hammock for watchmen in gardens.
sense.notes: Targ. Is. I, 8; XXIV, 20 (h. מלונה).—Erub. 25 b דעבידא כי אר' Ar. (ed. אור'; Rashi ארזי'; Tosaf. ערס') the roof of the shed has the shape of a cradle, i. e both sides slanting towards the centre.

sense.definition: (v. ארזוניא P. Sm. 374, cmp. פרשניא Neub. Géogr. p. 396) of Arzania.
sense.notes: Taan. 24 b ארבי דא' Ar. (ed. דחיטין דפרזינא; Ms. M. דפרזינאי) ships of the Arzanians. Fem. *אַרְזַנְיָיתָא. Git. 70 a חיטין א' Arzanian wheat (of a large size).
Targ. Judg. IV, 26.—Gitt. 56 b. Meg. 25 a (Ms. מַרְזפְתָּא).

sense.definition: (v. זַיִף, a. אַרְדַּפְנֵי = הַרְדַּ'; cmp. Löw, Pfl. p. 320) hypericum ( barbatum), St.
sense.notes: John’s wort, a plant said to be fatal to cattle. B. Kam. 47 b באר' Ar. a. Ms. H. (Var. הרזיפא, v. Koh. Ar.; ed. אפר') under ‘poison’ is meant arzafta which may also be called peré ( fruit, produces of the earth). B. Bath. 20 a אר' Ar. (Ms. אר', changed into אפ' as ed.). Cmp. הַרְזִיפּוּ.
Part. אוֹרֵחַ q. v.—Denom. אוֹרַח path

sense.definition: (Denom. of אוֹרֵחַ) to receive a guest, to lodge.
sense.notes: Ber. 63 b המְאָרֵחַ. Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c bot. לאָרְחוֹ.

sense.definition: to be received, be the guest of.
sense.notes: Sabb. 13 b a. fr. Y. Ḥall. IV, 60 a מִתְאָ'.
Targ. Jud. XIX, 17. [ארח, ארחא Yoma 82 b, a. e., Af. of רִיחַ.]

sense.definition: , contr. אִתְרַח to dwell as a stranger, sojourn.
sense.notes: Targ. Y. Deut. I, 6; v. אְחַר.

Targ. II Sam. XII, 4.—[Y. Ber. I, 2 d top לא הוה ארחא אתיא וכ', oth. ed. ארתא, read שַׁחְרָא with oth. ed.].— Pl. אָרְחִין, אוֹרְחִין. Y. Peah VIII, end, 21 b, (read as) Y. Shek. V, end, 49 b הוה ליה א' he had guests. [אָרְחָא path, v. אוֹרְחָא.]
—ארחין, v. אָרִיח.
proper nouns, Arta-. Gitt. 14 b, v. אַרְדָּא II.
a corruption of טְרִיבּוּן (a Jewish) tribunus; cmp. ארטיגוס. [Or pr. n.?]
, v. ארְטְבַנְיָא
Targ. Esth. VIII, 10 Levita, v. ערְטִילֵי

sense.definition: Artaban (IV), the last Parthian king, friend of R. Judah han-Nasi.
sense.notes: Y. Peah I, 15 d bot.; Gen. R. s. 35; Yalk. Deut. 844; Prov. 934.—V. אדרכן.

sense.definition: Artabania (named after Artaban, v. preced.), near Pumbeditha.
sense.notes: Erub. 51 b (Var. lect., v. Rabb. D. S. a. l.).
Yalk. Esth. 1053, read סְטַרְטֵיגוֹס or אִסְטְרָ' (Esth. R. to III, 1 טריכונוס, read טריב'; v. ארטבון).
, v. אַרְסְקִינָס
, v. ארכי ליפורין.
, v. עַרְטִילֵי
, Ex. R. s. 13 וא' נכנס, read: ואין רוטב נכנס בתוכה but no juice enters into it, כך נעשה לבו של פרעה ולא היה מקבל וכ' so was Pharaoh’s heart made and it received not &c.; v. Ter. X, 11.
Midr. Sam. ch. XIX בית א' שלו (Var. ארתוקופיון q. v.) a rendition of beth halla ḥ mi, I Sam. XVI,

to his (Jesse’s) bakery, שהוא בא וכ' (read with Yalk. Sam. 124 והוא יבוא וכ') and he (Jesse) shall come out (to the bakery) from Bethlehem (to meet Samuel there). Yalk. l. c. ארנקפאן, ארכ' (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: (v. next w.; cmp. אֲרוּ) prop. behold, in most cases corresponding to b. h. כִּי, that, so that, because, if; but.
sense.notes: Targ. O. ארי; Targ. Y. ארום; v. fr.

sense.definition: (√אר, cmp. ירי) prop. to point, throw, hence (in a logical sense) to argue, question, discuss, treat.
sense.notes: B. Kam. 30 b מדקא ארינן גלל Ar. (ed. איירינן, v. infra) since we pointed out the law about the dung placed in the street as an argument against Rab. Keth. 16 a, a. fr. ודקארי לה מאי קארי לה and he who raised the question, how could he raise it at all, i.e. the answer being so obvious, what must have been the impression he labored under, that he could ask such a question, or raise such an argument?—Y. Keth. VI, 30 d bot. ואין קמו יתמי ואָרוּן if the heirs should rise and raise objections (go to law).

same. Ned. 2 b איירי בהון he does treat thereof.—Pes. 6 b, a. fr. איידי דאיירי ב־ incidentally of treating the question of … Kerith. 14 a, a. fr. (באבר אחד) קא מַיְירֵי the argument is up (about one limb). B. Kam. 30 b כי איירינן when we raised the objection (taking our argument from ‘the dung’, v. supra), it was before R. N. had given his opinion; a. fr.—Deriv. אִרְיָא.

sense.definition: , v. ארר) [ to create a gap,] to pluck, esp. figs.
sense.notes: Shebi. I, 2 הָאוֹרֶה וכ' the gatherer and his basket. B. Mets. 89 b day laborers שהיו אוֹרִין בתאנים Ar. (ed. עודר'; v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note 300) engaged in picking figs. Y. B. Bath. V, 15 a bot.; a. fr.—Num. R. s. 20 Tanḥ. Bal. 4 (homiletic etymology of arah, Num. XXII, 6).

B. Kam. 16 b א' תרבות a tamed lion; a. fr.—Transf. brave man; distinguished scholar (opp. שועל). Yeb. 122 b. Kidd. 48 b; Snh. 8 b. Gitt. 83 b; Y. ib. IX, 50 a אין משיבין את הא' וכ' you must not argue against a lion (scholar) after he is dead. B. Kam. 117 a; a. fr.— Pl. אֲרָיוֹת.—זנב לא' a tail to lions, i.e. the least among the great (opp. head to foxes). Ab. IV, 15; Y. Snh. IV, 22 b bot.—Ḥull. 3 b, a. fr. גירי א', v. גֵּר.—[Gen. R. s. 28 א' גסטריות, v. גַּסְטְרָא.]

sense.definition: Leo, Lion the fifth sign of the Zodiac (corresp. to the month of Ab).
sense.notes: Yalk. Ex. 418. Pesik. Dibré p. 116 a; Pesik. R. s. 27 (28, p. 133 b, ed. Fr.); v. אֲרִיאֵל.

sense.definition: homiletic surname of the Lord, Israel &c. Pesik. l. c.; Pesik. R. l. c.; Yalk. Jer. 259, v. אֲרִיאֵל.

sense.notes: Targ. Num. XXIV, 9; a. fr.—B. Mets. 101 b, a. e., v. אֲרב. Ned. 62 b לאברוחי א' to drive the lion off, i.e. to get rid of the tax-collector.—Shebu. 22 b, a. fr. א' הוא דרביע עלה a lion lies on it, i.e. it is unavailable because it is forbidden.—Ab. Zar. 31 b, a. e. בר א' son of a lion (of a great man).—Ḥull. 59 b the tiger is א' דבי עילאי the lion of the forest of Ilai (v. Schorr He-Ḥaluts VII, 32; cmp. Koh. Angelol. p. 103).— Pl. אַרְיָוָתָא, אַרְיָוָן. Targ. I Chron. XI, 22; a. fr.— Lam. R. to I, 9) א' דאורייתא the lions of the Law (scholars). Y. Shebi. IX, 39 a top. Y. Sabb. I, 4 a top מעלי רישא בין א' to put one’s head between lions, i.e. to argue against the opinions of great men. [Yalk. Num. 771 גבתא דא', v. אֲרִיחַ.]

sense.definition: (אֲרִי, אֲרָא) pointing at, argument, topic, subject.
sense.notes: Kerith. 3 b גבי כריתות דאי' וכ' in speaking of K’rithoth, where this (the punishment of extinction) is the subject proper, I may say, the general term of Sabbath &c. is introduced (relying on those places in the Mishnah where the respective laws are treated in detail). Yoma 74 a, a. fr. אי משום הא לא א' were it only for this, there would be no argument (no difficulty). Kerith. 18 a, a. fr. מאי א' כי וכ' why is the argument brought up only on the presumption (that he has eaten? Supposed, he had not eaten, would not the same argument hold good?). Sabb. 101 a, a. fr. מידי א' is this an argument (i.e. how can you compare two cases so unlike each other)?

sense.definition: (b. h.) Ariël, Divine Light (cmp. Ps. CXVIII, 27, v. אֲרִי II); poetic surname of the Temple and Jerusalem.
sense.notes: Pesik. Dibré p. 116 a. Pesik. R. s. 27 (28, p. 133 b, ed. Fr.) הבית שנקרא אריה (read אריאל) the Temple which is called Ariël (Is. XXIX, 1). Ib. ישראל שנקרא אריאל (read אריה); בחדש שנקרא אריאל (read אריה); דבריו של אריאל (read אריה; Num. XXIII, 24; Amos III, 8); v. אַרְיֵה.

Sabb. XIII, 1; a. fr. Y. M. Kat. III, end, 83 d, what is meant by אִיחוּי? Ans. כאריג when it looks as if woven. Meg. 26 b, a. e. טווי לא' spinning the flax so as to prepare it for weaving (indirect preparation or designation); Snh. 48 a טווי לאֲרִיגָה, (Rashi לאריג).
Y. Yoma III, 40 c bot. אֲרִיגָתָן בקודש their weaving must take place within the sanctuary. Snh. 48 a, v. preced.
, v. אֲרִי.—אריה Y. Snh. X, 28 d, v. אֲרִיחַ.

(prob. corruption of אֲרִיחַ) pr. n. pl. Cant. R. to II, 17 (ref. to הרי בתר ibid. ‘mountains of cutting’) כדי שיטלו המלכיות בֶּתֶר א' (not שיתלו, v. Matt. Keh. a. l.) that the (Roman) governments may receive (their pay for) the massacre of Ar. (cmp. Joseph. B. J. III, 10, 9 sq. or perh. ref. to the Bar Kokhba war; cmp. גופנית, טור שמעון a. oth. Y. Taan. IV, 69 a sq.).
, v. אַרְיָא
Lam. R. to V, 5 (allusion to ארי).

sense.definition: (cmp. Dan. II, 14) Aryokh, a title of Samuel, the contemporary of Rab.
sense.notes: Sabb. 53 a. Kidd. 39 a. Men. 38 b. Ḥull. 76 b (prob. a Persian adaptation for judge).
Sifré Deut. 13; Yalk. Deut. 802.
, v. אורוסטי
Erub. I, 3; B. Bath. 3 b; a. e.— Pl. אָרִיחִין. Y. Erub. I, 19 a top ארחין (corr. acc.).

sense.definition: aria ḥ, a term used in rules for writing certain passages of Holy Scriptures metrically arranged, the short space filled out with writing, opp. לבנה (brick, the larger space); v. R. Niss. to Meg. 16 b; [Rashi: א' the writing, לבנה the blank).
sense.notes: Y. Meg. III, 74 b bot.; Bab. ib. l. c.; Treat. Sof’rim XII, 10 א' ע"ג ל' וכ' small brick (lath) above brick, and brick above small brick (lath); e.g. (Ex. ch. XV)
small brick (lath) above small brick and brick above brick; e.g. (Esth. IX, 7 sq.)

sense.definition: Ãri a ḥ; [Tarichæa, South of Tiberias, Neub. Géogr. p. 21 b].
sense.notes: Y. Snh. X, 28 d גופתה א'; Sifré Num. 131 גובתא דא'; Yalk. Num. 771 דאריא (Y. l. c. ed. Zyt. אריה) Gufta in the district of Ariaḥ. Tosef. Kil. I, 3; Y. ib. I, 27 a bot. תחום א' district of A.

Targ. Num. XIII, 23; a. e. (h. מוֹט). Bets. 32 b נפל לה ארי' בתנורא ed. (Ar. ארחא) a binder of the brick wall fell into the stove. Sabb. 129 a a house דשב לביניא וא' the width of whose walls was seven bricks and a half; a. e.— Pl. אָרִיחַיָּא, אֲרִיחִין, אַרְחֵי, אַרְחִין. Targ. Ex. XXV, 27; a. e. (h. בַּדִּים). B. Bath. 3 a כפיסין ארחי K’fissin are bondlaths. Y. Erub. I, 19 a top (also אורחין).
Targ. I Kings VIII, 8; II Chr. V, 9.—Y. Ab. Zar. I, 39 c top, v. אִימָמָא.
אָרֵךְ
Targ. Ex. XX, 12. Targ. Y. Deut. XXVIII, 67 מְאַרְכַן make appear long; a. fr.—Y. Taan. IV, 68 a מְאַרְכָה יומין to live long; Koh. R. to VII, 7.
Snh. 109 b כי מאריך when one was tall.

Targ. Num. IX, 22. Targ. Job VI, 11.—Y. Yoma VI, 43 d אורכין צבחר wait a while. Y. R. Hash. I, 57 a bot. הוות מוֹרְכָה וכ' she waited a whole year. Ib. הוו מורכין. Y. M. Kat. II, 81 b top אילפא מורכא לך the ship will wait for thee.
Targ. Ezek. XVII, 3.—Targ. Prov. XIV, 17 דא' תרעיתיה whose intrigue is long prepared (h. איש מזמות). V. אֲרִיכָא

sense.definition: (part. pass. of אֲרַךְ to arrange) right, befitting.
sense.notes: Ezra IV, 14.—Succ. 4 b א' או לא א' is it right or not? B. Mets. 75 a וא' and it is proper to do so. Midr. Till. to Ps. I, 2 וא' כדין is such a thing right?
Targ. Y. I Num. XIV, 18 (II א' רחמין, read רוחיה).
Sabb. 33 b הוא קא א' ליה לבישריה was dressing (cleansing) his body. Keth. 103 b ואָרֵיכְנָא וכ' I would dress parchment rolls of deer skins.

sense.definition: (preced.) [one who arranges arguments,] Arekha, title of a lecturer.
sense.notes: Sabb. 59 b גברא רבה א' a great man, a lecturer. Esp. known R. A ḥ a Arekha. Ib. 111 a; a. e. Ber. 33 a ed. (Ms. M. Ḥiya); Abba Arekha (Rab, v. רַב). [In legend: tall, v. אָרוּךְ.]
Midr. Till., beg. עבד לה א' used that idea of R. Yudan as a theme.

Bets. 30 b יומא א' Ms. M. (ed. אריכתא); Succ. 45 b יומא א' an adjourned day.—Fem. אֲרִיכְתָּא. Ber. 4 b תפלה א' a continued prayer; גאולה א' a continued benediction on redemption, v. גְּאוּלָּה.— Pl. אֲרִיכָתָא. Keth. 8 a שית א' the six lengthy benedictions.

sense.definition: (ארך) prolongation, length; (sub. אף, or פנים) forbearance.
sense.notes: Koh. R. to VII, 8 א' שהאריך וכ' the forbearance which Samuel showed. Gen. R. s. 70 א' פנים. Y. Ḥag. II, 77 b bot.; a. e. א' ימים length of days, long life.—Gen. R. s. 64 א' ימים lapse of time.
Targ. Is. XXXVIII, 11.

sense.definition: preparation, future (v. ורך, Schr. KAT p. 549).
sense.notes: Targ. Jer. XXXI, 5.
Y. Ḥag. I, 76 c bot.; Y. Pes. III, end, 30 b עליית בית א', v. עֲלִייָּה; (Sifré Deut. 41 ערוד; Yalk. ib. 681 שערים; Kidd. 40 b נתזה).
מקום א' a settlement in a desert. Lev. R. s. 35 (ed. אדרימון, Ar. ארימון, corr. acc.). Cant. R. to VII, 11.—Yalk. Jer. 257 אירימון, cmp. אֱירֵימִיאָה.

sense.definition: (ארס) something tied to the body (περίαμμα), whence an emblem set in a ring or chain (cmp. Deut. VI, 8; Prov. VI, 21, also Sm. Ant. s. v. Amuletum).
sense.notes: . Deut. R. s. 3 הכניסה לו שנים א' (read שני) brought into his house two emblems (of faith); the king, too, זקף לה כנגדן שני א' had two corresponding emblems set for her. Ib. Abraham delivered to his children שני א' two emblems (which they should guard, Gen. XVIII, 19).

sense.definition: (ארס) prop. bound, engaged, esp. tenant who tills the owner’s ground for a certain share in the produces, contrad. fr. חכור tenant who pays the landlord a certain rent in kind, irrespective of the yield of the crops.
sense.notes: Y. Bicc. I, end, 64 b. Y. B. Bath. III, 14 a bot. א' שהוריד א' a farmer letting to a sub-farmer. Ex. R. s. 43. Lev. R. s. 1 אֲרִיסוֹ his (the king’s) tenant, i.e. Adam (in paradise); a. fr.— Pl. אֲרִיסִים, אֲרִיסִין. Y. B. Bath. l. c. Y. M. Kat. III, 82 b bot. Deut. R. s. 7; a. fr.—Cmp. עָרִיס.

Targ. Y. Deut. XXIII, 25; 26 Levita (ed. פועל). Targ. Cant. VIII, 11.—Ab. Zar. 21 b א' אריסותיה קעביד the gentile tenant working during the Jewish festive week, works for his tenancy (not as the Jew’s employee). Ḥag. 25 b דינא הוא … א' וכ' it is the tenant’s business to procure kegs &c.—*B. Bath. 55 a דאריסא דפרסאי עד וכ' Rashb. a. l. (ed. אריסותא, Var. דאֲרִישָׂן, שָׂאִין …, דאֲרִישָׂאָן, v. Rabb. D. S. a. l. note, Ms. M. דאריש') that the tenant of the Persians is such only up to forty years (after which time he is considered a legitimate owner); v. Nim. Jos. to Alf. a. l. [It seems that the Pers. Jews pronounced אֲרִישָׁא a. אֲרִישׁוּתָא, cmp. דִּישְׁתָּנָא a. דִּיסְתָּנָא.]— Pl. אֲרִיסַיָּא. Targ. Job XXIX, 23. אֲרִישָׂאִין, v. supra. [Lev. R. s. 28, v. אֲרִיסְטָא.]
Tosef. Kel. B. Bath. IV, 8; v. עֲרִיסָה

sense.definition: (אָרִיס II) tenancy, condition of the Aris.
sense.notes: Peah V, 5 בא' as a tenancy; a. fr.— Pl. אֲרִיסִיּוֹת. Y. Bicc. I, end, 64 b בעלי א' owners of tenanted properties, v. חֲכִירָה.
Lev. R. s. 5. Ab. Zar. 21 b; a. e. B. Bath. 55 a, v. אֲרִיסָא. [M. Kat. 22 b, v. אֲרִישְׂתָּא.]

sense.definition: (corrupt. of אריסטיטא, ἀριστητής) break-fasting, in gen. invited guest.
sense.notes: Pl. אֲרִיסְטִין, אֲרִיסְטַיָּיא. Koh. R. to I, 3 שביק א' וכ' let the guests eat (some ed. אריסטון, our guests?). Lev. R. s. 28 אריסייא (corr. acc.). Lam. R. to IV, 2 ביני א' among the seated guests.

sense.definition: (Ἀριστόβουλος) Aristobule, brother of Hyrcan, son of Alexander Jannai.
sense.notes: Men. 64 b; B. Kam. 82 b; a. e.
, read:

morning meal, later principal meal, dinner, repast. Y. Ber. IV, 7 b אין הווה לכון א' כ' if ye are invited to a dinner, and the day is advanced, &c. Y. Snh. III, 21 c top גו א' during dinner. Ib. VI, 23 c; a. fr.
Ḥall. IV, 11; Y. Shebi. VI, end, 37 a (a Syrian land-owner).—Y. Yeb. XVI, end, 16 a חד א' one Ariston. [‘ One of the βουλὴ ἀριστῶν mentioned Cod. Theod. Lib. XII, Tit. 888, Frankel M’bo p. 65 a.]
Y. Ber. IV, 8 c (play on Aron, the ark) from there א' יוצאה לעולם curse goes forth into the world (for transgressors); a. e.
, v. אֲרָרָן
, v. אֲרִיסָא

sense.definition:
(ארשׁ, v. ארס) prop. obligation, hence (sub. סעודת) a meal which creates an obligation, a meal which is given in the expectation of receiving invitations from the
reciprocating members of a social club, opp. פורענא the entertainment in reciprocation for invitations received.
sense.notes: M. Kat. 22 b אריש' Ar. (ed. אריסותא, Ms. M. ארשיותא, read ארישו').

sense.definition: (ארת, √אר, cmp. יְאוֹר) cut, channel, dyke Targ. Ps. CVII, 35 (h. text אגם); a. e.—Ḥull.
sense.notes: 107 a א' דדלאי dyke for irrigation. B. Kam. 50 b sq.— Pl. (אֲרִיתַּ') אֲרִיתַיָּא. Targ. O. Ex. VIII, 11. Targ. Ps. LXXVIII, 44. (h. text יְאֹר); a. e. Cmp. חריץ.

sense.definition: (√אר, cmp. ארג) to join, weave; whence to arrange, plan; v. ערך.
sense.notes: —V. אֲרִיךְ II, אֲרוּכָה &c.

sense.definition: , cmp. Schr. KAT p. 497 ארג; cmp. also גדל to plait,to be tall) to be [ pointed, stretched,] long, tall.
to prolong, be long in doing.
sense.notes: Ber. I, 4 אמרו להַאֲרִיךְ they commended a lengthy benediction. Ib. 34 a; cmp. אַרְכָן. Yoma 35 b הֶאֱ' בתפלתו staid long in prayer.—הא' ימים to live long. Meg. 27 b; a. fr.—Ber. 8 b, a. fr. מַאֲרִיכִין ימיו his life will be prolonged.—פנים, הא' רוח to be long-suffering, forbearing. Y. Shebu. IV, beg. 35 b; a. fr.—Y. Taan. II, 65 b bot. when collecting debts (punishing) מאריך וגובה he is slow in collecting (punishes in long intervals, gives extension).
Num. R. s. 20, end הא' הברזל the point of the spear grew longer, v. infra; a. fr.

sense.definition: [ to lengthen the carrying pole,] to make heavy.
sense.notes: Nidd. 16 b כמה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ עלינו how heavy thou hast made our burden (through restrictive laws)!
Sifré Num. 131; Yalk. ib. 771; (Num. R. l. c. האריך).
, v. אֲרִיךְ I

sense.definition: (b. h.) only with אַף, אֲפַּיִם long-suffering, forbearing.
sense.notes: Y. Taan. II, 65 b; a. fr.; v. אַף.

sense.definition: (ארך; cmp. אוּרְבָּא); pl. אַרְכֵי meshes, ranges, intervals.
sense.notes: Sabb. 50 b. Gitt. 69 b. B. Bath. 3 a, v. אוּרְבָּא.—Targ. Esth. VIII, 15 בארכוהי in its (the girdle’s) meshes.

sense.definition: (ארך) duration, term, limit; extension of time.
sense.notes: Dan. IV, 24 (prolongation). Ib. VII, 12 (set term).—Targ. Gen. VI, 3; a. e.
Targ. II Chr. XXIV, 13.— Pl. (אֲרוּכִין) אַרְכִין. Targ. Ps. CXLVII, 3 (ed. Vien. ארכא).

sense.definition: (רכב) (a rider,) the uppermost layer of a clay dam around a field.
sense.notes: B. Mets. 103 b בוכרא the first, טפתא the additional (middle), א' the uppermost. [Targ. Y. Lev. IX, 17 read אַדְכַּרְתָּהּ.]

sense.definition: (v. אַרְכָא II) extension, a certain time.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. I4 (p. 259 a ed. Amst.) נתן להם א' וכ' allowed them a certain time but finally punished them.
= אַרְכּוּבְתָּא.

sense.definition: the leg from under the hip-bone to the ankle, the knee and its surrounding parts (containing three sections each of which is called א' and defined by a different surname).
sense.notes: Ḥull. IV, 6; v. ib. 76 a (also רְכוּבָה); a. fr.

Kil. VII, 1 הא' שבגפן (Tosef. ib. IV, 11, Var. הבריכה שבסלע) that part of the vine which is bent down and laid in the ground to rise at another place. Y. Meg. I, 71 c bot. א' של למ"ד the lower joint of the Lammed. Kel. XIV, 8 מפתח של א' וכ' (Tosef. ib. B. Mets. IV, 15 רוֹכְבָּה … רְכוּבָתוֹ) a key with a joint, broken at the joint.— Pl. אַרְכּוּבוֹת. Nid. 30 b. B. Mets. 105 a

Targ. Esth. V, 9. [Y. Maasr. V, end, 52 a אביבא דפילא, read ארכובא or עניבה; Y. Ned. III, 37 d bot.; Y. Shebu. III, 34 d.]— Pl. אַרְכּוּבָתָא. Targ. Koh. XII, 3. Targ. II, Esth. VI, 11.—אַרְכּוּבַיָּא Targ. Job. IV, 4.—V. רְכוּבְתָּא.
, v. ארכי'

sense.definition: (= h. אַרְכָן q. v.) ruler, elder Targ. I Chr.
sense.notes: XI, 2 (h. text נגיד). Targ. Job. XXI, 28 (h. text נדיב); a. fr.—Y. Ber. V, 9 a עבר א' an elder passed by.— Pl. אַרְכוֹנִין. Targ. II Chr. XI, 11; a. e.—Y. Peah VIII, 21 a (defective sentence); [h. pl. אַרְכוֹנוֹת, v. ארְכָן).

Y. Taan. IV, 69 a top. Lam. R. to II, 2; IV, 18. Gen. R. s. 76 ארכוננוס (corr. acc.). [The office of a city mayor or senator in the Roman days was often ruinous to its occupants; v. Sm. Ant. s. v. Senatus.]

sense.definition: (רכף, cmp. מַרְכּוֹף) prob. a screwing contrivance for bending wood; engine of torture, stocks.
sense.notes: Esth. R. to I, 1 b; v. אוּכַּיְיפָא.

sense.definition: (ארך, v. עַרְכִי; an adaptation of ἀρχή, cmp. אַרְכָן) term of office, office, court of elders.
sense.notes: Num. R. s. 9 whoever was signed as a witness בא' ישנה וכ' (Kidd. IV, 5 ערכי q. v.) in the old court of Zepphoris.—Y. M. Kat. II, end, 81 b מעלה לאַרְכִיָים he (the gentile) takes the deed to their (gentile) office for recording. Y. Gitt. I, 43 d top.—Ruth R. to I, 3 א' של בנך דוחקת the time of thy son’s accession to office presses. Deut. R. s. 2 הגיע א' וכ' surrender thy office to Joshua. Ib. a prefect שהיה בא' שלו who was in his office; a. fr.— Pl. אַרְכִיּוֹת. Ruth. R. l. c. א' א' הן the terms of office are predestined (cmp. Sabb. 30 a bot. ואין מלכות וכ'). [עַרְכָאוֹת, v. עַרְכִי.]

sense.definition: קִרְיַת א' Kiryath Arkhi (= קרית ספר); v. preced. Targ. Josh. XV, 15; a. e.
(Greek pref. ἀρχι—) chief of (gen. followed by a pl.) as א' בִּרְיוֹנִים chief of the castle guard.
sense.notes: Pesik. Ekha p. 122 b Ar. (ed. אדני מריונים, corr. acc.); v. respective determinants.
, Gen. R. s. 50 beg., Mus., v. יודקו

Tanḥ. Ki Thetsé 9 he went לא' של וכ' into the Egyptian archive; Pesik. Zakh. p. 27 a לבית א' Ar. (ed. ארמון, corr. acc.); Yalk. a. l. ארכוון (some ed. ארמון, corr. acc.). Esth. R. to I, 3 להדא א' דגדר as in the state-house of Gadara. [Ex. R. s. 5 בית ארמון corr. acc.]

Gen. R. s. 24, beg. לא' שבנה וכ' to be compared to an engineer that built the fortifications of a principality; Num.
